We then take a break from history and urban life and head to Ranthambore National Park, where drives give you a chance to spot wildlife greats such as Bengal tigers, sloth bears, nilgai antelope, sambar deer and jungle cats.

The rest of your trip is in the stunning state of Rajasthan. Explore the majestic ‘Pink City’ of Jaipur, the luscious Aravalli Hills and the hand-painted haveli houses of Alsisar.

On this family trip to India you will stay mostly in hotels, including typically elegant heritage hotels that India is famous for. We will use a mixture of transport between places on the itinerary, with private transfers and also some train travel, but all the time accompanied by your superb expert guide.

Please note that children aged 17 years and younger receive a 10% discount off the price of their trip. The recommended minimum age is five years old.

dayInfo.title: Delhi.
dayInfo.description: Namaste! Welcome to India. Your adventure begins in the one of the oldest cities in the world and India’s capital – Delhi. You and the family will have a welcome meeting today at 1 pm to meet your local leader and fellow families. After, head out on a guided sightseeing tour to explore the contrasts of Old and New Delhi. Squeeze through the Old City’s fortified walls on the way to Jama Masjid – dominating the city’s skyline, this mosque is a social hub as much as a place of worship. If you’d like, why not catch a rickshaw to the brilliantly coloured Red Fort. Then, leave the crowds behind and breathe a little easier in contrasting New Delhi. Visit the main sights – Parliament House, President House and India Gate, before returning to the hotel.

dayInfo.title: Agra.
dayInfo.description: Rise early to catch a train to Agra – the city was the capital of the Moghul Empire and has heaps of things to see, like one of the Seven Wonders of the World! When you arrive, take some time to relax, before heading out to see the city. Agra’s not just all about the Taj Mahal, it’s also home to one of the finest looking forts in India – sitting along the banks of the Yamuna River, Agra Fort is part stronghold, part palace and part prison. Enter the dark red sandstone fort by crossing the (now empty) crocodile-infested moat. Search through throne rooms and the tiny, decorated mosques, then climb to the top to get your first glimpse of the Taj across the river! Tonight, you’re free to relax, explore at your own pace or find some delicious local dinner.

dayInfo.title: Ranthambhore National Park.
dayInfo.description: Get up before the sun this morning to see it rise over the Taj Mahal – this wonder of the world is a UNESCO World Heritage site and maybe the most iconic site in India! Watch the colours play across the marble in early morning light and soak it all in! Best known as a monument to love and loss, the Taj is a beautiful example of Mughal architecture and is surrounded by trimmed English gardens. After ticking something huge off the list, you’ll all head east and pass the Kos Minar medieval milestones, which point the way to the abandoned city of Fatehpur Sikri. This well-preserved 16th century royal complex is full of courtyards, pavilions, gardens, the Jama Masjid Mosque and the intricately carved Rumi Sultana palace. This afternoon, you’ll continue to Ranthambhore National Park – the 'Jungle Book' brought to life!

dayInfo.title: Ranthambore National Park .
dayInfo.description: Ranthambhore National Park is one of the best national parks of India, teeming with wildlife – a place where nature has reclaimed ancient fortresses and temples. Today, you’ll make a couple of game drives to try and spot the majestic Bengal tigers that live among the ruined forts and temples here. Your drives will be early in the morning and in the late afternoon, as this is when the animals are most active! Even if the tigers are being too stealthy, the park is filled with other animals like gazelle, hyenas, sloth bears, crocodiles, jackals, three types of antelope (nilgai, sambar and chital) and leopards.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur.
dayInfo.description: Head northwest to the pink city of Jaipur – the capital of Rajasthan. When you arrive, grab the kids and head to the Jantar Mantar observatory, home to a cool collection of astronomical instruments built by the Rajput King Sawai Jai Singh II. Later, you’ll have some free time as a family to swim in the hotel pool or wander through the Pink City’s streets, busy with camels, motorbikes, rickshaws, and traditionally dressed Rajput men. Maybe head to the Old Town for raj kachori chaat (a big, fluffy chaat served with chutney, yoghurt, chilli and potato) and cool off with a lassi (a mango yoghurt dirnk) from Lassiwala – Jaipur's oldest and most famous lassi shop!

dayInfo.title: Jaipur.
dayInfo.description: Today, you’ll all visit the sprawling City Palace, once home to the Maharaja – an amazing complex home to colourful courtyard gates, museums displaying royal costumes and old weaponry. Then, it’s on to the five-storied Hawa Mahal, or Palace of Winds, with its detailed honeycombed outside filled with windows. The impressive structure makes it the most photographed building in the country, after the Tj Mahal! The rest of the day is free to explore with your family or to find a spot to people watch and relax.

dayInfo.title: Alsisar.
dayInfo.description: Climb the twisting roads of the Aravalli Hills to the massive Amber Fort today. This opulent palace is packed with rooms full of lavish murals, arches and delicate jali work. Don’t miss the sparkling Mirror Palace, covered floor-to-ceiling in thousands of reflective tiles, looking down over Moata Lake – the kids will love a photo here! Later, leave the city behind and travel to the relaxed village of Nawalgarh. Catch glimpses of local life in the most colourful regions of India – sari-clad women carrying terracotta pots of water, bangles tinkling as they walk. When you arrive, take a walk around the village and meet the locals before continuing to your final stop for the day – the small town of Alsisar.

dayInfo.title: Alsisar.
dayInfo.description: The semi-arid village of Alsisar is full of legends and stories and this morning, you’ll join your leader on a walk around the village to discover some of the beautiful and ornately decorated buildings. Aay hello to some of the locals along the way. Then, the rest of the afternoon is free to explore this peaceful town or enjoy your accommodation – you'll stay at the Alsisar Mahal, built in the 17th century! With its grand courtyards, colourful dining arcades and heritage rooms, it will certainly be a highlight of your trip. And the kids will love the pool!

dayInfo.title: Delhi.
dayInfo.description: After breakfast this morning, leave the countryside behind and get back into the beating rhythm of Delhi by mid-afternoon. When you arrive, you’re free to rest and recharge. Later, maybe practice your bargaining skills in Chandni Chowk, where you can buy local crafts straight from the hands of the artisans or gobble down street chaats. You could also relax in the Mughal gardens and have a picnic. You might like to get together with your group for a special dinner tonight to celebrate your adventure – your leader will have some great recommendations on where to eat!

dayInfo.title: Delhi.
dayInfo.description: There are no activities planned for the final day and you can depart the accommodation at any time. If your family would like to spend some more time in Delhi, why not book an Urban Adventures tour? The Made in Delhi Shopping Tour takes you to the best markets to shop, so you can find some bargains. Better yet, it’s child-friendly!

tourName: Family Taj Mahal and Tigers holiday
generalInfo:
Uncover Northern India's highlights on this family-friendly tour of the Golden Triangle. Witness awe-inspiring sites, from the delights of new and old Delhi to the pink beauty of Jaipur and the regal grace of the Taj Mahal. With rickshaw rides through bustling bazaars and camel cart treks through national parks, there's adventure at every turn. At the end of the day, sleep like Maharaja in heritage properties that bring you closer to India's history and culture.

Iconic must sees - From the Taj Mahal to the Amber Fort, tick off the must-sees from each corner of India's famous Golden Triangle.
Sleep in a historic fort - Experience traditional Indian hospitality at a family-run hotel based inside a historic fort.
Summer Itinerary - Ranthambore National Park closes for the summer months so summer departures will run on an alternative itinerary

dayInfo.title: Join tour in Delhi; city tour of New Delhi
dayInfo.description: : Arrive in New Delhi, India's bustling capital which successfully combines the ancient with the modern. Amidst the tall and modern skyscrapers, there are still the remnants of a bygone time with numerous monuments and temples. For those arriving on time today our Leader plans to meet you in the hotel reception at 1.30pm for the welcome meeting and to take us on our afternoon city tour which will visit the imposing India Gate (war memorial arch), the Parliament buildings and the Rashtrapati Bhawan, the President's residence as well as Qutab Minar, the tallest stone tower in India. Our Leader will be on hand in the evening to suggest evening dining options. If you would like to receive a complimentary airport transfer today, you'll need to arrive into New Delhi's Indira Gandhi International airport (airport code DEL), which is 18km, around 40 minutes from our hotel. Please note that if you wish to join the city tour today, you must arrive at the hotel by 1.30pm. If you are booking your own flights, we recommend giving yourself at least one hour to clear the airport. From the airport to the hotel is around 40 minutes' drive, so therefore the latest your flight can arrive is 11am. Should you miss the welcome meeting, your Leader will inform you of any essential information as soon as you catch up.

dayInfo.title: Old Delhi sightseeing by rickshaw; drive to Agra and visit the Agra Fort
dayInfo.description: : Compared to New Delhi the Old City is much closer to the image conjured up by Rudyard Kipling. We travel by cycle rickshaw to its hub at Chandni Chowk Bazaar, a jamboree of deafening barter and a wonderful introduction to the 'real' India. The major sights nearby are the Jami Masjid Mosque and we pass by the Red Fort on our way out of the city. Mid-morning, head south from New Delhi to Agra, a bus journey of approximately four to four and a half hours. In the afternoon we plan to visit Agra Fort, built by Akbar the Great, which contains the incomparable Moti Masjid (Pearl Mosque). Before returning to the hotel we will get our first sight of the Taj Mahal in the evening light.

dayInfo.title: Early morning visit to the Taj Mahal. Visit Keoladeo Ghana National Park. Continue to Ranthambore by train
dayInfo.description: : This morning we aim to visit the Taj Mahal, the world's most perfect and poetic building, at sunrise. Over 300 years have elapsed since its construction, yet it stands today unscarred by age; its beauty and symmetry seemingly beyond man, time and space. Created by Shah Jahan as a funerary monument to his favourite wife, Mumtaz, it took 22 years to build (1630-52). The Great Moghul lies beside his beloved under the white marble dome. Inlaid with precious gems, the building cost a fortune. Later Shah Jahan moved his capital to Delhi before being overthrown by his son, Aurangzeb. Later in the day, drive to the entrance of Keoladeo Ghana National Park. Formerly a royal duck-shooting reserve and now an ornithologist's paradise, the 12 square miles of lakes and marshlands offer a safe habitat for large numbers of breeding waterbirds and migrants. More than 300 species have been sighted, among them herons, storks, geese and the huge and rare Siberian crane. We will be taken on a birdwatching tour by cycle rickshaw and we hope to see some of these magnificent birds. After lunch we continue our journey, taking the train to Ranthambore National Park (approximately 2 hours).

dayInfo.title: Game drives in Ranthambore National Park in search of Bengal Tiger
dayInfo.description: : Ranthambore is one of the best examples of the country's tiger conservation projects. The best chance of sightings is between September and May. During this period water is scarce and the animals must stay close to the lakes and river. It is little wonder that this was once one of the best hunting areas of the Maharajahs. We include a game drive this morning into the Reserve, in search of the wildlife which, as well as tiger, includes sloth bear, langur, jackal and fox as well as crested hawk eagle, crested serpent eagle, jacana, parakeet and white-breasted kingfisher. The park itself is very picturesque with lakes, rivers and forests surrounded by steep cliffs and rocky outcrops. In the afternoon there is another opportunity to do a game drive to get a chance to see more wildlife and views. The vehicles used for game drives are open top jeeps, with 6 seats and ideal for spotting wildlife. Due to regulations aimed at keeping traffic to a minimum in the parks we cannot guarantee exclusive use of the jeeps so you may be sharing with non-Explore customers. Please note that because the jeeps can only accommodate 6 people there is a chance we may have to split family groups up, this will depend entirely on the make up of your group and we will avoid this wherever possible.

dayInfo.title: Optional game drive before driving to Pachewar to stay in a heritage hotel.
dayInfo.description: : This morning there is chance for an optional game drive before we drive to Pachewar (approximately 4 hours' drive). A small village, Pachewar is famous for cenotaphs, blue pottery kilns, metal toy makers and interesting surroundings. It is a lively place that was once ruled by Khangarot Rajputs. The caretaker of Khandar, Thakur Anoop Singh Khangarot, had captured the fort of Ranthambore from the captivity of Marathas and annexed the fort to the state of Jaipur. The pace of the trip slows as we stay two nights at a family run heritage hotel, Pachewar Garh. This fort with its huge ramparts, turrets and gates, was built about 300 years ago and bears testimony to its rich heritage. After checking in, the rest of the afternoon is free to explore the village and sample first hand traditional rural life, you may even see villagers partaking in a game of cricket! This evening there is a puppet show at the hotel.

dayInfo.title: Full day in Pachewar, rural Rajasthan. Village walk, cooking lesson and farm visit.
dayInfo.description: : This morning head out exploring the village on foot, visiting the local temple and a village home where we have a cooking demonstration showcasing traditional Rajasthan cuisine. Later in the afternoon head to a farm giving us a great opportunity to meet local families and see more of rural life in India, this is India's most colourful regions, it's not uncommon to witness sari-clad women carrying terracotta pots of water. There is ample time to relax at our heritage fort hotel, for an added bit of fun the hotel provides traditional Indian costumes to wear at dinner.

dayInfo.title: Drive to Jaipur, afternoon tour of the Pink City.
dayInfo.description: : After breakfast we drive to Jaipur taking about three hours, there is always something new or different to see along the roadside in rural India. Sometimes called the Pink City, Jaipur was first painted terracotta pink by Maharajah Sawai Ram Singh to celebrate the visit of Prince Albert in 1853. This afternoon we will take a city tour with our Explore tour leader. We will visit the lavish and well preserved City Palace with its fine collection of textiles, costumes and armoury and the Palace of the Winds, a 5-storied façade (built about 1760) which has been the subject of countless Indian posters. Jai Singh, the great Maharaja astronomer, built his extraordinary (and very accurate) stargazing Observatory here. The Old City has several fine gates let into the pink walls, and there are many opportunities for photos and shopping. There is an optional puppet show at the hotel this evening or you may wish to see a Bollywood movie at the local cinema.

dayInfo.title: Full day in Jaipur. Visit the Amber Palace and Fortress.
dayInfo.description: : Today, we drive the short distance to the foot of Amber Palace and drive up to the gateway. This impressive hilltop fortress possesses what must be the world's finest Chamber of Mirrors and also affords glorious views of the surrounding plains. We will visit the palace after which we will return to Jaipur. Sometimes called the Pink City, Jaipur's palaces and fortified walls were first painted terracotta pink by Maharajah Swai Ram Singh to celebrate the visit of Prince Albert in 1853. This afternoon has been left free to explore more of Jaipur in your own time. You may choose to visit one of the famous bazaars which are bursting with delights, from marble statues to antique textiles; traditional print blocks to local musical instruments.

dayInfo.title: Return to Delhi stopping at Samode Palace outside Jaipur for camel cart tour and lunch.
dayInfo.description: : After a leisurely breakfast bid farewell to Jaipur, driving back to Delhi. An hour north east of Jaipur we make a stop at Samode Palace in the Aravalli hills. Blending elements of Mughal traditional architecture, this 475 year old former royal residence is a treasure trove awaiting to be explored with twisting narrow stone staircases, lavish mosaics, fountains and hidden courtyards. We have a tour of the grounds on a camel cart and have lunch (included) at the palace before continuing our journey by bus to the modern Gurugram district of New Delhi, next to the airport; arriving early evening.

dayInfo.title: Tour ends in New Delhi
dayInfo.description: : The trip ends after breakfast at our hotel in New Delhi. There are no activities planned today, so you are free to depart from New Delhi at any time. If your flight is departing later in the day luggage storage facilities are available at our hotel. If you would like to receive a complimentary airport transfer today, you need to depart from New Delhi's Indira Gandhi International airport (airport code DEL), which is 8km, around 20 minutes from the hotel.

tourName: Golden Triangle 7 day tour in India
placesVisited: Delhi, Agra, Jaipur
generalInfo:
This 8-day Golden Triangle tour in India takes you to one of the country’s most diverse and fascinating areas. The trip is tailor-made, allowing you the freedom to adjust your itinerary to suit your requirements. What’s more, you’ll be accompanied by a driver, who will remain with you for the entire journey, as well as experienced local guides who’ll help you get the most out of your holiday.

Your tour kicks off in Delhi, where you’ll have time to acclimatise before heading off on a New Delhi city tour along with a food tour in Old Delhi. Next, you’ll move on to Agra travelling & experiencing hospitality of Indian railways. Agra is a wonderfully preserved historic city, which was once the capital of the Mughal Empire and is home to the world-famous Taj Mahal. You will also be taken on a cycle tour to see Agra beyond the Taj Mahal.

Your final stop is the ‘Pink City’ of Jaipur, the capital of Rajasthan where we have arranged a Block printing tour along with the tour of Temples and Havelis of Jaipur and a cooking demonstration along with dinner with the local family.

You will be staying in a 150 year old Haveli (mansion) a homestay, a boutique hotel where you can meet the host and his family.

As this is a bespoke tour, plenty of optional extras are available. You could, for example, trek through the local countryside or ramp up the adventure with a hot-air balloon safari. Live your dream holiday!

dayInfo.description: Upon arrival in Delhi airport, you will be met by our representative and will be provided assisted transfer to your hotel. Upon arrival check in to the Hotel. Spend the rest of the day at leisure, rest and rejunate at the hotel. Overnight at the UNESCO awarded Heritage Boutique Hotel Haveli Dharampura

Delhi - After breakfast, half day city tour of New Delhi. Places to visit include: Humayun’s Tomb • Qutub Minar • Drive past Kartavya Path (King´s Way) & Janpath. Later in the evening enjoy Delhi’s food tour in the most colourful bazar of India, visiting the Chandni Chowk on foot, and a Cycle Rickshaw ride in Old Delhi. • Visit to Asia's Largest Spice Market • Red Fort (from Outside) • Overnight at the Hotel (Haveli Dharampura)

Agra - After breakfast, you will be transferred to Delhi railway station for your 2-hour train journey to Agra. On arrival your guide will meet you at the station followed by a visit to Agra Fort. Later check in at the hotel. In the evening enjoy the Cycle Tour to see Agra beyond the Taj Mahal. The rest of the day is free at leisure. Overnight at the hotel (Coral Court)

Agra & Jaipur - Experience a unique Sunrise Visit of the Taj Mahal (closed on Friday). After the Taj visit return back to the Hotel for breakfast. Later drive to Jaipur (5 hours), en-route visit Fatehpur Sikri, the capital of Mugals before they shifted to Agra, also visit 8th century stepwell Chand Baori at Abhaneri village. Upon arrival in Jaipur, check-in at the hotel. Spend the evening at leisure. Overnight at the hotel (Ikkaki Niwas)

Jaipur -Today morning after breakfast, full day city tour of Jaipur. Places to visit: • Amber Fort • City Palace • Jantar Mantar • Hawa Mahal (from outside only). In the evening we have arranged a cooking demonstration for you, along with dinner with a local family. Hotel: Ikkaki Niwas

Jaipur - After breakfast, you will be driven a little outskirts of the city to experience the block printing of Jaipur. Later in the evening enjoy a beautiful walk of the Temples & Havelis of colourful and vibrant Jaipur with an expert. (We have a wide range of other activities as well according to your interest - please check with our Bespoke expert). Overnight at your Hotel (Ikkaki Niwas)
Delhi - After breakfast, drive back to Delhi (approx. 05 Hrs). Upon arrival check in to the Hotel and time to relax. Overnight at the Hotel (Pride Aero City)
Today morning after breakfast, you will be assisted & transferred in your private car to Delhi International airport to connect with your flight for your onward destination.

tourName: Golden Triangle 9 day tour in India
placesVisited: Delhi city tour, including Jama Masjid, Red Fort and Humayun’s Tomb, Cycle Rickshaw ride in Old Delhi, Agra, sunrise visit to Taj Mahal, Agra Fort, Fatehpur Sikri, Jaipur with full day city tour, including Jeep ride to Amber Fort, City Palace, Jantar Mantar and Hawa Mahal
generalInfo:
The gorgeous Golden Triangle is an unforgettable circuit, taking in three of northern India’s most celebrated and beautiful destinations: Delhi, Agra and Jaipur. This eight-day tour visits them all, exploring the key sights and most fascinating temples and monuments, including Delhi’s Red Fort and Jama Masjid mosque, the Taj Mahal, Agra Fort, 8th century stepwell and Jaipur’s City Palace and Amber Fort.

This is an excellent trip for anyone with only a short amount of time to spare, or it can be slotted into a longer itinerary. It’s incredibly priced but offers wonderful service, quality and style, accommodation for seven nights and all breakfasts included, plus travel with English speaking local guides and transfers in air-conditioned cars.

dayInfo.description: Arrival/Delhi - Upon arrival in Delhi airport, you will be met by our representative and will be provided assisted transfer to your hotel. Upon arrival check in to the Hotel. Spend the rest of the day at leisure. Overnight at the Hotel (Colonels Retreat).

Delhi - After breakfast, full day city tour of New & Old Delhi. Places to visit include: • Jama Masjid • Cycle Rickshaw ride in Old Delhi. • Visit to Asia's Largest Spice Market • Red Fort (from Outside) • Humayun’s Tomb • Qutub Minar • Drive Past Kartavya path & Janpath. Overnight at your Colonels Retreat Hotel.

Agra - After breakfast, you will be transferred to Delhi railway station for your 2 hours train journey to Agra. On arrival your guide will meet you at the station followed by a visit to Agra Fort. Then check in at the hotel. Later in the afternoon visit Mehtab Bagh to see the Taj Mahal from the other side of the river during sunset. The rest of the day is free at your leisure. Overnight at the hotel (Coral Court Boutique Homestay).

Agra & Jaipur - Enjoy an unforgettable Sunrise Visit of the Taj Mahal (closed on Friday). After Taj visit return back to the Hotel for breakfast. Later drive to Jaipur (5 hours), en-route visit Fatehpur Sikri, the capital of Mugals before they shifted to Agra. Also visit 8th century stepwell Chand Baori at Abhaneri village. Upon arrival in Jaipur, check-in at the hotel. Spend the evening at leisure. Overnight at your Heritage Boutique Hotel Ikkaki Niwas.

Jaipur - Today morning after breakfast, full day city tour of Jaipur. Places to visit include: • Amber Fort • City Palace • Jantar Mantar • Hawa Mahal (From outside only). In the evening explore the colorful local markets of Jaipur. Over night at your Ikkaki Niwas hotel.

Jaipur - Day free at leisure. We have a wide range of activities which we can organise for you for this free day on your request with supplement cost, for example Art & Antiquities Walk, Block Printing, Bagru, Bazaars, Craft & Cusines, Blue Pottery Excursion, cooking demonstrations along with meal with the local family, Kite flying for the kids and so on. Overnight at your Ikkaki Niwas hotel.

Delhi - After breakfast, drive back to Delhi (approx. 05 Hrs). Upon arrival check in to the Hotel. Overnight at the Hotel (Pride Aero City). Next day morning after breakfast, you will be assisted & transferred in your private car to Delhi International airport to connect flight for onward destination.

tourName: Golden Triangle and Central India tiger safari
generalInfo:
India is a medley of multiple components, a country so diverse that it may take several visits to explore the whole nation. However, for anyone visiting India for the first time, there are two aspects of the country that stand out. The Taj Mahal and the Tiger. And these two stand out not in isolation but in inclusion of all that surrounds them. This itinerary is a classic journey for those who maybe visiting India for the first time. For those who have not experienced the marvels of northern India and marvels of the verdant forests of Central India that inspired Rudyard Kipling. The journey gives a flavour of India’s rich history in Delhi where different eras of rule of stamped their mark, to the impact of Maharaja’s in the pink city of Jaipur leading on to Agra where the iconic Taj Mahal is world famous. After a romance with India’s royal past the journey takes you to the central Indian jungles to see another royal, India’s national animal, the Royal Bengal Tiger. India’s highly successful tiger conservation program which commenced in 1972, not only saved the tiger, but also all the other forest denizens that share the forest with it. Madhya Pradesh is the tiger state of India, with over 750 tigers in the wild it is the best place in the world to see tigers in the wild. Visit the up-and-coming Satpura National Park, Bori Wildlife Sanctuary and the better known Pench Tiger Reserve. Apart from tiger, these forests are home to leopard, sloth bear, Indian wild dog, Indian gaur, sambar deer, spotted deer and a host of other mammals. Birdlife is abundant here and a visit to these parks is a dream of any bird watcher. Enjoy a burst of both cultural and nature-based experiences through various highlights like…
• History visit and sightseeing in Delhi
• Exploring the pink city Jaipur
• Visting the Taj Mahal
• Enjoying a train journey to the city of Bhopal
• Exploring central Indian forests
• Jeep, walking, boat and night safaris
• Exquisite Indian cuisine
• Immersing into local life and culture
This journey is a must do for anyone visiting India for the first time who is inclined towards experiencing a blend of culture and nature alike.

dayInfo.description: Arrival at Delhi International airport Transfer to Taj Palace and day at leisure and relaxation.

After breakfast, explore historic landmarks in Delhi such as the Red Fort, Jama Masjid, and India Gate. Visit bustling markets like Chandni Chowk and Connaught Place, and explore museums such as the National Museum and Gandhi Smriti. Delhi, the vibrant capital of India, is a kaleidoscope of culture, history, and modernity. Dive into the city's rich heritage by exploring iconic landmarks such as the Red Fort, Qutub Minar, and Jama Masjid. Indulge in a shopping spree at bustling markets like Chandni Chowk or savor Delhi's culinary delights from street food to fine dining. Immerse yourself in the local lifestyle with a rickshaw ride through Old Delhi's narrow lanes or witness the peaceful coexistence of religions at Lotus Temple. From ancient monuments to bustling bazaars, Delhi offers a perfect blend of tradition and contemporary allure on your Golden Triangle itinerary. Overnight stay at Delhi Taj Palace
After breakfast, check out from the hotel and drive to Jaipur (approx. 6 hours, 315 km). Lunch at Jaipur and overnight stay at Jai Mahal Palace.

Jaipur, the vibrant Pink City of India, exudes a rich tapestry of culture and heritage that captivates visitors from around the world. Known for its majestic palaces, bustling bazaars, and colorful festivals, Jaipur offers a glimpse into Rajasthan's royal past and artistic traditions. The city's architectural marvels like the Amber Fort and Hawa Mahal narrate tales of grandeur and opulence. Dive into Jaipur's culture through its traditional music, folk dances, and sumptuous Rajasthani cuisine. The warmth and hospitality of its residents, coupled with the city's timeless charm, make Jaipur a captivating destination where history and culture converge in a kaleidoscope of experiences., including Amber Fort, Hawa Mahal, and City Palace. Visit the Jantar Mantar observatory and Albert Hall Museum. Shop for local handicrafts at the bazaars and enjoy Rajasthani cuisine. Overnight stay at Jai Mahal Palace.
After morning breakfast, check out from the hotel and drive to Agra (distance 235 km, duration 5 hours). Overnight stay at Taj View Agra.

Visit the iconic Taj Mahal at sunrise and explore Agra Fort. Explore Fatehpur Sikri, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Visit other attractions like Itmad-ud-Daulah's Tomb and Mehtab Bagh for a view of the Taj Mahal. Overnight stay at Taj View Agra

Check out from the hotel at Morning and drive to Agra Railway station to catch a train to reach Bhopal heart of central India (Duration 6:30 Hrs.) Arrival and received by chauffer and drive Jehan Numa Palace for Lunch after Lunch drive to Reni Pani Jungle lodge 3Hrs drive Relax and stay Reni Pani Jungle Lodge, Diner and Overnight stay at Reni Pani Jungle Lodge.

Morning core drive in Reni Pani Jungle Lodge - Exploring Satpura Tiger Reserve in the morning can be a great experience for wildlife enthusiasts! You may encounter a variety of animals such as tigers, leopards, sloth bears, Indian bison, and a wide range of birds and enjoy the beauty of nature breakfast will be in the park Return to lodge by 11:30 am to relax with hot lunch Night Drive in Reni Pani Jungle Lodge – Explore night drive To spot nocturnal wildlife. You may have the opportunity to see animals like leopards, sloth bear, foxes, civets’ jungle cat and if lucky rusty spotted cat the smallest wild cat in the world also various species of owls. Return you’re the lodge for drinks and dinner duration for night drive will be around 4 hours
Morning core drive at Reni Pani Jungle Lodge Evening core drive at Reni Pani Jungle Lodge Overnight stay at Reni Pani Jungle Lodge (Full Board)

Depart From Reni Pani Jungle Lodge to Bori Safari Lodge by Boat Transfers – The Saptura Tiger Reserve is a unique landscape in Central India where rugged mountains, evergreen patches, dry deciduous forests, grasslands and rivers can all be witnessed in one vista. The western and northern periphery of the park is covered by an expanse of water covering over 250 sq. kilometres of area, known as the Tawa Reservoir. Boat safaris are possible on this reservoir and Jehan Numa Wilderness has its own private boat that can be used by guests transferring between Reni Pani Jungle Lodge and Bori Safari Lodge or vice versa. The boat cruise transfer covers a distance of 35 kilometres over 2 hours on the Tawa Reservoir. This journey is mostly on the backwaters of the Denwa river, and this river meanders through some stunning landscape.
Morning core drive Churna Evening core drive Mallupura Overnight stay at Bori Safari Lodge (Full Board)
Morning core drive Churna Evening core drive Mallupura Overnight stay at Bori Safari Lodge (Full Board)
Morning Breakfast and Check out from the Bori safari Lodge Drive to Pench (4.30 Hrs). Arrival In Pench Lunch Overnight stay at Pench Tree Lodge.
Morning core drive in Pench Evening core drives at Pench Overnight stay at Pench Tree Lodge (Full Board)
Morning core drive in Pench Evening core drives at Pench Overnight stay at Pench Tree Lodge (Full Board)
Morning, after breakfast, you will depart for Nagpur Domestic Airport, which is a 3.5-hour drive, to catch your connecting flight to Delhi or Mumbai.

tourName: Golden Triangle and Kerala Tour
generalInfo: Experience a real taste of India on this tour.  The 'Golden Triangle' combines India’s most famous sights - historic Delhi, the legendary Taj Mahal at Agra and the Pink City of Jaipur.  In Kerala you visit the harbour city of Cochin, Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary in the Western Ghat mountains, spend two nights on a houseboat in Kerala's backwaters and finish at a beach for a couple of days relaxation.  This tour uses economy hotels, guesthouses and homestays so there are plenty of opportunities to upgrade if required.  There are airlines that allow an 'open jaw' flight into Delhi and out of Cochin, we have included Air India in the quote who fly direct to Delhi and back direct from Cochin..

dayInfo.description: Depart the UK. Arrive Delhi the same day. Transfer to accommodation. Three nights in Delhi.
Sightseeing - Old Delhi. Evening cookery class and dinner at Saffron Palate.
Sightseeing - New Delhi.
Transfer to the railway station. Take Gatimaan Express train. Depart Delhi 08.10 arrive Agra 09.50 [not operational on Fridays]. Agra sightseeing. One night in Agra.
Transfer to Jaipur visiting Fatehpur Sikri and Abhaneri Stepwell enroute. Two nights in Jaipur.
Sightseeing - Jaipur
Transfer to Jaipur Airport. Fly Jaipur to Cochin via Chennai. Transfer to Fort Cochin. Two nights in Cochin.
Sightseeing - Cochin. Evening - Kathakali performance.
Transfer to Thekkady [Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary]. Visit spice plantation on the way. Two nights in Thekkady.
Morning - Soft Trek. Evening - Kalaripayattu performance.
Transfer to backwaters to arrive before lunch. Two nights on board your exclusive houseboat.
Full day on houseboat - cruising morning and afternoon.
Disembark from houseboat and transfer to Mararikulam beach area. Two nights at Mararikulam.
Day free to relax / explore the area.
Transfer to Cochin Airport for your flight home.

tourName: Golden Triangle and Rajasthan tour in India
generalInfo:
Welcome to the Land of Royals. Feel like a Maharaja and experience things the same way. Visit the beautiful places that you have only heard of. Experience the splendid monuments, food, culture, history, palaces and the local traditions during this trip. Spend some time with the local artisans and learn the craft getting birth in front of you.

Below are the activities and places you would be enjoying during this trip:

1. Visit the UNESCO World Heritage Sites in Delhi and experience the imperial and Mughal architecture.
2. Visit one of the 7 wonders of the world Taj Mahal and discover the magic of white marble at Agra.
3. Energize yourself at Morning Taj Facing Yoga Session at Agra.
4. Enjoy guided tour of the Pink City.
5. Heena Painting on Hands and Feet in Jaipur.
6. Visit Mehrangarh Fort and experience the other architectural prowess of Jodhpur.
7. Sharing Boat Ride at Lake Pichola – an artificial lake located in the heart of Udaipur.
8. Go on a Mughal Heritage Kachhpura Village Walk tour in Agra- an eye-opening experience.
9. Enjoy a Cycle Rickshaw ride in the narrow lanes of Chandni Chowk Bazaar of Delhi.
10. Tour of Bagru Village to meet local people and experience the unique style of wood block prints.
11. Bishnoi Village visits near Jodhpur and interact with locals.
12. Visit Ranakpur Jain Temple – one of the most important among the five major pilgrimage centers of Jainism
13. Meet locals and see the art & craft of Udaipur.

This tour covers not only the highlights of the region but a host of bespoke activities to enhance your trip experience. The trip includes a lot of local interactions in terms of village visits and walks that enable the traveler to have an enriching trip experience. All internal land transport in a private comfortable MUV car, luxury hotel accommodations with breakfast, top local guides, tours, entrances, a few meals and a host of other inclusions are covered.

dayInfo.description: On arrival at New Delhi International Airport receive a warm welcome from our representative and get transferred to the hotel. Check into the hotel and enjoy rest of the day at leisure.

• After breakfast, proceed for sightseeing tour of the city with your guide. • Drive past or if you wish you may visit Red Fort • Drive Past or if you wish you may take a stop at Raj Ghat – the cremation site of Mahatma Gandhi. • Visit Agrasen ki Baoli (ancient water reservoir) • Visit Jama Masjid • Visit Chandni Chowk – ‘the Moonlight Square and enjoy a Cycle Rickshaw Ride which takes you through the narrow streets of the Chandni Chowk. • Visit Lakshmi Narayan Temple • Drive Past India Gate – The All India War Memorial • Also pass by the Rashtrapati Bhavan (formerly the viceroy's residence) and the Parliament House. • Enjoy a special lunch at local restaurant. • Visit Humayun's Tomb • Visit Qutub Minar - A UNESCO World Heritage Site.

After hearty breakfast, travel to Agra (222Km, 5 hour drive). On arrival meet our representative and check into the hotel. Enjoy rest of the day at leisure. In the evening enjoy a Special Dinner at Taj Facing Rooftop Restaurant.

• Early morning visit Taj Mahal during Sunrise (As fuel based vehicles are not permitted in the vicinity of Taj Mahal, you will head to Taj Mahal gate by a Battery operated Bus. (Friday Closed). • After breakfast, visit Agra Fort - An Epitome of the Mughal Dynasty • Visit Itmad-Ud-Daulah’s Tomb • Late afternoon go for Mughal Heritage Kachhpura Village walk with high tea OPTIONAL TOURS : • Mohabbat the Taj Show- You can watch the famous Mohabbat the Taj show, presented by the Sanskritik Natyashala. It is a series of play depicting the saga of love.

Early Morning, Enjoy Taj Mahal Facing Yoga Session. After breakfast, check out from hotel and travel to Jaipur (240Km, 5 hour drive). En-route visit Fatehpur Sikri - A city predominantly made of red sandstone and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. On arrival meet our representative and check into the hotel and enjoy rest of the day at leisure.

• After breakfast, proceed for full day Jaipur sightseeing tour with your Guide. • Visit Amber Fort – One of the most magnificent palaces in India. (The Fort is perched on a hill, so to reach there; you may enjoy a Jeep ride in Amber fort. • Visit Jantar Mantar – largest stone astronomical observatory in the world. • Visit to City Palace and Museum– Built by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh during the years 1729 to 1732. • Photo Stop Hawa Mahal – built by Maharaja Sawai Pratap Singh in the year 1799. • In the evening enjoy Heena Painting on hands and Feet.

After breakfast check out from hotel and travel to Jodhpur (337Km, 6 hour drive). En-route visit Bagru Village. Meet and interact local people and artisans and enjoy hands on experience where you create your own piece of art under a mentor to take back with you as a memento of your travels to India. On arrival at Jodhpur, meet our representative and check into the hotel. Enjoy rest of the day at leisure.

• After breakfast, proceed for sightseeing tour of Jodhpur city with your guide. • Visit Mehrangarh Fort • Visit- Jaswant Thada - The Royal Cenotaphs of Jodhpur • Visit the museum located in the Umaid Bhawan Palace. • Visit Madore Garden& Museum • Visit Toorji Ka Jhalra Bavdi (Stepwell) • Later visit Bishnoi Village near Jodhpur – The village is known for its cultural activities. Meet & Interact with local people.

After breakfast, check out from the hotel and travel to Udaipur (250Km, 5-hour drive). En-route visit the Ranakpur Temple. On arrival at Udaipur meet our representative and check into the hotel. Enjoy the rest of the day at leisure.

• After breakfast, proceed for Udaipur sightseeing with your guide. • Visit to City Palace & Museum • Visit the 17th century Jagdish Temple • Drive around the Fatehsagar Lake • Visit Saheliyon Ki Bari – A Majestic Garden. • Visit Bharatiya Lok Kala Museum • Later, take a Sharing Boat Ride at Lake Pichola. • In the evening, Visit Bagore Ki Haveli. Enjoy the live evening show, which introduces you to a variety of Indian dances.
After breakfast, check out from hotel and get transferred to Udaipur Airport and fly to New Delhi International Airport to board your flight for your home town.

tourName: Golden Triangle and Rajasthan tour, India
generalInfo:
Explore the highlights of North Indian Culture with this special 14 day tour.

From historic Delhi you will explore north, taking in cultural highlights of the region along with the Wonder of the World - the Taj Mahal.

Whether you are navigating the ghost city of Fatepur Sikri to Tiger tracking in National Parks you are never short of adventurous options!

Onward you will take in the rich history and stunning architecture of the famed Pink City, and trek on elephant to the unique Amber Fort.

Some of India's most famous forts are included in this tour, with stunning surroundings at Jaisalmer and Jodphur.

Finish your experience and reflect with a few days relaxing at one of our hand picked locations, to absorb the amazing experiences you have just enjoyed!

dayInfo.description: Arrive Delhi: Afternoon sightseeing where you can experience the new culture and local guide and driver will take you to see the Mahatma Gandhi Museum. Evening dinner & Overnight at one of our hand picked Hotels.

Sightseeing Delhi: Enjoy an easy morning and get ready to explore the old parts and new markets of Delhi. Sightseeing in Delhi where you will visit the Raj Ghat, the memorial to Mahatma Gandhi and then enjoy an afternoon tour of New Delhi that takes you past the Presidential Palace, the National Parliament, India Gate and more. Then you will visit the 800-year-old Qutub Minar, the world’s tallest brick minaret and the Iron Pillar. Evening dinner & Overnight at one of our hand picked Hotels.

First Train to Agra & Sightseeing: After breakfast, take an early train to Agra, a city whose very name evokes the romanticism and exoticism of India. On arrival, check in at the hotel before leaving in the afternoon for a visit to Agra Fort and later visiting Taj Mahal during the sunset. Evening dinner & Overnight at one of our hand picked Hotels.

Fatehpur Sikri, Bharatpur and Karauli: Sunrise Taj Mahal visit: After breakfast drive to Karauli and enroute visit Fatehpur Sikri. The abandoned, ghost city of Fatehpur Sikri lies some 40 km from Agra. The city is remarkably well-preserved, and visitors can see the Jama Masjid, the tomb of Salim Chisti, and several palaces. Afterwards visit Bharatpur for the afternoon to absorb the cultural experience of Rajsthan and then enjoy an evening drive to Karauli a small town experience. Evening dinner & Overnight at one of our hand picked Hotels.

Karauli - Ranthambhore National Park: Enjoy an easy morning and visit the town and markets. Then drive to Wildlife national park Ranthambhore. For the afternoon there will be a shared Jeep Safari and then return to the Camp. Overnight Tented Accommodation, Dinner, B’fast, lunch.

Ranthambhore National Park: Wake up early morning and leave for your safari into the National Park. Track the tigers and other wildlife through the morning safari. Our two game drives give you ample opportunity to spot Ranthambore’s famously inquisitive tigers. Relax at the resort - You have a choice to spend time at the pool or visits the town. Later in the afternoon proceed for afternoon safari. Overnight Tented Accommodation, Dinner, B’fast, lunch.

Ranthambore – Jaipur: We take to the road after breakfast towards Jaipur. Jaipur is a city of history and tradition, dating back to its foundation in the 17th century by Sawai Jai Singh, from whom it derives its name. Evening dinner & Overnight at one of our hand picked Hotels.

Jaipur – Pick City: Follow in the footsteps of the Mughals with an elephant trek to the amazing Amber Fort, which imperiously looks down on the city from atop the Hill of Eagles. You don’t just come here for the views – the Amber Fort is a majestic blend of Hindu and Mughal architecture built with red sandstone and white marble. The imposing and forbidding exterior belies the beautiful fusion of art and architecture behind the ramparts. Back in Jaipur, a sightseeing tour takes us to visit the City Palace, with its elaborately carved doorways and the Jantar Mantar observatory. Evening dinner & Overnight at one of our hand picked Hotels.

Jaipur: dinner with family: Late afternoon proceed to visit a local family, who will welcome you to their home. Join them in their kitchen and learn about the Indian spices and curry. You can even help them in their kitchen, after the cooking demonstration join them for dinner at their dinner table. Talk over the Indian living and culture at first hand. Evening dinner & Overnight at one of our hand picked Hotels.
Jaipur – Jaisalmer: Airport Transfer to Jaisalmer. Evening dinner & Overnight at one of our hand picked Hotels.

Jaisalmer Sightseeing: After breakfast visit the silent 12th century Fort built by Prince Jaisal and the Palace which stands at the highest point (100 metres) above the marketplace. Also visit the Jain Temples (12th-15th centuries) which lie within the fort complex. Visit Nathmal ki Haveli the last of the great havelis. Also visit Gadi-sar an artificial lake that was an important source of water in the past. Enjoy the options of Jeep & Camel Safaris, villages and local communities. Evening dinner & Overnight at one of our hand picked Hotels.

Jaisalmer – Jodhpur: After breakfast drive to Jodhpur visit Mehrangarh Fort. Considered one of India's best forts, this invincible stronghold of the Marwars sits on a steep hill lording over a wonderful view of its surroundings. It is also a beautiful fort and undoubtedly, the jewel of Jodhpur. Evening dinner & Overnight at one of our hand picked Hotels.

Jodhpur – Udaipur: Today early start drive to the famous town Udaipur. The city is replete with fantastic hilltop fortresses, exotic fairy-tale palaces and gripping legends of medieval chivalry and heroism. Evening dinner & Overnight at one of our hand picked Hotels.

Udaipur: Breakfast at hotel and then tart your city tour. The City Palace - was built in 1725 of granite and marble with filigreed balconies, ornate windows and craftsmanship in glass. The royal palace walls stretch over a mile on the eastern side of the lake. Later enjoy a two-hour boat-ride on Lake Pichola, visiting many of the ghats (banks) where ablutions and meditation take place, and enjoy excellent views of the Lake Palace and City Palace. Also you can visit jag Mandir Palace - formally the Royal Residence, Sahelio Ki Bari. Overnight at Udaipur at one of our hand picked hotels.

tourName: Golden Triangle cultural tour, India
generalInfo:
The Golden Triangle Cultural Tour, India with Kathmandu is one of the most popular and enriching travel circuits in South Asia, offering a perfect blend of history, architecture, culture, and spirituality across India and Nepal. This classic journey covers the three iconic cities of northern India—Delhi, Agra, and Jaipur—and extends to Kathmandu, the cultural and spiritual heart of Nepal.
The Golden Triangle route showcases the grandeur of Mughal, Rajput, and British-era heritage, allowing travelers to experience centuries of history through magnificent forts, palaces, temples, and UNESCO World Heritage Sites. From the bustling streets of India’s capital to the timeless beauty of the Taj Mahal and the royal elegance of Rajasthan’s Pink City, the tour is a celebration of South Asia’s cultural richness.

The journey continues to Kathmandu Valley, home to ancient Hindu and Buddhist landmarks, medieval cities, and living traditions. Here, travelers explore sacred temples, monumental stupas, and historic Durbar Squares, offering a fascinating contrast and cultural extension to the Indian Golden Triangle.

This tour is ideal for travelers seeking a comprehensive cultural experience, combining architectural wonders, spiritual heritage, and vibrant local life across two remarkable countries.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Delhi, the capital of India. You will be greeted by our representative at the airport and transferred to your hotel. The rest of the day is free to relax after your journey. Overnight at the hotel.

Delhi Sightseeing – Old & New Delhi. After breakfast, enjoy a guided tour of New Delhi, visiting Laxmi Narayan (Birla) Temple, India Gate, and Parliament House (drive past). In the afternoon, explore Old Delhi, including Jama Masjid, one of Asia’s largest mosques; the majestic Red Fort (UNESCO World Heritage Site); and Raj Ghat, the memorial of Mahatma Gandhi. In the evening, enjoy a sound and light show highlighting Delhi’s rich history. Overnight at the hotel.

Delhi – Agra (200 km | approx. 4 hrs). After breakfast, drive to Agra, the city of the Taj Mahal. Upon arrival, visit the world-famous Taj Mahal (UNESCO World Heritage Site), a symbol of eternal love. Continue to Agra Fort, an impressive red sandstone fortress that served as the seat of Mughal power. Check in to your hotel and relax. Overnight at the hotel in Agra.

Agra – Fatehpur Sikri – Jaipur (145 km | approx. 4 hrs). After breakfast, depart for Jaipur, stopping en route at Fatehpur Sikri, the abandoned Mughal capital built by Emperor Akbar. Explore highlights such as Buland Darwaza, Diwan-e-Khas, Panch Mahal, and the Tomb of Salim Chishti. Continue to Jaipur, the vibrant Pink City of Rajasthan. In the evening, enjoy a cultural dinner experience at Chokhi Dhani, a traditional Rajasthani village. Overnight at the hotel in Jaipur.

Jaipur Sightseeing. After breakfast, explore Jaipur’s royal heritage. Visit the magnificent Amber Fort, perched on a hilltop overlooking Maota Lake. Continue to the City Palace, Hawa Mahal (Palace of Winds), and the historic Jantar Mantar Observatory (UNESCO World Heritage Site). Overnight at the hotel in Jaipur.

Jaipur – Delhi (265 km | approx. 5 hrs) – Fly to Kathmandu. After breakfast, drive back to Delhi. Upon arrival, transfer to the international airport for your flight to Kathmandu, Nepal. On arrival, meet our representative and transfer to your hotel. Overnight at the hotel in Kathmandu.

Kathmandu and Bhaktapur Sightseeing. After breakfast, begin sightseeing in the Kathmandu Valley. Visit Pashupatinath Temple, Nepal’s most sacred Hindu temple, located on the banks of the Bagmati River. Continue to Boudhanath Stupa, one of the largest Buddhist stupas in the world. Later, drive to Bhaktapur, a beautifully preserved medieval city, and explore Bhaktapur Durbar Square, known for its exquisite temples and traditional architecture. Overnight at the hotel.

Kathmandu – Patan and Swayambhunath. After breakfast, enjoy a full-day cultural tour of Kathmandu Valley. Visit Kathmandu Durbar Square, including the Kumari Temple, home of the Living Goddess. Continue to Swayambhunath (Monkey Temple), offering panoramic views over the city. Later, explore Patan Durbar Square, famous for its Newari architecture, Krishna Mandir, and the Golden Temple. Overnight at the hotel.
Departure. Free time until your scheduled transfer to the airport for your onward journey, carrying unforgettable memories of India and Nepal’s cultural treasures.

tourName: Golden Triangle express tour, India
placesVisited: Golden Triangle, Delhi, Sanjay Colony slum walking tour, Street food tour, Jaipur, Hawa Mahal, Amber Fort, Agra, Agra Fort, Sunset at the Taj Mahal
generalInfo:
Over just four days, and travelling for the most part by train, this small group tour of India whisks you around some of the most iconic sights in the country, as you explore the famous Golden Triangle.

Beginning in Delhi, you will take a guided walking tour of the Sanjay Colony, a small slum, to learn about the daily lives of its residents. Time is set aside for sightseeing around key landmarks in the capital, including Qutub Minar, India Gate and Humayun’s Tomb, before reconnecting with your guide to enjoy a mouthwatering street food tour.

Next day you’ll move on to Jaipur, the fabulous ‘Pink City’, with almost every building in the historic centre painted in terracotta pink, a magnificent sight at sunset. The unmissable sights here of course included the Amber Fort, built from red sandtone during the 16th century.

From Jaipur it’s on to Agra, where you’ll be accommodated in a welcoming homestay. The historic Agra Fort was once the main residence of Mughal emperors, and is now a key attraction here, but you will be elsewhere by sunset. This is the perfect time to admire the spectacular Taj Mahal, the greatest monument to love ever created. You’ll need to be quick with your camera to capture a great shot, as this is without doubt India’s most-visited site.

After having dinner with your hosts in Agra, the following day it’s just a short train journey back to Delhi where you can continue your adventures. For those with limited budget or time, this tour really is the best way to take in the Golden Triangle, as well as several other lesser-known locations that many tours miss.

dayInfo.description: DELHI: Your guide will meet you at your hotel and on your first day you can do any of the city tours or slum tours which we do. We suggest in the morning visiting Sanjay Colony, a small slum built on 25 acres of land located in the south of Delhi near the Bahai Lotus Temple and Iskcon temple. Learn about the working and residential life and witness how despite the challenging living conditions, it remains an area charged with positive energy and strong community. You will also learn about the NGO programs run by our sister NGO Reality Gives, which are directly supported by your visit. In the afternoon we suggest doing some more traditional sightseeing of your choice such as visiting India Gate, Qutub Minar, Humayun’s tomb, Agrasen ki Baoli (a stepwell) and Gurudwara Bangla Sahib, a Sikh temple and one of the largest community kitchens in India which feeds more than 10,000 people per day. In the evening, if you still have the energy, you can explore old Delhi and go on our popular food tour if you wish!

Delhi / Jaipur : We’ll leave Delhi in the morning by train (5 hrs), arriving in Jaipur at lunch time, and will then check in to our hotel. We will then visit Amber Fort with its magnificent views. Later we’ll walk around the pink city visiting Jantar Mantar, Hawa Mahal and some markets including Bapu Bazaar.

Jaipur / Agra: In the morning, we’ll get the morning train to Agra, home of the Taj Mahal and Magnificent Agra Fort. We will arrive in Agra late at midday where we’ll check into a family run guest house; afterwards we’ll explore Mehtab Bagh, a small 22 acre Persian-style garden located next to the Yamuna river, offering a very unique view of the Taj Mahal. Later we’ll visit the massive Agra Fort, built with red sandstone, Head back to hotel in the evening after dinner. If you are not tired have a drink on the hotel’s roof top overlooking the Taj!

Agra/ Delhi: Today we’ll wake up early to see the Taj Mahal at sunrise- the best time to visit. We come back to our guest house to have a late breakfast and then check out and drive to Delhi. On the way we will stop at a small village where you will get an understanding of how the majority of India’s population live with their unique traditions and customs and to see one of or Rural Community Project. We’ll arrive in Delhi in the evening, and you probably won’t have much energy to do anything else! This will be the end of your tour

tourName: Golden Triangle & Kerala holiday, India
placesVisited: Delhi, City tour of Old Delhi, Agra, Sunrise Taj Mahal visit, Agra Fort, Fatehpur Sikri, Jaipur city tour, Cochin city tour, Munnar, Periyar, Thekkady tour, Spice plantation tour, Alleppey, Houseboat on backwaters, Marari
generalInfo:
The Best of the Golden Triangle & Kerala - Heritage Trail: A perfect intro to India!
This tailor made Golden Triangle and Kerala holiday, India, teams the unforgettable cities and sights of the celebrated Golden Triangle in the north with exploration of one of the country’s most beautiful and lush states, Kerala, in the south.

During this 17-day holiday you will stay in gorgeous, atmospheric properties and heritage hotels and will be driven by your own personal driver in a private air conditioned vehicle. Tour the historic cities of Delhi, Agra, Jaipur and Cochin accompanied by a private guide, taking in spectacular temples and architecture. Enjoy superb Indian food and discover India’s lush spice plantations in Thekkady. Round off your holiday with time relaxing on Kerala’s beautiful beaches. Throughout this holiday, you’ll be fully supported by our network of on-the-ground staff, so all you have to do is relax and enjoy these two beautiful regions of India!

dayInfo.description: Delhi - Upon arrival in Delhi airport, you will be met by our representative and will be provided assisted transfer to your hotel. Upon arrival check in to the Hotel. Spend the rest of the day at leisure. Overnight at the Hotel. Hotel: The Oberoi Maidens

Agra - Day 2: After breakfast, Morning city tour of Old Delhi. Places to visit include: • Jama Masjid • Cycle Rickshaw ride in Old Delhi • Red Fort (from Outside). Later you will be driven to Agra (4 hours approx.). On arrival check in at the hotel. Overnight at your hotel - the Boutique Homestay Coral Court. Day 3: Un unforgettable Sunrise Taj Visit (closed on Friday). After the Taj visit return back to the Hotel for breakfast. Later visit Agra Fort. Evening is at leisure. Overnight at the hotel Coral Court.

Jaipur - Day 4: Today morning after breakfast, drive to Jaipur (approx. 5 Hrs), en-route visit Fatehpur Sikri and 8th century Abaneri stepwell. Upon arrival in Jaipur, check-in at the hotel. Overnight at the Boutique Hotel: Ikkaki Niwas. Day 5: Today morning after breakfast, full day city tour of Jaipur. Places to visit include: • Amber Fort • City Palace • Jantar Mantar • Hawa Mahal (From outside only. In the evening explore the colourful local markets of Jaipur. Overnight at the Hotel. Day 6: After breakfast, day free at leisure. Overnight at the Hotel.

Cochin - Day 7: After breakfast, you will be provided assisted departure transfer to airport to connect the flight for Cochin via Mumbai. On arrival at Cochin airport, you will be provided assisted arrival transfer to Hotel. Overnight at The Francis Residence . Day 8: After breakfast, half day city tour of Cochin. Places to visit include: • Jewish Synagogue (Saturday remain closed) • Dutch Palace (Friday remain closed) • Chinese fishing nets • St. Francis Church. In the evening witness a classical Indian dance show – Kathakali. Overnight at the Hotel.

Munnar - Day 9: After breakfast, drive to Munnar (Approx. 4 Hours). Upon arrival check in at the Hotel. Rest of the day is free at leisure. Overnight at the hotel: Spice Tree. Day 10: After breakfast, full day sightseeing of Munnar, Laxmi Hill track, Tea Museum visit. Overnight at the hotel.

Periyar - Day 11: After breakfast, drive to Periyar (3.5 Hrs approx.). • Kalaripayattu in Thekkady. Upon arrival check in at the hotel. Overnight at the CGH eco hotel: Spice Village. Day 12: After breakfast, enjoy bamboo rafting at Periyar lake and later in afternoon enjoy the tracking at Periyar. Overnight at the hotel.
Alleppey-Houseboat - Day 13: After breakfast, drive to Alleppey (4 Hrs approx.). Upon arrival board into the Houseboat. Also enjoy the Canoe ride. Overnight at the Houseboat (Spice coast, CGH)

Marari - Day 14: After breakfast, check out from the Houseboat and drive to Marari (30 Min approx.). Upon arrival check in to the hotel. Overnight at the CGH Earth hotel Marari Beach Resort. Day 15 and 16: After breakfast, your days are free at leisure to enjoy the beaches, the hotel and time to relax. Overnights at the hotel. Hotel : Marari Beach Resort
After breakfast, you will be provided assisted departure to the airport for your onward flight or flight home.

tourName: Golden Triangle rail holiday in India
generalInfo:
Explore the Golden Triangle of India (Delhi, Agra & Jaipur) using trains with a side trip to the wildlife sanctuary of Panna.

In Panna stay at the lovely Sarai at Toria and as well as going in search of the elusive tiger you can explore the Khajuraho Temples, as well as the sights of Orchha.

The tour uses a mixture of overnight trains, fast express trains and one of the newer Vande Bharat trains.

Even though the main journeys are by train we will include all the sightseeing and guides so that you can get the most out of your stays in Delhi, Agra and Jaipur.

Stay in smaller properties, lovely guesthouses and homestay style havelis.

This tour gives you the highlights of the Golden Triangle with a wildlife and train twist.

dayInfo.description: Depart the UK. Flights can be booked by us and therefore the whole holiday will be protected under our ATOL.

Arrival in Delhi and transfer to Haveli Hauz Khas, your home for 2 nights. Afternoon visit Dilli-Haat. An open air craft bazaar, home to handicrafts and artisanal works from all states of India. It is an open-air craft bazaar. Followed by a walk through the INA market visiting: The Indian National Airways Market (known as INA Market), known as the food bazaar of Delhi. Fresh seafood, meat, spices, vegetables and fruits - if you don't get it anywhere else, you get it at this market. Enjoy the evening buying vegetables and spices for a cooking-demo, followed by dinner with a local Indian family.

Full day Delhi sightseeing tour: Morning: You will be taken to Old Delhi via Metro to enjoy "MASTER JI KE HAVELI" Old Delhi Tour with meal. A heritage & bazaar walk, some street food tasting, cycle/battery rickshaw rides, spice market visit (Khari Baoli), temple/Fatehpuri Mosque Visit. After this, you will visit Bangla Sahaib Gurudwara [Sikh Temple], witness community kitchen. The community kitchen cooks and doles out 800 kilograms of dahl and vegetable curry, chapatis made out of 1,700 kilograms of atta and 400 kilograms of rice daily. Over 35,000 people are fed each day, and the number goes up to 100,000 during festivals Afternoon: New Delhi Tour including Humayun Tomb, Qutab Minar and a drive through the administrative buildings [President House, Parliament, India Gate].

Late morning visit Salam Balal Trust: NGO for street children that provides full care and protection through education, vocational training and mental health. In time, you will be met and transferred to railway station to board overnight train to Khajuraho: 11842-KKDE KURJ EXPRESS departing at 18:20 (A/C First Class Sleeper) Overnight on the sleeper train.
Arrive Khajuraho railway station at 08:00. Meet & greet and transfer to Panna [30 Min]; Breakfast & relax in the lobby until your room is ready. Afternoon: Boat ride.
Morning & Afternoon Jeep Safaris to Panna National Park. [Note: Park will remain closed for the entire day on Diwali & Holi and on all Wednesday afternoons.
Morning: Excursion to Khajuraho for sightseeing of temples. Afternoon: At leisure.

After breakfast transfer to Orchha (approx 3.5 hrs) and visit Orchha Palace & Cenotaphs. [Lunch at Orchha on direct basis]. Transfer to Jhansi station (45 mins) for train to Agra: Gatimaan Express 15:05/17:40 - A/C Executive Class. On arrival transfer to Ekaa Villa in Agra.

Morning: Taj Mahal at Sunrise (closed on Friday). Return to hotel for breakfast. Agra-beat cycle tour with school visit (Closed on Sundays and National Holidays). After lunch visit Agra Fort and Itmad-ud-Daula.

After breakfast drive to Fatehpur Sikri (approx.1.5 hrs). Proceed further to Keoladeo National Park (Bharatpur) for a rickshaw ride for bird watching. Lunch on direct payment basis. Transferred to Bharatpur Railway Station for your train to Jaipur: 22988/Agra Fort - Ajmer SF Express 15:40/18:40 - AC Chair Car. On arrival transfer to Dera Mandawa for 3 nights.
Full day sightseeing tour of Jaipur including visit to Amer Fort, City Palace, Observatory, photo-stop at Palace of Wind & Jal Mahal. Explore local market of Jaipur.
Morning at leisure to explore on your own or rest. Afternoon kite flying at Dera Mandawa. Learn the art of flying kites, a challenging sport on the Chandni terrace of Dera Mandawa.
Early transfer to Jaipur Railway Station for train to Delhi: 20977/Vande Bharat 07:55/11:35 - A/C Executive Class. On arrival transferred to Haveli Hauz Khas for 1 night.
Transfer to Delhi Airport for your return home.

tourName: Golden Triangle small group holiday, India
placesVisited: Delhi, Jaipur, Karauli homestay, Agra and Taj Mahal
generalInfo:
Joining a small group of like-minded travellers for this eight day India Golden Triangle holiday is a great idea for making new friends as you see the sights and experience the sounds of India.

Rickshaw rides around Old Delhi, palaces and bazaars in Jaipur, and the Taj Mahal in Agra all combine to fabulous effect with a heritage homestay bound to add to the cultural and natural attraction of time spent on tour in Rajasthan.

India Golden Triangle holidays never fail to excite and enlighten in equal measures and this eight day small group tour is certainly no different with a world of markets, food stalls and iconic fortresses providing one unforgettable memory after the next.

dayInfo.title: Delhi.
dayInfo.description: Namaste! Welcome to India. Your adventure begins in Delhi – India’s thriving capital city – with a welcome meeting at 6 pm. If you arrive with hours (or days) to spare, consider heading out on your own, maybe to visit the UNESCO World Heritage-listed Humayun's Tomb. If you’ve got the time, explore some Delhi sights and join in on an Urban Adventure. After the welcome meeting, maybe head out for an optional meal with your group at a local restaurant.

dayInfo.title: Delhi.
dayInfo.description: Join your local leader on an excursion through Old Delhi. Ride the city’s metro system, then hop in a rickshaw to the busy marketplaces of Chandni Chowk. See the Jama Masjid, Delhi’s oldest mosque, before learning about the history of the Sikh religion at the Sheeshganj Gurudwara. Ask your trip leader for their recommendation on where to go for dinner.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur.
dayInfo.description: Drive into Rajasthan and on to its capital, Jaipur, known as the ‘Pink City’. Take your time to explore this busy city filled with palaces and bazaars selling everything from jewellery and textiles to tea and spices. You might like to stop by the Hawa Mahal (Palace of the Winds), then head over to Jaipur's Royal City Palace and explore its extravagant rooms and apartments. Later, discover one of the five astronomical observatories built by Maharaja Jai Singh, the founder of Jaipur.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur.
dayInfo.description: This morning, you might want to take an optional early morning hot air balloon experience. Cruising through the air overlooking the countryside is often a highlight of visiting Jaipur. In the afternoon, you’ll visit the Amber Fort. Set on a hilltop overlooking Maota Lake, the fort is an authentic example of Rajput architecture, and the Sheesh Mahal (Hall of Mirrors) is one of its more spectacular buildings.

dayInfo.title: Lotwara .
dayInfo.description: Leave the ‘Pink City’ of Jaipur behind and drive to the Lotwara Village in Dausa district of Rajasthan. This town, founded in the 17th century retains its traditional temples and is known as the ‘Peacock Town’ of Rajasthan due to the dense population of peacocks. Take a guided walk around the Old Quarter, learning about rural Indian life off the tourist trail. Be sure to visit the local stalls along the way and sample seasonal local sweets made from Indian ingredients, including petha (pumpkin), jaggery (organic sugar) and gazak (sesame seeds). Tonight, you’ll stay in a restored heritage property where dinner is included.

dayInfo.title: Fatehpur Sikri – Agra.
dayInfo.description: On the journey to Agra, stop at the one-time capital of the Mughal empire, Fatehpur Sikri. Its stunning mosque displays both Persian and Hindu designs and is secured by a 54-m-high entrance. Once in Agra, you have the option to visit the marble tomb that was saved for the greatest of the Mughal Emperors – Akbar's Mausoleum. End your day at the iconic Taj Mahal – one of the Seven Wonders of the World, this opulent monument was built in the 1640s as a memorial to Emperor Shah Jahan’s wife.

dayInfo.title: Delhi.
dayInfo.description: In the morning, take a guided tour along the banks of the Yamuna River to the iconic Agra Fort. Originally designed by Emperor Akbar in 1565 to be a military structure, it was converted into a palace during Emperor Shah Jahan's reign and later became his prison. You might like to stop for lunch at Sheroes Hangout – a vegetarian and vegan cafe and social enterprise providing employment and opportunities for victims of acid attacks. In the early afternoon, journey back to Delhi by private bus, arriving back at the hotel with enough time to freshen up and decide where to enjoy one final dinner with the group.

dayInfo.title: Delhi.
dayInfo.description: There are no activities planned for the final day and you're able to depart the accommodation at any time. If you are departing later, you can arrange luggage storage at the hotel. If you would like to stay an extra couple of days, and it's recommended that you do, just get in touch with your booking agent ahead of time. This trip is a great way to see a lot in a short period of time, but if you have more time to explore the south of India. You might like to check out South India Highlights.

tourName: Golden Triangle & tigers holiday in India
placesVisited: Delhi, Old Delhi, Kutub Minar,, President House, National Museum, India Gate, Jaipur, Jaipur palaces, Agra, Taj Mahal, Red fort, Jabalpur, Kanha National Park, Tiger watching and three game drives, Sleeper train journey
generalInfo:
This nine day, tailor made holiday revolves around a carefully crafted itinerary that takes in not only the cultural highlights of Golden Triangle, India ‘s stunning historical trail, but also one of the country’s natural highlights too: seeing India’s tigers in Kanha National Park.

After a day of sightseeing in Delhi, you will head to the majestic city of Jaipur, where you are immersed in an eclectic and fascinating mix of royal architecture, from the Palace of the Winds to the Amber Fort, as well as ancient markets intermixed with this ancient majesty.

From the pink city of Jaipur to the white marble magnificence of the Taj Mahal in Agra. A vast mausoleum built by the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his late wife. Famous the world over, take time here to absorb its greatness. Ironically, history has it that the emperor was imprisoned and here say has it that he was able to see his creation from his prison cell. This part of the trip also takes you to the Agra Fort and also the nearby fortified ancient city of Fatehpur Sikri, the Mughal capital, from 1571 to 1585.

From the Taj to tigers, as our next stop is Kanha National Park in Madhya Pradesh, where magnificent habitats of rich, native sal forests and open dry grasslands are the perfect terrain for India’s finest mammal. There are around a hundred tigers within the park, a large part of the park also designated as the Kanha Tiger Reserve, formed by the prestigious and pioneering Project Tiger in 1974. There is a wealth of other wildlife here too, of course, from langurs to leopard, sambhar to rare swamp deer. On the three game drives you will be accompanied by an expert naturalist guide.

The holiday cost includes bed and breakfast accommodation, driver guide and air conditioned vehicle in Delhi and Agra, entrance fees, transfers and overnight air conditioned rail journey. During your time in Kanha National Park you will stay in a luxury lodge, with all meals, game drives, park and naturalist guide fees included.

Please note that as this is a tailor made itinerary, we can always adapt it to your needs and interests. For example, many of our guests include an additional day or two to Varanasi and Khajuraho’s temples. Please do not hesitate to contact us to discuss any further ideas.

dayInfo.description: Arrive Delhi & transfer to hotel. Free to relax. Overnight hotel.
Sightseeing in Delhi, the capital city of India. Old Delhi, Kutub Minar, President House, National Museum & India Gate. Overnight hotel.

Leave for Jaipur, check-in at heritage hotel, half day sightseeing. Popularly known as the Pink City, Jaipur was founded in 1727 AD by one of the greatest rulers of the Singh. The pink colour was used to create an impression of red sandstone buildings of Mughal cities and repainted in 1876, during the visit of the Prince of Wales. The city is best explored on foot and the adventurous visitor willing to go into the inner lanes can discover a whole new world not visible to the tourist-in-a-hurry. Overnight hotel.

Jaipur sightseeing. Places of interest are mainly located within the walled city. The City Palace complex is the most important landmark with its numerous outbuildings, courtyards, impressive gateways and temples. Across the road from the palace is the Jantar Mantar, one of the five observatories built by Sawai Jai Singh. A collection of complex astronomical instruments, chiselled out of stone - most of which continue to provide fairly accurate information to this day - is the highlight of this observatory. Overnight hotel.
Leave Jaipur for Agra, visit Taj Mahal & Red fort. Late afternoon we board the train for our onward journey to Jabalpur. Overnight train
Reach Jabalpur early morning. Transfer to hotel for breakfast, freshen up. Later we drive to Kanha National Park (3hrs drive), check-in at lodge. Evening game drive
Kanha NP. Morning & evening game drive
Return to Jabalpur. Today after breakfast we drive back to Jabalpur to connect direct flight to delhi.Overnight Delhi
Transfer to International airport.

tourName: Golden Triangle tour, India
generalInfo: Dive deep into northern India’s great cultural route: the Golden Triangle – Delhi, Agra and Jaipur – on an adventure where the headline acts are just part of the story. The rest is unlocked thanks to the in-depth knowledge of your local tour leader. It’s meeting the vendors at spice-laden market stalls, waving to friendly local people, learning to cook (and eat) traditional Rajasthani cuisine, and staying in a 600-year-old royal residence. Of course, the highlight for many is visiting the Taj Mahal at sunrise, but the lesser-known wonders may linger just as long in the memory.

dayInfo.description: Begin your adventure in pulsating Delhi. It’s a city split in two, with historic Old Delhi in the north and the nation’s capital, New Delhi, in the south. At approximately 2pm, join your leader for a tour of Old Delhi, starting outside Jama Masjid, a colossal mosque capable of holding up to 25,000 worshippers. After, we’re taken through the narrow streets of the Old Delhi markets by cycle rickshaw, finishing at Khari Baoli, the largest spice market in India, where we can meet the vendors and walk through the fragrant rows of spices, nuts, herbs and grains. Around 6pm, we gather as a group to get to know each other and learn more about the adventures ahead over a welcome meeting. Your tour leader then arranges a group dinner at a nearby restaurant. Want more time in Delhi? Secure pre-tour hotel nights through your sales representative Accommodation: Iris Park (or similar)

Join our tour leader to explore New Delhi this morning. It starts at Humayun’s Tomb, a rather understated name for what is really a precursor to the Taj Mahal, a mausoleum on a palatial scale. We then drive past fine colonial buildings, including Rashtrapati Bhavan, a 320-acre (130ha) estate built by British architect Edwin Lutyens in 1931, which comprises the official residence of the President of India, Parliament House and India Gate – a memorial to soldiers who died in the First World War. This afternoon, we head to Agra (approximately four to five hours’ drive). Upon arrival, check into the hotel with the evening free to relax. Accommodation: The Taj Vilas (or similar)

It’s the moment everyone’s been waiting for! Wake early to visit the Taj Mahal at sunrise, when the white-marble exterior is illuminated by the soft early light, the crowds are smaller and the birds chatter among themselves. After admiring it from the outside and enjoying a deep dive into this New World Wonder from our tour leader, we head inside, with a chance to explore the beautiful inner chambers and mausoleum. After we’ve fully soaked in the magnificence of the Taj Mahal, we visit the imposing Agra Fort (also known as the Red Fort). It was built by the third Mughal emperor, Akbar, whose mighty red sandstone walls enclose the white-marble Pearl Mosque and the palaces, halls, courtyards, and gardens of his sons and successors, Jehangir and Shah Jahan. In the afternoon, we transfer (approximately three to four hours) to Suroth Mahal, a 600-year-old fort in the city of Hindaun. This former royal residence was once home to the Maharaja Krishna Chandra Pal, though tonight you’ll be the guest of honour! After checking into the hotel and freshening up, we have a 45-minute round trip by camel cart to a century-old Hindu temple. Back at the hotel, enjoy a short cooking demonstration, in which you’re shown how to make pakora – a skill certain to impress your friends back home. Accommodation: Suroth Mahal, Heritage Hotel (or similar)

Start the day with a gentle one-hour walk to a 300-year-old village, where we meet the residents and learn about their daily life. En route, we also visit a local market (haat) and see the community going about their daily tasks, such as creating handicrafts or working in their fields. In the afternoon, transfer (approximately four to five hours) to Jaipur. Breaking up this journey, we stop at Chand Baori, one of the largest and deepest stepwells in India. With its intricate criss-cross staircase pattern, you’ll feel like you’re part of an Escher artwork. The evening is free but if you still have some energy, why not join your tour leader for an evening cooking class at a local family home? This optional activity is a great way to interact with the local people, learn some great cooking tips and gorge on sumptuous food.
