Pokhara/Kathmandu: Today we drive to Kathmandu (6-7 hrs), on the way we will visit Manakamana Temple, getting there via one of the longest ropeways in the world- we hope you aren’t scared of heights! Upon arriving in the evening in Kathmandu, you’ll have free time to explore and do any last-minute shopping.

Kathmandu: Join us in the morning as we explore some of Kathmandu’s most visited attractions. Our itinerary includes Durbar Square, Kumari Palace, Pashupati Temple, and Swayambhunath Stupa. In addition to these historic landmarks, Kathmandu offers an exciting sensory experience that may be overwhelming to some. The city is bustling with people, sounds, sights, smells, and more.
Departure: Sadly the tour will end today. You can leave anytime after breakfast today back home or to your next destination. We will transfer you to the airport.

tourName: India and Sri Lanka holiday, 24 days
generalInfo:
Ready to explore the best of South Asia? On our 24-day India + Sri Lanka Experience, you'll dive into everything these vibrant countries have to offer. From the lively streets of Delhi to the wilds of Ranthambore, and from the lush tea fields of Ella to the serene beaches of Mirissa, this will tick off everything on your bucket list! With an awesome group leader from the moment your trip starts, an instant group of friends to share your adventure, amazing accommodation and so much included. Get ready for the trip of a lifetime!

HIGHLIGHTS

- Check out ancient forts, temples, and palaces on mountaintops, floating on lakes and hidden in jungles
- Get a taste of real Rajasthani hospitality by staying in traditional tents and riding jeeps over sand dunes during an overnight desert camp
- Eat your way through India with a local family cooking demo, trying both the famous dishes and some new ones
- Look for monkeys, deer, crocodiles, peacocks, wild boar, and hopefully Bengal tigers on a safari in Ranthambore National Park
- Be amazed by the Taj Mahal on a guided sunrise tour
Explore tea plantations and learn to pick tea with locals
- Scramble up little Adam's Peak and snap the Insta famous Nine Arches Bridge
- Spot water buffalo, crocodiles and herds of wild elephants on a sunrise safari
- Learn to surf or kick back and relax at Welligama Beach
- Visit a Buddhist Monastery school and learn their way of life

INCLUSIONS

Aiport Pickup
23 nights accommodation
Explore bustling Delhi markets
Traditional Lunch
Jama Masjid
Mehrangarh Fort
The ‘Blue City’
Tuk tuk tour
Bishnoi traditional village
Overnight desert camp
Sunset dune safari
Pushkar lake and viewpoint
Yoga class
Hawa Mahal
Jaipur Observatory
Jeep ride to Amber Fort
Jal Mahal Water Palace

Ranthambore Fort
Ranthambore National Park safari

Visit local markets
Ride in a tuk tukiver boat ride
Local village experience

Spice garden
Temple of the Tooth
Tea plantations
Ella train journey
Little Adam’s Peak
Nine Arches Bridge
Wildlife safari
Yoga
Learn to surf
Buddhist monastery visit
Meals as indicated on itinerary
All transport
Experienced group leader and local guides
Onward travel help & planning
24/7 support after the trip finishes
+ This tour is 100% carbon neutral!

dayInfo.description: ARRIVE AND MEET THE GROUP: We’ll pick you up from Delhi airport and take you to our accommodation in the heart of the city. You’ll then have plenty of time to chill out and meet everyone in your group.

OLD DELHI AND TRADITIONAL LUNCH: Today, we'll immerse ourselves in the sights, sounds, and smells of Delhi. As we wander through the streets of Chawri Bazaar with our local guide, we'll see how traditional life remains largely unchanged. We'll also get to taste India's famous cuisine by sampling local delicacies - chaat or lassi anyone? In the afternoon, we'll visit the stunning red-marbled Jama Masjid, the largest mosque in India, and learn about the significant role religion plays in this country of over a billion people. To wrap up the city tour, we’ll stop by Rajghat Memorial, where Mahatma Gandhi was cremated, and check out a Sikh Temple.

JODHPUR AND THE BLUE CITY: This morning, we'll leave the bustling streets of Delhi behind and catch a quick flight to Jodhpur, the 700-year-old 'blue city' in the desert. We'll explore the maze of blue architecture—don't worry, our guide will lead the way. We’ll jump on some tuk tuks to explore the city, catch an amazing sunset, and then head out for dinner.

MEHRANGARH FORT & BISHNOI VILLAGE: Towering over the Jodhpur skyline, the magnificent Mehrangarh Fort sits on a rocky hilltop, offering breathtaking views of the city and desert plains below. Today, we'll explore this remarkable site, delving into the area's rich history and enjoying the stunning vistas. In the afternoon, we'll visit the traditional villages of the warm and hospitable Bishnoi people to experience their unique way of life.

GLAMPING EXPERIENCE: It’s time to travel to our beautiful luxury tents. We’ll enjoy unique views from Savitri Devi temple. As night falls, we’ll immerse ourselves in authentic Rajasthani warmth and hospitality and experience traditional dancing.

PUSHKAR: Next up is Pushkar, renowned as one of India’s most sacred cities. We'll enjoy a walking tour around this city centered around a serene lake, the incredibly vibrant markets, and the Brahma temple. This afternoon you’ll have time to enjoy more of the city or lounge by the pool.

SUNRISE YOGA AND JAIPUR: What better spot than the birthplace of yoga to reconnect with your inner yogi? This morning, we’re up bright and early to unwind with an included sunrise yoga session. After breakfast, we’ll hit the road to Jaipur, aka the ‘Pink City’. Get ready for some seriously Instagrammable rose-tinted buildings! Tonight we’ll visit to a local family and help prepare dinner.

EXPLORING JAIPUR: Today, we're heading to the enchanting Rajasthani Amber Fort, and to spare our legs, we'll hop on a jeep to reach the hilltop. Behind its weathered walls lies a stunning paradise filled with beautifully adorned chambers and intricate artwork. We’ll then swing by Hawa Mahal for that obligatory perfectly symmetrical photo op. Then it’s time for Jantar Mantar, Jaipur’s ancient observatory.

RANTHAMBORE NATIONAL PARK & FORT: Today, let's embrace a bit of adventure! Bid farewell to the chaos of rickshaws and scooters as we switch gears and venture towards the outskirts of one of India's biggest and most famous national parks. Once we're settled into our accom, it's time to kick back and relax. But don't get too comfortable because later, we're channelling our inner Indiana Jones and embarking on a jungle expedition to uncover the mysteries of Ranthambore Fort.

SAFARI: Time for some tiger action! We're kicking off bright and early this morning with a sunrise safari, hoping to catch a glimpse of these majestic big cats in their natural habitat. Ranthambore National Park is full of diverse wildlife - from playful monkeys and lurking crocodiles to wild boars, deer, peacocks, and even elusive leopards - ensuring our safari is packed with excitement. After our safari, feel free to explore the local surroundings or simply unwind and recharge by the pool.

DRIVE TO AGRA & BABY TAJ: Leaving the jungle behind, we'll make a pit stop at the Abhaneri Stepwell, a fascinating structure constructed over a millennium ago to preserve water and offer relief from the scorching heat. After snapping some photos, we'll hit the road towards enchanting Agra, giving you a taste of what's in store by visiting the exquisite tomb of I’timãd-ud-Daulah, affectionately known as the Baby Taj. The excitement is building...

SUNRISE AT THE TAJ MAHAL AND RETURN TO DELHI: Wake up bright and early to catch the stunning sunrise casting a golden hue over the iconic Taj Mahal. We've kept the best for last! As one of the Seven New Wonders of the World, our local guide will share tales of the Taj's rich history and reveal its hidden secrets, while guiding us to picture-perfect spots. With our minds buzzing and cameras full, we’ll return to the hotel for breakfast before embarking on our journey back South Delhi. Tonight, let's toast to our unforgettable adventure with a final Indian feast, some drinks, and perhaps a little Bollywood dancing to top it all off. Cheers to memories made!
FLY TO SRI LANKA: Today, we'll hop on our included flight to the stunning island of Sri Lanka to kick off the second leg of our epic journey!

TUK TUK TOUR: Discover the beachside town of Negombo by tuk tuk and visit the local fish markets, before heading to the beautiful town of Sigiriya. The next two nights we will stay in a hotel amidst lush tropical greenery.

SIGIRIYA AND LOCAL VILLAGE: An amazing and diverse day starting with experiencing the stunning views of the famous Sigiriya Rock Fortress by climbing Pidurangala Rock followed by an authentic local village experience. We’ll hop on some local transport and enjoy a cooking demonstration by the local village women and live and eat like the locals!

SPICE GARDEN AND TEMPLE OF THE TOOTH: Today we’ll head south via a spice garden before arriving in the cultural centre of Sri Lanka – Kandy. We’ll visit the amazing Temple of the Tooth, before heading out for dinner and a few drinks.

TEA PICKING & A SCENIC TRAIN RIDE TO ELLA: We’ll continue south through stunning rolling green tea plantations, stopping to learn how to pick and make tea; Sri Lanka’s most famous export. Before boarding the ‘world’s most scenic train’ to the town of Ella. Once we arrive we’ll head into town for dinner and a night out!

LITTLE ADAMS PEAK: A free morning to relax and explore the beautiful little town of Ella. We’ll then hike the stunning Little Adam’s Peak and enjoy the spectacular views. After the little hike, feel free to treat yourself to a traditional massage, do some shopping, or just curl up with a book and cuppa.
NINE ARCHES BRIDGE: This morning we’ll visit the famous Nine Arches Bridge before heading south to the amazing Udawalawe National Park.

SUNRISE SAFARI: A truly unforgettable day as we wake for sunrise and travel by jeep into the stunning Udawalawe National Park to spot herds of wild free roaming elephants, crocodiles and amazing bird life. We’ll then head to the beachside oasis of Hiriketiya for a chilled afternoon in paradise. Later we’ll arrive at our beachfront eco retreat in gorgeous Tallala, where we’ll finish the day watching the sunset whilst tucking into dinner.

ECO RETREAT: The aim of today is to do as little or as much as you want. Take a deep breath and feel the peace and calm wash over you at this beautiful retreat. Participate in the included yoga session, read a book on the loungers by the pool, book an ayuverdic massage, or just snooze under a palm tree whilst soaking in one of the best kept secret beaches of the south.

LEARN TO SURF: This morning we’ll continue along the coast and stop for a private surf lesson on the super friendly and relaxed Welligama Beach. We’ll later check into our beachfront accommodation in Mirissa before visiting Coconut Tree Hill for it’s stunning view.

BUDDHIST MONASTERY VISIT: Today we’ll have a truly special experience! We’ll head to a Buddhist Monastery to take part in a cultural exchange with the local monk students who live there and gain a unique insight into Buddhist ways of life. Tonight and in celebration of our last evening together, we’ll be treating you to a farewell dinner on the beach.
CHECKOUT AND ONWARD TRAVEL: Your epic adventure comes to an end today. Your group leader will help organise your onward travel.

tourName: India backpacking tour
generalInfo:
India is not only exciting but it is also a travelling must-see destination. If you are short of time and looking for an affordable and fun tour, look no further. In 13-days, you will see some of the iconic wonders of this mesmerising country.

If you are heading to India in October, why not take part in our 18-day tour that adds on the golden beaches of Goa? Not to be missed!

The cost of the tour covers all accommodation and transport. Some must-see activities are included but many activities are optional. We provide full budgeting information pre-departure.

dayInfo.description: Delhi - The adventure begins at 19:00 on day 1 in the capital. Board an overnight train to Varansi.
Varansi -You will have the day to explore the city - opt to watch the Ganga Aarti ceremony or visit the excavated ruins. In the evening, head out for your first group dinner.
Agra - Home of the impressive Taj Mahal, see the stunning building as the sunrises. There will also be plenty of opportunities to explore the Agra Fort or the foundations of the Black Taj.
Jaipur - Take part in a guided tour of 'The Pink City'. You can also opt to take part in a food tour or an art class.
Jaisalmer - Head to the desert and camp under the stars. The camel trek will continue to a desert village.
Jodhpur - Visit the 'Blue City' where, if you are feeling brave, you can zip-line over the Mehrangarh Fort.
Udaipur - Arrive early in the afternoon in time for a sunset cruise on Lake Pichola, with incredible views of the old town and palace.
Mumbai - End the tour in Mumbai, where there are plenty of opportunities to explore all the city offers. You can also opt to take a walking tour.

tourName: India cultural country tour
placesVisited: Mumbai, Gateway to India, Dhobi Ghats, Dharavi slum, Train to Aurangabad, Ajanta caves, Ellora caves, Devagiri-Daulatabad fort, Overnight train to Hyderabad, Charminar, Taj Falaknuma Palace, Golconda Fort, Tombs of the Qutb Shahi Kings, Bijapur, Golgumbaz, Badami, Aiholé temples, Pattadakal, Anegundi, Hampi ruins, Goa, Goa Velha
generalInfo:
It tends to be the tourist-friendly northern and southern regions of India that garner attention, but this two-week small group tour through central India eschews the more popular, and busy, locations in favour of a more original experience.

Begin with a guided tour around the highlights of Mumbai, including the iconic Gateway to India, and the Dhobi Ghats, as well as an eye-opening visit to the Dharavi slum, before taking the train to Aurangabad. Here you’ll see the Buddhist caves of Ellora and Ajanta, both of them UNESCO World Heritage Sites and featuring superb examples of ancient Indian art and monuments.

An overnight train brings you to Hyderabad, the ‘City of Pearls’, with its many traditional bazaars and other landmarks such as the Taj Falaknuma Palace, now a hotel where you’ll take tea. The palace’s billiards table has one exact replica, which is in Buckingham Palace.

Entering Karnataka state, you’ll pause at the majestic Golgumbaz mausoleum, built in the 17th century for the Sultan of Bijapur, and the fascinating temples of Pattadakal, another UNESCO-rated architectural treasure. You’ll also spend a day touring Hampi, a group of monuments circling an immense pyramid which is still a busy gathering place for Hindus.

Finally, the tour culminates in Goa, once a Portuguese province and now among India’s most celebrated destinations for its well preserved heritage and deliriously beautiful white beaches.

You’ll feel like a true explorer on this India cultural tour, which avoids the relentlessly crowded locations for the most part. One for the committed Indiaphile definitely, but also for those who look to get beneath the surface of the places they travel and seek out what most people miss.

dayInfo.description: Tour Starts in Mumbai: The tour starts this afternoon at the joining hotel. From here we’ll take a wander around this fascinating city, with time at the famous arch that is the ‘Gateway to India’ and the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Vastu Sangrahalaya (formally Prince of Wales) Museum. We’ll end the day with a visit to the Taj, which overlooks the harbour and is a great place for a drink, before having dinner at a local restaurant.

In Mumbai: After breakfast we’ll head out to visit the ‘Mahalaxmi Dhobi Ghat’, otherwise known as the largest non-mechanised laundry facility in the world! Although there are some machines on site, most of the washing is still done by hand in a long series of concrete wash basins, each with its own flogging stone to beat the clothes against. From here we will take a walking tour of the Dharavi slum, the heart of small-scale industry in Mumbai. As we wander through 'India's largest slum' we will witness a wide range of business enterprises and activities: recycling, pottery-making, embroidery, bakery, soap factory, leather tanning, poppadom-making and much more. People from all over India live in Dharavi, making it a cultural melting pot, and a tour through its narrow alleys is quite an adventure. More recently Dharavi has become a focus of artists from all over the world, who in collaboration with the locals have painted murals on the walls of houses, and as we explore Dharavi it’s worth looking out for the abundant street art which the local community is very proud of. We’ll also visit a number of the most famous buildings Mumbai is noted for, including Chhatrapati Shivajitrain train station (formerly Victoria Terminus), the Mahalakshmi temple, the Rajabai Clock Tower and library, and the colonial general post office.

Mumbai - Aurangabad: We will have a leisurely morning in Mumbai before heading to the train station to catch a day train to Aurangabad. The journey should take around 6 hours, offering us a chance to take in the scenery and meet the local people. On arrival this evening we’ll transfer to our hotel for dinner.

Aurangabad - Ajanta Caves - Aurangabad: After breakfast we’ll drive north for a couple of hours to visit the Ajanta Caves. Predating those at Ellora, the Ajanta Caves are entirely Buddhist and famous for their exquisite paintings. After the decline in Buddhism, the caves were forgotten only to be ‘rediscovered’ in 1819 by a group of British soldiers out on a hunting trip. Their beauty was soon unveiled and they now represent one of Maharashtra’s best-known sites. In the afternoon we will drive back to Aurangabad where the rest of the day will be at your leisure.

Aurangabad - Ellora Caves - Overnight Train To Hyderabad: After breakfast we’ll visit the Ellora Caves, a truly amazing series of underground temples, some with extraordinary sculptures, built between the 7th and 11th centuries AD. From here we’ll travel back to Aurangabad, stopping on the way to visit Devagiri-Daulatabad fort, an imposing structure built by King Bhillam of the Yadava dynasty in the late 12th century. Its strategic location on a large rock outcrop was so impregnable that it was never taken by force. We’ll then have an early dinner before boarding our overnight train to Hyderabad. Please see the 'Supplementary Information' section for more information on what to expect from the train journey

In Hyderabad: Arriving early into Hyderabad we will transfer to our hotel for the chance to freshen up. Once in the ‘city of pearls’ we’ll walk around the Old City and the 16th century Charminar, which houses Hyderabad’s oldest mosque. We’ll also explore the bazaars around the Charminar selling all manner of items from bangles to budgerigars and look around the Mecca Masjid which can house up to 10,000 worshippers. Tonight we’ll have drinks at the historic Taj Falaknuma Palace, without doubt one of the most opulent hotels on the subcontinent. The former residence of the Nizam of Hyderabad, the hotel exudes the elegance and gilded grandeur of a bygone age. Boasting Venetian chandeliers, priceless art, Japanese Gardens and a library of rare distinction, the hotel affords us a truly unique insight into the lives of one of India’s richest dynasties.

In & Around Hyderabad: This morning we head out of town to visit Golconda Fort, the capital of Telangana until 1590 when a terrible drought forced the people of the city to move and the founding of Hyderabad. We then return to town, stopping en route to wander around the serenely set tombs of the Qutb Shahi Kings. This afternoon/evening you will be free to wander and discover more of this fascinating city for yourself. Dinner tonight will be at your own expense.

Hyderabad - Bijapur: After breakfast we’ll say goodbye to this glorious city and drive to the neighbouring state of Karnataka, and on to Bijapur with its dominating Islamic architecture. The drive will take most of the day, but we should have a bit of time on arrival to stretch our legs and view some of the local sites before dinner.Driving time: Approx. 8.5 - 9.5 hrs

Bijapur - Badami: This morning we’ll explore the magnificent Golgumbaz which is the town’s largest monument with an imposing 38 metre diameter dome – second only to St Peter’s Basilica in Rome! Climbing the narrow stairs brings us out onto the whispering gallery, where secrets whispered into the wall are directed across the dome to listening ears. Also in this sleepy town is the beautiful Ibrahim Rouza, which is considered by many to be one of the most finely proportioned Islamic monuments in India. The focus here is not the size but the elegance and detail. The 24 metre high minarets are said to have inspired those of the Taj Mahal. Adil Shah II built the monuments for his queen at the height of Bijapur’s prosperity in the 17th century; though sadly he died before his Queen was laid to rest alongside his family. Following lunch we’ll drive on to Badami for the night.

In Badami: This morning we’ll visit the wonderful 5th century temples at Aiholé before moving on to the world heritage site of Pattadakal. In the afternoon we will have plenty of time to enjoy the sensational rock carved temples at Badami.

Badami - Hampi: Arguably saving the best until last, this morning we will drive to Anegundi – the ruined fortified stronghold across the river from Hampi. After checking into our hotel we’ll have a bit of time to relax in this often overlooked village, just a stone’s throw from the stunning UNESCO World Heritage Site of Hampi. From here we’ll take our first look around this incredible place.Driving time: Approx. 3.5 - 4.5 hrs

In Hampi: Today we explore the scattered ruins of the 15th century city of Vijayanagar. We will visit the highlight of the Hampi ruins, the Vittala Temple, as well as the other main sights including the Elephant Stables and the Lotus Mahal, before heading back into town. Having lunch at a beautiful spot by the river we’ll escape the heat and relax, after which the rest of the afternoon and evening will be free to explore at your leisure. Dinner tonight will be at your own expense.

Hampi - Goa: After breakfast we say goodbye to Hampi and travel west to the coastline of the Arabian Sea and Goa. This will be a long day on the road, but we’ll break it up along the way and the relaxed atmosphere that Goa offers at the end of the journey will make it all worthwhile.Driving time: Approx. 7.5 - 8.5 hrs

In Goa: This morning we’ll take a guided tour of Goa Velha (old Goa), visiting numerous sites of interest including the UNESCO listed Portuguese churches of Igreja de Nossa Senhora do Rosário, the Basilica of Bom Jesus, the church of St. Francis of Assisi and the Chapel of Santa Catarina. After lunch the afternoon will be free to do as you choose. Most people like to relax by swimming in the pool or by taking a dip in the sea nearby, but there’s plenty more besides. The town houses an arts centre as well as offering options for cycling, fishing and yoga. Tonight we will have a farewell dinner at a lovely local restaurant.
Tour Ends In Goa: The tour ends after breakfast this morning. There will be some free time to enjoy more of Goa before those on the suggested group flight are transferred to the airport.

tourName: India culture and wildlife tour
placesVisited: Explore vibrant markets, majestic forts, and historical mosques, Experience the rich cultural and religious heritage of Jaipur and Varanasi, Witness the Taj Mahal during sunrise, Discover the architectural wonders of Khajuraho temples, Overnight train journey, Thrilling big cat safari in Bandhavgarh tiger reserve.
generalInfo:
Embark on a grand tour of Central India, immersing yourself in the rich tapestry of Indian culture, architecture, and wildlife. This two-week journey will take you on a captivating adventure from Delhi to Bandhavgarh, with stops at Jaipur, Agra, Varanasi, and Khajuraho.

Begin your tour in Delhi, the bustling capital of India, where you'll be enthralled by its historical sites, vibrant street life, and delectable cuisine. Explore the enchanting streets of Old Delhi, where every corner tells a story.

From Delhi, travel to Jaipur, also known as the "pink city" and the capital of Rajasthan. Adorned with pink sandstone palaces and majestic forts, Jaipur showcases the opulence and grandeur of its rich cultural heritage.

Continue eastward to Agra, the former Mughal capital, where you'll witness the magnificence of the Agra Fort and the iconic Taj Mahal, an architectural marvel and a symbol of love.

Next, embark on an overnight train journey to Varanasi, a sacred city that embodies the essence of India. Experience the spiritual rituals along the banks of the Ganges River and immerse yourself in the vibrant blend of religions and traditions.

Venturing further into the heart of India, you'll reach Khajuraho, renowned for its awe-inspiring temples adorned with intricate sculptures depicting various facets of life, including passion, dance, and music. Marvel at the brilliance of Indian architecture and delve into the medieval cultural heritage.

Finally, conclude your journey in Bandhavgarh Tiger Reserve, where nature takes centre stage. With a rich history and one of the highest tiger densities in the world, Bandhavgarh offers a remarkable opportunity to witness these majestic creatures in their natural habitat.

This grand tour of Central India encapsulates the essence of Indian diversity, from the architectural wonders to the spiritual experiences and the captivating wildlife encounters. Prepare to be captivated by the fervour, depth, and beauty of India.

dayInfo.description: New Delhi: After your arrival at Indira Gandhi International Airport in New Delhi, you will be greeted and transferred to your hotel. Once you have settled in, your guide will meet you at the hotel to discuss the various sightseeing options available to you. They will provide you with information on the attractions and activities in Delhi, allowing you to customize your itinerary based on your preferences and energy level after the journey.

New Delhi: After breakfast, set out to explore New Delhi on a guided tour at 09:30 am. Your guide will meet you in the hotel to discuss the options. You will have a full day to explore the city. From historic monuments to traditional markets to spicy street food, the Old Delhi tour is a journey full of unexpected sights and ancient surprises. At the same time, New Delhi is twentieth-century India and beyond. Both speak volumes about India's history, culture and tradition. In Old Delhi, your senses will come alive as you encounter the many captivating sights and sounds this fantastic part of the city has to offer. You can visit Chandani Chowk, famous for its vibrant bazaar, where you can shop for some ancient artefacts and jewellery. Within Old Delhi, you will also see the Jama Masjid, India's largest mosque and the Red Fort, two of Delhi's magnificent ancient buildings built by the Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in the 17th century. You can also visit Lutyen's Delhi, which includes buildings and monuments made during the colonial period.

Jaipur: After breakfast, your driver will pick you up from the hotel to take you to the Rajputana city of Jaipur to reach in time for lunch. After lunch, you can relax at the hotel or explore the city with a guide visiting various historical monuments reflecting the great cultural past. You can visit Nahargarh Fort for the stunning sunset view of the Pink City. The next day, visit the magnificent City Palace, a complex of palatial structures that houses precious artefacts of the Rajput era. Explore the beautiful Hawa Mahal, known for its intricate architecture and airy windows. Discover the Jantar Mantar, an impressive astronomical observatory recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. A visit to the majestic Amber Fort, situated on a ridge on the outskirts of Jaipur, is a must. Don't miss the Jal Mahal and Laxmi Narayan Temple, among other attractions. In the evening, you can also take a leisurely stroll through the bustling markets of Jaipur, indulge in local delicacies, and shop for fabrics, artefacts, and handicrafts.

Fathepur Sikri & Agra: After breakfast set off for Agra. A five-hour drive through the Chambal ravines will take you to the romantic city of Agra. Pause a little short of Agra at the Fatehpur Sikri, a city that was once the proud capital of the Mughal Empire in the 16th century, built by Emperor Akbar now stands deserted as a well-preserved ghost town. From Fatehpur Sikri continue to Agra and check into your hotel. Located a 10-minute walk from the Taj Mahal, the hotel also has a rooftop restaurant which offers a beautiful view of the Taj itself. You can relax at the hotel enjoying the view from the rooftop restaurant or enjoy the pool.

Agra & Overnight train to Varanasi: Agra, situated on the banks of the Yamuna River, is a treasure trove of Mughal art, culture, and architecture. Begin your day by meeting your guide in the hotel lobby and heading to the Taj Mahal, a masterpiece of Mughal architecture and one of the Seven Wonders of the World. The Taj Mahal is best experienced during the early hours of sunrise. After breakfast, visit the Agra Fort, a magnificent structure that offers a glimpse into the grandeur of the Mughal Empire with its impressive buildings and courtyards. Explore the tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah, often called the Baby Taj, as it resembles a smaller version of the Taj Mahal and is believed to have inspired its construction. In the evening, take the opportunity to visit local shops and purchase souvenirs such as marble crafts or rugs. Return to your hotel for dinner and prepare for an overnight train journey from Agra Cantt to Varanasi. You will have a comfortable AC compartment with separate bunk beds reserved for a comfortable journey.

Varanasi: Upon arrival in Varanasi at 06:00 am, your driver will greet you at the train station and transfer you to the hotel. After breakfast and some rest, embark on a guided exploration of this ancient and sacred city. Varanasi, known as India's spiritual capital, is a city steeped in history and culture. Visit the old streets and ghats, where temples are found at every turn. Attend the mesmerizing Ganga aarti in the evening, a prayer honoursthat honours the holy Ganges River. Don't miss visiting the renowned Kashi Vishwanath temple, covered in gold. Experience the serene beauty of a sunrise boat ride on the Ganges River, witnessing holy rituals and daily life along the ghats. Explore the Sarnath temple complex, where Lord Buddha delivered his first sermon. And, of course, indulge in the mouth-watering street food that Varanasi is famous for. Each street offers its own culinary delights, making for a truly gastronomic experience.

Khajuraho: Today, after breakfast, transfer to Khajuraho. It is going to be a long day travelling south in the heart of India to Madhya Pradesh state. A guided tour of the city. A UNESCO World Heritage Site, the spectacular group of temples at Khajuraho, built by the Chandela dynasty between the 9th and 10th centuries, is one of India's seven wonders, second only to the incredible Taj Mahal. Visit this temple complex which highlights several facets of Indian life from thousand years ago. The erotic sculptures portraying Kama Sutra are completely unique in the world. Above all, it reflects a unique architectural talent which depicts royalty, courtship, marriage, spiritual teachings, meditation, kinship and intimate scenes of human emotions and relationships.

Bandhavgarh Tiger Reserve: Bit of a natural respite in Bandhavgarh Tiger Reserve. After breakfast, transfer to Bandhavgarh to reach in time for lunch. Bandhavgarh is one of the best national parks in the world for tigers. Few return without seeing this most magnificent of animals and the largest of the big cats. Wildlife includes the spotted deer or chital, chinkara, wild boar, sambhar, muntjac and nilgai. Each outing in Reserve provides a chance to meet one of its rarer inhabitants, such as a sloth bear, Indian fox, jackal, wolf and jungle cat. Two hundred forty-two species of birds have been identified in the reserve. The most commonly seen are the peafowl, red jungle fowl, grey hornbill, red-wattled lapwing, crested serpent eagle, white-breasted kingfisher and lesser adjutant stork. Search for tigers and other wildlife in the morning and afternoon open jeep safari.
New Delhi After breakfast, leave Bandhavgarh and travel to Jabalpur airport to catch a flight to New Delhi.

tourName: India experience 13 day tour
generalInfo:
India Experience is the absolute best of India in 13 days. You’ll dive into a whirlwind of color, character, spirituality, and spice. From the vibrant energy of Delhi to the wilds of Ranthambore. Immerse yourself in rich culture, marvel at world wonders, wake up to breathtaking landscapes, spot tigers, savor delectable cuisine, and embrace a delightful culture shock. With an awesome group leader from the moment your trip starts, an instant group of friends to share your adventure, amazing accommodation and so much included. Get ready for the trip of a lifetime!

HIGHLIGHTS

- Check out ancient forts, temples, and palaces on mountaintops, floating on lakes and hidden in jungles
- Get a taste of real Rajasthani hospitality by staying in traditional tents and riding jeeps over sand dunes during an overnight desert camp
- Eat your way through India with a local family cooking demo, trying both the famous dishes and some new ones
- Look for monkeys, deer, crocodiles, peacocks, wild boar, and hopefully Bengal tigers on a safari in Ranthambore National Park
- Be amazed by the Taj Mahal on a guided sunrise tour

INCLUSIONS

Airport Pickup
12 nights accommodation
Explore bustling Delhi markets
Traditional Lunch
Jama Masjid
Mehrangarh Fort
The ‘Blue City’
Tuk tuk tour
Bishnoi traditional village
Overnight desert camp
Sunset dune safari
Pushkar lake and viewpoint
Yoga class
Hawa Mahal
Jaipur Observatory
Jeep ride to Amber Fort
Jal Mahal Water Palace
Family cooking demonstration
Ranthambore Fort
Ranthambore National Park safari
Abhaneri Stepwell
Baby Taj
Sunrise at the Taj Mahal
Meals as indicated on itinerary
All transport
Experienced group leader and local guides
Onward travel help & planning
24/7 support after the trip finishes
+ This tour is 100% carbon neutral!

dayInfo.description: ARRIVE AND MEET THE GROUP: We’ll pick you up from Delhi airport and take you to our accommodation in the heart of the city. You’ll then have plenty of time to chill out and meet everyone in your group.

OLD DELHI AND TRADITIONAL LUNCH: Today, we'll immerse ourselves in the sights, sounds, and smells of Delhi. As we wander through the streets of Chawri Bazaar with our local guide, we'll see how traditional life remains largely unchanged. We'll also get to taste India's famous cuisine by sampling local delicacies - chaat or lassi anyone? In the afternoon, we'll visit the stunning red-marbled Jama Masjid, the largest mosque in India, and learn about the significant role religion plays in this country of over a billion people. To wrap up the city tour, we’ll stop by Rajghat Memorial, where Mahatma Gandhi was cremated, and check out a Sikh Temple.

JODHPUR AND THE BLUE CITY: This morning, we'll leave the bustling streets of Delhi behind and catch a quick flight to Jodhpur, the 700-year-old 'blue city' in the desert. We'll explore the maze of blue architecture—don't worry, our guide will lead the way. We’ll jump on some tuk tuks to explore the city, catch an amazing sunset, and then head out for dinner.

MEHRANGARH FORT & BISHNOI VILLAGE: Towering over the Jodhpur skyline, the magnificent Mehrangarh Fort sits on a rocky hilltop, offering breathtaking views of the city and desert plains below. Today, we'll explore this remarkable site, delving into the area's rich history and enjoying the stunning vistas. In the afternoon, we'll visit the traditional villages of the warm and hospitable Bishnoi people to experience their unique way of life.

GLAMPING EXPERIENCE: It’s time to travel to our beautiful luxury tents. We’ll enjoy unique views from Savitri Devi temple. As night falls, we’ll immerse ourselves in authentic Rajasthani warmth and hospitality and experience traditional dancing.

PUSHKAR: Next up is Pushkar, renowned as one of India’s most sacred cities. We'll enjoy a walking tour around this city centered around a serene lake, the incredibly vibrant markets, and the Brahma temple. This afternoon you’ll have time to enjoy more of the city or lounge by the pool.

SUNRISE YOGA AND JAIPUR: What better spot than the birthplace of yoga to reconnect with your inner yogi? This morning, we’re up bright and early to unwind with an included sunrise yoga session. After breakfast, we’ll hit the road to Jaipur, aka the ‘Pink City’. Get ready for some seriously Instagrammable rose-tinted buildings! Tonight we’ll visit to a local family and help them prepare dinner.

EXPLORING JAIPUR: Today, we'll start with a stop at Hawa Mahal for that obligatory perfectly symmetrical photo op. Next we're heading to the enchanting Rajasthani Amber Fort, and to spare our legs, we'll hop on a jeep to reach the hilltop. Behind its weathered walls lies a stunning paradise filled with beautifully adorned chambers and intricate artwork. Then it’s time for Jantar Mantar, Jaipur’s ancient observatory.

RANTHAMBORE NATIONAL PARK & FORT: Today, let's embrace a bit of adventure! Bid farewell to the chaos of rickshaws and scooters as we switch gears and venture towards the outskirts of one of India's biggest and most famous national parks. Once we're settled into our accom, it's time to kick back and relax. But don't get too comfortable because later, we're channelling our inner Indiana Jones and embarking on a jungle expedition to uncover the mysteries of Ranthambore Fort.

SAFARI: Time for some tiger action! We're kicking off bright and early this morning with a sunrise safari, hoping to catch a glimpse of these majestic big cats in their natural habitat. Ranthambore National Park is full of diverse wildlife - from playful monkeys and lurking crocodiles to wild boars, deer, peacocks, and even elusive leopards - ensuring our safari is packed with excitement. After our safari, feel free to explore the local surroundings or simply unwind and recharge by the pool.

DRIVE TO AGRA & BABY TAJ: Leaving the jungle behind, we'll make a pit stop at the Abhaneri Stepwell, a fascinating structure constructed over a millennium ago to preserve water and offer relief from the scorching heat. After snapping some photos, we'll hit the road towards enchanting Agra, giving you a taste of what's in store by visiting the exquisite tomb of I’timãd-ud-Daulah, affectionately known as the Baby Taj. The excitement is building...

SUNRISE AT THE TAJ MAHAL AND RETURN TO DELHI: Wake up bright and early to catch the stunning sunrise casting a golden hue over the iconic Taj Mahal. We've kept the best for last! As one of the Seven New Wonders of the World, our local guide will share tales of the Taj's rich history and reveal its hidden secrets, while guiding us to picture-perfect spots. With our minds buzzing and cameras full, we’ll return to the hotel for breakfast before embarking on our journey back South Delhi. Tonight, let's toast to our unforgettable adventure with a final Indian feast, some drinks, and perhaps a little Bollywood dancing to top it all off. Cheers to memories made!
CHECKOUT AND ONWARD TRAVEL: Your epic adventure comes to an end today. Your group leader will help organise your onward travel.

tourName: India family holiday
placesVisited: Delhi, Shekhavati, Rajasthan, Camel trek, Jaipur, Ranthambore National Park, Karauli village, Keoladeo Bird Sanctuary, Fatehpur Sikri, Agra, Taj Mahal
generalInfo:
India is an incredibly exciting destination, a constant kaleidoscope of colour, noise, mayhem and occasional serenity. There are holy cows wandering in the middle of the road, holy men with long dreadlocks getting into strange contortions and holy temples awash with incense, fragrant flowers and hundreds of pilgrims.

It is a huge country that deserves many visits and we recommend that you concentrate on one particular part of the country for each stay. A good place to start is the princely state of Rajasthan, home to many of India's most beautiful and well known sights, including crumbling forts that are begging to be explored, exquisitely decorated merchants' houses, majestic palaces which are the perfect venue for a game of hide and seek, and the constant backdrop of colour whether from mounds of spices in the market or from the brightly coloured saris of women walking through the countryside with pots balanced on their heads. Not far from Rajasthan is Agra, home to the Taj Mahal, possibly one of the most beautiful buildings in the world.

Also popular is the lovely state of Kerala, in the south of India, and a world away from the north. Life here operates at a slightly slower pace and it is a land of peaceful waterways where you can spend the night in a converted rice barge, picturesque coffee and tea plantations that are perfect for a hike (or gentle ramble!) and idyllic beaches.

More adventurous families might want to head into the far north, to the Himalayas, home to incredible scenery and some great activities. Sip a cup of freshly picked tea on a tea estate in Darjeeling, watch the sun rise over the tip of Kanchenjunga, hang out with the monks in Ladakh, ride the rapids down a tributary of the Ganges or cycle in the mountain foothills.

Everywhere you will find the welcome friendly and the children will be permanently wide eyed and fascinated by the incredible experiences on offer.

dayInfo.description: DELHI When you arrive in Delhi you will be met by one of our representatives and transferred to your hotel to unwind.

DELHI Enjoy a full days guided tour of Old and New Delhi. Children will love taking to the road by a rickshaw into the vibrant hustle and bustle of Old Delhi. Spot the majestic Red Fort, the exquisite 17th century Jama Masjid Mosque and the lively markets of Chandni Chowk. Holy cows jostle for space amongst the energetic streets, with smells, sounds and sights that scream “Welcome to India”. As noon creeps in, take a breath and experience the serenity of New Delhi with its impressive colonial buildings and wide tree-lined streets. You will visit the Qutab Minar and Humayun’s Tomb, both exquisite World Heritage sites that are sure not to be missed.

UDAIPUR Continue your tour of India with a flight to Udaipur. If you are feeling the need for adventure, why not take the overnight train instead? Wake in a new city set around the vast Pichola Lake. Udaipur is dominated with dramatic palaces, towering whitewashed houses, winding alleyways and dusted with an almost medieval charm. The huge City Palace, still the residence of the Maharana, is carved out of yellow sandstone and stands on the banks of the Lake Pichola. From here, you will be treated to fabulous views over the lake and the famous Lake Palace Hotel. Spend the rest of the day exploring or simply unwind.

UDAIPUR This morning you will be treated to a city tour of Udaipur. Number one on your list of must-sees is the City Palace, now preserved as a museum with a large and varied collection of mosaics, glass and porcelain figures, miniatures and paintings, the experience is an unforgettable one. Take a moment to head out on to one of the many terraces and courtyards for superb views over Lake Pichola and an overall air of luxury and grandeur. Nearby is the Jagdish temple, a centre of constant activity. Dedicated to Lord Vishnu, the temple was built in 1651 by Maharana Jagat Singh 1, and is famous for its distinctive architecture. Later you will take a boat ride on Lake Pichola where you will spot all sorts of activity on the ‘ghats’ used by local people for washing and bathing. You will pass the famous luxury Lake Palace hotel, and stop to visit the ‘pleasure island’ of Jag Mandir.

UDAIPUR - CHITTORGARH Journey to Chittorgarh, one of Rajasthan’s most impressive forts. Perched on a hilltop, the fort covers a massive 700 acres and dates back to the 7th century. You will have the chance to learn more with your own personal guide. If the children are feeling the need for adventure, why not hop on a push bike and peddle your way around Chittorgarh.

CHITTORGARH - JAIPUR Continue your tour of India with a trip to Jaipur. Once you reach, head out of town to the magnificent Amber Fort. Set upon a hilltop, the extravagant fort offers spectacular views of Jaipur. Children will love discovering the beautifully adorned walls with intricate carvings and delicate paintings.

JAIPUR Wake with the sun for a cycling tour of the backstreets of Jaipur. As you peddle the city will come alive before your very eyes, with local children running errands in the street and market stalls arranging their goods for sale. After you catch your breath, head for an afternoon of sightseeing. Make sure to visit the City Palace, the principal residence of the former royal family.

JAIPUR - SAMODE Continue your tour of India as you travel to Samode, just outside Jaipur. Accommodation is endless; bunk up in a tented camp among the orchard garden or treat yourself to a spot of luxury with a fairy-tale palace. The afternoon is free to wander the narrow streets of Samode.

SAMODE - RANTHAMBORE Journey to Sawai Madhopur, near Ranthambore National Park. Once you arrive you will visit the magnificent old Ranthambore Fort, populated by resident monkeys. The fort is perched on a rocky outcrop, offering breath-taking views of the rich national park below. Children will become explorers for the day as they clamber around the endless hidden corridors and towers. If you are feeling the need for adventure, why not try a safari too?

RANTHAMBORE Today you will enjoy morning and afternoon game drives in Ranthambore National Park. Children will become park rangers as leopard, nilgai, wild boar, hyena, bear and many different types of deer prance about the place for beady eyed little explores to spot. This is also one of the few places in India left to see a tiger in its national habitat too!
RANTHAMBORE - KARAULI Continue your journey through rural Rajasthan to the small town of Karauli.

KARAULI Today you shall explore the hidden gem that is Karauli. This is not a place frequented by most travellers to India, but is all the more rewarding for that. The village hosts a fascinating and lively bazaar full of handicrafts, stone carvings, colourful bangles and handmade wooden toys – a great place for children to hone their haggling skills. Set aside time to visit the wonderful City Palace, a treasure trove of beautiful architecture and lavishly painted rooms. Tours are available for those who are interested. Take a walking tour of the town by morning and a ride on a camel cart through the narrow market streets noon.

KARAULI - AGRA Journey to the Keoladeo Bird Sanctuary, one of the finest bird sanctuaries in the world and a UNESCO world heritage site. Children will love hopping on a traditional Indian rickshaw for a ride around the reserve as they play I Spy, spotting numerous species of our feathered friends. Continue on to the ghost city of Fatehpur Sikri. Built by the Moghul Emperor Akhbar nearly 500 years ago, the strangely peaceful city was abandoned only 15 years after completion because of a lack of water supply and is immaculately preserved.

AGRA Make a dentin the bucket list as you watch the sun rise over the magnificent Taj Mahal, one of the world’s most beautiful buildings. This truly magical experience is best inhaled in the early morning when it is at its quietest and most serene. Children will be entertained with the addition of a audio tour, allowing them to get the most out of their experience at the Taj Mahal. The rest of the morning is free for you to relax. However, if you are feeling well rested why not visit the nearby sanctuary which houses rescued dancing bears? As the afternoon creeps in, you will treated to an exciting city tour, first visiting Agra Fort, a masterpiece of design and construction. The fort's colossal walls tower over 20m in height and measure 2.5 km in circumference. Enclosed is a maze of exquisite buildings, forming an intriguing “city within a city”. It is here that you can access the thoughts and feelings of Shah Jehan, the builder of the Taj Mahal. Jehan spent the last 12 years of his life here under house arrest, take a moment to appreciate the same view he had of his masterpiece. From here you cross the River Yamuna and visit Itimad-ud-Daulah's tomb – the aptly named Baby Taj. Often referred to as a “jewel box”, the interior decoration and marble inlay is considered by many to have inspired that of the Taj Mahal. Finally you will visit Mehtab Bagh, the ultimate Taj Mahal viewing spot. Translated as the Moonlight Garden, the space was built using the exact dimensions of the Taj Mahal complex, offering a picture perfect view from every angle. As the evening draws in take the train back to Delhi. Once you reach you will be transferred to your hotel.
DELHI Time to say goodbye to India and head home.

tourName: India Golden Triangle and tiger safari holiday
generalInfo:
The Golden Triangle circuit comprising of Delhi, Agra and Jaipur is one of the most visited regions of India. Various UNESCO Sites like Taj Mahal, Fatehpur Sikri, Agra Fort, Qutub Minar, Monuments of Jaipur etc. are the highlights. Apart from these standard highlights, this tour includes awesome bespoke experiences like village visits, local interactions, Yoga sessions, food tours, wildlife safaris and much more.

Trip Highlights:

1. Visit the UNESCO World Heritage Sites in Delhi and experience the imperial and Mughal architecture.
2. Visit one of the 7 wonders of the world - Taj Mahal and discover the magic of white marble at Agra.
3. Energize yourself at Morning Taj Facing Yoga Session at Agra.
4. Visit the world-renowned Ranthambore National Park – Known for tigers and other species of animals – Go on an Open Jeep/Canter Safari to explore the national park.
5. Enjoy a guided tour of the Pink City.
6. Enjoy food tour in Jaipur

dayInfo.description: Arrive at New Delhi International Airport. Receive a warm welcome from our representative and get transferred to the hotel. On arrival complete the check in formalities and enjoy rest of the day at leisure.

• After breakfast, proceed for a sightseeing tour of the city with your guide. • Drive past or if you wish you may visit Red Fort • Drive past or if you wish you may take a stop at Raj Ghat – the cremation site of Mahatma Gandhi. • Visit Agrasen ki Baoli (ancient water reservoir) • Visit Jama Masjid • Visit Chandni Chowk – ‘the Moonlight Square and enjoy a Cycle Rickshaw Ride which takes you through the narrow streets of the Chandni Chowk. • Visit Lakshmi Narayan Temple • Drive Past India Gate – The All India War Memorial • Also pass by the Rashtrapati Bhavan (formerly the viceroy's residence) and the Parliament House. • Enjoy a special lunch at a local restaurant. • Visit Humayun's Tomb • Visit Qutub Minar - A UNESCO World Heritage Site.
After a hearty breakfast, travel to Agra (222Km, 5-hour drive). On arrival meet our representative and check into the hotel. Late afternoon go for Mughal Heritage Kachhpura Village walk with high tea

Early morning visit Taj Mahal during Sunrise (As fuel-based vehicles are not permitted in the vicinity of the Taj Mahal, you will head to the Taj Mahal gate by a Battery operated Bus. (Friday Closed). •After breakfast, visit Agra Fort - An Epitome of the Mughal Dynasty •Visit Itmad-Ud-Daulah’s Tomb OPTIONAL TOURS : •Mohabbat the Taj Show- You can watch the famous Mohabbat the Taj show, presented by the Sanskritik Natyashala. It is a series of play depicting the saga of love.

Early Morning, Enjoy the Taj Mahal Facing Yoga Session. After breakfast, check out from the hotel and travel to Ranthambore (240Km, 5-hour drive). En-route visit Fatehpur Sikri - A city predominantly made of red sandstone and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. On arrival meet our representative and check into the hotel and enjoy the rest of the day at leisure.
Enjoy the morning and evening Wildlife Safaris in the Ranthambore National Park on sharing basis.

After breakfast, check out from the hotel and travel to Jaipur (145Km, 4-hour drive). On arrival receive a warm welcome by our representative. Complete the check-in formalities. Evening enjoy the local food tour of Jaipur covering the culinary highlights of the city.

After breakfast, proceed for a full day Jaipur sightseeing tour with your Guide. •Visit Amber Fort – One of the most magnificent palaces in India. (The Fort is perched on a hill, so to reach there; you may enjoy a Jeep ride in Amber fort. •Visit Jantar Mantar – largest stone astronomical observatory in the world. •Visit to City Palace and Museum– Built by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh during the years 1729 to 1732. •Photo Stop Hawa Mahal – built by Maharaja Sawai Pratap Singh in the year 1799. •In the evening enjoy Heena Painting on Hands and Feet.
After breakfast check out from hotel and travel to New Delhi International Airport (270Km, 5 Hours drive) to board the flight for you home town.

tourName: India Golden Triangle & holy Ganges holiday
generalInfo:
Welcome aboard on your personal trip to Indian Golden Triangle and Varanasi.
Your journey will take you through the national capital of India, the pink city Jaipur and the world's architectural masterpiece - The Taj Mahal. In the end, you will visit the the holiest city of India – Varanasi, the destination for millions of pilgrims each year who come to bathe in the River Ganges and say farewell to their loved ones. You will also visit Sarnath where Buddha Sarnath, where Buddha delivered his first sermon..

To bring you more closer to India and its local people, we will take you to the local family to interact and learn about the use of Indian spices in Indian cooking ; we will introduce you to the century old Yoga practice and the ancient Indian principles of Ayurveda..

Highlights :
- Experience The Taj Mahal, widely considered to be one of the greatest architectural masterpieces in the world and is listed as one of the New Seven Wonders of World.
- Explore UNESCO World heritage sites with the help of knowledgeable local guides.
- Witness the impeccable handwork on fabric, marble and gems during this sumptuous journey.
- Interaction with local families to learn about use of Indian spices and Indian cooking.
- One Yoga session
- Introduction to Ayurveda along with one Ayurvedic massage.
- Rickshaw ride by Pink City Rickshaw ride company that aims to provide employment opportunity to women from low income households.
- Visit Varanasi, holiest city of India
- Early morning Boat ride on river Ganges
- Evening Aarti ceremony at the ghats of river Ganges.
- Sarnath, where Buddha delivered his first sermon.

Note :
a) These prices are not valid during peak period i.e during festival time like Diwali and Holi festivals, between 20 December to 10 January and also during Dev Deepawali festival in Varanasi. Some of the hotels charge higher prices during these dates.
If your travel is happening during this period, we will advise you prices based on your travel dates.
b) If you love to see wildlife in open nature, you can include Ranthambore National Park which has good visibility of Tigers.
c) These prices include 5% GST which is subject to change.
d) We have included 2 domestic flightss within India. Free baggage allowance in domestic flights is 15 kg for check-in baggage and 7 kg for hand baggage. Incase your baggage will be more than this limit, you will have to pay for extra baggage at the airport. For each traveller, only 1 check-in baggage is allowed.

dayInfo.description: Arrive Delhi. Arrive Delhi and meet your representative at airport. Transfer to hotel (check-in time 14h00).

In Delhi Start your tour to India with visit to Rajghat, memorial dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi (also known as Father of Nation). It’s a black marble platform where last rites of Mahatma Gandhi were performed after his assassination on 31th January 1948. It is an open-air memorial spread in large green area. Morning start your day with orientation tour of New Delhi, the foundation stone of the city was laid by Emperor George V during the Delhi Durbar of 1911. It was designed by British architects, Sir Edwin Lutyens and Sir Herbert Baker. Drive pass of President House (formerly Viceroy’s House), Indian Parliament, India Gate - a memorial to 70,000 soldiers of the British Indian Army who died in between 1914–1921 in the First World War and the third Anglo-Afghan War, and Connaught Place. Continue to visit Humayun’s Tomb built in the 1560’s, with the patronage of Humayun’s son, the great Emperor Akbar. Persian and Indian craftsmen worked together to build the garden-tomb, far grander than any tomb built before in the Islamic world. Humayun’s garden-tomb is an example of the charbagh (a four quadrant garden with the four rivers of Quranic paradise represented), with pools joined by channels. The garden is entered from lofty gateways on the south and from the west with pavilions located in the centre of the eastern and northern walls. Later proceed to Gurudwara Bangla Sahib, one of the prominent Sikh gurdwara or Sikh house of worship. Once inside the main building, you will be amazed with great interior, there is space to be seated on the floor and listen to “kirtan – the devotional songs” sung live by the staff. The holy book of Sikhs, the Guru Granth Sahib, is placed on top of a bed of silk and flowers. Like in all Sikh Gurdwaras, the concept of “langar, a communal free kitchen offering free sit-down meal” is practiced here too, and all people, regardless of race or religion may eat in the Gurdwara kitchen (langar hall). The Langar (food) is prepared by volunteers who wish to help out and by gursikhs who work there. It is believed that everyday around 25000 people eat in this hall. You are supposed to cover your head with a scarf and clean your feet with water at the entrance, as it is strictly followed in

Delhi / Jaipur (by road – approx. 5 hr) Morning drive to Jaipur, an enthralling prolific “pink city” and capital of Rajasthan state. The city was painted in pink to welcome the Prince of Wales and Queen Victoria in 1876 since the colour is the mark of Hospitality. As a result, Jaipur started to be known as the Pink City. Late afternoon enjoy rickshaw ride for transfer from hotel to City Palace in Pink City Rickshaw ride company that aims to provide employment opportunity to women from low income households. Later proceed to beautiful palace that came into existence with the establishment of the city of Jaipur. Built by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh II, the palace was the administrative and ceremonial seat of Jaipur Maharaja. Beautiful courtyards and buildings in the palace complex are worth exploring. Continue to visit 18th century astronomical observation site, the Jantar Mantar. This UNESCO World Heritage site has collection of some 20 fixed astronomical instruments built by the Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh II. Designed for the observation of astronomical positions with the naked eye, they embody several architectural and instrumental innovations. Later introduction to Ayurveda, the Science of Life, that originated in India more than 5,000 years ago. Avail Abhyanga massage that includes a gentle massage with a large amount of pre-medicated warm oil. Abhyanga is beneficial for the nourishment of the entire body and it also reduces the aging effect. It divulges the muscle tone and strengthens the tissues of the body, which results in quick relief from muscular pain.

In Jaipur Morning excursion to the famous Amber Fort constructed in the 16th century by Maan Singh, the trusted general of Emperor Akbar. The fort is known for its architectural splendour manifested in Sukh Mandir, the Hall of Public Audience, Sheesh Mahal and Kesar Kyari. Photo stop at Jaipur’s most photographed building, the Hawa Mahal or Palace of Winds, is an extraordinary pink-painted, honeycombed hive that rises five storeys. It was constructed in 1799 to facilitate ladies of the royal families to watch the life and processions of the city. Late afternoon visit local Indian family to dinner…interact with family and learn about Indian cooking and spices. Lady travelers will learn wearing Indian sari and also Mehndi, is a form of body art in which decorative designs are created on hands and feet.

Jaipur / Fatehpur Sikri / Agra (by road – approx. 5 hrs drive) Morning drive to Agra with option of enroute stop at UNESCO World Heritage site of Fatehpur Sikri to visit this ghost town. Built during the second half of the 16th century by the Emperor Akbar, Fatehpur Sikri (the City of Victory) was the capital of the Mughal Empire for only some 10 years. It has complex of monuments and temples, all in a uniform architectural style. Continue to Agra, once a Mughal capital.

In Agra Morning visit The Taj Mahal, an enormous mausoleum complex commissioned in 1632 by the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan to house the remains of his beloved wife. Constructed over a 20-year period on the southern bank of the Yamuna River in Agra, India, the famed complex is one of the most outstanding examples of Mughal architecture, which combined Indian, Persian and Islamic influences. At its center is the Taj Mahal itself, built of shimmering white marble that seems to change color depending on the daylight. Designated a UNESCO World Heritage site in 1983, it remains one of the world’s most celebrated structures and a stunning symbol of India’s rich history. Later continue to Agra Fort, also called Red Fort, large 16th-century of red sandstone located on the Yamuna river. It was established by the Mughal dynasty emperor Akbar and, in its capacity as both a military base and a royal residence, served as the seat of government when the Mughal capital was in Agra. The fort complex was designated a UNESCO World Heritage site in 1983. Return back to hotel. Rest of the day free to relax at hotel.

Agra / Delhi (by road - approx. 4hrs drive) + Delhi / Varanasi (by flight) Morning drive back to Delhi. On arrival in Delhi, connect flight to Varanasi, one of the holiest cities in India and the destination for millions of pilgrims each year who come to bathe in

In Varanasi Early morning, take a boat ride on the River Ganges to enjoy the sunrise and observe the devotees having their ritual bath and performing prayers to rising sun (an ancient tradition that is still followed today). Return to the hotel for breakfast before heading out again for a tour of Varanasi with your guide. Rest this afternoon, as you'll take to the waters tonight to observe the Aarti ceremony on the ghats. Thousands of locals and pilgrims gather together every sunset to offer their prayers to the Mother Ganges. This prayer ceremony, a fire offering given to the Goddess Ganga, is performed on a stage by a group of young Hindu priests (pandits) dressed in saffron attire. The ceremony begins with the blowing of a conch shell and continues with the circling of large flaming lamps. The movement of these lamps is synchronized with the rhythmic chants of hymns and clang of cymbals. Note : Boat ride and Aarti ceremony is subject to water level of River Ganges.

Varanasi / Delhi (by flight) Morning introduction to Yoga, a 5,000-year-old Indian knowledge. For everyone it has different meaning. For some, it is a way of life or a spiritual practice and for others it is a way to feel good in their bodies. Yoga involves various breathing exercises, yoga poses (asanas) and meditation. Return back to hotel for breakfast. Transfer to Sarnath, a major Buddhist centre where Buddha delivered his first sermon after attaining enlightenment, in which he taught the four noble truths and the teachings associated with it. Connect flight to Delhi to connect your flight to next destination...no accommodation in Delhi, but it can be booked depending on your flight schedule for next destination.
Delhi / Fly to next destination

tourName: India Golden Triangle tour, a journey beyond
placesVisited: Delhi, Agra, Bundi, Udaipur, visit the rural communities of Rajasthan, Leh, Ladakh, Amritsar, mountain train journey, Shimla
generalInfo:
This India Golden Triangle tour takes you to the rich plains and mountains of North India, which have drawn numerous visitors from across Asia, Persia and beyond. From luminous figures such as Napoleon to Alexander the Great to the British East India Company, many have vied to control the vast expanses and rich resources of the North.

The journey that we’ve put together was designed with a lot of thought. Thought into the elements that would help showcase North India’s tumultuous and checkered history, and provide insights into its various people, from the great Mughals, Persians and Afghans, to the Rajputs, the Sikhs, the Tibetans and ultimately the English who shaped the region’s more recent history.

Ultimately the North is not only about its people and their cultures but also about the incredible diversity in landscape and vistas. This holiday experience takes you to landscapes ranging from flat plains, to the fringes of the Thar, to agricultural fertility in the Punjab, to high Himalayan vistas.

We typically begin with Mughal history, from Mughal Old Delhi and Agra to the desert state of Rajasthan. Rajasthan is where we look to showcase the incredible diversity that exists, not only in the region’s landscape, but in its people and their cultures as well. Starting with the incredible bird life of Bharatpur with its one of the kind responsible safari experiences, we move into the hillsides of Bundi, through the Aravalli Mountains, and to the lakes of Udaipur, which is also home to incredible Rajput and Jain architecture.

Moving away from the Aravallis we enter the semi arid but incredibly nature-rich regions that border the Thar Desert. From tented abodes that serve us some of the most delectable Rajasthani rural cuisine to rustic and immersive family homestay experiences in the heart of the villages of Osian, this part of the journey is about the discovery of local people and the cultures that form their identities in the present day.

The journey beyond Rajasthan enters a part of Northern India that’s often overlooked. We take you into the fertile fields of the Punjab where through a series of walking trails we showcase the unique customs, religion and way of life of the Sikhs.

The final stage of this journey enters the Himalayan wilderness of Leh with its high altitude lakes and Buddhist beliefs, and moves on to the former summer capital of the Raj at Shimla. Shimla is filled with historic relics from its English past, making it a nice way to wrap up a fantastic set of experiences.

Also known as a home of the Nawabs of Avadh, they were great patrons of the culinary and other arts, particularly dance and music. You will find great architecture of British Raj era buildings and mausoleums. Visit architecturally beautiful La Martiniere, built by Frenchman Claude Martin as his palatial home. Continue to visit the ruins of Lucknow Residency which offer a glimpse into events of First War of Independence (Indian Uprising) in 1857, considered to be the beginning of the end for the British Raj. The complex has a hall, a mosque, gardens and a step well. You will have a photo stop at the 220 foot tall red brick Clock Tower. tourName: India highlights, Taj, Ganges, & ancient monuments
placesVisited: Tour of India's capital Delhi, Palaces and forts in the 'Pink City' of Jaipur, Taj Mahal and other Moghul architectural glories, Train ride to Jhansi, Temple complexes in Khajuraho, The holy city of Varanasi, Boat cruise on the Ganges, Sacred sites of Buddhism, Optional extension: Tiger Safari at Kanha National Park
generalInfo:
This tour provides a window on ancient India and its incredible cultural heritage, from architectural jewels to spiritual depths.

Begin by exploring India's capital, Delhi, visiting the grand Swami Naryan Temple, the old town's magnificent Red Fort – one-time seat of Moghul rulers – and the ornately decorated Qutub Minar minaret.

The 'Pink City' of Jaipur – capital of Rajasthan – provides colourful counterpoint to Delhi with its ravishing mix of ancient merchant houses, historic forts and lavish palaces. Your next destination is Agra, pausing en route to visit Fatehpur Sikri, a fascinating example of Moghul architecture built by the illustrious King Akbar. In Agra, the Agra Fort is merely a grand taster for a visit to one of the world's most iconic historic buildings, the Taj Mahal.

Next day, it's all-aboard to ride one of India's characterful trains to Jhansi, before transferring to the road to drive to the 'Temple City' of Khajuraho in Madhya Pradesh. You'll pause en route to stretch your legs at a delightful hill station in Orchha. In Khajuraho, discover one of India's finest concentrations of temples, from the ornately decorated Jahangir Mahal to the sensuous Devi Jagdamba, adorned with erotic carvings.

Your journey concludes with a flight to the holy city of Varanasi and a boat ride on the sacred Ganges River, its stepped embankments lined with bathing pilgrims and temples. Gain insight into their worship at Benares Hindu University, a centre of learning for Sanskrit and Indian culture. Suitably enlightened, you'll visit some of the most sacred sites of Buddhism – Sarnath, where the Buddha preached his first sermon, then the Dhamek Stupa where the Buddha proclaimed his faith.

dayInfo.description: Day 1: New Delhi Upon Arrival at New Delhi Airport ,our executive will be there to welcome you,later you will be transferred to your booked hotel. The finest Gateaway destination New Delhi is capital city of India. One of the most populated metropolis in the country is an amalgamation of modernity and ancient monuments.

Day 2: New Delhi This day we will explore the capital city a window to cultural India. A [ot pourri of diverse cultures and ethnic profiles it will give you a glimpse of what lies in store . The first visit is to Swami Naryan Temple a modern megalith it is an architectural grandeur. Then we move to Old Delhi and visit the Red Fort. The seat of erstwhile Moghul kings you will love the magnificent architecture and grand spaces. Qutub Minar is a looming minaret that basks in the glory of the ancient slave dynasties. The minaret never ceases to impress with its overall construction and fine carvings. The Indian Cuisine is an introduction to mouth watering delicaies and hot curries. You will fall in love with the food. We eat as we move.Overnight Hotel

Day 3:Capital Jaipur _ Rajasthan On this day we move to Jaipur also known as the pink city. We will reach after six hours drive through colorful hamlets and quaint townships bustling with life. Overnight Hotel

Day 4: Jaipur – Pink City The Capital City of Rajasthan State is a fascinating agglomeration of a colorful culture complimented by the majestic havelis, forts, palaces, and lakes. Hawa Mahal, Jaipur Palace. The Rajputs were great warriors as well as pleasure seekers, They loved everything culture,c uisine, monuments you name it. The sightseeing explores the legacy of erstwhile Maharajas Overnight: overnight hotel

Day 5: Agra – North India Today we will visit Fatehpur Sikri on route to Agra. Built by the Mogul King Akbar as his headquarters it is a fascinating doorway to Mogul architecture in India. From here we will proceed towards Agra City and head straight for Agra Fort, built on the lines of the Red Fort at New Delhi. After the visit to the Red Fort we will see the Taj Mahal, cynosure of all eyes. Taj Mahal needs no elaborationm, the fantastic edifice is one among the seventh wonder of the World. Overnight Hotel

Day 6: Khajuraho – Madhya Pradesh After breakfast we board train to Jhansi in North India. Upon arrival we drive three hours to Khajuraho the Temple City enroute we halt at Orchha a hill station with awesome architectures. We visit Jahangir Mahal a delicate work of artistic delight. Then we move to Raja Ram Temple a Hindu place of worship dedicated to Lord Ram. We then drive on to the temple city.Overnight Hotel.

Day 7: Khajuraho - Varanasi – (Banaras) At Khajuraho we move to Western Group of Temples -the Kandariya Mahadeo, Devi Jagdamba which exhibit erotic carvings, sensuos and exotic. Post lunch we explore the Eastern Group of Temples- Parsvanath Jain Temple and others in the complex. After the visit we fly to Varanasi the holy city. Overnight Hotel.

Day 8: Varanasi Our day begins with a boat ride on the Ganges River. As we row we enamour at the numerous ghats with bustling hoards of the pious pilgrins and the temples of the stepped enbankments. The splendrous ride offers view of sacred rites and rituals enacted by the pilgrims, Later we visit the Benares Hindu Universitytial center of learning for Sanskrit, Indian art, culture, and music. Then from here we drive about eight km to Sarnath where the Buddha preached his first sermon. We also see the Dhamek Stupa where the Buddha proclaimed his faith. The amazing relic found here is the Ashoka Pillar dating 250 BC.Overnight hotel
Day 9: Varanasi- Delhi Transfer to airport to connect flight to New delhi overnight Hotel
Day 10: Transfer to international airport.

tourName: India luxury 16 day tour
generalInfo:
This trip really takes in the very best of Indian experiences

Palaces, Forts, Safari, Culture, Great Food and fantastic beaches!

We have included some unique off the beaten track experiences which go to places that mass tourism does not reach.

As the name suggests this journey is simply breathtaking. IT will be good 2- & 1/2-weeks luxury tour of India.

The hotels we have handpicked are some of the world's finest

The Imperial, Delhi
The Oberoi Amar Vilas, Agra
The Oberoi Vanya Vilas, Ranthambore
Taj Ram Bagh Palace, Jaipur
The Oberoi Udai Vilas, Udaipur
CGH Brunton Boatyard, Cochin
CGH Spice Coast Cruise, Alleppey
CGH Marari Beach Resort, Mararikulam

This is a breathtaking trip

dayInfo.description: Delhi Step off the plane and into our care with assistance on arrival at Delhi International. Redolent with history, the Imperial Hotel is a fascinating blend of Art Deco, old Colonial and Victorian styles. Plan your adventures for the days ahead over a breakfast briefing. Explore the vibrant cities of New and Old Delhi.

Agra Wake up early, excited to travel again. Tonight you’ll be sleeping in the beautifully-preserved city of Agra, surrounded by some of the world’s finest monuments. Sleep soundly in The Oberoi Amar Vilas hotel, just a stone’s throw away from one of the world’s most famous landmarks, the Taj Mahal.

Ranthambore -2 nights Relax and enjoy the day of travel ahead as we’ll take care of everything. From the majesty of Agra, head south to the wild beauty of Ranthambore National park. Board the Shatabdi Express at Agra station and speed through the golden countryside on an air-conditioned train. Overnight stay at The Oberoi Vanya Vilas Hotel

Jaipur -2 nights Relax and enjoy the morning journey to Jaipur, we’ll take care of everything. Discover why Jaipur earned its nickname of the ‘Paris of India’ on a half-day tour. Stroll its wide boulevards and photograph the flamboyant pink-painted streets. Stock up on treasures to take home at the vibrant night market. Overnight stay at Hotel Taj Ram Bagh Palace.

Udaipur -2 nights Head north by comfy air-conditioned car to Udaipur, nicknamed the ‘Venice of the East’. Explore the city’s palaces and landscaped gardens on a half-day tour. Experience life in majestic luxury at the Oberoi Udaivilas.

Cochin -2 nights Visit synagogues, temples and churches, experience the cultural melting pot of this ancient port city From the Dutch to the Portuguese and Chinese, walk in the footsteps of past explorers on a half-day tour. Take a relaxing soak in your tub at the Brunton Boatyard Hotel. Watch from the window as dolphins swim in the glittering waters beyond. Visit the gravestone of Vasco de Gama, the explorer who discovered the sea route from Europe to India.

Alleppey Your home for the next two nights will be a traditional air-conditioned houseboat. Relax and unwind as you enjoy the tranquil life onboard, gently cruising the network of canals along the backwaters.

Mararikulam -2 nights Time to shift into a deeper level of relaxation. After breakfast enjoy a drive to the Marari Beach Resort, an oasis of calm where you can unwind completely, enjoying secluded beaches and stunning sunsets.

tourName: India luxury NP wildlife holidays
generalInfo:
See the very best national parks in India where you’ll spot abundant wild and bird life. The Tour is nicely paced and can be easily tailored if it does not quite hit the mark.

Luxury accommodation for 13 nights including breakfast
All airport and hotel transfers
An air-conditioned car with driver
English-speaking local guides in Delhi, Agra, Khajuraho, Bandhavgarh, Pench, Kanha
Monument and all park entrance fees included

dayInfo.description: Delhi Day 1 Upon arrival in Delhi airport, you will be met by our representative and will be provided assisted transfer to your hotel. Upon arrival check in to the Hotel. Spend the rest of the day at leisure. Overnight at the Hotel. Day 2 After breakfast, full day city tour of New & Old Delhi. Places to visit includes: • Jama Masjid • Cycle Rickshaw ride in Old Delhi • Red Fort (from Outside) • Humayun’s Tomb • Qutub Minar • Drive Past Janpath Overnight at the Hotel.

Ranthambore Day 3 After breakfast, you will be provided assisted departure transfer to railway station to board the train for Ranthambore. • Train Kota Jan Shatabdi ETD 1315 Hrs / ETA 1802 Hrs Class AC Chair Car On arrival in Ranthambore, you will be provided assisted arrival transfer from railway station to Hotel. Upon arrival check in to the Hotel. Overnight at the Hotel. Day 4 Early morning proceed for jungle safari (shared basis) in Ranthambore National Park. Return to the hotel for breakfast & lunch. Afternoon: Proceed for another jungle safari (shared basis). Overnight at the Hotel.

Agra Day 5 After breakfast, you will be driven to Agra (5.5 Hours approx.). Upon arrival check in at the hotel. Later visit Taj Mahal (Friday Closed) and Agra Fort. On arrival check in at the hotel. Rest of the day is free at leisure.

Khajuraho Day 6 After breakfast, you will be provided assisted departure transfer to railway station to board the train for Jhansi. • Train Bhopal Shatabdi ETD 0755 Hrs / ETA 1040 Hrs Class AC Chair Car In Jhansi, you will be received by our representative and then drive to Khajuraho enroute visiting Orchha (3.5 Hours approx.). Upon arrival check in at the Hotel. Overnight at the Hotel

Bandhavgarh Day 7 After breakfast, Visit Khajuraho temples. Later drive to Bandhavgarh (05 Hours approx.). Upon arrival check in at the hotel. Overnight at the hotel. Day 8 Early morning proceed for jungle safari (shared basis) in Bandhavgarh National Park. Return to the hotel for breakfast & lunch. Afternoon: Proceed for another jungle safari (shared basis). Overnight at the Hotel.
