dayInfo.description: Delhi - Arrival Once you arrive into Delhi international airport you will be met by your local guide and driver and then be transferred to your hotel in the city. If your flight arrived in the morning you can enjoy some sightseeing today. (no meals included today).

Corbett National Park - Travelling This morning you will be collected from your hotel in Delhi and transfered to Corbett National Park. Corbett is located around 250km north-east of Delhi in the sub-Himalayan Sivalik hills. The drive is around 4-5 hours and along the way the highway crosses the famous Ganges River and as this is the closest point of the river to Delhi so that it can get busy with worshippers. Once you arrive at the park and your lodge you will check in and then if time allows you will be taken on a short afternoon jeep safari into the buffer-zone of the park. This is a brief introduction to some of the wildlife in the area and you should see barking deer, wild boar and chital as well as many species of the commoner bird species such as crested serpent eagles, blossom-headed parakeets, pied kingfishers, dollarbirds and Asian paradise flycatchers. During this short safari you will cross the wonderful Ramganga River, this is a monsoonal river that is the lifeblood of the surrounding areas you will see how most people’s lives revolve around the river. After this you will be taken back to the accommodation to relax and enjoy your evening meal. (breakfast and dinner included).

Corbett National Park - Wildlife Watching This morning you can have another jeep safari before breakfast, this would be your last chance of seeing hog deer that love the grasslands around here, then after breakfast you will board the jeep and head back towards the town of Ramnagar along the Ramganga River, this is the dry season so the river will be low and you will see the huge rounded boulders that have been brought here from high in the distance Himalayas over thousands of years of spring melts and monsoonal floods. It is a shame that the park is closed during the monsoon season as it must be incredible to see this mighty river in full flow during this time of year. Along the way you have the chance of seeing more wildlife for the last time before arriving back at the lodge and your evening meal. (all meals included today).
Delhi - Travelling This morning you will leave the lodge after breakfast and be transferred back to Delhi and your hotel for the last night in India. (breakfast is the only meal included today).
Home - Departure After breakfast you will be transferred to the international airport in time to catch your return flight home. (breakfast is the only meal included today).

tourName: India tiger safari in Kanha National Park
generalInfo:
This budget tiger safari of India takes you to one of the best national parks in the country; Kanha National Park. This park is a wonderful mix of grassy plateaus, open misty plains and bamboo forests and is home to around a hundred tigers living wild. As well as dhole, guar, leopard, sambhar, chital and monkeys and dozens more species.

This budget safari has been designed to maximise your time in the park and chances of seeing tigers with as low a cost as possible. We are proud of our 100% sighting rate and of course, you will also get a chance to see a wide array of other wildlife, not just tigers. Please note that we are very happy to organise this trip for a solo traveller as well as for groups.

Introduction:
We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching all over the world and we have a great range of Indian wildlife watching safari holidays. These tours range from the dry desert regions of Gujarat in search of striped hyena and Asiatic lions to the icy peaks of the Himalayas on the quest for snow leopards. But we also focus heavily on some of the 40 plus Tiger Reserves in this wonderful and diverse country. One of these reserves is Kanha National Park, a popular and large park with a huge number of tigers inhabiting inside it – but without the large numbers of tourists that can be found in the more popular and well known parks.

This tour explores this great park on the trail of tigers of course, this iconic denizen of the Indian jungles is as symbolic of India as the Taj Mahal or Mahatma Ghandi. But Kanha has a fantastic record for also showing the other predators of the jungle. Whilst rare and hard to see in other parks the leopards, sloth bears and dhole are all regularly seen here. So we will dedicate a large amount time to these species as well as the tigers whilst here.

Kanha is one of India's more popular parks, however we have an incredible range of safaris in India. Whether you wish to visit the Western Ghats for its endemic species, Gujarat for the desert adapted species, the high grasslands of the North East for giants such as rhinos, elephants and buffalo or even head to the Himalayas for snow leopard spotting we have the itinerary for you. India is a treasure trove of wildlife and habitats and all you have to do is to get in touch with your budget and your group size and where you would like to go and we will come back to you with an itinerary and quote for your perfect Indian wildlife safari tour.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner) where mentioned, in some locations lunch and dinner are not included (please refer to the itinerary), such as in Delhi. There will be bottled water (approx 1ltr) available for each guest each day. We have our own private air conditioned vehicles with an excellent driver for all transfers. Where possible we use two brilliant guides; first a professional zoologist (when available - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) who will escort you on all your excursions and we also have very knowledgeable English speaking local naturalist guides who have decades of experience working and guiding through India and particularly Kanha. Your naturalist escort is an expert in tigers and their conservation and behaviour and will be able to help you identify the different species as well as interpret you what behaviours you are seeing.

The local guides have spent years searching out the best wildlife watching locations and have an unrivalled knowledge where we are going to visit. Where needed we further employ local guides at specific locations where their intimate knowledge of individual reserves and parks is invaluable in finding our targeted species. We also include all vehicle safaris, park entrance fees and sightseeing entrance fees. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the park. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us).

Seasons:

The best time to go tiger watching in India is mid January to mid May. This is the hot dry season with the hottest time from beginning March until mid May. This is when tigers come out to waterholes to find water, or prey on other wildlife doing the same.
However you can visit this park and enjoy the itinerary between November – April.

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by an experienced naturalist as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge..
• Our local Indian guides around Kanha have a good relationship with the park officials and because of this we get a heads up when animals are sighted and this can guide us in where to focus and thus increasing our chances of seeing our targeted species.
• All the above reasons give this, our wildlife and tiger safaris of India a great success rate of seeing the best wildlife around here. We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides throughout India so that we can try and find and observe animals such as the tigers, leopards, sloth bears, dhole and many more species. We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of India at other times of year and focusing on other species such as brown and snow leopards, Indian one-horned rhinos, Western Ghats endemics, elephants, primates, Asiatic lions and many species throughout this incredible country. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Locations:

This tour is completely focused on one national park and tiger reserve, Kanha. It is located in Madhya Pradesh. We will fly in and out of Delhi and then travel onto Jabaplur before reaching the park in the Indian wilderness.

Fitness Level:

All of this safari is done from a vehicle. So no physical fitness for hiking or anything like that is needed. This is a very easy trip to undertake.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking.

Minimum Age: 15 Years Old

dayInfo.description: Jabalpur - Today you will arrive into the city of Jabalpur in Madhya Pradesh. On arrival you will be met by your local guide and taken direct towards Kanha National Park. The rest of the day will be free for you to rest and relax and tomorrow you head into the park for your first day of safaris. (Breakfast and dinner included today).

Kanha National Park - Travelling & Safari - After an early breakfast this morning you will leave the hotel to Kanha National park (4.5-5 hrs) in a private vehicle. On your arrival at the park you will check into your lodge and then in the afternoon head into the park for your first jeep safari. Every time you enter the park you will be accompanied by a national park naturist and local drive; so you will be in good company when looking for wildlife. (Breakfast and dinner only).

Kanha National Park / Jabalpur - Safari & Travelling - This morning you will have one last jeep safari into Kanha before breakfast back at the lodge. You will then travel back to Jabalpur (4.5-5 hours). This afternoon is free for you to rest and relax. (Breakfast only).
Home - Departure - Today after breakfast we will be taken to Jabalpur airport in time to catch the flight back to home. (Breakfast only).

tourName: India tiger safari small group holiday
generalInfo:
Journey into the heartland of India in search of the majestic Royal Bengal Tiger. On this 15-day tour, we take in five sprawling national parks, spotting tigers, dolphins, gharials and sambar dear amongst others. Soak in the astounding scenery as we travel by boat and 4WD vehicles through the forests, rivers and mountains of central India.

Bandhavgarh Tiger Reserve - Search for tigers in Bandhavgarh, boasting the highest population density of tigers in the world.
Kanha National Park - Spot wildlife on jeep safaris through Kanha, the inspiration for Rudyard Kipling's 'Jungle Book'.
Panna, Sariska and Chambal - Explore the rocky Aravalli Hills, boat along the River Chambal and drive through the forests of the lesser-known Panna.

dayInfo.title: Join trip in Delhi. Evening prayer ceremony at Hanuman Temple
dayInfo.description: : Arrive in New Delhi, the capital of India and the colourful, bustling centre of the nation. The city has been at the heart of numerous empires and dynasties over time from the Mughals to the British Raj, with each one having left its own unique mark on the city, resulting in the rich patchwork that is modern-day Delhi. For those arriving on time today, our tour leader plans to meet you in the hotel reception at 5pm for a welcome meeting. We'll then make our way out into the city on foot, arriving at Hanuman's Temple in time to witness the evening prayer rituals. Afterwards, we'll explore the bustling hub of Connaught Place - a colonial-era circus of shops, bars, restaurants and street vendors. If you'd like an airport transfer today, you'll need to arrive into New Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport (DEL), which is around 45 minutes from our hotel. Please note, that if you'd like to join the city tour today, you'll need to arrive at the hotel by 4pm. If you're booking your own flights, we recommend giving yourself at least one hour to clear the airport. The drive from the airport to the hotel is then around 45 minutes, therefore the latest your flight can arrive is 2pm. If you miss the welcome meeting, your tour leader will inform you of any essential information as soon as you catch up.

dayInfo.title: Explore the sights of New Delhi including Humayun's Tomb, then drive to Sariska
dayInfo.description: : This morning, we'll explore more of the city, acclimatising ourselves to the calmer area of New Delhi, and driving along the wide avenues to take in the major sights that begin to tell the story of India's rich history. We visit India Gate and the UNESCO-listed Mughal site of Humayun's Tomb, a precursor to the great Taj Mahal. After lunch, we leave Delhi and drive to Sariska National Park, a drive of approximately three and a half hours. There will be some free time in the late afternoon to enjoy our lodge's facilities before dinner.

dayInfo.title: Morning and afternoon game drives searching for wildlife in Sariska National Park
dayInfo.description: : Sariska National Park has been a real success story of conservation. Back in the early 2000s, it was thought that due to poaching and habitat degradation, the reserve had no tigers left within its boundaries. A huge conservation effort was mounted and fast-forwarding to today there is now thought to be a population of around 30 tigers including a litter of healthy cubs. Straddling Rajasthan's Aravalli Hills, Sariska is characterised by dry deciduous forests, grasslands and rocky landscapes. The park is generally considered to be a far quieter park than its very popular neighbour, Ranthambore. As the sun rises and the dawn breaks, we head out early to catch our first glimpse of India's incredible wildlife. As well as the tigers, the park is also home to the elusive leopard, jungle cat, jackals, a variety of deer a huge number of langurs. After lunch, we take a second game drive as we continue to search for wildlife. The group will be split into a number of open-topped, private jeeps, with each jeep having an accompanying naturalist.

dayInfo.title: Drive to Dholpur to take a boat on the Chambal River to spot river-side wildlife
dayInfo.description: : This morning we will leave Rajasthan behind and cross into India's most populous state, Uttar Pradesh. Such is the population of UP, that if it were a country in its own right, it would be the fifth most populous country in the world. The state is a major industrial and commercial centre and, being on the main Indo-Gangetic plain, it benefits from rich soil for excellent agriculture. We make the five-hour drive across fertile landscapes to the city of Dholpur, sitting beside the Chambal River. The Chambal is one of the few remaining undammed rivers in northern India and is known for its rich biodiversity and relatively untouched natural surroundings. After lunch, we will take a private boat out onto the river where we hope to spot some of the rich variety of wildlife found here. This river is one of the last remaining habitats for the critically endangered Gharial, a species of long-snouted crocodile which are often found on the banks of the river, basking in the afternoon sun. As well as crocodiles, we may spot the playful Gangetic River Dolphin, smooth-coated otters or the Indian softshell turtle. The river is also a haven for birdlife where we hope to be lucky enough to spot Indian Skimmers, Sarus Cranes and Kingfishers. In the rare event that water levels in the Chambal River rise, Indian authorities may suspend river safaris for safety reasons, in which case an alternative activity will be provided.

dayInfo.title: Take a train to Jhansi, then drive to Khajuraho. Late afternoon free
dayInfo.description: : We head deeper into central India today, making the short drive to the train station this morning where we catch the two-hour train ride to Jhansi. Travelling by train is a wonderful way to experience India, from the bustling railway platforms to the chai wallahs that ply their trade through the carriages, offering hot tea and snacks along the journey. India has one of the largest rail networks in the world, and it serves as a vital lifeline for many Indians - connecting many small towns, villages and rural areas with larger commercial centres. Along the way, we can soak in the rural scenery as it rolls past our window and we're likely to get the chance to chat with some of the locals in our carriage who are often interested to see tourists travelling by train. After disembarking in Jhansi we will continue by bus, crossing into the central state of Madhya Pradesh to Khajuraho, a journey of around three hours. The rest of the afternoon has been left free to relax or to explore this ancient town.

dayInfo.title: Early morning game drive in Panna National Park. Afternoon visit to the Jain temples of Khajuraho
dayInfo.description: : We set off early this morning for our private 4WD game drive through the varied landscapes of Panna National Park. The park's topography provides some truly stunning scenery and makes it quite different from our experience in Sariska. The park is made up of thick teak forests separated by wide plateaus and gorges. The lazy Ken River flows through the park and acts as its main water source, and in parts cascades down stacked rocks forming impressive waterfalls. Known less for tigers (although sightings still can be made) the park is renowned for its birdlife with over 200 recorded species found here. Vultures and eagles are not uncommon sightings, as well as the colourful Asian Paradise Flycatcher; the state bird of Madhya Pradesh. Migratory birds are also prevalent in the winter months. Later this afternoon, we explore the UNESCO World Heritage Temples of Khajuraho. Intricately hand-carved, the erotic sculptures which adorn the Hindu and Jain temples here are full of symbolism and depict various aspects of life at the time, during the 9th to 12th century. We spend the afternoon exploring the main temples including the magnificent Kandariya Mahadev and Vishwanath temples.

dayInfo.title: Drive through rural countryside, past the farmlands of Madhya Pradesh to Bandhavgarh Tiger Reserve
dayInfo.description: : Our journey continues today, as we drive further into the heart of India to Bandhavgarh - arguably the most famous tiger reserve in the world. The drive will take approximately five hours with breaks and will give us a real taste of rural India as we pass by patchworks of farmlands and pockets of small villages. It's a common scene in rural India to see children playing in the water from the hand-pumped wells, and cows and other livestock roaming freely through the villages and across the roads. Upon arrival in Bandhavgarh, the rest of the afternoon has been left free to relax.

dayInfo.title: Morning and afternoon game drives in Bandhavgarh National Park searching for the elusive Royal Bengal Tiger
dayInfo.description: : The former hunting reserve of the Maharaja of Rewa, Bandhavgarh Tiger Reserve is today world-renowned for reputedly having the highest population density of tigers in any park on earth. The majestic Royal Bengal is at home here amongst the ideal habitat of high grasslands interspersed with forests of sal and bamboo, while rivers and streams crisscross their way through the park. The trees and high grasslands provide ample food for the park's large deer population, and in turn, provide plenty of cover for the tigers to hunt their prey. The various water sources are an ideal location for tigers to rest and a great place to spot the big cats lazing around on hotter days. Whilst tigers are the focus here, the park is also home to wild dogs, hyenas, spotted deer (chital), bison and many more species. We spend the day taking two safaris through the park, one in the early morning and one in the late afternoon. Safaris will be in private 4WD vehicles with a maximum of four to a jeep and with an accompanying naturalist.

dayInfo.title: Another morning and afternoon game drive in Bandhavgarh National Park
dayInfo.description: : We spend another day in Bandhavgarh, with two further morning and afternoon game drives in our private 4WD vehicles. Game drives are usually taken in the early morning, between the hours of 06.00 and 11.00 and afternoon game drives are between 14.30 and 17.30. The time in between can be spent at leisure, using the facilities of the lodge and enjoying an extended lunch break.

dayInfo.title: Drive from Bandhavgarh to Kanha National Park
dayInfo.description: : We leave Bandhavgarh National Park this morning and drive to Kanha, a journey of approximately six hours, with plenty of time for refreshment stops. We'll enjoy a late lunch on arrival at our jungle lodge, and the remainder of the afternoon is at leisure.

dayInfo.title: Morning and afternoon game drives searching for wildlife in Kanha National Park
dayInfo.description: : Kanha's huge expanses of grassy meadows and thick deciduous forests are said to have served as inspiration to Rudyard Kipling for The Jungle Book. It's easy to see why with the sheer variety on offer at Kanha, both for flora and fauna. The park is home to a significant population of tigers, as well as leopards, sloth bears, Bengal foxes, bison and the rare Indian antelope (blackbuck), as well as over 300 species of bird. The park is expansive, covering an area of 940 square kilometres and we plan to explore the park on five private game drives over the following three days. Today we enjoy two game drives, one in the early morning and one in the late afternoon as we look to spot the park's abundant wildlife and take in Kanha's beautiful vistas.

dayInfo.title: Another full day in Kanha National Park, with morning and afternoon game drives
dayInfo.description: : We have another day in Kanha National Park, with morning and afternoon game drives in our private 4WD jeeps alongside a naturalist. Morning game drives can be especially beautiful as we are out in the park just as the sun rises. But during the winter months these drives can be especially cold, so be sure to prepare with extra layers.

dayInfo.title: Morning game drive in Kanha NP, then drive to Jabalpur to catch the overnight train to Delhi
dayInfo.description: : We enjoy one final game drive in Kanha National Park this morning before we leave the boundaries of the park and drive to Jabalpur, a journey of approximately four to five hours including stops. From Jabalpur, we board our overnight train which will take us back to Delhi. Indian sleeper trains are a fantastic experience and a great way to meet people as we travel. We make our bookings in second-class air-conditioned sleepers, which have four beds in each compartment and all bedding provided. Whilst we try to ensure the group is all together, due to overwhelming demand and the system for booking train tickets in India, it may not always be possible to have everyone in the same carriage and some reservations may be in third-class air-conditioned. In such cases, our tour leaders will help everyone to find their seats and ensure you get the most out of your journey. For overnight trains, each berth is separated by curtains and has 4/6 bunk beds. Bedding (sheet, blanket and pillow) is provided but you may wish to bring your own sleeping bag liner for added comfort.

dayInfo.title: Free morning in Delhi, then explore the narrow lanes of Old Delhi on foot and by cycle rickshaw
dayInfo.description: : This morning has been left free to rest and freshen up before we go out and explore the temples and bazaars of Old Delhi. This afternoon we walk around the narrow, packed lanes of this fascinating part of the city, culminating with a jamboree of sounds at Chandni Chowk Bazaar. A short cycle rickshaw ride then takes us to the (outside of) Jama Masjid mosque, a sublime example of Mughal architecture built by emperor Shah Jahan and a bit of an oasis amid the city. Whilst in Old Delhi we will get to try some of the capital's street food treats straight from the stall sellers including aloo chaat (fried potato and spice mix) or paneer tikka (cottage cheese marinated in spices) along with freshly cooked breads such as parathas and rotis.

dayInfo.title: Tour ends in Delhi
dayInfo.description: : The trip ends after breakfast at our hotel in Delhi. There are no activities planned today, so you are free to depart from Delhi at any time. If your flight is departing later in the day, luggage storage facilities are available at our hotel. If you would like to receive a complimentary airport transfer today, you need to depart from New Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport (airport code DEL), which is around 45 minutes from the hotel.

tourName: India tiger safaris on a budget
generalInfo:
India is well known for various things, however what many people associate with this massive and fascinating country are the many glorious temples and fantastic architecture and also the iconic and endangered tiger. This tour focuses on showcasing the tiger in its natural habitat in a way that should fit any budget.

Introduction:
We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching all over the world and we have a great range of Indian wildlife watching safari holidays. These tours range from the dry desert regions of Gujarat in search of striped hyena and Asiatic lions to the icy peaks of the Himalayas on the quest for snow leopards. But we also focus heavily on some of the 40 plus Tiger Reserves in this wonderful and diverse country. But it is not just the wildlife of India that makes India such a great holiday destination, but the varied and unique culture is also a focus for our trips.

This tour is a specialist tiger safari of one of the best locations in the world for tigers. Bandhavgarh National Park has the highest density of wild tigers in the world. As well as the large population of tigers the park is also home to a great range of other species. Animals such as leopards, sloth bears, chital, wild boar, Indian peafowl, crested serpent eagles and dozens more are all regularly seen here alongside the iconic king of the Indian jungle, the majestic tiger.

Because this tour is only focused on Bandhavgarh National Park you can add on extensions to also visit many of the cultural highlights such as the Taj Mahal or Old Delhi. If you are interested in adding on more to this Indian Budget Tiger Safari please let us know.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner) where mentioned, in some locations lunch and dinner are not included (please refer to the itinerary), such as in Khajuraho. There will be bottled water (approx 1ltr) available for each guest each day. We have our own private air conditioned vehicles with an excellent driver for all transfers. Where possible we use two brilliant guides; first a professional zoologist (when available - a zoologist is not always available, please contact us for availability if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip) who will escort you on all your excursions and we also have very knowledgeable English speaking local naturalist guides who have decades of experience working and guiding through India and particularly Bandhavgarh. Your naturalist escort is an expert in tigers and their conservation and behaviour and will be able to help you identify the different species as well as interpret you what behaviours you are seeing. We will also employ a specific cultural guide for all sightseeing of temples and monuments.

The local guides have spent years searching out the best wildlife watching locations and have an unrivalled knowledge where we are going to visit. Where needed we further employ local guides at specific locations where their intimate knowledge of individual reserves and parks is invaluable in finding our targeted species. We also include all vehicle safaris, river safaris, spotlighting, guided walks, park entrance fees and sightseeing entrance fees. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the park. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide).

Seasons:

This tour is recommended for February - May as this is the dry season and the chances of seeing tigers is much higher in the dry season. However the temperatures from April onward can be very hot and humid. You can visit this park and enjoy the itinerary between October – June. The park is closed during the monsoon season.

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by an experienced naturalist as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• Our local Indian guides around Bandhavgarh have a good relationship with the park officials and because of this we get a heads up when animals are sighted and this can guide us in where to focus and thus increasing our chances of seeing our targeted species.
• Visit the park morning and afternoon in your own private jeep for your group only.
• All the above reasons give this, our wildlife and tiger safaris of India a great success rate of seeing the best wildlife around here. We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides throughout India so that we can try and find and observe animals such as the tigers, leopards, sloth bears, dhole and many more species. We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of India at other times of year and focusing on other species such as striped hyena and snow leopards, Indian one-horned rhinos, Western Ghats endemics, elephants, primates, Asiatic lions and many species throughout this incredible country. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Locations:

This tour is completely focused on one national park and tiger reserve, Bandhavgarh. It is located in Madhya Pradesh. We will fly in and out of Khajuraho, which is your entry and exit point for the trip.

Fitness Level:

The vast majority of wildlife watching is all done from a vehicle. So no physical fitness for hiking or anything like that is needed. This is a very easy trip to undertake.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking.

Minimum Age: 12 Years Old

dayInfo.description: Khajuraho / Bandhavgarh National Park - On arrival at the Khajuraho airport, you will be met by your guide and immediately depart for Bandhavgarh National Park (5-6 hours) in your private AC vehicle. When you arrive at your lodge in the border of Bandhavgarh you will check in and have the rest of the afternoon to rest before heading into the park tomorrow. (D)

Bandhavgarh National Park / Khajuraho - Today will be your last safari into Bandhavgarh this morning. Then after the morning safari you will leave the lodge and travel back to Khajuraho. Khajuraho is an ancient city and is well known for its magnificent temples, which were built between 950 and 1050 A.D. Khajuraho derives its name from the Khajur tree (the date palm tree), which can be found in abundance in the area. The divine sculptures in these temples are a tribute to Life itself, embodying everything that is sublime and spontaneous about it. The murals depict the life and times of the Chandelas, and celebrate the erotic state of being. They not only testify to the mastery of the craftsman, but also to the extraordinary breadth of vision of the Chandela Rajputs under whose reign, these temples were constructed. If we have time we will explore some of these temples after checking into our accommodation for your final night in central India. (B)
Home - This morning you will be collected at the hotel and taken to Khajuraho airport in time to catch your flight back to Delhi and therefore your onward flight home. (B)

Minimum Age: 12 Years Old

dayInfo.description: Delhi - On arrival at the Delhi international airport, you will be met by your local guide/driver. From the airport you will be taken to your hotel for the night. Delhi, was once the capital of kingdoms and empires and is now a sprawling metropolis with a fascinating blend of the past and the present. It is a perfect introduction to the composite culture of an ancient land. Depending on the time of arrival we will spend some time exploring the city. (no meals included).

Khajuraho - After breakfast at the hotel in Delhi you will travel to the airport and take a short flight (2.20 hrs) to Khajuraho. On arrival in Khajuraho, you will meet a new local guide/driver, who will transfer you to the accommodation. Khajuraho is well known for its magnificent temples, which were built between 950 and 1050 A.D. The city derives its name from the Khajur tree (the date palm tree), which can be found in abundance in the area; and has become famous due to the divine sculptures in these temples which are a tribute to Life itself, embodying everything that is sublime and spontaneous about it. The murals depict the life and times of the Chandelas, and celebrate the erotic state of being. They not only testify to the mastery of the craftsman, but also to the extraordinary breadth of vision of the Chandela Rajputs under whose reign, these temples were constructed. After lunch you will be taken to the Eastern & Western groups of Temples for a guided tour. A highlight here is Kandariya Mahadeo, which is the largest and most typical Khajuraho temple. Dedicated to Lord Shiva, it soars 31 m high and makes a brilliant picture. (breakfast is the only meal included).

Bandhavgarh National Park - After breakfast in the Khajuraho hotel you will be collected and transfered in a private air conditioned vehicle to Bandhavgarh National Park (5-6 hours). Bandhavgarh National Park is set among the Vindhya Hills in Madhya Pradesh (a central Indian state). It is 168sq miles and is a mixture of bamboo, grassland, and a complex of deciduous forests. The dominant forest type is sal. The whole area is renowned for its bird life and there are at least 150 species of birds in the park, along with a wealth of mammals such as tigers, sloth bear, langur monkeys, wild boar, mongoose, 3 kinds of deer – chital, sambar and Indian muntjac, to name a few. In fact Bandhavgarh National Park has the highest density of tigers in the world. Once we arrive at Bandhavgarh we will check into our accommodation and in the afternoon you will have your first afternoon jungle safari by 4×4 open jeep accompanied by resident naturalist and forest park guide. With these companions you should have no problem in finding all the animals that are out and about. After the sun sets we return to the lodge and have evening tea. Dinner will be eat our evening meal here and get some sleep before an early start tomorrow. (breakfast and dinner included)

Delhi - After your breakfast you will depart from the park and start your journey back to Delhi. The drive to either Khajuraho or Jabalpur airport is around (4-5 hours) in our private air conditioned vehicle in time to catch our flight to Delhi. Once we arrive back in Delhi we will be met by our guide in Delhi and transferred to the hotel and the rest of the day will be free. (Breakfast only included today).
Home - Today you will be collected from your hotel and transferred to Delhi international airport in time to catch your flight home.

tourName: India to Sri Lanka 26 day tour
generalInfo:
Begin an exciting adventure through India and Sri Lanka! Experience the vibrant cities, stunning landscapes, and cultural treasures of both countries.

Explore the bustling streets of New Delhi and Colombo, hike ancient rock fortresses in Sigiriya, camp under the stars in Jaisalmer's desert, and embark on thrilling safaris to encounter Sri Lanka's wildlife.

Each day promises unforgettable experiences and cultural immersion on this epic journey!


Inclusions:

- Bilingual, epic Adventure Leaders throughout the entire trip
- All transport within India and Sri Lanka
- Accommodation (including hostels, guesthouses, & 2 nights camping)
Meals: 12 breakfasts, 2 lunches, & 1 dinner

India Included Activities:

Sri Bangla Sahib Gurdwara Temple visit (Delhi)
Hindi Language Lesson (Delhi)
Old Delhi Tour (Delhi)
Ghat Boat Tour (Varanasi)
Sunset Ghat Boat Tour (Varanasi)
Taj Mahal Sunrise Visit (Agra)
Desert Camping – including camel trek, campfire (seasonal), overnight stay under the stars, and watching the sunrise. (Jaisalmer)
Blue City Orientation Walk (Jodhpur)
Mumbai City Walking Tour (Mumbai)
Transfer from hostel to Mumbai airport
Flight from Mumbai to Colombo


Sri Lanka Included Activities:

Transfer from Colombo airport to hostel
Evening walking tour of the old town of Colombo (Colombo)
Negombo to visit the fish market (Negombo)
Dambulla Cave Complex (Dambulla)
Sigiriya Rock Fortress hike (Sigiriya)
A glass Sri Lanka’s favourite alcohol, Arrack (Dambulla)
Hike along the scenic Manigala Trai (Knuckles)
Visit to Dalada Maligawa a.k.a. The Temple of the Tooth (Kandy)
Sunset visit to Kandy Lake (Kandy)
The Sputnik Centre (Kurunegala, Kandy)
White Water rafting (Kitulgala)
Train from Hatton to Ella (Ella)
Ella Rock hike at sunrise (Ella)
Visit Rawana Falls (Ella)
Hike to Mini-worlds end at sunrise (Ella)
Visit the Buduruvagala Ancient Temple (Ella to Udawalawe)
Jeep safari into Udawalawe National Park (Udawalawe)
Visit to Handunugoda Tea Estate (Handunugoda)
Surf lesson (Unawatuna)
NOTE: Sri Lanka’s surfing season is from December to April – we expect most surfing sessions to run as normal, but should the conditions not be deemed suitable, travellers will receive a full refund for this activity.
Tuk-tuk ride to Galle, for Galle Fort City (Galle)
Visit temple to meet a Buddhist priest and take part in a pooja (blessing ritual) (Unawatuna – Colombo)

dayInfo.description: New Delhi: You will meet the group and Adventure Leader at the hostel. Here you will have a pre-departure briefing at 12pm in which your Adventure Leader will tell you everything you need to know about the tour before taking part in your first Hindi lesson of the trip. Next, head out on a Old Delhi Tour with the group; visiting markets, street food vendors and Temples along the way. Next, visit Sri Bangla Sahib Gurdwara, one of Delhi’s iconic Sikh temples and take a tour of the temple. Finish the day with dinner and chilling out with your tour group.

Delhi: Day 2 - This morning you have the chance to join an Ultimate Frisbee Game in Lodhi Garden. There is also the opportunity to join an English Session where you can ask questions about the local life in India and their daily lives. Next, you will visit the wonderful Akshardham Temple with the group and Adventure Leader. In the afternoon, there is the opportunity to join a pottery workshop or visit the Humayun Tomb or Qutub Minar. Our team will be able to provide you with further information on either.

Varanasi: Day 3 - Arrive in Varanasi early in the morning and take a private transfer to your accommodation. Check into your hostel and freshen up. This afternoon, join a Ghat Boat Tour and watch the Ganga Aarti Ceremony, a devotional ritual made to the Goddess Ganga that uses fire. In the evening you will have the option to enjoy a group dinner at the Dolphin restaurant.

Agra: Day 4 - Wake up before the crack of dawn and enjoy a sunrise boat tour. You will be able to witness the religious significance of the Ganges River as the local community begins their morning prayers and washing in holy water. In the afternoon, there's the option to visit Blue Lassi and enjoy the old market walk. You can enjoy a show, watching Indian classical music and dance. In the evening you will board an overnight train to Agra.

Agra: Day 5 - Arrive in Agra and check in to your accommodation. This morning you will be able to take part in some optional activities - (Take a rickshaw to Agra Fort and Baby Taj, one of India’s listed UNESCO World Heritage sites or chill out with the group at a rooftop pool). In the evening as a suggested activity, you can enjoy dinner and drinks as a group at the Salt Cafe.

Jaipur: Day 6 - Wake up and experience a beautiful sunrise over the majestic Taj Mahal, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Here you will take some time to explore the site and get that insta-worthy snap!. After, you will take a private transfer to Jaipur and check into your accommodation followed by a bus journey to Nahagarth Fort, where you can enjoy beautiful views.

Jaipur: Day 7 - This morning, you have the option to take a Balloon Safari and see Jaipur from the skies at sunrise. Or, use this morning to sleep and enjoy breakfast at a local cafe. Suggested activities for today; head to Amber Fort where you'll admire the artistic architecture and enjoy the views of Maota Lake, watch a Bollywood movie at the famous Raj Mandir Theatre or enjoy a food court tour and soak up the nightlife of Jaipur.

Jaisalmer: Day 8 - In the morning make your way to Monkey Temple in Galtaji and get the opportunity to feed the wild monkeys. Today you are free to do what you want. However, you can take part in some optional activities - (Join in on a guided tour of Jaipur and explore the Pink City or take part in an dance class and practice your Bollywood dance moves). In the evening you will hop on an overnight train and make your way to Jaisalmer.

Jaisalmer: Day 9 - Arrive in Jaisalmer and make your way to your hostel where you can take some time to shower, rest and have something to eat. Late in the morning, you can take time to visit Jaisalmer Fort. You can also choose to visit Gadsisar Lake In and Viewpoint. In the afternoon you will make your way to the desert via jeep. Here you will begin your Camel Safari to your campsite for the evening. For dinner, you will all sit around a campfire, enjoy a vegetarian dinner and soak up the incredible views of the night sky.

Jodhpur: Day 10 - Wake up early for an incredible sunrise and make your way to a local desert village via a camel trek. Afterwards, you will head back to your hostel and take some time to relax and grab some lunch. Take a private transfer from Jaisalmer to Jodhpur and enjoy a walk at the Blue City with the group. End the day with a drink at Stepwell Cafe.

Jodhpur: Day 11 - This morning you can take part in a cooking class if you want to try your best at cooking 10 local dishes. Another optional activity includes hopping on a flying fox zipline over the Mehrangarh Fort! End the day with drinks on the hostel rooftop.

Mumbai: Day 12 - Wake up and catch a flight to Mumbai. Arrive at Mumbai airport in the afternoon and take a private transfer to your hostel. In the afternoon, explore some of Mumbai or rest, before enjoying a movie night watching a Bollywood movie, with the option to enjoy drinks on a rooftop.

Mumbai: Day 13 - It’s time to explore Mumbai! Take part in a Dharavi Slum Tour, or visit Dhobi Ghat Malaxmi, before taking part in the Mumbai orientation walk. Explore the Gateway of India and the Colaba District, a monument that marks India's chief ports. In the evening you will have the option to take part in a night out in Mumbai with your fellow dragons.

Colombo: Today marks the beginning of your Sri Lanka adventure! After catching a flight from Mumbai to Colombo, you'll rendezvous with your new Adventure Leader in the lobby of the Colombo hostel. Once you've dropped off your luggage, you'll gather for a pre-departure briefing to go over the itinerary. Following this, embark on an evening walking tour around the old town of Colombo, immersing yourself in the city's rich history and culture.

Negombo & Dambulla: Start your day bright and early with a journey to Negombo to explore the renowned fish market, fondly called 'Lellama' by locals. Located along the picturesque Negombo beach, this bustling market offers an authentic glimpse into the local fishing industry. Immerse yourself in the vibrant atmosphere as you interact with fishermen and witness the lively fish auction, where fresh catches are bought and sold. Next, you'll head to the Sputnik Centre for a half-day of volunteer activities, gaining a firsthand look at Sri Lanka’s incredible efforts to support and empower its youth. For over 20 years, Sputnik has provided language courses, community programs, and even table tennis lessons—all driven by dedicated volunteers. It’s a truly uplifting experience that will leave you feeling inspired and connected. After experiencing the hustle and bustle of the fish market and the exciting visit to the Sputnik Center, continue your journey to Dambulla. Here, you'll visit the awe-inspiring Dambulla Cave Temple complex, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Explore the series of caves that were transformed into temples nearly 2,000 years ago, adorned with intricate statues and vibrant murals depicting Buddhist deities and legends. After your exploration, retreat to your hostel in Dambulla for a relaxing evening.

Sigiriya: After enjoying a hearty breakfast, journey northeast to one of Sri Lanka’s most iconic UNESCO World Heritage sites – the ancient city of Sigiriya. Here, you'll embark on an unforgettable climb up the ancient rock fortress, which was once the capital built by King Kashyapa I during his reign from 477 to 495. Take in breathtaking views of the surrounding lowlands as you ascend to the ruins atop the rock. Following your exploration of Sigiriya, the afternoon offers the option to continue your cultural journey with an optional visit to the old city of Polonnaruwa. Another remarkable UNESCO World Heritage site, Polonnaruwa is a treasure trove of medieval ruins, including majestic monuments, statues, royal palaces, temples, and pagodas. Explore this ancient capital city by bicycle, soaking in its rich history and architectural wonders. After a fulfilling day of exploration, return to your guesthouse in Dambulla for a well-deserved evening of relaxation. Unwind with a glass of arrack, a traditional Sri Lankan spirit distilled from the sap of the coconut flower, and reflect on the day's adventures amidst the tranquil surroundings.

Knuckles Mountain Range: Following breakfast, we'll embark on a journey southward to the Knuckles Mountain Range, celebrated for its distinctive recumbent folds and peaks reminiscent of clenched fists. Our hike along the picturesque Manigala Trail will immerse us in the breathtaking beauty of this cloud forest, allowing us to witness its diverse flora and fauna. We'll pause along the way to enjoy a packed lunch amidst stunning panoramic vistas. As the late afternoon approaches, we'll bid adieu to the majestic mountains and make our way to Kandy, the hill capital and the second-largest city in Sri Lanka. Here, you'll have the opportunity to explore the vibrant blend of ancient and modern architecture that defines this city's character. Before concluding the day's adventures, we'll pay a visit to a local pub, where you can unwind and immerse yourself in the lively atmosphere of Kandy.

Kandy: After enjoying a hearty breakfast, our first stop of the day will be at one of Sri Lanka's most revered landmarks: The Temple of the Tooth. Once the royal palace of Sri Lankan kings, it now serves as a temple and houses the sacred tooth relic of Lord Buddha, making it a place of profound significance for Buddhists across the country. For the afternoon, you have the option to further explore the charming city of Kandy at your leisure or embark on a visit to the Royal Botanical Gardens of Peradeniya. Situated approximately 5.5 kilometers west of Kandy, these gardens offer a serene escape from the urban bustle, boasting a renowned collection of orchids among its botanical treasures. As the late afternoon approaches, we'll take a leisurely stroll to Kandy Lake, which serves as the centerpiece of the city's landscape. Here, amidst the tranquil waters and lush surroundings, you'll witness the enchanting beauty of golden hour casting its glow over the scenery. Afterward, feel free to unwind and explore Kandy at your own pace, soaking in the ambiance of this historic city. Finally, return to your hostel for a restful evening, reflecting on the day's memorable experiences.

Ella: After an early breakfast, head to Nanu Oya railway station and board the iconic train to Ella. This breathtaking journey winds through rolling tea plantations, misty forests, and charming hilltop villages—widely hailed as one of the world's most scenic train rides! Upon arrival, take a short stroll to your hostel, drop off your bags, and soak up Ella’s relaxed atmosphere. Later, lace up your hiking shoes for a scenic trek to Little Adam’s Peak. This gentle climb through lush tea fields rewards you with stunning panoramic views of Ella’s picturesque hill country—the perfect way to wrap up the day!

Ella: Kick off your day with a packed breakfast before embarking on an unforgettable hike along the 15th and 16th stages of the Pekoe Trail. Your adventure begins at the serene Makulella Buddhist Temple, perched above the Ambagaswatte Valley. Stage 15 takes you through eucalyptus forests, lush tea fields, and jungle paths, leading up to the summit of Ella Rock. Here, soak in breathtaking views of Ella Gap and Little Adam’s Peak before the trail winds back into town. Stage 16 continues the journey, guiding you through the enchanting Ella Forest Reserve, past the iconic Nine Arches Bridge, and along scenic village roads. Along the way, you’ll pass stunning tea estates like Newburgh and Demodara, finishing at the renowned Demodara Railway Loop. As evening falls, unwind and explore Ella at your own pace—whether it’s browsing quirky shops, relaxing in cosy pubs, or indulging in delicious local cuisine, this charming town has plenty to offer.

Ella: Start your day with a hands-on Sri Lankan cooking class, where you’ll master the art of blending spices and creating iconic local dishes. Get ready to chop, stir, and season your way to a mouthwatering feast—your taste buds will thank you! The afternoon is yours to explore Ella at your own pace. Whether you opt for a relaxing yoga session, an adrenaline rush on the Flying Ravana Zipline, or a leisurely stroll through this charming hill town, the choice is yours.

Udawalawe: After breakfast, journey to Udawalawe, a region renowned for its breathtaking wildlife. Along the way, stop at the ancient Buduruwagala Temple, a hidden gem nestled in a tranquil forest. Admire the seven striking rock-carved statues, including a towering standing Buddha flanked by bodhisattvas and deities, dating back to the 10th century. The serene atmosphere makes this spiritual site even more enchanting. Later, arrive at your campsite on the edge of Udawalawe National Park. As you settle in, keep an eye out for wild elephants, crocodiles, spotted deer, and a dazzling array of birdlife in this incredible natural sanctuary.

Handunugoda & Unawatuna: Immerse yourself in Sri Lanka's rich tea culture with a visit to the Handunugoda Tea Estate, renowned for its production of exquisite teas. After a hearty breakfast, we'll embark on a scenic 2-hour journey southwest to the tea estate, where you'll have the opportunity to delve into the fascinating tea-making process, from the lush fields to the final cup. Explore the historic tea factory and museum, gaining insights into the intricacies of tea production, before indulging in a freshly brewed cup of tea to savor the rich flavors. Afterward, we'll continue our journey along the stunning southern coastline, reaching the vibrant beach destination of Unawatuna in just 30 minutes. With its pristine shores and excellent surfing spots, Unawatuna offers the perfect setting to unwind and soak up the sun. Spend the evening exploring the bustling town, sampling local delicacies, or simply relaxing on the golden sands before retiring to your comfortable hostel for a well-deserved rest.

Unawatuna: Indulge in a day of sun, sand, and surfing as we immerse ourselves in the coastal delights of Sri Lanka! Spend the morning unwinding on the pristine beaches, soaking up the tropical sunshine and enjoying the tranquil sea breeze. As the day progresses, gear up for an exhilarating surfing lesson, where you'll ride the waves and experience the thrill of gliding across the ocean. Please note that Sri Lanka's prime surfing season typically runs from December to April, ensuring optimal conditions for catching the perfect wave. In the event of unsuitable weather conditions, rest assured that travelers will receive a full refund for the surfing activity. In the afternoon, unleash your creativity with a unique mask painting session, a traditional Sri Lankan craft with cultural significance. Dive into the vibrant colors and intricate designs as you craft your own mask, believed to possess healing and protective powers in Sri Lankan folklore. Embrace the artistic spirit and create a one-of-a-kind masterpiece to cherish as a memento of your Sri Lankan adventure.

Galle: Begin your day with a delightful tuk-tuk ride to Galle, the bustling southern hub of Sri Lanka, and home to the enchanting Galle Fort City, a UNESCO World Heritage site. This historic fort, erected in the 16th century by the Portuguese, stands as a remarkable testament to the fusion of architectural styles and South Asian traditions. Wander through the cobblestone streets of the fort, marveling at its well-preserved ramparts adorned with a lighthouse, clock tower, churches, houses, and various other structures. Many of these buildings have been transformed into chic restaurants, boutique shops, private villas, and guesthouses, offering a unique blend of modern amenities within the authentic ambiance of the fort. After exploring the city on foot and soaking in its rich history, ascend to the ramparts of the fort to witness the breathtaking sunset over the Indian Ocean. Experience the magical golden hour as the sun dips below the horizon, casting a warm glow over the ancient fortifications. Conclude your day by returning to Unawatuna, filled with memories of Galle's captivating charm and scenic beauty.

Colombo: As our India to Sri Lanka group tour package comes to a close, we embark on our journey back to Colombo, the vibrant capital city of Sri Lanka. Along the way, we will make a special stop at a temple, where you will have the unique opportunity to meet a Buddhist priest and participate in a pooja, a traditional blessing ritual. This spiritual experience offers a fitting conclusion to our unforgettable journey together. Upon our arrival in Colombo, it will be time to bid farewell to your fellow travellers and new friends, as you prepare to head home with cherished memories and experiences from our adventure across two incredible countries.

tourName: India tour, palaces and leopards
generalInfo:
Highlights : Palaces-Taj & Leopards

Visit National Capital New Delhi
Visit City of Lakes Udaipur
Visit Jawai for Bera leopards

An existing exploratory tour of desert realms and amazing edifices. Admire the ancient architectural masterpieces and discover the glory of India.

A wild safari in leopard country is the focus of this tour. Trail around every corner awaits you in this magical desert landscape the home of wild leopards. Join us for the memorable journey.

dayInfo.description: Arrive Delhi. Our representative will be waiting for you. He will take you to your hotel for check in. After trip discussion & fine dinner a sound sleep awaits. An exciting safari is waiting for you and an amazing Royal experience at Maharajah Lodge. Sleep Well!

Local sightseeing of Delhi: The Capital City can be breathtaking and it is in spite of the tremendous chaos. Hidden in between the modern metropolis is ancient jewels of architecture that astounds one and all. Red Fort, Humayun’s Tomb, Purana Qila, Qutub Minar and more. Choose your pick.

After Breakfast we take a direct flight to Udaipur. Assistance upon arrival later transfer to Hotel. Udaipur City in Rajasthan built by a legendary Maharajah Udai Singh extols his virtue as a valiant king and a magnificent architect of palaces and temples. After arrival we will visit Udaipur Palace and the Perfumed Garden or Saheliyon KI Badi. A stay at the heritage hotel resplendent in past glory is another

Udaipur offers romantic escapades like none. Mesmerizing Palaces and Forts, serene lakes, resplendent mansions or has and more. In this scenic locale amidst colourful people exploring the venues make an amazing holiday. Till time immemorial the visit will keep appearing in the memory lane. So gear up for the best in India.

Drive to Bera: The drive is one hundred forty km long but worth every penny. The unique, exotic hamlets and desert scapes are a treat to the travellers' eyes. Upon reaching beta we will explore the leopard country on open jeep. And we are sure to meet the big cats of the desert. The stay at Bear Safari Lodge is extremely comforting in a grand suite with exquisite decor and enchanting ambience. The enticing aroma of the cuisine does just that for your palate. We will stay overnight here. Wind and Dine and revel under starry night with inebriating cocktails and food.

Morning & Evening safaris. In the company of an acclaimed naturalist and leopard expert Shtrunjay Pratap the big cat experience is much enhanced. He managed to stop a mining debacle set to ravage this fragile ecosystem. His knowledge and expertise makes it worthy to be in his company. You will be able to see many leopards and learn all about them. This is an exploration journey worth its salt. So do not delay, book your tour now.
Drive to Udaipur to board flight to Delhi. Overnight stay at New Delhi.
Transfer to international airport

tourName: India tour, rural India
placesVisited: Fort Ahilya, Mandu palaces and temples, Pilgrimage town of Ujjain, Chandrabhaga, Bundi, Pangarh Lake, Artisan villages, Castle Bijaipur, Udaipur
generalInfo:
Few visitors experience the day-to-day riches of rural India, so step off the usual tourist trails for a vivid experience of how the vast majority of Indians live. On this Indian road less-travelled, tour rural communities in open-topped vintage jeeps and partake in local life, from farming to craftwork.

Take the experience described with the word Godhuli ('the homecoming'), when dusk settles in a thousand villages across the subcontinent and the night creeps in. Buffalo wander back from the fields, blue jays dart overhead, smoke rises from the cooking fires and the aromatic smell of spices flood the air. Women in brightly coloured saris carry water from the well and children play on the path. A magical time...

Ease into your journey with a stay at the magnificent Fort Ahilya in Maheshwar as a guest of the Maharaja, before moving onto the explore the vast ruined city at Mandu - a collection of forts, palaces and temples said to be the largest in Asia. You'll also visit the beautiful Fort Amla, the pilgrimage town of Ujjain and the ancient temples of Chandrabhaga.

Bundi, meanwhile, is a historic town famous for bangle making and brass ware, guarded by the impressive Gagron Fort. From here, you head to Pangarh Lake, taking in rustic villages and the Menal temple complex en route.

You'll also visit the artisanal village of Athana on the way to Castle Bijaipur, a glorious historic base for three nights offering activities such as walking, cycling, horse riding and yoga, plus visits to local villages where you may be lucky enough to see an opium ceremony.

The beautiful lake-side 'White City' of Udaipur provides a glorious finale to your trip as you ease back into the hustle of life exploring its maze of characterful historic lanes in the lee of the imposing Chittorgarh Fort.

dayInfo.description: Tour Starts in Udaipur: The tour starts this afternoon in the ‘white city’ of Udaipur. After checking in to our hotel we’ll head out for an orientation tour of the city, before our first group dinner and the chance to talk about the trip ahead.

In Udaipur: This morning we’ll head out on a guided tour of some of the key sites in Udaipur such as the City Palace, the Jagdish temple and the beautiful gardens at Saheliyon-ki-Bari. To allow for greater flexibility lunch will be at your own expense today, and this afternoon will be free to wander through the alleys and narrow streets, to take a cooking lesson or even a miniature painting class. We’ll meet later in the day to take a sunset boat ride on Lake Pichola, before heading out for dinner at a local restaurant favoured by our clients.

Udaipur - Chittorgarh - Castle Bijaipur: After breakfast we’ll drive to Chittorgarh to visit the colossal fort that most represents the doomed idea of Rajput chivalry. Chittorgarh was attacked and taken by Muslim invaders on three separate occasions and always with the same result; Jauhar being declared - and while the men donned the saffron robes of martyrdom and rode out to certain death - the women consigned themselves to the flames on a huge funeral pyre. From here we’ll continue to Castle Bijaipur. This wonderful castle – parts of which date back 360 years – is run by the ruling family, our friend Narendra Singh and his clan, and is the perfect place to relax. Once we’ve settled in we’ll take an orientation walk of the castle and surrounding village, before heading back in time for dinner.

At Castle Bijaipur: This morning we’ll visit some of the nearby villages to learn about the culture and activities of the community. After lunch and some time to relax at the hotel this afternoon, we will visit a local farm for drinks before returning to the castle in time for dinner. If you prefer you can instead enjoy the optional activities at Castle Bijaipur like cycling and horse riding today. Please note optional activities at Castle Bijaipur are at your own expense and can be paid for locally.

Castle Bijaipur - Athana - Pangarh Lake: After breakfast we’ll drive for an hour or so to Athana, a large village that has a great deal of old world charm. On arrival there will be time for a leisurely stroll through the village and the chance to visit the crafts workshops before moving on to visit the hand block printing village of Tarapur. The printers in Tarapur still use 100% natural dyes and prepare colours with techniques that are centuries old. The fabric is made locally from natural fibres like cotton, silk, jute, etc. From here we’ll drive to Pangarh Lake for the rest of the day. Set on the banks of a beautiful lotus lake and surrounded by hills on all sides, the village of Pangarh is 1,000 years old and to this day the villagers hunt fish using spears in the marshy waters of the lake, famous for its abundance of seasonal lotus flowers. After lunch we will take a walk to the nearby ruined fort, before heading back to spend the evening at our hotel by the lake.

Pangarh Lake - Bundi: After an early breakfast we’ll drive east towards Bundi. On the way we will stop at the old town of Bijoliya to see its small castle and temples, most of which is still inside the fortress walls that take you back to the 18th century. From here we’ll continue to the Menal temple complex of the Maurya Dynasty. Here we can see examples of Khajuraho erotic iconography dating back 1,000 years. After visiting the temples we’ll journey further east, crossing the biggest sandstone mining area in India, arriving at the beautiful town of Bundi. Carrying the same relaxed feeling of Udaipur – only with a fraction of the tourists – Bundi comprises many narrow alleys and streets, a colourful vegetable market and a stunning city palace for us to explore and visit.

In Bundi: After breakfast we’ll head out on a tour of the small city of Bundi, seemingly untouched by modernisation. Bundi is famous for its bangle makers and brass pottery but the real attraction is the stunning fort and palace, which we’ll enjoy a guided tour of. We will then visit the bazaar, the Kipling palace and the royal cenotaph. This evening we will take part in a cookery class which will also form our evening meal.

Bundi - Jhalawar: This morning we head south for Jhalawar, stopping on the way to visit the spectacular Gagron Fort. Surrounded by the Vindhyan Hills and the waters of the Ahu and Kalisindh rivers on three sides, this UNESCO World Heritage site makes for an impressive structure. On arrival in Jhalawar we’ll receive a royal welcome at the residence of the former Maharaja of Jhalawar in the families former hunting lodge. It’s a stunning place - more akin to a museum than a family home, and in the evening we’ll have dinner and take the chance to unwind and relax.

In Jhalawar: There is so much to see and do in Jhalawar. For a start, the palace – the present Maharaja’s grandfather’s former hunting lodge – is so amazing you could easily spend a day just relaxing in the quiet grounds! The city itself is worth having a look around with a fine palace and library. In addition we’ll visit the nearby pilgrimage town of Jhalrapatan, one of the purest towns that remain to be seen in India today. Although more than 800 years old the town is very well planned, most of it still lying within the city walls that were built to defend against local dacoits and looters. The town has some beautiful temples and a very nice market. Right outside the city walls are the famous temples of Chandrabhaga. From here we will return to Jhalawar for dinner.

Jhalawar - Ujjain: This morning we’ll drive south for around 5 hours to Ujjain, where we’ll visit the only temple in India dedicated to the alcohol drinking god of death, Kal Bhairay. From here we visit the Vedh Shala or Jantar Mantar observatory, built by Maharaja Jai Singh II in 1725, and consisting of 13 architectural astronomy instruments. The observatory is the oldest of the five observatories built by Maharaja Jai Singh II when he was governor of Ujjain.

Ujjain - Fort Ahilya: This morning we continue south to visit the impressive ruined Mughal era city at Mandu. After a guided tour of the site we’ll head for Maheshwar and Ahilya Fort, where you’ll experience a stay straight out of the 18th century. Situated above the banks of the sacred Narmada River, it was once the capital of one of India's celebrated women rulers, Ahilya Bai Holkar. Her fortress has been converted into a wonderful heritage hotel of discrete charm, where guests can appreciate surroundings which have not changed since Ahilya Bai. Her Wada palace is simple and elegant; built in 1766 it is a typical example of the Maratha architecture of that period. On arrival we will check in and enjoy our first group dinner at this stunning heritage property.

At Fort Ahilya: We now have 2 full days to relax at this gorgeous location. We can visit the local handloom manufacturers of the Maheshwari saris, and also visit different villages located on the riverbanks travelling by boat. But really these days in rural India will be for you to unwind and relax amongst this charming setting.
Fort Ahilya - Indore: Tour ends at Airport: We’ll enjoy a relaxing morning at this stunning property before having lunch. From here we’ll drive to Indore where our tour ends.

tourName: India tour with added comfort
generalInfo:
This spiritual journey takes us from India's capital Delhi, through the foothills of the Himalaya and the plains of Punjab, ending at the holy city of Amritsar. On our journey, we'll experience a ceremonial Aarti, enjoy yoga and meditation by the Ganges, visit the home of the Dalai Lama and explore India's greenest city - Chandigarh.

Rishikesh and Haridwar - Visit the Beatles Ashram and experience an Aarti ceremony besides the sacred River Ganges
Himalayan Hillstations - Explore colonial Shimla and discover the home of the Dalai Lama in Dharamsala
Golden Temple of Amritsar - Explore the holy shrine of Sikhism and visit the Partition Museum

dayInfo.title: Join trip in Delhi
dayInfo.description: : Today we arrive in Delhi, India's bustling capital. The city is the perfect blend of new and old, with monuments and temples hidden amongst its glittering skyscrapers. For those arriving in time today our tour leader will meet you in the hotel reception at 5pm for a welcome meeting followed by the option to go out for dinner. If you arrive later, our tour leader will catch you up as soon as possible. If you'd like an airport transfer, you'll need to arrive into New Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport (DEL), a one to one-and-a-half hour drive from our hotel. For those arriving early, there is the option to visit the Akshardham temple. Famous for being the largest Hindu temple complex in the World, Akshardham is an architectural marvel with its intricately carved sandstone and marble structure.

dayInfo.title: Full day exploring Old and New Delhi
dayInfo.description: : We'll set off to explore the two sides of Delhi this morning. Old Delhi is a maze of old, narrow streets, lined with bazaars and dotted with mosques and temples; while New Delhi feels a world away with its wide, leafy boulevards and grand colonial-era buildings. We'll start in the calmer area of New Delhi, driving along the avenues and taking in the major sights that begin to tell the story of India's rich history. We'll visit India Gate, the impressive column of Qutab Minar and the UNESCO-listed Mughal site of Humayun's Tomb - a precursor to the great Taj Mahal. After lunch, we'll take cycle rickshaws to explore the winding lanes of Chandni Chowk bazaar in Old Delhi, a sprawling market where you can buy almost anything from household wares to souvenirs. Here we'll sample some tasty street food from some of Old Delhi's most famous vendors, such as freshly-made vegetable samosas, pakoras and jalebi - a crispy sweet treat. We'll also view the incredible and imposing Red Fort and the beautiful Jami Masjid Mosque (from the outside).

dayInfo.title: Drive to Haridwar, walk through the market and witness the evening Aarti ceremony
dayInfo.description: : Leaving the capital behind today, we set off on a five hour drive to the state of Uttarakhand and the holy city of Haridwar. Set on the banks of the sacred River Ganges, Haridwar has long been a pilgrimage site for Hindus. Every 12 years the city hosts the Kumbh Mela Festival, a mass-pilgrimage where Hindus travel thousands of miles to take a ceremonial dip in the river, which is thought to be the biggest gathering of human beings in the planet. Aside from this festival it is still a popular destination for Hindus, hosting several important temples such as the Mansa Devi Temple and the Kankhal Temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva. Perhaps most iconic though, is the nightly Ganga Aarti ceremony that takes place on the riverside. Several Brahmin priests line the Ghats and perform a coordinated ritual involving fire-lit lamps, chanting and bell-ringing, making their offerings to Mother Ganga. We have some time to explore Haridwar's temples, markets and to soak up the atmosphere before heading down to the Ghats for sunset to witness this atmospheric ritual.

dayInfo.title: Optional morning safari in Rajaji National Park. Drive to Rishikesh.
dayInfo.description: : This morning, there is the option to take a three-hour safari in Rajaji National Park, home to wild elephant, deer, peacock, leopard and an array of birdlife. After a leisurely start to the morning, we leave Haridwar to continue our journey northwards, heading further up the Ganges on a short drive to Rishikesh Often dubbed the 'yoga capital of the world', Rishikesh plays host to numerous ashrams, retreats and wellness centres. Although it has long-been one of the leading spiritual centres of India, Rishikesh first entered the Western psyche in the 60's when John, Paul, George and Ringo came here to study transcendental meditation. The Beatles stayed at the Maharishi Mahesh Yogi Ashram for three months in 1968, cementing its place in pop culture. Rishikesh, in turn, exerted its own influence over the future music of the Beatles. On arrival, we have some free time to explore Rishikesh at our own pace before we make our way down to Triveni Ghat this evening to witness another spectacular Aarti ceremony. Our base for the next couple of nights is nestled on the banks of the River Ganges and a 10-minute walk from town.

dayInfo.title: Discover this spiritual riverside town of Rishikesh. Visit Beatles Ashram
dayInfo.description: : Famous for its yoga and wellness scene, Rishikesh is also a launchpad for outdoor adventure, set in the Himalayan foothills where two rivers meet. This morning we take a half-day orientation walk, exploring the town's temples, colourful markets and the ashram once made famous by the Beatles. The rest of the day is free to spend as you choose. You might head out on a guided walk through the surrounding forests, join a meditation or yoga session at a local ashram, or simply take time to relax and soak up Rishikesh's uplifting, feel-good atmosphere.

dayInfo.title: Drive to Chandigarh and discover the sights of India's Greenest City
dayInfo.description: : This morning we continue our journey through the foothills of the Indian Himalayas as we head to Chandigarh, a drive of approximately five hours. In stark contrast to the haphazard nature of most Indian cities, Chandigarh came to life in the 1950's as a so-called 'planned city'. Designed by the architect 'Le Corbusier'- Chandigarh is laid out in an orderly grid system with the city being divided into quarters, dissected by wide-leafy boulevards and interspersed with plenty of green parks and spaces. We spend time this afternoon exploring the city's grand buildings including its Capital Complex, including a visit to the Rock Garden - a unique sculpture created entirely from industrial and household waste.

dayInfo.title: Drive to Dharampur station and catch the Toy Train up to the British Hillstation of Shimla
dayInfo.description: : After a leisurely start to the day, we take a short drive to Dharampur Station. We will grab some lunch and snacks for the train before we swap modes of transport and begin winding our way along a narrow-gauge track aboard the remarkable 'Toy Train'. Climbing from the plains below, the train negotiates a meandering journey of 62 kilometres in a little over three hours, ascending over 1000 metres to the heights of the old British hill station of Shimla. Whilst traditionally the Toy Train was pulled by steam engines, today they are mostly pulled by diesel engines. The journey takes us through 103 tunnels and some of the most scenic landscapes in the region. Finally we reach Shimla itself, stretched out along a crescent shaped ridge, with alpine-style houses shaded beneath dense forests of fir. On arrival in Shimla, we meet our transport for the 30-minute drive up into the Shimla Hills to reach our accommodation. Our hotel for the next couple of nights is tucked away in the hills, overlooking Shimla and offering a peaceful base away from the bustle of Mall Road. For ease, dinner has been included for your two nights in Shimla.

dayInfo.title: Discover the colonial sites of Shimla on a walking tour, including the Post Office and Viceregal Lodge
dayInfo.description: : Today, we'll start our day by visiting the Viceregal Lodge, the former residence of the British viceroy and site of a number of important negotiations that preceded Indian independence. We'll then head into Shimla where we'll have a full day to explore the town, taking in some of its colonial ambience. The opening of the Kalka-Shimla railway at the turn of the 20th century allowed the well-to-do families of the Raj to escape the heat of Kolkata and Delhi and spend the hot summer months amongst the cooler landscapes of these verdant hills. We'll take in the ageing charm of the Christ Church and Scandal Point, where the mock Tudor architecture presents a surreal imitation of old England against the magnificent backdrop of the Himalayas. This orientation tour is done on foot, and it should take around an hour. The afternoon has been left free for further exploration of the town.

dayInfo.title: Full day's drive to Dharamsala
dayInfo.description: : A full day of driving today takes us from one hill station to another, to the town of Dharamsala. Our drive to the iconic hill town of Dharamsala, arriving in the late afternoon. Total journey time today will be around ten hours. Until 1959 this was a quiet and unassuming town, but that all changed when the Dalai Lama settled here after fleeing Tibet at the time of the Chinese invasion in October of that year. McLeodganj is the upper part of the town situated 500m above Lower Dharamsala and is the area with the greatest Tibetan influence. We will be based in Lower Dharamsala for our two nights.

dayInfo.title: Drive up to upper Dharamasala, explore the Dalai Lama Temple and the Norbulingka Institute
dayInfo.description: : We'll spend the morning exploring lower Dharamsala, starting with the Norbulingka Institute - named after the Dalai Lama's summer palace in Lhasa, Tibet. This institute was set up in 1988 to preserve Tibetan heritage and culture, providing education as well as showcasing Tibetan arts, crafts and also hosting a series of festivals over the years From here, we'll drive around 40 minutes up to Upper Dharamshala in taxis to explore McLeodganj on foot.
