We'll have an orientation walk which includes the Buddhist Namgyal Monastery, known locally as Little Lhasa.If the Dalai Lama is giving one of his occasional public audiences, we might be lucky enough to be granted permission to attend. There will be some time this afternoon to explore McLeodganj's markets to take in the atmosphere or do some souvenir shopping. We'll return to the hotel, visiting the Church of St John in the Wilderness en route.

dayInfo.title: Drive from foothills onto the plains of Punjab, to the holy city of Amritsar
dayInfo.description: : Departing Dharamsala this morning, we drive down from the cooler climes of the hill station to the plains of Punjab and on to Amritsar. This drive should take about five hours. The road between Dharamsala and Amritsar is currently under construction, with a brand new highway being built to connect the two location. Until the roadworks are complete, this section of the journey will be bumpy. The holy city of the Sikhs, Amritsar was founded in 1577 and is home to the spectacular Golden Temple. The city has played a key part in the subcontinent's history and, despite extremist unrest and destructive invaders, it remains the spiritual centre of the Sikh religion. After lunch, we'll visit the Partition Museum, housed in the imposing 19th-century Town Hall along Amritsar's Heritage Mile. This remarkable institution is devoted entirely to telling the story of the 1947 Partition of India, with moving personal accounts and evocative displays. We'll also explore the Hindu Durgiana Temple, with its golden façade reflected in a tranquil pool, We will then visit Jalianwala Bagh, the site of a bloody massacre and a dark day in British history. On the 13th of April 1919 a large crowd gathered in Jalianwala Bagh to protest against the arrest of some pro-independence activists. The crowds were surrounded by the British Indian Army, the exits were blocked and General Dyer gave the order to fire into the crowd. Although condemned by the British government and the then-Secretary of State for War, Winston Churchill, the Jailanwala Bagh massacre resulted in irreversible damage to the Anglo-India relationship and is thought to be one of the keys events that put India on course for independence from the British Before the end of the day, we'll head over to the Golden Temple in the evening to experience its shimmering beauty under the lights. Tomorrow, we'll return for a more in-depth visit to this most revered of Sikh sites.

dayInfo.title: Morning heritage walking tour of Amritsar including the Golden temple and Durgiana Temple
dayInfo.description: : Today we'll explore the Hindu Durgiana Temple, with its golden façade reflected in a tranquil pool before heading back to the centrepiece of the city, the incredible Golden Temple. The temple is a fusion of Hindu and Islamic influences and home to the revered texts of the Sikh Holy Scriptures, the Guru Granth Sahib, and its gilded dome is covered in over 700kg of pure gold. The temple was the scene of a massacre of hundreds of Sikh protesters in 1984 when the Indian army, acting on the orders of the then Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, evicted extremists from the temple - an act that led to the assassination of Indira Ghandi by Sikh bodyguards later that same year. Upon entering, we'll need to remove our shoes, cover our heads and wash our feet. The temple itself is a surprisingly small building surrounded almost entirely by tanks of holy water in which the Sikh pilgrims bathe (the name of the town itself comes from the Amrit Sarovar - the Pool of Nectar). The atmosphere is one of incredible calm, with devotees taking their turn to pass through the main shrine, where there is a continuous and melodic recital (known as the Akhand Path) from the Guru Granth Sahib. The rest of the afternoon has been left free for further explanation, or for some shopping in the city's excellent local \expndtw-2 markets

dayInfo.title: Trip ends in Amritsar
dayInfo.description: : The trip ends today after breakfast. There are no activities planned today, so you're free to depart at any time. If your flight leaves later in the day, luggage storage facilities are available at our hotel. If you'd like a hotel transfer, you'll need to depart from Sri Guru Ram Dass Jee International Airport (ATQ)

tourName: India village holiday, forest and fables
generalInfo: The central states of Chhattisgarh and Madhya Pradesh form the beautiful heart of India. Landscapes of undulating, forested hills, venerated winding rivers and magnificent temples delight the eye. It is a land that tribal communities have husbanded for generations with their deep knowledge of the natural world. This too has always been the realm of the king of the jungle, the Bengal tiger. It is no wonder that this land inspired Rudyard Kipling to write the much loved ‘Jungle Book’. With Forests & Fables you stay as a guest of tribal villages with the Gond and Baiga people. Enjoy access and unique insight into three of their beautiful villages.  Admire their painting art and jewellery craft. Learn of their deep knowledge of trees and plants, of their myths and legends, song and dance. Visit one of the great tiger reserves and hope to meet the king. This wonderful journey of exploration through Madhya Pradesh and Chhattisgarh, takes you from the Hill Tribe Village of Lamna to the serene village of Umargohan, passing through Amarkantak, a spiritual site with ancient temples,  connecting both the central Indian states. Your final nights are in another Tribe Village of Lagma – Mukki, with the Kanha National Park/Tiger Sanctuary close by. Privileged Interactions with Forest Dweller community members of Gond, Baiga, Korku and Pandu Tribes , passing through Jungle, river valleys, temples, wildlife – all in one discovery journey through the heart of India.

dayInfo.description: Arrival In Delhi & night train Arrival Delhi. Transfer to Guest house. An evening transfer takes you to Hazrat Nizamuddin station to catch the overnight train to Pendra Road (A small town in Chhattisgarh). Or Choose to Enjoy another day in Delhi, there is so much to do and see: Humayan’s Tomb, the Lotus Temple or Akshardham, explore the Red Fort or shop in Dilli Haat.

Arrival in Chhattisgarh and Lamna Hill Tribe Village. A short transfer on arrival takes you to Village Lamna after a quick and delicious breakfast in a local tea and snack restaurant in Pendra town.. A Scenic drive A scenic drive through forested hills takes you to Lamna, a village where your adventure truly begins. Over three days, connect with the locals and explore their way of life—learn traditional farming, pottery, and the secrets of medicinal plants. Trek through the forest, cycle to nearby villages, visit the local temples, enjoy the storytelling around the fire. Every moment here is a step deeper into the vibrant pulse of village life.

Village life in Umargohan and a spiritual Journey From Lamna, a drive to enter the state of Madhya Pradesh, with a stop at the sacred town of Amarkantak, the source of the revered River ‘Narmada’. Arrive in Umargohan, where the Baiga and Gond tribes warmly welcome you. Over two days, hike through enchanting forests, uncover hidden natural wonders, and marvel at the intricate craftsmanship of tribal jewellery and art. Share in the joy of local dance and song under the starry skies, feeling the spirit of the land, come alive.

By road to Lagma - Mukki Village Travel deeper into the wild to Lagma Mukki, a village nestled on the edge of Kanha National Park. Experience the thrill of exploring village life with a bullock cart ride, learn ancient crafts from skilled artisans. The following morning, rise with the sun for an exhilarating safari in Kanha, one of India’s premier wildlife sanctuaries. As you venture into the jungle, keep your eyes peeled for the elusive Bengal tiger and other majestic creatures roaming freely in this untouched paradise.
Your return journey to Delhi via Jabalpur After a hearty breakfast, head to Jabalpur to catch the overnight train back to Delhi.
Arrival Delhi Day room before a night flight home or an extra night in the guesthouse.

tourName: India wildlife and culture tour, Rajasthan
placesVisited: Delhi, Agra, Taj Mahal, Fatehpur Sikri, Bharatpur, Keoladao National Park, Jodhpur, Kumbhalgarh Wildlife Sanctuary, Aravali mountain range, Ellora, Mumbai
generalInfo:
Spend 18 days discovering the wildlife and culture of India on this remarkable tailor made tour that takes travellers into the sanctuaries and national parks of Rajasthan where jungles and mountains form an indelible backdrop for a Jeep safari.

From the importance that animals play within India’s cultural heritage to the thrill of tracking footprints in the jungle, this wildlife and culture tour of Rajasthan will leave travellers in no uncertain terms as to the relevance of the natural world and the part it plays in everything India holds dear.

With numerous national parks and hundreds of wildlife sanctuaries, this 18 day tailor made tour really lifts the lid on the wild side of Rajasthan with overnight campsites in the jungle and visits to ancient temples, such as Jain Temple, providing a unique glimpse at India’s natural and cultural heritage.

With a huge range of influences, including Hindi, Islamic and European, a tour of Rajasthan leads you from Delhi to Mumbai via Kumbhalgarh wildlife sanctuary for a series of classic and lesser-known sites to help you thread together the region’s natural and cultural history on a tour to truly savour.

dayInfo.description: Day 1 Arrive early morning at Delhi airport. On arrival you will be met by our tour manager, who will accompany you on this tour you will stay in boutique hotel. Breakfast and lunch at the hotel. Rest and relax at your hotel in the late afternoon. If you would like to go out in the evening for dinner or a short tour that would be fine. If you prefer to stay at hotel to relax as well as have dinner there that is also fine. DAY 2 Breakfast followed by a tour of Humuyuns Tomb and the Qutab Minar complex. Besides the famous tower the complex also has the finest metallurgy pillar made in the ancient world, created by the Guptas. After the Qutab Minar lunch followed by a tour of the Delhi Red Fort and Jama Masjid followed by exploring the old Delhi bazaar. In the evening dinner at Kareems, the 5th generation Mughal restaurant, followed by returning to hotel for night stay. DAY 3 Early morning transfer to the New Delhi railway station to board your Executive Class 1st AC train to Agra that departs at 6 am where breakfast will be served on board. Arrive in Agra just after 8 am proceed to your stay in hotel situated near west gate of Tajmahal,. Arrive at the hotel for relaxing and lunch until the early afternoon where you will depart on your tour of the Agra Red Fort. The Agra Red Fort has wonderful architecture. Return to hotel in the evening for dinner and night stay. DAY 4 Early light Breakfast followed by sunrise at the Taj Mahal for a 2-3 hour tour of the Taj Mahal and the surrounding buildings, museum and gardens. you will appreciate the incredible and detail petra dura (inlay work) craftsmanship is every ware on Tajmahal. In the early afternoon lunch in the Taj Mahal area followed by a tour of the Itmad-ud-Daula (the first marble tomb to be made in India as well as being the resting place of Noor Jehan’s father). Return to The hotel for dinner and night stay.

Day 5 Breakfast following leaving by road to Bharatpur (1 hour) via Fatehpur Sikri. Fatehpur Sikri is the magnificent 16th Century Mughal capital city (40 minutes from Bharatpur). There is both the royal palace complex as well as the mosque complex that also has the wonderful Buland Darwaza which is the main gate into the city as well as the tallest gate in the world. The mausoleum of Salim Chisti which has some of the finest carved latticed marble screens in India is inside the main square. Proceed to Bharatpur in the late afternoon. Your accommodation here is a small lodge dedicated to wildlife and birding at the edge of the Keoladao National Park. The Keoladao National Park is also a World Heritage site. The National Park has forest, a bit of savannah and much wetlands where over 400 different resident and migratory birds are present. It is a special place and for a few years it was of concern as many species were not present as they were for many years until 2013 when many returned bringing this wetland jungle back to its former glory. Besides the many birds other commonly seen species include Chital (spotted deer), wild boar, and jungle cats. The fishing cat is now rarely seen outside of Eastern India where it is now present only in a few places. Keoladao National Park has a small population which is the only known fishing cat population in western India. Arrive at your accommodation for relaxing, dinner and night stay. Day 6 6 am breakfast followed by leaving by bicycle rickshaw into the Keoladao National Park for a 3 hour wildlife safari with your guide as well as with a local naturalist. This wildlife safari will be partly by bicycle rickshaw, walking and row boats. Return to lodge for lunch and relaxing before your mid afternoon return to the jungle for a further 2 hour wildlife safari. Return to lodge for dinner and night stay. Day 7 Early morning Breakfast followed by leaving by road to Ranthanbore (3 hours). Ranthanbore National Park is a beautiful jungle where the last remaining indigenous population of tiger still exists in Rajasthan. Your stay in erstwhile hunting lodge (converted into the hotel) of the Royal family of Jaipur. The hunting lodge sets on a rocky outcrop surrounded by indigenous forest that borders the National Park with many species of animals including herds of Spotted Dear (Chital), and the occasional leopard that roam here. After arrival lunch followed by your first tiger wildlife safari in the mid afternoon to late afternoon by jeep in the jungle (2 hours). Return to hotel in the late evening for dinner and night stay. Day 8 Early morning breakfast followed by your second tiger wildlife safari in the jungle (2 to 2 and half hours). Return for brunch at hotel followed by leaving by road to 16 century Fort palace. Lunch at Fort Palace (3 and half hour drives). The Fort Palace is in a village setting and is the only royal palace in India where guests can stay inside the authentic 16th Century Princess Room. This is unchanged from this period except for the addition of electricity and the bathroom. The Princess room is large and lovely. The architecture of the Fort is also very fine. Arrive in evening for relaxing, exploring the fort palace followed by dinner and night stay in the Princess room.

DAY 9 Your Another one night stay in Fort (3 hours drive) it was constructed in early 1611 A.D. for Maharajah Gopal Das Ji, who was granted ‘Jagirs’ (fiefdoms) of Area of nearby villages of the Fort ,his great achievement in war against the Mughals, in honour of his service to the Maharaja of Jodhpur. DAY 10 Breakfast followed by road to Jodhpur (1 and half hour drive). After arrive at Jodhpur, the tour of the15th-18th centaury Jodhpur Mehrangarh (Mejestic) Fort was laid by Rao Jodha, the Fort is named after Brahmin (particular cast) Mehran. The fort had more accommodation for women than for men as two thirds of the palace is taken up by the zenana (for ladies). Walls of Mehrangarh are 125 ft high and made of red sand stone. In the early afternoon lunch in the finest restaurant of this region followed by trying some of the famous Jodhpur desserts. Before return to Manor home in the evening for a display of the finest South Asian art mediums produced by the last remaining erstwhile royal appointed master artisans will be shown to you with explanations on history and processes. Drinks followed by a traditional dinner and a concert of erstwhile Jodhpur royal appointed musicians at Manor home. Day 11 Breakfast followed by leaving by road to the Jagnath Wildlife Safari (Sanctuary 2 and a half hours) Arrival at the Jagnath Wildlife Sanctuary in the early afternoon. The Jagnath Wildlife Sanctuary is India’s only family owned and operated wildlife sanctuary. It is the last semi-arid eco system left in India intact and an abundance of rare and endangered species are present. We offer two wildlife safaris per day; the first would be at night an hour after dark by jeep. This is for 3 hours for you to view the nocturnal species of the sanctuary. These include the endangered Asian Steppe Wildcat (the sanctuary has the highest number of this rare cat of any protected area), Jungle Cat, Leopard, The Great Eurasian Eagle Owl, Desert Hare, the endangered Desert Fox, Indian Porcupine, and at risk Striped Hyena. Following your night safari drinks and dinner by a sustainable campfire at our permanent campsite. You will stay in a private cottage with attached bath. The sanctuary has no villages inside and the atmosphere quite relaxing and beautiful with savannah grasslands, foothills and Granite Mountains covered in deciduous forests surrounding the permanent safari campsite. Dinner after your night safari followed by night stay in your private bungalow in the safari campsite. DAY 12 Early morning breakfast followed by your second safari is in the morning by foot for three hours in the savannah and foothills to view herds of Gazelle, Blue-Bull Antelope (Asia’s largest Antelope), Zird (similar to a Gerbil but more timid), troops of Hanuman Langoor and up to 200 different bird species including the Tawny Eagle, Imperial Eagle, Eurasian Vulture, and the critically endangered Long-Billed Vulture. Return to the campsite. After early lunch visit the Shepherds village to experience local countryside life, return to campsite for your second night safari by jeep. Drinks followed by the dinner and night stay in your privet bungalow.

Day 13 Breakfast followed by departing by road (3 hours) to Sena Leopard conservation zone situated at the border of Kumbhalgarh wildlife Sanctuary. This area is near the village of Sena and the highest chance to see great sightings of Leopard in the wild in India is here. Almost every wildlife safari in the evening Leopard is present. Arrival for lunch at your privet cottage (With en suite bath) for guests in the village area. A late afternoon wildlife safari by jeep to first a small wetland area in the foothills of Aravali mountain range, where local and migratory birds are present along with muggermuch (mugger crocodile) followed by 2 hours Leopard safari where you will see Leopard up close, other species that are possible to see include Rufous-tailed Hare and jackal. Late evening barbeque dinner followed by night stay. Day 14 Breakfast followed by an early morning safari to an area that has many muggermuch crocodile and birding possibilities. Lunch at our campsite followed by a relaxing early afternoon before your second evening wildlife safari for Leopard. Late evening dinner and night stay. Day 15 Breakfast followed by leaving by road to Udaipur (via Ranikpur) 4 and half hours. Arrive at Ranikpur for lunch followed by exploring the 15th Century Jain Temple complexes for a couple of hours after lunch. There are also a few older temples that are Hindu that are worthwhile to see as well. Those who have interests in culture, history, architecture and wildlife this would be the perfect place for them to experience. We are close friends with Princess who would be your hostess at her family’s 16th Century Fort. She opened part of the palace for guests to stay in six years ago. It is also the gateway to one of the least well known but very special jungles of India, the Sita Mata. Arrive at Fort in the early evening for relaxing and exploring the palace. If you wish the palace has fine Marwari Horses nearby at their stables and 60 acres for riding. Princess has also just put in a lovely swimming pool if you like to swim. Dinner at the Fort. Day 16 Breakfast followed by transfer to Udaipur airport for domestic flight to Aurangabad for Ajanta and Ellora. After arrival check in your Boutique hotel. Rest and relaxing in hotel. Dinner and night stay in hotel.

DAY 17 Morning breakfast followed the tour of Ellora. The cave temples and monasteries at Ellora, excavated out of the vertical face of an escarpment, are 26 km north of Aurangabad. Extending in a linear arrangement, the 34 caves contain Buddhist Chaityas or halls of worship, and Viharas, or monasteries, Hindu and Jain temples. Spanning a period of about 600 years between the 5th and 11th century AD, the earliest excavation here is of the Dhumar Lena (Cave 29).The most imposing excavation is, without doubt, that of the magnificent Kailasa Temple (Cave 16) which is the largest monolithic structure in the world. Interestingly, Ellora, unlike the site of Ajanta, was never 'rediscovered'. Known as Verul in ancient times, it has continuously attracted pilgrims through the centuries to the present. Dinner at local restaurants and catch the train at 21:35 pm for Mumbai arrived at 5:40 am and transfer to hotel in colaba area. DAY 18 after breakfast the day is at your leisure, you can explore the streets of Colaba and magnificent view of Gate way of India from Tajmahal Palace hotel. We will arrange your airport departure according to your return flight schedule.

tourName: India wildlife tour, Ranthambore and Chambal River
generalInfo:
India is a wealth of wonderful wildlife, historical and cultural attractions. There is an never ending variety of historical sites to visit and wilderness areas to observe animals and this tour provides you with a great overview of Indian culture and wildlife.

Introduction:
This tour is perfect for people visiting India for the first time or seasoned travellers to the Subcontinent. This tour will showcase two of the best reasons to travel to India as well as visiting probably the last refuge for two of the worlds most unusual and endangered species. Combining sightseeing of historical sites in Old Delhi, and marvelling at the magnificent Taj Mahal, with tiger safaris in the stunning and culturally important Ranthambore National Park and river safaris looking for gharial and Gangetic river dolphins; this is the perfect overall wildlife holiday of India.

Ranthambore is probably the most iconic of all Indian tiger reserves and we visit here to look for tigers. The most iconic and famous wildlife resident of India is the tiger and many of the tigers that live in Ranthambore are very well known. They are regularly filmed for various documentaries and most of known by name. It is a great way to further understand the tiger and it's role in modern India.

Along with the tigers we will see in Ranthambore and the cultural excursions taken to Old Delhi and Agra which will include sites such as Taj Mahal, Red Fort and Agra Fort; this tour also visits the Chambal River Sanctuary. This is one of the most important sanctuaries in the world for 2 of the world's most endangered large animals, the large fish-eating crocodilian, gharial, and the Gangetic river dolphin. These two species are commonly seen here and coupled with the tiger provide chances to see some of the world's most endangered and wonderful species.

We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching all over the world and we have a great range of Indian wildlife watching safari holidays. These tours range from the dry desert regions of Gujarat in search of striped hyena and Asiatic lions to the icy peaks of the Himalayas on the quest for snow leopards. But we also have a range of specific birding and bird watching tours, this being one of them.

This tour is a specialist wildlife and cultural tour of north-west India. There are many species of mammals, birds and reptiles that can be found in Ranthambore and Chambal. The different ecosystems of sal forest, bamboo groves and meadows coupled with the river and wetlands of the Chambal Sanctuary are home to a great diversity of life of all kinds. But of course no trip to India is complete without visiting religious and culturally important iconic sites such as the Taj Mahal.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner) where mentioned, in some locations lunch and dinner are not included (please refer to the itinerary), such as in cities and towns. There will be bottled water (approx 1ltr) available for each guest each day. We have our own private air conditioned vehicles with an excellent driver for all transfers. Where possible we use two brilliant guides; first a professional zoologist (when available - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) who will escort you on all your excursions and we also have very knowledgeable English speaking local naturalist guides who have decades of experience working and guiding through India and particularly tiger safaris. Your naturalist escort is an expert in ornithology and their conservation and behaviour and will be able to help you identify the different species as well as interpret you what behaviours you are seeing. We will also employ a specific cultural guide for all sightseeing of temples and monuments.

The local guides have spent years searching out the best wildlife watching locations and have an unrivalled knowledge where we are going to visit. Where needed we further employ local guides at specific locations where their intimate knowledge of individual reserves and parks is invaluable in finding our targeted species. We also include all vehicle safaris, river safaris, spotlighting, guided walks, park entrance fees and sightseeing entrance fees. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the park. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us).

Seasons:

This tour is recommended for February - May as this is the dry season and the chances of seeing tigers is much higher in the dry season. However the temperatures from April onward can be very hot and humid. You can visit this park and enjoy the itinerary between October – June. The park is closed during the monsoon season.

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by an experienced naturalist as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• Our local Indian guides have a good relationship with the park and reserve officials and because of this we get a heads up when animals are sighted and this can guide us in where to focus and thus increasing our chances of seeing our targeted species.
• Visit the parks and reserves morning and afternoon in your own private vehicle for your group only.
• All the above reasons give this, our wildlife and bird watching holidays of India a great success rate of seeing the best wildlife around here. We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides throughout India so that we can try and find and observe birds. We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of India at other times of year and focusing on other species such many mammals like tigers, snow leopards, elephants, rhinos and many species throughout this incredible country. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Locations:

This tour is focused on two wildlife watching locations in the northern part of India, the great national park of Ranthambore as well as the Chambal River Sanctuary and then the iconic cities of Delhi and Agra.

Fitness Level:

The vast majority of wildlife watching is all done from a vehicle. So no physical fitness for hiking or anything like that is needed. This is a very easy trip to undertake.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking.

Minimum Age: 18 Years Old

dayInfo.description: Delhi - Arrival On arrival at the airport you will meet your local guide and be transferred to your hotel. If your flight arrives in the morning you can enjoy sightseeing of Old Delhi. This part of town boasts some of the best preserved monuments dating back to the powerful Mughal empire such as Red Fort, Humayun Tomb and the Qutub Minar and all of this before your first evening meal in India on a roof top restaurant amid the flying foxes leaving to forage in the night sky. (no meals included today).

Ranthambore National Park - Travelling After breakfast this morning you will be transferred south to Ranthambore National Park (5- hours). You will arrive at your lodge for the next 3 nights and the rest of the is at your leisure. (breakfast and dinner included today).

Agra - Travelling & Sightseeing This morning after a later breakfast than the last couple of days you will be transferred to the wonderful city of Agra (~4 hours) in your private vehicle. Once here you will be taken to your hotel. Then in the afternoon you will have a guided tour of one of the wonders of the world, the majestic Taj Mahal. This marvel of human engineering took 20,000 men 22 years to complete for the emperor Shah Jahan as a tomb for his beloved wife. But it is not just the beautiful architecture and manicured gardens that hold the attention in the Taj Mahal grounds, there are numerous bird species to be found here too. From Egyptian vultures and black kites that nest on the high turrets and minarets of the buildings to many babblers, warblers, grey hornbills and the very approachable common tailorbird that can be found in the gardens. After spending a couple of hours here you will come back to the hotel. (breakfast only included today).

Chambal River Sanctuary - Travelling & Wildlife Watching This morning you will be transferred in your private vehicle to the wonderful Chambal River Sanctuary (~2 hours). Before exploring this river sanctuary you will be taken to the lodge. This is a huge sanctuary which protects one of the largest and most biologically valuable rivers in India, covering a 400km stretch of the river and protecting around 1.6 km on either side of the river the sanctuary is 1235km sq. The sanctuary was initially set up for the gharial, these huge fish-eating crocodile can grow to 7m long and is the most critically endangered species in the Indian subcontinent. There may be as few as 250 breeding individuals in the world and the vast majority live along the Chambal river. But as well as providing protection for this magnificent and ancient animal the sanctuary now has over 330 bird species recorded as well as other mammals, reptiles and amphibians that now rely on this protected stretch of water. After settling into the accommodation and lunch you will be taken on a river safari here to welcome you to the birdlife. You should encounter small pratincoles, numerous duck species, black-winged stilts, common & spotted redshanks, ospreys, bar-headed geese and up to 100 other water birds. You may also see both gharial and the other crocodile species here the mugger crocodile as well as up to 8 species of freshwater turtles (all of which are endangered), the unsual and endangered Gangetic river dolphin and possible a family of foraging or playing smooth-coated otters. When you arrive back to the lodge you are free to stroll the gardens as the sunsets and listen to the many Indian flying foxes that roost and feed in the trees around the lodge, before your evening meal. (all meals included today).

Chambal River Sanctuary Over the next two days you will further explore the various ecosystems of the Chambal River sanctuary, there are a variety of activities that can be provided by the lodge and exactly what you want to do and the order of the activities will vary. But we recommend the following itinerary for your stay at this eco-lodge; after breakfast on the first full day here we suggest taking a jeep safari to the plains that surround areas of the Chambal river, you will travel to some isolated ravines in the Chambal sanctuary to try and find one of the most beautiful animals in India, the stunning blackbuck antelope. There is a small population here protected in the sanctuary, whilst the blackbuck was once widespread throughout the Gangetic plains, hunting and habitat destruction all but wiped the antelope out. This used to be the favoured prey of the Indian cheetah and there are ongoing talks about reintroducing the cheetah to the Gangetic plains and that would be a wonderful sight. Whilst spending the afternoon here you are likely to see some species of birds that have spend their time on the open grasslands that the blackbuck favour such as coursers, harriers and possibly falcons. Then after coming back to the lodge and having lunch you would be taken the short distance to the ancient Bateshwar Temple complex. These Hindu temples are built on the banks of the Yamuna river and consist of over 100 temples dedicated to Lord Shiva. The ravines surrounding the temples and river are home to a number of Naga sadhus (snake worshiping ascetics) who have carved out little caves and temples within the mud walls. These temples are a very nice way to see how the Hindu people around here still use these ancient temples in ways that have not changes for hundreds, possibly thousands of years. The next day we suggest participating in a camel ride safari through some of the ravines that fork off from the Chambal River, here you are likely to see a different range of birdlife including plain martins, wire-tailed swallows, jungle babblers, steppe eagles, sand lark, wood sandpipers and large grey babblers. Travelling on camel back is a wonderful experience and a great way of exploring the ravines and river bank whilst on the way to another ancient building. This is Ater fort and it is a magnificent site perched on the cliff side. It is also home to many species of raptors and other bird species; once a valued stronghold and at the forefront of numerous battles between the Rajputs, the Mughals and the Marathas, the crumbling ruins bring alive the romantic glory of a bygone age but it is the breathtaking views out over the Chambal valley that are truly spectacular. From here a scan of the skies can produce many more species and hopefully some of the critically endangered vultures. Then after lunch you will have a guided walk along a new section of the Chambal river bank. By walking the riverbanks with the local guide from the lodge you will be in good hands when it comes to spotting some of the harder to see mammals birds and reptiles such as golden jackals, black-naped hares, Burmese spot-bellied duck, Temmincks stint, Pallas gull, Indian skimmer and some of the 9 species of freshwater turtles here. Whilst spending time around the lodge you are free to explore the vibrant and diverse gardens. In the grounds of the lodge the abundant flowers attract many sunbirds and the fruiting trees are home to commersmith and brown-headed barbets, many babblers, hornbills, koels, treepies as well as being the day roosts for flying foxes and owls. Also whilst here, if you are not too tired we recommend a guided evening walk around the expansive grounds of the lodge; these walks often find Indian palm civets, jungle cats, Indian foxes, black-naped hares, hedgehogs and possibly the very elusive striped hyena. Of course the skies will be full of flying foxes, owls and nightjars as well. (all of your meals included).

Delhi - Travelling Today you will be transferred back to the capital city of Delhi (4-5 hours) after breakfast in your own private vehicle. After arriving at your hotel you will have the rest of the afternoon free to relax and maybe purchase some souvenirs, head over to the Yamuna river for some more birding or visit some more of the many sights here. (breakfast only included).
Home This morning after breakfast we will arrange for transfers to Delhi International Airport so you can catch your return flight home. (breakfast only)

tourName: Indian Himalayas tour, toy trains and hill stations
generalInfo:
This holiday is a mix of train and road travel in northern India. Start off in the agricultural heartland of India to visit the Golden Temple and get a taste for life on a Punjabi farm. From here travel up to the foothills of the Himalayas where you can eat momos and rub shoulders with Tibetan monks in the Dalai Lama’s hometown. After a couple of days relaxing in a nearby traditional village, continue to the former British Raj summer capital of Shimla for a few days, and descend the mountains on the famous toy train.

Remember, this is just a suggested itinerary - your own holiday can be tailored to your preference of budget, duration, locations and experiences.

dayInfo.description: Take to the skies Take the overnight flight from wherever you are to New Delhi.
Welcome to India! We will meet you at the airport and take you to your hotel to settle in and get ready for the upcoming adventure.

Markets & monuments of Delhi We will pick you up from the hotel and take you out to explore the gems of Delhi today. You can ride a cycle rickshaw through the old city, stop in at a traditional perfume shop, wander the bridal bazaar, or haggle for spices in the Khari Baoli market. Later on visit the stunning sandstone tomb of the emperor Humayun, and the medieval tower at the Qutab Minar.

Train to Amritsar Wake up early to board your train to Amritsar – the Shatabdi Express departs Delhi at 07:20 and arrives at Amritsar at 13:45, a classic experience of Indian rail travel. On arrival check in to your hotel and put your feet up. This evening we will drive you out to the Indian border with Pakistan for the enthralling closing ceremony.

Amritsar! Some people who visit the Golden Temple in Amritsar end up staying there all day, soaking in the atmosphere, chatting with Sikh devotees or volunteering in the kitchen. It’s really up to you. It is worth visiting the nearby park of Jallianwala Bagh which is now a sombre monument to the British massacre which took place there. The Partition Museum is also very good. In the evening be sure to return to the Golden Temple for the closing ceremony in which the holy book is put to bed for the night.

Punjabiyat in the Punjabi countryside Leave the city today and drive out 1h30m to Punjabiyat for an experience of surprisingly lively rural life in the agricultural heartland of India. Punjabiyat is on a working farm among acres of mustard and wheat fields, and while staying here you can cycle out in the countryside, ride bullock carts and get your hands dirty on the farm. Or you can just sit back and enjoy the serenity.

Dharamsala - Day 1 From the fertile plains of Punjab it’s a 4-hour scenic drive through changing scenery up to the foothills of the Himalayas. The former British hill station of Dharamsala is now a thriving Tibetan town and the headquarters of the exiled Dalai Lama. Check in to your hotel and explore the town.

Dharamsala - Day 2 Your guide will show you around Dharamsala today. You can visit the main temple where the Dalai Lama resides, or one of the smaller monasteries and nunneries dotted around. If you are interested in Buddhism you can take a philosophy class at the Tibetan Library, or have a consultation at the Astrological Institute.

Travel to Pragpur It’s just a 2-hour drive to step back a few hundred years in the beautifully preserved village of Pragpur, where your accommodation is at the historic Judge’s Court. Spend the afternoon relaxing or let the hotel staff show you around the village.
Explore Pragpur Relax and enjoy old fashioned village life in Pragpur.

Travel to Shimla The drive to Shimla takes about 6 hours, and there is some beautiful mountain scenery to take in along the way. Arrive in the former summer capital of the British Raj, and check in to your old-world hotel.
Shimla – Queen of Hills Today let us show you around Shimla – there’s plenty to see, especially the Viceregal Lodge and the Jakhu temple.
Explore Shimla Spend the day in Shimla at your own leisure for a stroll around town, tea & last-minute shopping.

Toy Train to Chandigarh Leave Shimla on one of the most beautiful train journeys the world - the famous toy train winds its way down the mountains through tunnels and past villages. The journey is about 6 hours and we can cut it short if you prefer. We will meet you at the rail head in Kalka and drop you off at your hotel in the nearby town of Chandigarh.
Chandigarh & Delhi Enjoy a morning tour of Chandigarh and the quirky yet brilliant Rock Garden, before heading to Chandigarh airport to fly to Delhi and connect with your return flight home.

tourName: Karnataka 12 day tour, India
generalInfo:
Karnataka is often overlooked for her more famous neighbour Kerala, which is a shame as the state offers everything from Heritage properties, abundant wildlife to stunning temple complex like Hampi, a UNESCO world heritage site fast becoming India’s Angkor Wat.

The cradle of the most powerful empires of bygone India, Karnataka holds a wealth of heritage and culture. Glittering temples, verdant valleys, thundering waterfalls and exotic wildlife.

Accommodation for 12 nights, including breakfast
An air-conditioned car with driver
English-speaking local guide in Bangalore, Hampi, Hassan and Mysore
Monument entrance fees included
Experienced naturalist guide on park ride in Kabini

Bangalore, Hospet, Hassan, Coorg, Kabini & Mysore

Indian cultural history, Luxury resorts, Jungle and bird watching

dayInfo.description: Bangalore -2 nights Step off the plane and into our care with assistance on arrival at Bangalore International. Spend your first night in India surrounded by five-star indulgence at the Leela Palace hotel enjoying nine acres of ornate gardens and cascading waterfalls. Plan your adventures for the days ahead over a breakfast briefing. Explore on a city tour. Experience Smell the fragrant blossoms and discover why Bangalore is called the “Garden City”. Admire the intricate French rosewood at the summer palace of Tipu Sultan. See the gold-plated Kalash Shikara at the Iskcon Temple shimmer in the night. Get caught up in the excitement of the night market. Browse glittering bangles and handcrafts.

Hospet -2 nights After a leisurely breakfast it’s time to continue your adventure and head north through Karnataka state. Enjoy the views while we take care of the driving. Settle in, refresh yourself with a dip in the pool. Sleep soundly, in the morning you’ll spend the day at Hampi, exploring the remains of a 14th century empire. Experience Enjoy mouth watering local delicacies at the rooftop restaurant at the luxe Royal Orchid hotel. Watch the sunset blaze over the ruins of Vijayanagar from Matanga Hill. Lose count of the carvings at the Hazara Rama temple which tell the legend of Ramayana. Choose a stone carving of your own to take home from a local artist, respect the skill passed down from generation to generation.

Hassan -2 nights Enjoy breakfast on the terrace before setting out on your travels. South this time, retracing your steps, and then west to Hassan, the temple capital of Karnataka. A day discovering architectural gems awaits on tours in Belur and Halebidu. Sleep soundly in simple, yet luxurious comfort at the Hoysala Village Resort. Experience Feel yourself unwind under the tranquil palm trees. Savour a candlelight supper, the air heady with the scent of incense and spicy home-cooked food. Walk in the shadow of history at the ruined city of Halebidu. Marvel at the complex friezes of exotic creatures and Shilabalika dancers at Chennakeshava temple complex. Visit the almost-thousand year old Jain temple of Hassan

Coorg -2 nights Today you’ll be journeying high into the mountains, The Taj Madikeri is nestled on the side of the rugged mountains 5000 feet above sea level, surrounded by the rainforest and streams, to a place where the air is gently perfumed with coffee and cardamom. Experience Stroll into a bygone age on a plantation tour. Rising high into the dense forest, surrounded by the Western Ghats, enjoy the scenic drive to Coorg. Feel the reverence from the thousands of lamas praying at the Tibetan Golden Temple at Kushalnagar.

Kabini -2 nights Take one last walk through the spice trees after breakfast before journeying further south to transfer to The Kabini River Lodge. Bordered on two sides by the Kabini River, enjoy sweeping panoramic views. Discover the wild side of the Karnataka on guided park rides to view tigers and elephants. Experience Wake early, listen to the bird song. Learn to identify the different species on a guided birding tour. Discover the river with fresh eyes on a night-time motorboat cruise Hear the splash of the paddle on a traditional coracle boat ride. Let the soothing jets of water in your private Jacuzzi pummel tired muscles. Lie back, enjoy the sensation of bathing under the stars.

Mysore Wake up with the sun to make the most of this time in the jungle with a final park ride spotting exotic animals before a hearty breakfast. Later you’ll be travelling to the base of the Chamundi Hills to Mysore, the cultural capital of Karnataka, city of palaces and gardens. Experience Enjoy modern luxury in the heart of the royal city at the Hotel Regaalis. Marvel at the ornately-gilded columns and stained glass ceilings at the Mysore Palace. Show off your best bargaining skills at the Devaraja market. Climb the stairs to the Chamundi temple, lose count of the deities carved upon its Gopuram.

Depart from Bangalore After breakfast, it’s time to leave, but the adventure continues with a visit to Shravanabelagola to see the 17-meters high statue of Gomateshwara, an important Jain pilgrimage site. Enjoy a final farewell dinner before we take you to connect to your flight at Bangalore International.

tourName: Karnataka and Kerala holiday
generalInfo:
This cultural and adventurous trip starts with the IT hub of South India - Mysore - the capital of Wodeyar Kingdom, where you will be exploring the royal heritage and enjoy local experiences. We bring you further to Kabini – Wilderness at its best in South India and the Nilgiri Mountain Railway. You will enjoy the nature, biodiversity and plantation splendors of Coonoor and Wayanad.

Then experience a local train expedition to Kochi, immerse yourself into the historic charm, again replenish to the lap of nature at Periyar, then at the charming backwaters with a floating overnight and finish you trip with total relaxation at the less explored beaches at Marari.

This trip can of course be tailor-made to your specific wishes, please get in touch.

Includes:
- 17 Nights accommodation in double room as per the meal plan specified
- Transport services using Air-conditioned Toyota Innova as per the program from Bangalore Airport till drop at Calicut Railway station
- Transport services using Air-conditioned Toyota Innova as per the program from Eranakulam Railway station till drop at Cochin Airport
- Services of English speaking Guide for sightseeing at Srirangapatna, Mysore & Cochin
- Explore Mysore by walk program with breakfast from a local restaurant
- Monument entrances as per program
- 04 Sessions of wild life safaris at Kabini
- Toy train tickets from Ooty to Coonoor in First / Second Sitting Class
- Train ticket from Calicut to Ernakulam in AC Chair Car Class
- Kathakalli show at local theater at Cochin
- Spice Plantation visit & Kalaripayattu show at Periyar
- Forest entry charges and ticket charges for Common Boating at Lake Periyar
- Half day bamboo rafting program at Periyar (Approx timing : 0730 – 1230)
- Meet and assistance on arrival at Bangalore and departure at Cochin Airport
- Taxes applicable as per present rules
- Farewell gift with Bespoke Logo as our complements
- Arrival/Departure assistance at Bangalore / Cochin airports by our Representative

dayInfo.description: BANGALORE TO MYSORE [By Surface - 185 km/Approx 4.5 hrs] Arrive Bangalore Airport. Assistance at Bangalore Airport. Drive from Bangalore to Mysore. Srirangapatna Visit. Dinner at the homestay. Overnight at the homestay. Arrive at Bangalore Airport in the morning. You will be met by us once you exit the arrival hall and whisked away to your waiting transport. Drive to Mysore with en route visit at Srirangapatna. Srirangapatnam - The ruins of Hyder Ali’s and Tipu sultan’s capital, from which they ruled much of Southern India during the 18th century. In 1799, the British finally conquered them with the help of disgruntled local leaders. Srirangapatnam was built on a long island in the Cauvery River. The dungeon where Tipu held a number of British officers has been preserved. Inside the fortress walls there’s a mosque and the Sri Ranganathsway Temple. After visits continue drive to Mysore. On arrival check in at home stay. Rest of the day at leisure. Overnight at Mysore.

MYSORE - Breakfast at the homestay. Sightseeing at Mysore. Dinner at the homestay. Overnight at the homestay. Mysore, once the capital of the Wodeyar kingdom, is today the second largest city in Karnataka and one of the finest in southern India. Small, easygoing, famous for its silks and sandalwood, it is a city of fine gardens, tree-lined boulevards, art galleries and an intriguing palace. Mysore’s ten day Dessara festival in September-October is still celebrated with medieval pageantry. In the morning proceed for the Mysore sightseeing with guide. Enjoy a city tour of Mysore visiting the Maharaja’s palace built in 1911-1912. Visit the art gallery and drive up to the 1062 m high Chamundi hill to see the Chamundeshwari temple with a panoramic view of Mysore. On your way back see the 5 m high bull carved out of solid rock built in 1659. Enjoy a visit to the flower market in the evening with our chauffeur. Overnight at Mysore.

MYSORE - KABINI [By Surface - 90 km/Approx 03 hrs] Explore Mysore by walk & “Dosa” from a local restaurant. Drive to Kabini. Day at leisure. Lunch & Dinner at the resort. Overnight at the resort. Wake up early in the morning and by 0700 hrs our guide will meet you at the lobby to accompany you for a walk through the streets of the city where many heritage structures & institutions are located. The duration is about 1 hr 30 mins and covers approximately 6 km. The highlights include Town hall, Clock Tower, Freemason’s Club, Devaraja Market, General Hospital, Medical College, Church Circle and a short history of these will be explained by the guide. At the end of the trail enjoy breakfast from a local restaurant and walk back to the homestay. Around 1045 hrs drive to Kabini. Once a private hunting area for the British, this famous wildlife destination has a rich variety of flora and fauna making it a gorgeous tourist spot. On arrival check in at the resort and rest of the day at leisure. Overnight at Kabini.

KABINI - Morning & Evening Jungle safaris. Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner at the resort. Overnight at the Resort. Enjoy jungle safari in the National Park. Come back to the hotel and have breakfast. Day at leisure to enjoy the nature and facilities by the resort. You have the options of Coracle Ride, Nature walk etc. Afternoon enjoy jungle safari in the National Park. Overnight at Kabini.

KABINI - Morning & Evening Jungle safaris. Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner at the resort. Overnight at the Resort. Enjoy jungle safari in the National Park. Come back to the hotel and have breakfast. Day at leisure to enjoy the nature and facilities by the resort. You have the options of Coracle Ride, Nature walk etc. Afternoon enjoy jungle safari in the National Park. Overnight at Kabini.

KABINI - OOTY - COONOOR [By Surface: 165 km / Approx. 4.5 hrs + By Train : 1 hr 5 mins + By Surface 15 km / 40 mins] Breakfast at the resort. Drive to Ooty Railway station. Toy Train from Ooty to Coonoor (Dep 1400 Arr 1505 hrs). Transfer from Coonoor Railway station to resort. Dinner at the resort. Overnight at the resort. After breakfast drive to Ooty. Board the toy train departure at 1400 hrs from Ooty Railway station to Coonoor. The Toy train connects the hill station Ooty with the base valley Mettupalayam and has been running since 1908. The Nilgiri Mountain Railway covers a distance of 46 km in this ride of about 4 hrs. Also the train offers travelers the panoramic view of long stretches of rice fields, lofty hills, 13 tunnels and 26 viaducts. It provides excellent photographic opportunities too. Arrive Coonoor Railway station by 1505 hrs and our chauffeur will be waiting for you and transfer to the resort. Named after the Kurumbas, a forgotten tribe, Kurumba Village resort is a tribute to the ancient clan that co-existed happily with nature in this hot spot of great bio-diversity. It is a lush space, a refuge for the senses where the land is nurtured and life-affirming moments happen all the time. On arrival check in at the resort. Rest of the day at leisure to enjoy the nature or facilities by the resort. Overnight at Coonoor.

COONOOR - Breakfast at the resort. Day at leisure to enjoy the activities offered by the resort. Lunch & Dinner at the resort. Overnight at the resort. You are at leisure to enjoy the nature or various activities offered by the resort. There are various activities which include forest walks, trekking, tea plantation tour, nature trail, horse ride, jeep ride, market visits and much more. The in-house naturalist or front office would assist you to arrange any of these as per your interest. Overnight at Coonoor.

COONOOR - WAYANAD [By Surface -140 km / Approx 4.5 hrs ] Breakfast at the resort. Transfer to Wayanad. Lunch & Dinner at the resort. Overnight at the resort. After breakfast drive to Wayanad. Amaryllis is set amidst the serenity and timeless beauty of Wayanad’s famed mist shrouded mountains. It looks down on the backwaters of the Karapuzha Reservoir and with the Western Ghats in the background the views are truly spectacular. No plantation house is complete without dogs – Sultan (the German Shepard) & Amigo (Golden Retriever/Labrador) join the host in welcoming guests into the home. Check in at the resort. It is a perfect place to enjoy the old world charm & luxury of a planter’s home – leisurely breakfasts, lazing around the pool, sleepy afternoons, tea on the veranda, evenings under the stars, followed by dinner. Overnight at Wayanad.

WAYANAD - Breakfast at the resort. Enjoy activities offered by the resort. Lunch & Dinner at the resort. Overnight at the resort Day at leisure to explore activities offered by the resort. An array of activities are feasible - walking around the farm amongst the various crops, walk down to the backwaters of the reservoir, or meander along the country roads above the property. Trek to the far corners of the estate and discover the stories and fables that only nature can relate. Explore prehistoric caves, watch wildlife in their natural habitat and experience a rhythm of life older than man himself. Overnight at Wayanad.

WAYANAD - CALICUT - COCHIN [By Surface / Train : 300 km /Approx. 8 Hrs including train ] Breakfast at the hotel. Transfer from hotel to Calicut Railway station. Train journey from Calicut to Eranakulam (Dep 1345 Arr 1720 hrs). Drive from Eranakulam Railway station to Fort Cochin. Overnight at the hotel. Checkout from the resort by 0930 hrs proceed to Calicut Railway station to connect train departing at 1345 hrs to Eranakulam. Arrive at Eranakulam Railway station by 1720 hrs and our chauffeur will be waiting for you and transfer you to the hotel in Cochin which is further about 40 minutes. Check in at the hotel and relax. Overnight at Cochin.

COCHIN - Breakfast at the hotel. Cochin Sightseeing. Overnight stay at the hotel. After breakfast proceed for a half day tour of Cochin. Kochi (colonial name Cochin) is the green commercial capital of Kerala, a cluster of islands located on the coast of the Arabian sea with one of the finest natural harbours in the world .. The harbour is the nucleus around which Cochin and its mainland part Eranakulam has grown to attain such strategic importance over the centuries as underlined by the sobriquet “Queen of the Arabian Sea “. Informally, Cochin is also referred to as the Gateway to Kerala, being the most cosmopolitan and modern city of Kerala where the best shopping, markets and bazaars are located. Visit the Dutch Palace at Mattancherry (Friday closed) renowned for its wall murals depicting scenes from the Ramayana. The Jewish Synagogue (Friday & Saturday closed) at the heart of what is locally called the Jew Town. The St Francis Church, the oldest European Church in India. The Santa Cruz Basilica, originally built in 1557 by the Portuguese. The Chinese fishing nets believed to brought to Kochi by the Chinese Traders. Afternoon at leisure or you may drive through the modern part of Cochin called Eranakulam with your chauffeur. Later in the evening visit a nearby theatre to witness Kathakali dance. The Kathakali is one of the famous art form of Kerala with elaborate make up for the artists, each performance based on a story. It will be interesting to watch from the time the artist starts the makeup. Overnight at Cochin.

COCHIN - PERIYAR [By Surface : 190 km Approx / 4.5 hrs] Breakfast at the hotel. Drive to Periyar. Kalarippayattu Show. Overnight stay at the hotel. After breakfast proceed to Periyar. Thekkady or Periyar is South India’s most popular wildlife sanctuary, encompassing an area of 777 sq km. Set on the attractive man-made Periyar Lake; it attracts over 300,000 visitors a year. Though the sanctuary was made a part of Project Tiger in 1973, it is better known for its elephants. On arrival check in at the resort and be at leisure for some time. In the evening enjoy a Kalarippayattu (Martial Art) show at a local centre. Overnight at Periyar.

PERIYAR - Breakfast at Hotel. Spice plantation visit. Boating at Periyar. Overnight at Hotel. Breakfast at hotel and by 0930 hrs proceed for a spice plantation visit. Apart from being enjoyable, these plantation tours give tourists an insight into the growing, harvesting and processing of spices. The peeling and drying of cinnamon etc can be observed on such trips. In the afternoon enjoy a boat ride at Lake Periyar (Tentative Timing : 1530 - 1700 hrs) and see the wildlife around the lake as you cruise along its banks. Apart from elephants, bison, sambar, wild boar, langur, otter and flying squirrel are common. There are also 246 species of birds and 112 species of butterfly. Overnight at Periyar.

PERIYAR - Breakfast at the hotel. Bamboo Rafting program. Overnight at the hotel. After an early breakfast by 0715 hrs proceed to the boat landing point to join the Bamboo rafting program. (Provisional timings: 0730 – 1230 hrs). This is a range hiking and rafting programme through some of the richest forest tracks of Periyar Tiger Reserve. Starting at 0730 hrs from the boat landing, a mosaic of habitats will be traversed before the party gets into rafts made of bamboos. The forests are rich in bird life and arboreal animals like giant squirrel and Nilgiri langur. The rafting is for about three hours and one gets a panoramic view of forest-clad hills reflected on the lake. Animals like elephant, gaur and sambar are sighted keeping close to the edges of the lake. The team hitchhikes back to boat landing by about 1230 hrs. Usually an armed guard and 4 guides will accompany a max. of 10 guests. Tea, snacks and packed refreshments will be served enroute. Afternoon at leisure or you may explore the spice town on your own. Overnight at Periyar.

PERIYAR - ALLEPPEY [By Surface: 165 km /Approx. 4.5 Hrs] Breakfast at the hotel. Drive to Alleppey. Lunch, Dinner & Overnight onboard Houseboat. Drive from Periyar to Alleppey and in the afternoon board a houseboat for cruise around the backwaters of Kerala. Large wooden Cargo boats are converted into Houseboats with overnight staying facilities became an attraction in the backwaters. The Houseboats are normally equipped with fully furnished bed rooms with attached bathrooms and kitchen. Mouthwatering Kerala Dishes to be served on the Plantain Leaves await you on the Boat. There are ample opportunities to do nothing, just relax and embrace the natural wind. In the evening wait for the romance of birds displayed seasonally in the vast canvas of the reddish sky. Then enjoy the delight of a royal dinner under million stars. Listen the lullaby of waves and weeds of the Lake and have a sound sleep. Depending upon your interest and as per the operational feasibility crew can arrange some local visits. Overnight onboard Houseboat.

ALLEPPEY - MARARIKULAM [By Surface: 25km/Approx. 45 Mins] Breakfast onboard Houseboat. Drive to Mararikulam. Overnight at the boutique villa. By 0930 hrs disembark the houseboat at Alleppey after breakfast. You will be met by our chauffeur and drive to Mararikulam. Mararikulam is a beach village in the district of Alappuzha. It is one of the most beautiful destinations for tourists who visit Kerala, and was rated as one of the world’s top five hammock beaches by National Geographic survey. Marari is a nature lover’s paradise and a morning stroll with one of our naturalists in tow is a fine way to introduce yourself to the Malabar coast's unique ecosystem and explore its myriad charms. Flamingo Marari is nestled in its own secluded place surrounded by the natural environment. Flamingo is a home of wellness and positive energy, a home to explore its rich cultural heritage and responds to an ethnic Kerala lifestyle. This boutique villa is an old house renovated to a heritage property with modern amenities for the travelers to stay at Marari. The property is around 75 years old having lived 3 generations of the family. Check in at the hotel and rest of the day at leisure to enjoy the beach. Overnight at Mararikulam.

MARARIKULAM - Breakfast at the boutique villa. Day at leisure. Overnight at the boutique villa. Breakfast at the villa and you are at leisure to enjoy the activities offered by the villa. An array of activities can be enjoyed on site or in the surroundings, including fishing. Also they offer Canoe to access the beach through the backwaters. Overnight at Mararikulam.

MARARI - COCHIN AIRPORT DEPARTURE [By Surface: 80 km/Approx 2.5 Hrs] Breakfast at the boutique villa. Transfer to Cochin Airport . Our chauffeur will meet you & transfer you to Cochin airport for your flight for your onward journey.

tourName: Karnataka holiday in Southern India
generalInfo:
Discover the heart of real India, and relax in the warmth of South India, perfect for a winter escape. Explore the ways and culture of Karnataka, and stay in comfortable guesthouses that are owned and run by local communities. Local people benefit directly from your stay, and the welcome given to guests is truly special. These are tailor-made trips, and you have your own local guides who will reveal so much about local life. You begin in the sub-tropical warmth of the Western Ghats to explore a beautiful, little known part of southern India. Visit the majestic temples and palaces at Hampi, then taste life amongst spice plantations from the wonderful 'Spice House' at Hulgol. See the auction market, and explore on foot or by cycle the forests and the holy river. The Spice House is a comfortable traditional style bungalow, with three twin-bedded rooms. Wonderful fresh produce is used to create delicious meals. There are ample opportunities for exploring around the fascinating hamlet and spice gardens, or longer walks to temples, waterfalls and just meeting villagers. The diversity of the flora and fauna is fascinating: a wide variety of birds, small mammals, butterflies and fireflies flickering at night.

From Hulgol, you visit the coast to discover the fishing community of Pavinakurva where you can watch the fishermen, and relax on a secluded beach, a marvelous place to unwind. This is a magnificent, unspoiled stretch of coast, where life continues as it has for centuries, reliant on the catch brought in by small fishing boats. Again, the guesthouse is comfortable and the fresh fish and local vegetables create memorable meals cooked by your hosts. The guesthouse is shaded by coconut palms, close to a cashew orchard, with river and distant hill views. Sitting in the shade reading a book is a delight! The village's sandy beach sweeps away into the distance, peaceful apart from a few seabirds and the boats drawn up above the tide line. Just off-shore is the mysterious Basavraja Durga island, a small wooded rock outcrop. Above the shore line the sandy dunes have been planted with Cassurina trees, including grassy shaded areas suited to picnics or just relaxing and watching the ebb and flow of the sea. Unfortunately, difficult currents make this an unsafe beach for swimming.

Karnataka, both its coast and hills, is a wonderful region to explore, and this combination of guesthouses is ideal.

dayInfo.description: Welcome at Mumbai airport, transfer to city centre. Overnight Mumbai guesthouse.
A full day to explore the city, before a transfer to the station to catch the overnight Express to Hubli.
Arrive Hubli; lunch in Hubli before transfer to Hospet (3 hours).Overnight in Hotel in Hospet.
Spend the day exploring the nearby ancient site of Hampi (10km from Hospet). Guided tour and option to explore by bicycle. Return to Hotel for a second night.
Transfer from Hospet to Hulgol (5 ¼ hours). Lunch and relax at Spice House guesthouse; introduction to the area. Your guide will meet you to plan and help you make the most of you stay.
Transfer to the coastal town of Kumta for overnight train to Mumbai.
Arrive at Mumbai station, transfer to airport for homeward flight.

tourName: Karnataka luxury tour, heritage hills & wildlife
generalInfo:
A real favourite of ours.

Experience Karnataka in style with top class jungle and bird watching. We also love the historical properties of Hampi and Mysore. Then getting away from it all at the beautiful hill station of Coorg (Kodagu).

You'll be really getting into the interior and off the beaten track.

This is a wonderfully paced trip visiting places that mass tourism does not get to.

With outstanding properties at both Coorg and Kabani and the plethora of amazing wildlife within touching distance of both resorts.

Karnataka should firmly be a state that you consider.... so much variety and contrast with great authentic experiences to keep you capitivated!

dayInfo.description: Bangalore - Step off the plane and into our care with assistance on arrival at Bangalore International. Spend your first night in India surrounded by five-star indulgence at the Leela Palace hotel enjoying nine acres of ornate gardens and cascading waterfalls. Plan your adventures for the days ahead over a breakfast briefing. Explore on a city tour.

Hospet/Hampi -2 nights After a leisurely breakfast it’s time to continue your adventure and head north through Karnataka state. Enjoy the views while we take care of the driving. Settle in, refresh yourself with a dip in the pool. Sleep soundly, in the morning you’ll spend the day at Hampi, exploring the remains of a 14th century empire.

Hassan - 2 nights Enjoy breakfast on the terrace before setting out on your travels. South this time, retracing your steps, and then west to Hassan, the temple capital of Karnataka. A day discovering architectural gems awaits on tours in Belur and Halebidu. Sleep soundly in simple, yet luxurious comfort at the Hoysala Village Resort.

Coorg -2 nights Today you’ll be journeying high into the mountains, The Taj Madikeri is nestled on the side of the rugged mountains 5000 feet above sea level, surrounded by the rainforest and streams, to a place where the air is gently perfumed with coffee and cardamom.

Kabini -2 nights Take one last walk through the spice trees after breakfast before journeying further south to transfer to The Kabini River Lodge. Bordered on two sides by the Kabini River, enjoy sweeping panoramic views.

Mysore -2 nights Wake up with the sun to make the most of this time in the jungle with a final park ride spotting exotic animals before a hearty breakfast. Later you’ll be travelling to the base of the Chamundi Hills to Mysore, the cultural capital of Karnataka, city of palaces and gardens.

Bangalore After breakfast, it’s time to leave, but the adventure continues with a visit to Shravanabelagola to see the 17-meters high statue of Gomateshwara, an important Jain pilgrimage site. Enjoy a final farewell dinner before we take you to connect to your flight at Bangalore International.

tourName: Karnataka luxury tour in India
generalInfo:
• 14 Nights Accommodation in 1 Double Room as per the above mentioned accommodation plan and the specified meal plan
• Transport services using Customized Air-conditioned Toyota Innova as per the program from Bangalore Airport till drop at Shreyas Retreat
• Departure transfer using Aircon Toyota Innova from Shreyas Retreat to Bangalore Airport
• Services of English speaking local guide for sightseeing at Mysore, Shravanabelegola, Belur, Halebid & Hampi.
• Monument Entrance fees for sightseeing as applicable at above places
• Cooking demo with dinner at Gitanjali Homestay Mysore
• Explore Mysore by walk with breakfast from a local restaurant
• 3 Jungle Safaris per Person at Kabini (Day 3 Evening, Day 4 Morning & Evening)
• 1 Candle light cruise dinner during the stay at Orange County Kabini
• Visit to Bylakkuppe while driving from Kabini to Coorg
• Exclusive plantation walk at Coorg
• Coracle ride at Coorg
• 1 Dinner at Machan during the stay at Orange County Coorg
• Visit to Shravanabelegola while driving from Coorg to Chikmagalur
• Coracle Ride at Hampi
• Wellness consultation on arrival at Shreyas
• 1 Session of Personalised Pranayama , Meditation / Yoga Nidra & Facial per person at Shreyas as per the package
• 2 Rejuvenation Massages per person at Shreyas as per the package
• Twice daily group Yoga sessions at Shreyas as per the package
• Unlimited supply of bottled drinking water during the drives
• Basic mobile with local SIM card for the use from arrival till departure. (This number will be shared to you 5 days before arrival at Bangalore)
• Arrival/Departure assistance at Bangalore airports by our Representative

dayInfo.description: BANGALORE Arrive at Bangalore International Airport. After clearing customs and immigrations you will be met by us once you exit the arrival hall and whisked away to your waiting transport. You will be transferred to the hotel. Bangalore, renamed as Bengaluru now is the capital city of Karnataka and a veritable melting pot of various races and cultures. This Garden City has well - laid out parks, gardens, long avenues of blossoming trees and salubrious climate. Emerging as the hi-tech capital of India, it still retains a charm that is totally Indian. Founded in 1537 by a local Chieftain Kempe Gowda, Bangalore has changed dramatically over the years.

After breakfast proceed to Mysore with enroute visit at Srirangapatna. Srirangapatnam - The ruins of Hyder Ali’s and Tipu sultan’s capital, from which they ruled much of Southern India during the 18th century. In 1799, the British finally conquered them with the help of disgruntled local leaders. Srirangapatnam was built on a long island in the Cauvery River. The dungeon where Tipu held a number of British officers has been preserved. Inside the fortress walls there’s a mosque and the Sri Ranganathsway Temple. After visits proceed to Mysore. Mysore, once the capital of the Wodeyar kingdom, is today the second largest city in Karnataka and one of the finest in southern India. Small, easygoing, famous for its silks and sandalwood, it is a city of fine gardens, tree-lined boulevards, art galleries and an intriguing palace. Mysore’s ten day Dessara festival in September-October is still celebrated with medieval pageantry. On arrival check in at the hotel and relax for a while. In the afternoon enjoy a city tour of Mysore visiting the Maharaja’s palace built in 1911-1912. Visit the art gallery and drive upto the 1062 m high Chamundi hill to see the Chamundeshwari temple with a panoramic view of Mysore. On your way back see the 5 m high bull carved out of solid rock built in 1659. By 1700 hrs proceed to Gitanjali Homestay where a cooking demonstration is arranged. An elaborate, ethnic Kodava spread and interaction with your host Yamuna, dressed in her traditional Kodava attire, promises a unique experience. Enjoy a sumptuous dinner and drive back to the hotel

Wake up early in the morning and by 0700 hrs our guide will meet you at the lobby to accompany you for a walk thru the streets of the city where many heritage structures & institutions are located. The duration is about 1 hr 30 mins and covers approximately 6 km. The highlights include Town hall, Clock Tower, Freemason’s Club, Devaraja Market, General Hospital, Medical College, Church Circle and a short history of these will be explained by the guide. At the end of the trail enjoy breakfast from a local restaurant and walk back to the hotel. Around 1030 hrs drive to Kabini The legend and romance of Kabini plays out in a theatre called Nagarhole, and revolves around a pristine river called Kabini (originally Kapila) that snakes its way through the Nagarhole National Park in Karnataka, and forms an aqueous boundary with the Bandipur National park. Together, this area constitutes the largest contiguous forest cover in this part of the world and is part of the Nilgiri biosphere, the largest in Asia, and home to the largest concentration of herbivores in Asia. And herbivores don't get larger than the Asiatic elephant, whose favorite playground this is. At Nagarhole, one can witness the largest congregation of Asiatic Elephants in the world, and these majestic mammals rule the roost here. Afternoon enjoy vehicle safari in the National Park. (1500 – 1900 hrs). Later enjoy a Candle Light Cruise Dinner. A one of a kind boat-dining experience designed to literally set your love and longings afloat. Relish each other’s company under the gentle, warm, glow of candle lights while silently floating on the waters of the Kabini. Savor exquisite food and wine from a choice menu prepared onboard just for the two of you.

Enjoy safari in the National Park by boat. (0630 – 0915 hrs). Come back to the hotel and have breakfast. Day at leisure to enjoy the nature and facilities by the resort. You have the options of Coracle Ride, Nature walk etc. Afternoon enjoy vehicle safari in the National Park. (1500 – 1900 hrs). Later enjoy a Candle Light Cruise Dinner. A one of a kind boat-dining experience designed to literally set your love and longings afloat. Relish each other’s company under the gentle,

After breakfast, by 0900 hrs leave to Coorg with an enroute stop at Bylakkuppe. Bylakkuppe is the second largest Tibetan settlement outside Tibet, complete with a Tibetan monastery with about 7,000 monks, a Golden temple, a Tibetan village and a flea market. Then continue drive to Coorg. Coorg or locally known as Kodagu is one of the most popular tourist spot in Karnataka state. Coorg is the smallest district in Karnataka and one district which do not have any railway lines. Dubbed the Scotland of India, Coorg with its misty hills, lush forests, orange groves, coffee plantations, is an ideal place to relax. Check in at the hotel and free time to relax. Later by 1600 hrs proceed for a Coracle Ride (Duration 45 mins). Coracles are local fishing crafts that are circular and ideal for navigating these waters. The coracle ride on the river not only helps you to gauge the myriad moods of the river, but also gives you a fish-eye view of the surrounding forest and the habitation, and allows you to be a small part of the ebb and flow of riverine life.

Breakfast at the hotel and be on your own at the resort. By mid day interaction & walk with Mrs. Kanthi Aneesh, General Manager of the resort. - This is indented to give you a glimpse of women empowerment. By 1600 hrs proceed for a guided tour of the 300 acre working coffee and spice plantation on foot. Learn firsthand the difference between an Arabica and Robusta, discover how the Malabar blend got ‘monsooned’, and explore the spice scented pathways of Orange County to slip into the spirit of the land. By 1830 hrs you will be back at the room. A Private Dinner is envisaged at The Machan - A ‘restaurant for two’ offers you a completely private and elevated dining experience that towers above all else. The Machan is your chance to commune with nature, even as you discover each other in the gentle intimacy of a treetop gourmet meal.

After breakfast drive to Chikmagalur. Enroute visit Sravanabelogola to witness the 1000 year old monolithic statue of Gomateshwara. Continue drive to Chikmagalur and check in at the resort on arrival. The residences at Primrose Villas are a haven of peace tucked away on the mountain tops of the Western Ghats in India. The stunning scenery from the villas, dining areas and the lounges, the 360 degree views, the divine serenity, gorgeous mountain treks and walks, fine dining, and the uniquely romantic setting take you to a world of sublime tranquility and privacy. Rest of the day at leisure.

After breakfast, proceed to visit the two famous Hoysala temples at Belur and Halebid. The temple in Belur is dedicated to Lord Chennakesava and the construction commenced in 1116 A.D. and took 103 years to complete. The Hoysaleswara temple in Halebid has two shrines dedicated to Lord Shiva – Hoysaleswara and Shanteleswara. The open air museum in the temple premises displays treasured articles of sculpture After visits drive back to the resort and rest of the day at leisure to enjoy the facilities at the resort or any activity by them. Or you may take a drive through the magnificent Mullayyanagiri mountains that surround the property is another wonderful opportunity to sync with nature.

After breakfast, drive to Hampi and check-in to the resort booked for the next 03 Nights. Travel back in time to the glorious days of the 14th century Vijayanagara Empire. Let the stone monuments at Hampi tell you the story of what was once described as “the best provided city in the world”.. Its fort like entrances, stone-paved boulevards, arched hallways and regal chambers mirror the famed palaces of a bygone but glorious era. Check in at the resort and you have the remaining day to indulge in the luxury of the property
