After breakfast proceed for sightseeing of Hampi. You have the whole day to explore the World Heritage site of Hampi, the Capital of the medieval Vijayanagar Empire and the most evocative of all the ruins in India. In the late afternoon ride in a small boat (Coracle) on the river (about 1 hr).

The day is at leisure. You may enjoy the facilities by the resort. Optional: If you wish to explore Hampi more, we recommend Tungabhadra Trek offered by the resort. This is an offbeat evening trek that takes you through giant boulders, the ruins of the Achyutaraya Temple and the famed ‘Courtesan Bazaar’. You could have a splendid view of the setting sun behind the boulder hills as you walk along the banks of the scenic Tungabhadra River. (Cost : Approx £ 120 for 2 payable to the resort)

After an early breakfast, by 0800 hrs depart to Bangalore. As you would arrive Bangalore after lunch time it is suggested to have lunch from a local restaurant in between and our chauffeur will find a good place for you. On arrival check in at the retreat. Shreyas is dedicated to promoting the authentic spiritual tradition of Yoga in a holistic manner and is recognized as one of the finest Yoga retreats in the world. What makes Shreyas unique is that, whilst Yoga is taught in traditional ashram style (daily yoga, meditation sessions, chanting classes, gourmet vegetarian cuisine, no alcohol policy and community service), the guests live in a luxurious environment normally associated with a star hotel. They enable guests to integrate the manifold facets and benefits of Yoga into their daily lives without the austerity and rigor usually associated with ashrams. A 03 Nights package under Wellness For The Soul category is booked here for you which is a combination of the best that Shreyas has to offer. You will have an opportunity to learn and practice the different facets of Yoga -for physical strength, balance and flexibility, for physiological & therapeutic benefits and if you are interested, guidance along your spiritual path. This includes a well-balanced itinerary of yoga, meditation and pranayama sessions, rejuvenating massages, cooking classes, community exercises, and nature farming. On arrival, check-in to your hotel. Further a Wellness consultation will be arranged
Engage in various activities like Yoga, personalized sessions of Pranayama Meditation / Yoga Nidra, Facial, Rejuvenation Massages etc as included in the package.
Today on time we will meet you & transfer you to Bangalore airport to connect flight for your onward journey

tourName: Karnataka tailormade holiday, India
placesVisited: Welcoming homestay in Mysuru, Coorg, Two safaris in Nagarhole Tiger Reserve, Take the atmospheric sleeper train to Hampi, Explore UNESCO-listed Hampi with an expert guide
generalInfo:
This two-week Karnataka holiday promises a sublime mix of culture, wildlife-watching and relaxation, with plenty of views that you’ll no doubt remember for a long time to come.

Travel in a private, air-conditioned and chauffeur-driven car from Mysore to Coorg and then Nagarhole Tiger Reserve, followed by a sleeper train to the UNESCO-listed Hampi, with two or three nights in each destination allowing you to gain a deeper appreciation of life in Karnataka.

Get your bearings in the majestic city of Mysuru (Mysore) a three-night homestay here ideal for sightseeing around key locations such as the Mysuru Palace, and the Devaraja Market, a must for photographers and anyone with a passion for Indian spices and scents.

From Mysuru continue on to the gorgeous hill station of Coorg. Waterfalls tumble in this laidback paradise of forests, coffee plantations and rice paddies, and the panoramas from the famous Raja’s Seat are nothing short of spectacular.

A change of scenery, and a change of pace, as you next spend a few nights at a luxurious safari lodge in Nagarhole Tiger Reserve. Here Asian elephants and tigers wander the forests, and you’ll enjoy excellent opportunities to see both thanks to the efforts of expert guides, who nevertheless ensure the animals’ welfare is paramount.

Taking the overnight train to Hampi, you’ll explore this majestic UNESCO World Heritage Site in the company of a local guide who will bring the ancient temples, monuments and fortresses here to life with stories of their past.

All the way round, you’ll stay in carefully chosen accommodation, from hotels to resorts to homestays, that place a strong focus on environmental protection and employing people from the local community. Each provides another window on the unique culture of this region, as well as a memorable taste of luxury, on an India tour that’s as stylish as it is comfortable.

dayInfo.description: Depart the UK. Flights can be booked by us and therefore the whole holiday will be protected under our ATOL.
Arrive at Bangalore Airport and immediately transfer to Mysore. Three nights at Efkay's Homestay.

At leisure and sightseeing in the wonderful city of Mysore. Sightseeing may include Mysore Palace, Chamundi Hill and the temple of Somnathpur a short distance away. There is also a bird sanctuary in the area. Mysore market is a must for photographers.
Transfer to Coorg. Three nights at Evolve Back - Coorg.
Two full days in the area allowing plenty of time to discover Coorg.
Transfer to Nagarhole National Park. Afternoon boat safari. Three nights at Evolve Back.
Two safaris are included. Other activities are available as well as a delightful pool to relax by.
Transfer to Mysore Station and board your overnight train to Hospet (Hampi). Overnight on train.
Arrive Hospet and transfer to Evolve Back - Hampi. Three nights at Evolve Back.
Two days with a guide to explore the fascinating UNESCO World Heritage Site of Hampi.
Transfer by car to Bangalore Airport. Overnight at the Taj hotel close to the Airport.
Transfer to Bangalore Airport for your return flight.

tourName: Kashmir and Ladakh holiday, India
placesVisited: Delhi, Srinagar, Overnight on Srinagar houseboat Leh, Nubra Valley, Khardungla La mountain pass, Pangong Lake
generalInfo:
For some people Ladakh and Kashmir holidays can seem too remote, more of an expedition than a holiday. But this fourteen day, tailor made itinerary has been carefully crafted to allow travellers who want to visit these stunning Himalayan regions to do so with ease of access, and stay in good quality accommodation along the way. By starting and ending your trip in Delhi, you will have the services of a private guide to guide you around the city highlights, and then guide you to onto domestic flights to both Srinagar for a few days and then, after a day’s rest back in Delhi, on another flight to Leh. Where more expert local guides await.

In Srinagar, the largest city of Jammu and Kashmir state, you will stay overnight on one of the city’s famous houseboats which interconnect Lakes Dal and Nigeen, and also have plenty of time to take in the mosques, ancient streets and markets of this historical city, brimming with cultural heritage.

In Leh, the capital of the Himalayan heaven that is Ladakh, enjoy its magnificent setting at 3500m, enveloped by snowy peaks, and visit some of its cultural highlights, the top of the list being its extraordinary royal palace, set into the mountain. From Leh, you can also take trips out to the Nubra Valley with your chauffeur guide, a flower filled landscape created by two rivers and stunning natural division between the Ladakh and Karakoram mountains. You will access it via the famous Khardung La pass, an ancient trading and caravan route.

Your final trip before returning to Delhi will be spent on a camping adventure at one of Ladakh’s most beautiful places to visit: Panong Lake, shared by both India and Tibet. Serene and sumptuously blue, this is the most perfect Ladakhi way to bring your trip to a close, before flying back to Delhi.

dayInfo.description: Delhi Day 1 Upon arrival in Delhi airport, you will be met by our representative and will be provided assisted transfer to your hotel. Upon arrival check in to the Hotel. Spend the rest of the day at leisure. Overnight at the hotel. Day 2 After breakfast, full day city tour of New & Old Delhi. Places to visit includes: • Jama Masjid • Cycle Rickshaw ride in Old Delhi • Red Fort (from Outside) • Humayun’s Tomb • Qutub Minar • Drive Past Janpath Overnight at the Hotel.

Srinagar Day 3 After breakfast, you will be provided assisted transfer to airport to connect the flight for Srinagar. • 9W 603 ETD 1000 Hrs / 1120 Hrs In Srinagar, you will be provided assisted arrival transfer to Houseboat. Later in the afternoon Shikara ride on Dal Lake visiting floating gardens. Overnight at the houseboat. Day 4 After breakfast, transfer to the Hotel. Later sightseeing of Mughal Gardens. Rest of the day is free at leisure. Overnight at the hotel. Day 5 After breakfast, drive through old part of Srinagar city and visit the famous Jamia Masjid, Shah-E-Hamdan Mosque, Wooden Mosque and walk through Heritage buildings, old spice market and ancient lanes of Srinagar city. Enroute also visit the Kashmir Handicraft units for last minute shopping. Later return back to the Hotel. Overnight at the Hotel.

Delhi Day 6 After breakfast, you will be provided assisted departure transfer to connect the flight for Delhi. • 9W 604 ETD 1200 Hrs / 1335 Hrs Upon arrival in Delhi, you will be provided assisted arrival transfer to Hotel. Overnight at the hotel.

Leh Day 7 After breakfast, you will be provided assisted transfer to airport to connect the flight for Leh. • AI 445 ETD 0555 Hrs / 0725 Hrs In Leh, you will be provided assisted arrival transfer to Hotel. Rest of the day is free at leisure. Overnight at the hotel. Day 8 After breakfast, Visit Spituk, Phyang and Stok Palace. After having visit return back to the hotel. Overnight at the hotel. Day 9 After breakfast, Visit Shey Palace, Thiksey and Hemis Monasteries Overnight at the hotel.
Nubra Day 10 After breakfast, drive to Nubra Valley via Khardungla Top (4.5 Hrs Approx.). Upon arrival check in to the Hotel. Overnight at the hotel.
Leh Day 11 After breakfast, drive back to Leh. Upon arrival check in at the Hotel. Overnight at the hotel.
Pangong Day 12 After breakfast, drive to Pangong (3.5 Hrs Approx.). Upon arrival check in at the camp. Overnight at the camp.

Delhi Day 14 After breakfast, you will be provided assisted departure transfer to airport to connect the flight for Delhi. • AI 446 ETD 0800 Hrs / 0920 Hrs In Delhi, you will be provided assisted departure transfer from airport to Hotel. Rest of the day is at leisure. Overnight at the Hotel. Day 15 After breakfast, you will be provided assisted departure transfer from Hotel to airport to connect the flight for onwards journey.

tourName: Kashmir small group holiday, India
placesVisited: Old Delhi, Leh, Himalayan monasteries, World's highest road, Kargil, Nubra Valley, Zanskar Valley, Srinagar, Houseboat cruise, Sonamarg, Gulmarg
generalInfo:
The troubled years when conflict put Kashmir off-limits to foreign visitors have passed, and this is a chance to experience the diversity of this stunning region, complemented with the neighbouring Ladakh with its strong Tibetan Buddhist influences.

After exploring Old Delhi's Red Fort and Chandi Chowk, take a flight over the Himalayas to Leh. As well as visiting amazing monasteries including Tikse, Moatho & Shey, you'll explore the Nubra Valley – including a drive along the world's highest road (5600m) through some of the finest scenery in Ladakh. There are also on foot encounters with local villagers – and Bactrian camels.

Take the High Road to Kashmir over a 4000m pass to your next base in the spectacular Zanskar Valley. Camping amid Buddhist villages and monasteries, enjoy scenic village walks plus a visit to the Islamic town of Kargil.

After an incredible drive to Srinagar - with lunch at the strikingly beautiful Sonamarg – board a houseboat for three days afloat, taking in sights such as the Moghul Gardens, a visit to a floating market plus one last mountain jaunt day trip to Gulmarg to ride the world’s highest chairlift (3980m).

Price includes all activities/equipment, tour leaders, local guides and drivers, meals, mineral water, all transport (excluding international flights) , all accommodation and all entrance fees as outlined in the itinerary

dayInfo.description: Tour Starts In Delhi: Explore New Delhi: The tour starts with a group welcome meeting at lunchtime. Rooms are available from 14:00 so we will check in if possible, before taking a drive through New Delhi – visiting Rajpath and India Gate as well as Humayun’s tomb, one of the best preserved Mughal monuments, commissioned by Humayun's son Akbar and designed by the Persian architect Mirak Mirza Ghiya. This evening we will head to Connaught Place for dinner.

Delhi – Leh (3,500M): The Land of High Passes: After a relaxed morning we'll take one of the most spectacular flights in the world in the early afternoon, from Delhi across the plains and over the Himalayas to Leh – if your eyesight is good enough you might even see K2! Upon arrival in Leh, we’ll transfer to our hotel and spend some time relaxing and acclimatising to the altitude. Known as the ‘Land of High Passes’, Ladakh and its capital, Leh, was an important junction on the famous Silk Route. In the afternoon, we’ll take an orientation walk around the town, which is still dominated by the ruins of Leh Palace. This former residence of the royal family of Ladakh is built along the lines of the Potala Palace in Tibet. At nine storeys high, it’s a striking building and an architectural icon of Leh.

In & Around Leh: The Monasteries of Leh: Today we’ll visit some of the most spectacular monasteries in the area surrounding Leh. Situated on a hilltop to the south, Shey Monastery was once the summer palace of the royal family and it’s believed that many of the Kings of Leh were born here. The monastery is home to an impressive 24m high seated image of Buddha cast from copper and covered with gold leaf. Thiksey Monastery, filled with colourful murals and statues, affords picturesque views of the green Indus valley from its rooftop. Located around 26kms from Leh, Matho Monastery is a Tibetan Buddhist monastery built around 500 years ago which belongs to the Sakya order. We’ll return to Leh in time for dinner this evening.

Leh - Nubra Valley (3,000M): Over Khardung La Pass: This morning we’ll head north on a scenic journey along one of the highest motorable roads in the world as we journey over the Khardung La Pass (5,359m), before descending into the spectacular Nubra Valley below. Lying high on the Tibetan plateau - and only recently opened to foreign visitors - Nubra Valley means ‘Valley of Flowers’ and visiting here is like stepping back in time. This is where the Shyok River meets the Siachan River to form a large valley separating the Ladakh and Karakoram mountain ranges. Throughout the journey, a number of stops are required to obtain protected area permits and to show passports. On arrival, we’ll settle into Desert Himalaya Resort, with some free time to explore the surrounding area or to relax on the veranda of your premium tent. In the late afternoon, there is an option to take an easy walk from Diskit. We will start from the main bazaar in the village of Diskit. En route, we pass sea buckthorn bushes used as a traditional medicine for centuries and visit a rolling expanse of sand dunes. We then return to our camp and have dinner. Driving distance today, 120km, approx. 5 hours.

In The Nubra Valley: Chortens and the Wishful Lake: After breakfast, we cross the Shyok River heading to the other side of the Nubra Valley to visit a couple of remote local monasteries. Home to around 50 monks, Samstanling Monastery is the main monastery of the region and is over 130 years old. In contrast, Ensa Monastery is around 600 years old with only one resident monk. Here, the kora path takes us past dozens of white chortens and a hermitage retreat to offer fabulous views of the valley. We return to the banks of the Nubra for a picnic lunch. This afternoon, we take a short drive to the Yarab Tso Lake, known locally as ‘Wishful Lake’. Situated at 3,300m, it is one of the holiest high-altitude lakes in the valley where we can enjoy another pleasant walk. On our return journey, we pay a visit to the Women’s Alliance of Nubra, an initiative to improve the status of women in this region, for a traditional Ladakhi lunch before returning to our camp for the evening.

Nubra Valley – Leh: Return from the Valley: We rise early this morning to observe the monks carrying out their morning prayers at Diskit Monastery. We return to the camp for breakfast and after taking in some more of the magnificent views we’ll return to Leh where the rest of the day is free to explore at your leisure. Dinner tonight will be at your own expense. Driving distance today, 120km, approx. 5 hours.

In & around Leh: Explore Leh: If it transpires, as it often does, that this day coincides with one of the annual colourful Buddhist festivals held in Leh itself or one of the nearby gompas, we’ll plan to spend much of the day marvelling at the famous masked dancers, who through plays, music and dance tell the teachings of Guru Rinpoché – the precious jewel. Alternatively, if there are no festive celebrations today, we'll have a whole day to further explore the Ladakhi capital and its stunning surroundings with a chance to take an optional hike in Stok Gorge. This area marks the entrance to Hemis National Park, renowned for its snow leopards, ibex, urial, and blue sheep or bharal. The gorge is the starting point for the much longer trek to Stok Kangri and features remarkable rock formations and diverse plant life. Along the way, we'll pass many mani walls and chortens before returning along the same path with a stop alongside the stream for a picnic lunch before returning to Leh.

Leh – Lamayuru (3,510M): Alchi and the Start of the High Road: Today we depart Leh and start our journey on the exhilarating High Road to Kashmir, stopping at Alchi Monastery (3,100M) en route. Adorned with murals depicting different forms of Buddha, this monastery is distinct from other monasteries in Ladakh in that it sits on flat ground rather than a hilltop. From here, we’ll drive to the magnificent 11th-century Lamayuru Monastery (3,510M). This impressive building belongs to the Red Hat sect of Buddhism and is home to more than 150 monks, housing a rich collection of artefacts, wall paintings, thangas, statues, carpets and an impressive 11-headed, 1,000-eyed image of Chenzing. We continue on to Lamayuru (3,510M), where we will overnight.Driving distance today, 115km, approx. 4 hours.

Lamayuru - Padum (3,669M): Through the Zanskar Valley: Today will be a long day, as we traverse some of the most breathtaking scenery and remote villages that have remained hidden for centuries, and true wilderness, some of which is completely uninhabited. We’ll leave early as we travel through the spectacular Zanskar Valley and on to Padum. Once the capital of the ancient kingdom of Zanskar, Padum is the present-day administrative centre of the Zanskar region of Kargil. Arriving in the late afternoon, we will spend the next two nights in Padum. Driving distance today, 240km, approx 8/9 hours.

In Padum: Karsha and Bardan Monasteries: We’ll have the whole day to explore some of Zanskar’s striking scenery, as well as its religious and historical treasures. With opportunities throughout for small walks and interactions with the local residents of the region, we will visit the nearby monasteries of Karsha and Bardan. Karsha Monastery (4,400m) is situated on the far side of the Stod River and stands majestically on a steep mountainside above Karsha village. Fortress-like Bardan Gompa, a 17th-century Buddhist Monastery, sits atop a rocky crag and belongs to the Dugpa-Kagyud monastic order. It was one of the first monasteries of this sect to be established in Zanskar and the main prayer hall retains some ancient murals.

Padum – Kargil: Journey through the Peaks: Leaving early, we’ll take a scenic drive out of the Zanskar Valley and on to Kargil, the second largest town in Ladakh. If time permits, we will take a stroll around this very Islamic town, with workshops and old merchant stores cramming the packed central area. Driving distance today, 240km, approx 8/9 hours.

Kargil – Srinagar: Sonamarg and Through the Sindh Valley: This morning, we’ll leave early for our drive to Srinagar. En route, we’ll make a brief stop at the Drass War Memorial, built in commemoration of the fallen soldiers from the 1999 conflict, before continuing over the Zoji Pass and onto Sonamarg, meaning "Meadow of Gold" in the Kashmiri language. We should arrive in Sonamarg for lunch, surrounded by Kashmir’s most beautiful mountain countryside. From here, we’ll begin our final drive through the Sindh Valley to Srinagar, a town that is, in many ways, the real highlight of this trip! Sitting at the heart of the Vale of Kashmir lies this extraordinary town, famed for centuries for its clean, clear air, idyllic setting, and lakes. Framed by high-forested hills that rise up in the distance to the snow-capped Himalayas, it’s simply one of the most picturesque places you’re ever likely to visit. On arrival, we’ll transfer by shikaras and check into our beautiful houseboat, which have changed little since the British first built them back in the 19th century. Our houseboat, usually made from cedar wood, is family-owned and operated, therefore providing a wonderful personal touch. Driving distance today, 202km, approx. 5 hours. There may be unavoidable diversions in place on the drive today, which could see the tour diverted through a short 5km tunnel. Please see Key Aspects to Consider in the Key Information section.

In & Around Srinagar: Land of Lakes and Gardens: Often referred to as the ‘Land of Lakes and Gardens’ or the ‘Switzerland of India’, Srinagar is a place of unforgettable natural beauty. The famous gardens have a distinctly Mughal influence as many of them were cultivated by Mughal emperors. The old city, with its narrow streets and ancient mosques, is a wonderful place to explore on foot. We may also take a stroll up to the imposing 18th-century Hari Parbat Fort, built by Emperor Akbar in the 1590s and visible from virtually anywhere in Srinagar. Until recently, this was closed off to the public but it is now open from time to time when the security situation allows it, and a visit here provides some stunning views of the surrounding area. There’s also the opportunity to do some shopping from local hawkers, selling silk, leather, flowers, jewellery, pashminas, etc. They can come to the houseboat on request so you don't need to go far for souvenirs.

In & Around Srinagar: Floating Markets and City Waterways: If you don’t mind an early start then a dawn trip to the floating vegetable market to watch the hustle and bustle of trading on the water, along with the accompanying sunrise, is a truly wonderful experience. Returning to the houseboat for breakfast, we’ll enjoy a trip out on the lakes taking in more of the picturesque gardens, drifting along the narrow waterways and witnessing more of the unique lifestyle that Srinagar offers.

Srinagar – Delhi: Return to Delhi: After a leisurely morning, we’ll fly to Delhi and check into our hotel. Depending on our flight arrival time, there might be a couple of hours free for a last look around before heading out for our farewell dinner.
Tour Ends In Delhi: The tour ends after breakfast at our hotel. Those on the suggested group flight will be transfered to the airport in time for their morning flight.

tourName: Kayaking in the Keralan Backwaters
placesVisited: Alleppey, Pulinkunnu canals, Kavalam island, homestay experience
generalInfo:
Southern India presents a much more peaceful experience when compared with the hectic cities further north and there's no activity that epitomises laid back relaxation more than kayaking on the Keralan backwaters which is why this five day trip is such a joy for all the senses.

The backwaters of Kerala have long been the preserve of traders and farmers with the historic port of Alleppey providing, perhaps, the perfect setting for kayaking on the Keralan backwaters on some of the region's most revered lagoons, lakes and picturesque canals and river systems.

From friendly riverside villages and delicious Keralan cuisine to staying overnight in heritage villages and smaller locally-owned family resorts, this kayaking on the Keralan backwaters holiday has all you need to experience life afloat on some of the most tranquil waterways in the whole of southern India.

dayInfo.description: You arrive at the kayaking jetty, a short distance from the town of Alappuzha, better known by its angelized name Alleppey. Your guide will meet you on the bank of the river and after a short briefing, you set out on the kayaks for a fascinating introduction to this meandering world of water. You pass by coconut palm fringed villages with quaint names ending in suffixes like ‘kery’- a nod to the chieftain of area many centuries ago, or ‘kulam’ a homage to the fresh water ponds families depended on. You will be heading to Champakulam on the banks of the river Pamba which was an important stop on the river route from Kollam to the ancient port of Muziris. Famous for the St Mary’s Basilica which count as one of the oldest churches in India and an offshoot the church established by Thomas the apostle at Niranam. The structure built in the 1100s, still retains decorative elements like lotus’ a very Indian motif, the original rock cross – testament to this being a “Nasrani Christian” church and is a prime example of the East Syriac architectural scheme. In the evening you explore this area with a lot of interesting history. You visit Karumadi Kuttan, a renowned Buddhist pilgrim centre, wherein lies a special Buddha statue that dates back to the 11th century. Made of solid black granite, the entire site is today under the protection of Kerala Archaeology Department. You will be staying at a homestay and your hosts will be happy to share their home and Syrian Christian traditions and more importantly you will indulge in the home cooked delectable cuisine of the region

We start kayaking in the morning and the onslaught of amazing sights continue today with glimpses of emerald green fields or large expanses of water filled paddy fields, children skipping over narrow ‘palams’ or bridges on canals on their way to school, a boatsman herding a flock of ducks in an impossibly narrow wooden canoe, Cormorants on their perches on the river. You may have opportunities to interact with children, women doing their washing on the shore, or even encounter the fishmonger and grocer who sells his wares off his small wooden canoe - calling out to the ladies of the house he knows by name. You will be able to observe at close quarters homes, schools, whitewashed churches, wood worked ambalams or temples with notches for oil lamps that are lit at sunset, the thick foliage of overhanging trees. You break for refreshments along a bund/ dyke at the mouth of the river Pamba as it flows into the ‘kayal’ or lake. The narrow bund separates the paddy fields and the water, between growing seasons the fields are flooded with water to replenish the soil. The coconut palms that frame the narrow strip of land against the reflective waters on either side is the most endearing and iconic sight of the backwaters. You head to a 100 year old traditional home, complete with it original teak ‘arra’ or the granary of the home, around which the home was built. You will also get to wander around the village, interact with the locals as they fish, toddy tap, drink tea at the local chai kada and discuss the latest news with them as they devour the local Malayalam newspaper.
Fond farewells & you will be dropped to Alleppey town.

tourName: Kerala 15 day tour with Backwaters
generalInfo:
South India has something for everyone. Discover a colonial port town, stand in awe of majestic tea covered hills, laze about on the backwaters, explore rural villages, and relax on one of Kerala’s world famous beaches.

Starting from Mumbai, this 15 day tour takes guests through the best of Kerala, the south India state that National Geographic Traveller has named one of the "50 places to see in a lifetime" and "ten paradises of the world." You'll see why when you visit this charming, friendly, and laid-back part of India.

But we’ll also take you further and deeper into south India too. We’ll visit rural Karnataka where you will stay at the family home of Krishna and learn about village life as you spend two days in this coconut and fish filled tropical paradise.

A mix of must-see sights such as the colonial port city of Kochi and the tea plantations of Munnar and numerous opportunities for local interaction make this tour the ideal choice to gain a full picture of the real south India.

Not only that, but, because of our unique business model, 80% of all our tour profits go towards our sister NGO, Reality Gives, which provides quality education programs for underprivileged communities in Mumbai and Delhi.

dayInfo.description: Mumbai: Welcome to the cosmopolitan metropolis of Mumbai! Your tour guide will pick you up from the airport and transfer you to your hotel in Colaba. Depending on your arrival time and how tired you are, you might want to explore the surrounding area on foot on your own or with your guide, seeing places like the Gateway of India, the Prince of Wales Museum and Marine Drive. Over a welcome dinner at a traditional Indian rooftop restaurant, your guide will go over the itinerary for the next 14 action-packed days!

Mumbai: We will travel together to Dharavi, one of Asia’s biggest slums and the heart of small-scale industry in Mumbai. The tour of Dharavi, our company’s award-winning and signature tour, shows a balanced portrayal of life for the less privileged in Mumbai and you will learn about the NGO programs directly supported by your tour. The rest of the day will allow time for some sightseeing of your choice such as Victoria Terminus, Haji Ali Mosque, the view of the city from Malabar Hill as well as the many different, chaotic markets that the city has to offer. You also have an option to take our Bicycle tour in the morning or Food Tour in the evening.

Mumbai/Kochi: We will take a morning flight to Kochi, one of the big cities of Kerala. After checking into the hotel, in the afternoon we will visit Fort Kochi, known for its Dutch, Portuguese, and British colonial architecture. We will explore the area, spending time with some fishermen at the famous Chinese fishing nets and there will be a chance to try pulling the nets yourself!

Kochi: Today we will visit “Jew Town” where the first Jewish people settled in India and Paradesi Synagogue, the first in India. We will also visit the Dutch Palace, gifted to the Cochin Royal Family by the Dutch. In the evening, you’ll attend an amazing Kathakali performance. Kathakali, a 17th century dance-drama that originated in Kerala, will capture you with its elaborate costumes, make-up, and most of all, complicated facial expressions.

Kochi/Munnar: Today we will drive (6-7 hours) to Munnar in the morning. During the long, winding journey to Munnar, you will make several stops where your guide will show you many aspects of domestic and agricultural Keralan village life. We will also visit a toddy shop (liquor made from coconut sap, which you can try) and we will enjoy a delicious sea food lunch (also visited by Anthony Bourdain and Gordon Ramsey). Arriving in Munnar in the late afternoon, from the hustle and bustle of Kochi you’ll barely recognize where you are amidst the rolling mountains, fresh air, and tea plantations stretching as far as the eye can see. You’ll have time to get settled into your guesthouse and explore Munnar a bit on your own. You can go for a short hike or you can sit back and relax with a good book, a nice cup of tea, and enjoy the scenery.

Munnar: Today we’ll do a full day tour in Munnar. We will visit Munnar’s tea museum to really understand what makes this hill station famous and you’ll learn how the tea transforms from a simple leaf to a piping hot cup of chai. We will also visit the very scenic Echo Point and the Rose Garden. In the evening you have an option to watch Kalaripayattu (martial art of Kerala), join a tea tasting event or learn some Kerala recipes at your hotel kitchen with the chef!!

Munnar/Alleppey: Today we’ll continue south from Munnar to Alleppey, home to some of Kerala’s most famous backwaters. Along the way, we’ll stop off at a spice plantation to learn about the ingredients that make Indian cuisine so diverse. If the season allows, we will meet some beekeepers and taste some of the local produce. We’ll arrive in the afternoon, settle into our guesthouse, and your guide can recommend a number of restaurants for dinner this evening after the long journey.

Alleppey: We will begin early in the morning with a visit to a local fish market, where your guide will help you choose delicious seafood to be cooked on board our very own houseboat for lunch! We’ll then make our way to the backwaters and board our kettuvallam (Keralan houseboat). It will be a relaxing day spent cruising along the backwaters, a vast network of lakes, rivers, canals, and lagoons, observing and occasionally visiting some villages and rice farms. We’ll stay overnight on the open water on our houseboat (bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms) and enjoy the Kerala style lunch, dinner and breakfast cooked by our chef on board.

Alleppey/Kovalam: This morning we will check out of the houseboat and will travel to Kovalam (3 to 4 hrs). In the afternoon, you will have free time to relax on the stunning beach or you can partake in water activities, cooking classes, yoga/pilates, ayurvedic treatments and shopping.

Kovalam: Today we will go on a day trip to the very southern tip of India, Kanyakumari, where you will experience some incredible views of the Indian Ocean and Arabian sea. We will get a boat to the 41-metre-tall Thiruvalluvar Statue. In the evening we have the optional visit to Jatayu Park to see the world’s largest bird sculpture.

Kovalam / Overnight Train: Today we will take a day train to Heranjalu Village the home of Krishna, one of the founders of Reality Tours, in the state of Karnataka. We will enjoy the beautiful views of the region from our window when the train passes through 100s of villages, farms of Kerala on the west coast. We will be reaching Byndoor late in the night at 12:30am. On arrival in Byndoor we will get to the home and go to bed.

To day if you wake up early, go for a village walk or Jog around the rice fields and river. We will have breakfast with Krishna’s family in their home, where we will be spending couple of days. Following breakfast your guide will orient you with an introductory walk through the village where you will meet the people and learn about their lives. In the afternoon we will participate in whatever village activities are happening at the time. This could be farming, a celebration, walking to the nearby river that is central to local life, or visiting the nearby coast and backwaters. We will once again join the family for a group dinner in the evening. After dinner, we will visit a live Yakshagana performance, one of the most popular folk theatre forms of Karnataka, and learn about the history and beliefs of this cultural and religious art.

Heranjalu / Train to Mumbai: Today we’ll bid farewell to the family and visit Murudeshwar Shiva Temple, the second tallest Shiva idol in the world, before we travel back to Byndoor in the evening to catch our overnight train to Mumbai leaving at 5pm and arriving the next day at 6am in Mumbai. If you prefer to fly back to Mumbai, that is possible.

Mumbai: Our train will arrive in Mumbai in the early morning and the rest of the day is yours to see or do anything that you missed at the start. You are also welcome to join one of our city tours such as our Market Tour, Local Transport Tour, or Street Food Tour. That evening our trip will sadly come to an end and we'll enjoy a farewell dinner together.
Mumbai ( Departure) : We will transfer you to the airport.

tourName: Kerala and Goa holiday, Backwaters & beaches
generalInfo:
The backwaters of Kerala are unique and unlike anything else in the world. In essence, the backwaters are a network of lakes, canals, estuaries and deltas of forty-four rivers that drain into the Arabian Sea. The backwaters of Kerala are a self supporting eco-system teeming with aquatic life. The canals connect the villages together and are still used for local transport. Over 900 km of this labyrinthine water world is navigable. By visiting Kerala also have opportunities to understand the importance of Yoga and Meditation in life and how Yoga will help to achieve peak of Meditation. Our guest will experience this while they stay in Yoga and Meditation Ashrams. Kerala is the centre of most powerful religious Temples of India and also richest in term of storage of gold and precious gems belongs to erstwhile ruler of the areas. Be the witness of praying ceremony at temples is unique experience for our guest.

Between Kerala and Goa we offer our guest to feel blessed by spent two days at UNESCO World Heritage site HAMPI. At HAMPI, the past comes alive. Whispering winds, magnificent ruins, traces and scents of a bygone era all linger fresh here. And they virtually transport you to a world of kings, battles and long forgotten marvels. This is the world's largest natural open-air museum.

Goa is stretching on the coastline along with Arabian Sea. Interestingly Portuguese ruled Goa and same time their country itself ruled by Spain in late 16 Century.From Deep South to up North there is a row of beautiful beaches and plenty of 16 and 17th Century Catholic Churches were build in Portuguese Baroque style. Apart from this our guest will entertain by Goani families at there home to taking lessons of cooking the Goani traditional food and explore the coastline up North to Deep South with every single beach.

dayInfo.description: Day 1 Arrived at Mumbai international airport, Meet your tour manager who will accompany you on this tour. Transfer to the hotel for rest, Dinner and night stay at hotel. Day 2 Late Breakfast followed transfer to railway station for your first class AC over night train to Tirvananthapuram (Kerala). Lunch and dinner will be serving in train. Day 3 Thiruvananthapuram is the capital of Travancore state in mid 18 century. This city is beautiful seaside built on seven hills. Lunch followed by road to Kovalam (half hour drive). Kovalam has internationally renowned beach. There are three beaches separated by rocky outcroppings. Check in your beach resort and enjoy at your leisure on the beach. Day 4 Early morning to late evening you will be at your leisure on beach and resort, in afternoon if you would like to visit local fishermen’s market we will arrange the visit.

Day 5 Breakfast followed by road to Thekkady (4 hours drive). Thekkady town situated at the border of Periyar National Park. Your stay in eco lodge near the National Park. Day 6 5.30am in the morning start from eco lodge by Jeep, 40 kms scenic drive through the jungle. Reach at River side for breakfast and followed you to visit view point, cardamom plant and processing unit. Local guide will accompany you; return to River side for Lunch followed experience canoeing in the Gavi Lake. Return to lodge for dinner and night stay. Day 7, 8 Breakfast followed by road to Munnar (40 minutes drive). Munnar was the hill resort in British period. This hill town situated 1600 meter above sea level and surrounded with Tea gardens. Your stay in Munnar is unique by learn and practicing for Yoga and Meditation also wondering valleys of Tea gardens.

Day 9 Breakfast followed by leaving to Alleppey (4 hours drive). Alleppey is gifted with great natural beauty with the Laccadive Sea on its west. The city has a network of lakes, lagoons and fresh water rivers. The richness of the coastal Alleppey waters is expressed annually in the blooming and consequent deposit of a huge quantity of fishes and prawns on the Alleppey coast. After arrival check in the house boat with nice furnished rooms with attach bath and proceed to explore the back water life, Paddy farms and villages by passing through in house boat. Dinner and night stay in house boat. Day 10 Lunch followed one hour drive to Cochin airport for flight to Bangalore. Arrive at Bangalore airport and transfer to railway stations after lunch for 1st class AC train to Hampi. Day 11, 12 Two days tour of Hampi on bicycle or horse carte. Hampi is UNESCO World Heritage Site in India. Hampi”s spectacular setting is dominated by river Tungabhadra, craggy hill ranges and open plains, with widespread physical remains. The sophistication of the varied urban, royal and sacred systems is evident from more then 1600 surviving remains that include forts, riverside features, royal and sacred complexes, temples, shrines, pillared halls, Mandaps, memorial structures, gateways, defense check posts, stables, water structures, ect.

Day 13, 14 Early morning arrive at Madgaon (Goa) and transfer to one of the best beach resort in North Goa. In these two days and nights you will be totally beach person you can never have enough of beaches in your life. Goa is a beach paradise of India. Armbol, Ashvem, Morjim, Anjuna and Candolim are the perfect beaches for beach holiday and water sports. Day15, 16 South Goa is the reliable source to estimate the rich Portuguese architectural legacy left behind. This part of Goa offering some of the best beaches for romantic escape and authentic villages that are quite the place for rest and relaxing. Colva, Benualim, Bogmalo, Verca, Patnem and Mobor are the beaches of south Goa. You will stay in beach resorts in South Goa and visit these beaches in two days. Day 17 Breakfast followed by leaving to Panjim airport for fly to Mumbai. Arrival at Mumbai airport and transfer to hotel. This day will organize according to your international flight sechdule.

tourName: Kerala and Golden Triangle tour in India
generalInfo:
The Indian Sub-Continent has stark regional differences as you move from North to South. The culture, the food as well as the landscape differs from North to South. We have tried to cover interesting highlights of these places to give you the real feel of the incredibly diverse India. Together with fascinating destinations of North India, the tour covers the state of Kerala in the South - known for its Backwaters, Ayurveda, Food and Culture.

Some of the prominent activities are highlighted below:

1. Visit the UNESCO World Heritage Sites in Delhi and experience the imperial and Mughal architecture.
2. Visit one of the 7 wonders of the world Taj Mahal and discover the magic of white marble at Agra.
3. Energize yourself at Morning Taj Facing Yoga Session at Agra.
4. Enjoy a guided tour of the Pink City.
5. Heena Painting on Hands and Feet in Jaipur.
6. Witness the architectural marvels of Cochin.
7. Enjoy the traditional and classical dance form – Kathakali.
8. Feel the adrenaline rush while watching the ancient art from- Kalarippayattu.
9. Experience the beauty of nature while relaxing in the traditional private Houseboat.
10. Marvel at the beautiful Akshardham and Lotus Temples - amongst the most magnificent in India.

dayInfo.description: Arrive at New Delhi International Airport. Receive a warm welcome from our representative and get transferred to the hotel. On arrival complete the check-in formalities and enjoy the rest of the day at leisure.

After breakfast, proceed for a sightseeing tour of the city with your guide. • Drive past or if you wish you may visit Red Fort • Drive past or if you wish you may take a stop at Raj Ghat – the cremation site of Mahatma Gandhi. • Visit Agrasen ki Baoli (ancient water reservoir) • Visit Jama Masjid • Visit Chandni Chowk – ‘the Moonlight Square and enjoy a Cycle Rickshaw Ride which takes you through the narrow streets of the Chandni Chowk. • Visit Lakshmi Narayan Temple • Drive Past India Gate – The All India War Memorial • Also pass by the Rashtrapati Bhavan (formerly the viceroy's residence) and the Parliament House. • Enjoy a special lunch at a local restaurant. • Visit Humayun's Tomb • Visit Qutub Minar - A UNESCO World Heritage Site.
After breakfast, proceed to visit the Akshardham Temple – A true beauty on its own. Later, visit the Lotus Temple and feel the calm within.

After a hearty breakfast, travel to Agra (222Km, 5-hour drive). On arrival meet our representative and check into the hotel. Enjoy the rest of the day at leisure. In the evening enjoy a Special Dinner at Taj Facing Rooftop Restaurant.

Early morning visit Taj Mahal during Sunrise (As fuel-based vehicles are not permitted in the vicinity of Taj Mahal, you will head to the Taj Mahal gate by a Battery operated Bus. (Friday Closed). •After breakfast, visit Agra Fort - An Epitome of the Mughal Dynasty •Visit Itmad-Ud-Daulah’s Tomb •Late afternoon go for Mughal Heritage Kachhpura Village walk with high tea OPTIONAL TOURS: •Mohabbat the Taj Show- You can watch the famous Mohabbat the Taj show, presented by the Sanskritik Natyashala. It is a series of play depicting the saga of love.

Early Morning, Enjoy the Taj Mahal Facing Yoga Session. After breakfast, check out from the hotel and travel to Jaipur (240Km, 5-hour drive). En-route visit Fatehpur Sikri - A city predominantly made of red sandstone and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. On arrival meet our representative and check into the hotel and enjoy the rest of the day at leisure.

After breakfast, proceed for full day Jaipur sightseeing tour with your Guide. •Visit Amber Fort – One of the most magnificent palaces in India. (The Fort is perched on a hill, so to reach there; you may enjoy a Jeep ride in Amber fort. •Visit Jantar Mantar – largest stone astronomical observatory in the world. •Visit to City Palace and Museum– Built by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh during the years 1729 to 1732. •Photo Stop Hawa Mahal – built by Maharaja Sawai Pratap Singh in the year 1799. •In the evening enjoy Heena Painting on Hands and Feet.

After breakfast, check out from the hotel and get transferred to Jaipur Airport and fly to Cochin – The Queen of the Arabian Sea. On arrival receive a warm welcome from our representative and get transferred to the hotel. Complete the check-in formalities and enjoy the rest of the day leisure.

After breakfast, go on a sightseeing tour of the city with your guide. (Cochin Monuments are closed on Friday). • Visit Jewish Synagogue: (Closed on Fri and Sat) • Explore the Fort Kochi area • Visit the St. Francis Church • Witness the Chinese Fishing Nets - Most Photographed Sight in Kochi. • Visit Dutch Palace & Dutch cemetery • Visit the spice and vegetable market. • Visit the Bishop's House Road, • Visit Union Club building • Visit Santa Cruz Basilica. • Visit Ernakulam Shiva Temple • Enjoy special lunch at a local restaurant in Kochi. • enjoy the folk dance form of Kathakali • Experience the ancient art form of Kalarippayattu

After breakfast check out from the hotel and travel to Alappuzha (53 Km, 2-hour drive). Receive a warm welcome from our representative and check in to the Houseboat and set out on an enchanting overnight backwater cruise in a traditionally decorated houseboat.
After breakfast, check out from Houseboat and travel to Cochin International Airport to board a flight for your home town.

tourName: Kerala and Karnataka small group holiday, India
placesVisited: Bangalore, Summer Palace, Hassan Hoysala temples, Coorg, Mysore, Kabini, Nagarahole National Park, Calicut, Kalarippayattu demonstration, Cheruthuruthy artisan workshops, Kumarakum, Allepey, Houseboat cruise, Vaikom, Kochi
generalInfo:
While Kerala is becoming more widely known to savvy travellers, there is far more to India’s most literate state than simply beautiful beaches and superb cuisine. Not that there’s anything wrong with them! But if you’re interested in a more immersive take on life in this part of southern India, then this fascinating two-week adventure will surely pique your curiosity.

Departing from Bangalore, the ‘Garden City’, you’ll drive via the ancient Hoysala temples in Hassan to Coorg, for an overnight stay at an eco lodge on the edge of a plantation. This coffee and spice-growing region sees few visitors, and is therefore wonderfully picturesque and tranquil.

From Coorg you’ll move on to the renowned city of Mysore, to explore its hilly scenery, markets and palace, before a further drive to Kabini. This will be your base for a safari into the Nagarahole National Park, where over 250 species of bird populate the trees, looking down on Asian elephants, Samba deer and Langur monkeys.

Cultural highlights of the trip follow in swift succession. In Calicut you’ll visit a Keralan gymnasium for a demonstration of kalarippayattu, a type of martial art. In Cheruthuruthy, you’ll meet a host of local artisans, and perhaps take in a show at a performing arts centre. Then, arriving in Allepey, you’ll take a dreamy houseboat cruise through the backwaters and channels of the coastal plains. Didn't we tell you this trip was a little bit special?

Please note from 2019 this trip will depart directly from the airport to Hassan on day one without a stop in Bangalore.

dayInfo.description: Tour Starts in Bengaluru (Bangalore); Drive to Hassan: The joining point of the trip will be at Bangalore International Airport this morning, the capital of Karnataka. We drive straight out of the city westwards towards Hassan, named after the Hindu goddess Hassanamba and famous for the many temples and monuments in the area. After a chance to relax and freshen up at our comfortable resort, we head out to nearby Shravanabelagola after lunch to see the Gomateswara temple. This Jain temple is famous for the Bahubali Statue, supposedly the tallest monolithic stone statue in the world at 58 feet in height, carved out of a single block of granite. Driving distance 210km, 4 hours approx.

In Hassan: Today we spend the full day exploring the striking Hoysala temples at Belur and Halebid, constructed when this region was part of the Hoysala Empire between the 11th and 14th centuries. The sheer quantity of the carvings in itself would be enough to impress, but when combined with the masterful detail and intricacy of the actual carvings, these structures will be sure to leave a lasting impression. We return to our resort late this afternoon for a second night.

Hassan - Coorg: Departing Hassan this morning we head to Coorg, the rarely visited coffee and spice growing region. Not only is Coorg a stunningly beautiful area but it is also home to the Kodavas, whose origin is believed to be in Kashmir or even in Kurdistan. Here we stay in a lodge perched on top of hill surrounded by lush plantations and panoramic views of the tropical rainforests of the Western Ghats. This afternoon we will have a tour around a plantation with the local staff for a chance to learn about their work and the coffee, spices and teas they grow.

Coorg - Mysore: The morning we have set aside some time to relax and enjoy the tranquillity of this beautiful spot before we drive on to Mysore, one of the country’s cultural gems. If all goes smoothly on our journey, we should have time on arrival for an orientation walk before dinner.

In & Around Mysore: Long known for its festivals and palaces, Mysore can boast one of the most opulent and iconic buildings in Southern India, the stunningly ornate Mysore Palace. Originally built in the 14th Century, the palace of today is the result of a significant redesign by the British architect, Henry Irwin. A wonderful fusion of European and Indian influences, the palace is still the official residence of the Wodeyar dynasty, the royal family of Mysore. We take a walking tour around the city this morning, taking in the palace and the markets before driving out to the hills that surround the city. The Chamundi Hills are home to the impressive Sri Chamundeswari Temple and the sacred Nandi bull, one of the largest of its kind and carved from a single piece of rock. We’ll also stop off at the nearby impressive Srirangapatnam with its 18th Century remains of Tipu Sultan’s Fort, Palace and Mausoleum.

Mysore - Kabini: Today’s journey takes us on to Kabini, our base on the edge of the Nagarahole National Park. This afternoon, once we have settled into our rooms, there will be the chance to head out on safari to spot some of the local wildlife that includes Asian Elephant, Samba Deer, Langur Monkeys plus over 250 species of birds.

Kabini - Calicut: Before breakfast this morning we will embark on another safari in the Nagarahole National Park in the hope that we may see tiger or leopard, the two species of big cat that are resident in the park. Later we depart for Calicut, across the border in Kerala, an important trading centre and the place where Vasco de Gama first set foot on the Indian Subcontinent in 1498. This evening should be a tour highlight as we visit a Kalari, a special Keralan gymnasium, to witness kalarippayattu - a distinct martial arts discipline dating back over 1500 years. Driving distance 138km, 4.5 hrs approx.

Calicut - Cheruthuruthy: Today we head south towards Cheruthuruthy on the Nila River. After a traditional lunch we will have the opportunity to meet some local artisans, including potters, weavers and toymakers. This evening there may be the opportunity to watch a performance of local folk song and dance.

Cheruthuruthy - Kumarakom: We hope to make an early morning visit to a Kalamandalam – a performing arts centre - which prides itself on maintaining and teaching the great arts and traditions of Keralan society for which it is famed. We then drive south towards the famous Keralan backwaters and will spend the night in Kumarakom. Driving distance 160km, 4hrs approx.

Kumarakom - Alleppey – Backwater Cruise: This morning we drive to Alleppey to take to the waters of this most beautiful and unique of landscapes. Boarding our traditional houseboats, we will spend the next two days cruising the waterways and channels that honeycomb the coastal plains running parallel to the Arabian Sea. A unique ecosystem that is home to a rich variety of aquatic life, the backwaters present us with a time-honoured image of an India long forgotten. Scattered villages survive amongst the labyrinthine channels much as they have for generations. Kettuvallams, Keralan houseboats, once negotiated these canals carrying rice, grain and even royalty through the backwaters. Today they provide us with an ideal way to appreciate the tranquillity and tradition of this part of southern India. We’ll pass isolated communities, and gardens of hibiscus and vegetables, as well as hopping off the boats to visit interesting sights en route. Our evenings will be spent moored up besides the lapping shores of these idyllic backwaters. Having two nights aboard our private chartered houseboats enables us to venture further into the backwaters - catching a glimpse of life rarely seen by foreign visitors to Kerala.

Alleppey - Kochi (Cochin): Disembarking our boats this morning, we drive to Kochi, the glittering ‘Queen of the Arabian Sea’. The oldest European settlement in India, Kochi is a vibrant mix of Arab, Chinese, European and Indian influences and home to the oldest church and synagogue in the country. Built on commerce the city began to prosper with the arrival of Jewish and Arab traders. With the later arrival of the Portuguese, and then the Dutch and English, Kochi went on to become a vibrant settlement - incorporating a rare fusion of European and Asian traditions and styles. Today we will take a walking tour around the historic old streets of Fort Cochin and the red-tiled riverfront of Mattancherry, once the old capital’s main market area and the centre of the Malabar spice trade. The city is also famous for its Chinese fishing nets, which are made from teak and bamboo. The huge cantilevered nets are a legacy of some of the earliest visitors to the Malabar Coast. Similarly, the city is renowned for its Santa Cruz Basilica and the Church of St. Francis, the oldest European church in India, where the body of Vasco de Gama was held before being returned to Portugal. This evening we will enjoy a sunset cruise on the harbour before learning to cook a traditional Keralan dinner with a local family.

Kochi – Vaikom - Kochi: Today we head into rural Kerala to get a feel for everyday village life, spending time with the people of Vaikom. There’ll be opportunities to witness and perhaps even take part in various activities including rope and basket-making, toddy-tapping, mat-weaving and for the more active, canoeing and coconut-tree climbing! This is a great way to experience life beyond the beach resorts for which Kerala is usually known. Returning to the town tonight, we’ll enjoy our final dinner together and a chance to reflect on our experiences.
Tour Ends in Kochi (Cochin): The tour ends after breakfast at our hotel. Those on our suggested flights will depart early for the airport.

tourName: Kerala and Karnataka tour, India
placesVisited: Mysore, Nagarhole National Park, Coonoor, Cochin, Optional activities include: safari tours, cooking classes and guided nature walks
generalInfo:
This fourteen day tailor made tour of Karnataka, Tamil Nadu and Kerala tickles the senses and opens the eyes to some of southern India's most exciting cultural and natural settings. From Mysore to Cochin by way of Nagarhole National Park, the Nilgiris and Kotagiri, this tour is as enlightening as exclusive with a private car and driver ensuring you travel in style from one hand-picked property to the next.

Our company has an intimate knowledge of both Karnataka, Tamil Nadu and Kerala which is why we've been able to craft this tailor made itinerary to get you off the beaten track and into the true character of southern India. Local assistance along the way and genuinely welcoming hosts ensure you'll get to experience as much or as little as you like with cooking, safaris and sightseeing all ideal for making the most of your time over the course of ten days.

Adapting the tour below is entirely up to you. We've tried to ensure a balance between free time, optional activities and cultural immersion with a couple of nights in each location ideal for those who like to get to know a place, and the local people, rather than whizzing from one site to the next.

We think that the best time to visit Kerala is either side of the rainy season that tends to last from May through to the end of July. Christmas and New Year are extremely special times to visit.

dayInfo.description: Depart the UK. Flights can be booked by us and therefore the whole holiday will be protected under our ATOL.

Morning and afternoon vehicle safaris in National Park.

Cochin city tour (guided).
Transfer to Cochin Airport to catch flight home. Or extend the trip with some time in the Backwaters or the beach.

tourName: Kerala and tigers tour in India
generalInfo:
This magical 11-day tour of India provides you with an unbeatable mix of landscapes and experiences. From the Dutch forts of Cochin to the high-altitude tea estate of Kolukkumulai, you are sure to experience the wonders India has to offer.

Starting in Cochin, you will be treated to wonderful Dutch-inspired hotel, an elegant base from which to explore the city and with its own superb dining experience not to be missed. Once you have found your feet, it's off into the mountains where you will discover the pristine air of a high-altitude tea plantation. Check into the original staff quarters, roll up your sleeves and get ready to learn about top-quality tea production. Enjoy a breath-taking hike up India's second highest peak (don't worry - we'll send you with a picnic) and soak up the fresh air, staggering views and tranquillity of the mountains.

From mountains to rivers - your next stop takes you to the twisting waterways of Kerala. Explore this lush region and its vast network of channels from the comfort of an original wooden houseboat.

Head back to civilisation with a trip to India's most famous city - Delhi. Spend some time soaking up the bustle before heading back into the wilderness to Bandhavgarh National Park. Three days of thrilling game drives should reward with sightings of birdlife, wild boar, cheetas and bison, but most importantly India's highest density of tigers.

Your luxurious park lodge provides the perfect base with a tranquil outdoor swimming pool and beautiful sympathetically built eco-cottages which blend into the forest background.

At the end of your stay you will return briefly to Delhi before making your return flight armed with promises of returning.

Internal travel arrangements are included, along with a guide and private chauffeur driven car for transfers. Internal Flights are included however international flights are excluded in the price but can be quoted for separately and any additional activities can be added or tweaked to your liking. Meals are as specified in the itinerary.

dayInfo.description: Your chauffeur will collect you from Cochin airport and transfer you to your hotel in a private car. Once you have checked in, enjoy a half day tour of this beautiful city. Believed to be the oldest European settlement in India, there are a number of fascinating architectural sights plus historic Fort Cochin to enjoy before returning to your luxurious hotel to unwind.

Leave the city and head into the countryside in a jeep as you travel a winding dirt track up to the highest tea plantation in the world. Learn about the history of tea making and its modern incarnation and how the high altitude produces the finest quality tea. You'll stay in the well-equipped guest room in the heart of the estate. (B, L, D)
Enjoy a full day surrounded by mountains as you hike on a full day trek up the second highest peak in the Western Ghats. A guide and picnic lunch are provided. (B, L, D)
Time to try your hand at tea-making as you roll up your sleeves and have a go at creating your own blend. (B, L, D)

Today you will take to the water to board a houseboat in Alleppey. From your vantage point on deck, explore the lagoons, lakes, canals and estuaries which make up the 900km of backwater of Kerala. Experience the local tradition of coir rope making and fishing and discover the importance of these canals for washing, transport and food. Spend the night on board your boat and let the peaceful sounds of water lull you to sleep. (B, L, D)
Enjoy a full day exploring the waterways before returning to dry land late afternoon and heading onto the bustling city of Delhi. (B)

Hop on a plane to visit Bandhavgargh National Park, home to the highest density of tigers in India. For the next three days you will enjoy a variety of game drives across the broken hilly terrain and grassy swamps spotting not just tiger, but the incredible variety of wildlife and bird species which live in this beautiful National Park. (B, L, D)
Return to Delhi and spend the day exploring the city. Speak to us about adding in a guided tour. (B)
You will be collected from your hotel and driven to the airport for your return flight. (B)

tourName: Kerala bespoke tour
generalInfo:
Experience the splendid monuments, food, culture, history, palaces, and local traditions during this trip. Enjoy the local delicacies along with the serene beauty of God’s Own Country and feel the nature at its best.

Trip Highlights:

1) Visit the beautiful sites of Cochin and learn about the amalgamation of history and modernization.
2) Visit the beautiful Tea Estates in Munnar and feel the essence of Tea in the air.
3) Visit the Spice Plantations of Thekkady and learn how spices are grown
4) Relax on a Traditional private Houseboat and feel the beauty of backwaters.
5) Take a stroll on the beautiful beach of Mararikulam and feel at peace.

dayInfo.description: Arrive at Cochin International Airport. Receive a warm welcome by our representative and get transferred to the hotel. On arrival complete the check-in formalities and enjoy the rest of the day at leisure.

After breakfast, go on a sightseeing tour of the city with your guide. (Cochin Monuments are closed on Friday). • Visit Jewish Synagogue: (Closed on Fri and Sat) • Explore the Fort Kochi area • Visit the St. Francis Church • Witness the Chinese Fishing Nets - Most Photographed Sight in Kochi. • Visit Dutch Palace & Dutch cemetery • Visit the spice and vegetable market. • Visit the Bishop's House Road, • Visit Union Club building • Visit Santa Cruz Basilica. • Visit Ernakulam Shiva Temple • Enjoy special lunch at a local restaurant in Kochi. • enjoy the folk dance form of Kathakali • Experience the ancient art form of Kalarippayattu
After breakfast, check out from the hotel and travel to Munnar (130Km, 4-hour drive). On arrival receive a warm welcome and complete the check-in formalities and enjoy the rest of the day at leisure.
After breakfast, go on a sightseeing tour of the city with your guide. • Visit Mattupetty Dam • Visit Eravikulam National Park • Visit Tea Museum • Visit Kundala Lake • Visit Echo Point

After breakfast, visit the Kolukkumalai Tea Estate and enjoy a guided tour of the Tea Factory along with a hot cup of tea made from the freshly plucked tea leaves. The ride to Kolukkumalai is very bumpy but scenic.

After breakfast, check out from the hotel and travel to Thekkady (100Km, 4-hour drive). On arrival receive a warm welcome and complete the check-in formalities and rest for a while. Later, Go for a guided tour of Spice Plantations, Visit the Kumily Spice Market. We can also arrange a cooking class with local family for those interested in learning local food.

Early morning go on a Jungle hike in Thekkady. Also enjoy boat cruise in the national park. You can spot various species of animals and birds during the hike and boat cruise. Rest of the day at leisure.

After breakfast, check out from the hotel and travel to Alappuzha (140Km, 4-hour drive). On arrival receive a warm welcome and check in to the luxurious Houseboat. Relax on the deck of Houseboat and enjoy the serene beauty of God’s Own Country.

After breakfast, check out from the Houseboat and travel to Mararikulam (18Km, 30 minutes’ drive). On arrival receive a hearty welcome and complete the check-in formalities and enjoy the rest of the day at leisure.
After breakfast, take a stroll at the beautiful beach of Mararikulam and enjoy the day at leisure.
After breakfast, check out from the hotel and travel to Cochin International Airport (73Km, 2-hour drive) to board the flight for your home town.

tourName: Kerala budget holiday, tailor made
placesVisited: Cochin, Homestay experiences, Munnar hill station, Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary, Kadathanadan Kalari Centre, Exclusive backwaters houseboat, Munroe Island, Varkala beach resort, Optional yoga and Pilates sessions
generalInfo:
Kerala’s calling – and you don’t need to break the bank to answer. One of the best ways to experience this relaxed part of India is using homestays. This trip uses a few handpicked homestays, as well as guest houses and a houseboat to give you a taste of the area.

And what a taste. Enjoy the home advantage of home-cooked meals. In a region that’s celebrated for its cuisine, gorge on gorgeous coconut-based pancakes, rice dishes and desserts, marinated fish, biriyanis, and vegetarian curries.

This trip is run by an operator with over two decades experience organising Kerala holidays and can be tailor made to you.

You could start with Cochin and Fort Cochin, Kerala’s colourful harbourside city, as an appetiser, before getting out into nature.

You’ll have your own driver taking you around for some of the trip – a little luxury that’s incredibly helpful when it comes to getting out of the city. This way you can be driven up inland to Munnar hill station and Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary in comfort – and then down towards the coast to explore the backwaters around Kollam and on to the beachy regions of southern Kerala.

No trip to this area is complete without a stay on a houseboat – the region is famous for the converted river barges on its backwaters that have been converted into idiosyncratic floating hotels.

It’s great to end your trip at a beach resort – and there’s no better place than Varkala beach – one of the best sandy stretches in Kerala. The beach has a spring that’s thought to have healing properties. Whether you find these or not, ending your trip here will have you feeling fully restored.

dayInfo.description: Depart the UK. Flights can be booked by us and therefore the whole holiday will be protected under our ATOL.
Arrive Cochin Airport and transfer to the harbour city of Cochin. Two nights at Walton's Homestay.
Enjoy a city tour to discover historic Fort Cochin and in the evening experience the Kerala art form of Kathakali.
Transfer by car to the hill station of Munnar. Two nights at Royal Mist homestay.
Visit a tea plantation, factory and museum.
Transfer by car to Thekkady (Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary) visiting a spice plantation on the way. Two nights at Wildernest.
In the morning take a soft trek into the forest. Later visit Kadathanadan Kalari Centre to see a display of the oldest martial art.
Transfer to the backwaters and board your exclusive houseboat just before lunch. Spend the rest day relaxing, eating and being looked after by the attentive staff. Overnight on board the houseboat.
Transfer to the southern backwaters near Kollam. Two nights at Munroe Island Homestay.
Explore this off the beaten track area with your hosts - by foot or boat.
Transfer to the beach resort of Varkala. Three nights at Deshadan Resort.

Varkala is Kerala’s second most popular beach resort. There is a string of bars and small restaurants along the cliff top and a variety of shops and tailors in the village as well as a temple and a cultural.
Day at leisure.
Transfer to Trivandrum airport for your flight home.

tourName: Kerala classic 14 day tour
generalInfo:
•Accommodation as specified in the itinerary on Double sharing basis for 13 Nights
•Daily buffet breakfast at all the hotels
•All Meals (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner) whilst stay at Houseboat
•Single entry to the monuments
•All transfers and excursions using 1 AC Vehicle
•Services of an English speaking local Guide as per the itinerary (on private basis)
•Kathakali dance show in Cochin
•Spice plantation in Periyar
•Assistance on arrival and departure transfers
•All applicable taxes on hotel & transport
•Govt. service tax

dayInfo.description: COCHIN Upon arrival in Cochin airport, you will be met by our representative and will be provided assisted transfer to your hotel. Upon arrival check in to the Hotel Spend the rest of the day at leisure . Overnight at the hotel. Day 2 Today you will start your day with a half day city tour of the city. You will first proceed to visit the oldest Jewish Synagogue in India, built in 1568; it was destroyed by the Portuguese and rebuilt by the Dutch a century later. From the Jewish Synagogue you will visit Chinese fishing nets. In the evening enjoy a classical Indian dance show - Kathakali.

MUNNAR Today morning after breakfast, you will be transferred in your private vehicle to Munnar Upon arrival in Munnar, check-in at the hotel. Munnar is the nature-lover’s paradise. Snuggling in the green and serene Kannan Devan Hills lies the quiet and restful resort of Munnar. Panoramic views of low-flying clouds and mist filled valleys make it a pretty little heaven with a cool bracing climate. It was opened up out of virgin forests a century ago by pioneering planters. Within its remote and elderly churches - gracious, stone-structures with ancient chandeliers and rosewood pews. A little beyond lies Anaimudi, South India's highest peak. Spend the evening at leisure.

THEKKADY Today morning after breakfast, you will be transferred in your private vehicle to Thekkady (approx. 05 Hrs). Upon arrival in Thekkady, check-in at the hotel. In the evening we visit The Kerala Kalari Centre which is a great place to witness the ancient Kalaripayattu martial dance performed and practised by dedicated local swordsmen. Day 06:THEKKADY In the morning proceed for a guided walk through spice plantation to see the cultivation of cardamom, pepper, vanilla and coffee. In the afternoon proceed for boat ride at the Lake Periyar. Among the animals found here are gaur (the largest of the world's wild oxen), elephant, wild pig, sambar, barking deer, mouse deer, the rare and endangered lion-tailed macaque, the Nilgiri langur, the common langur and the bonnet macaque, porcupine, Malabar squirrel, wild dog and tiger. Evening is at leisure.

KUMARAKOM Upon arrival in Kumarakom, check-in at the hotel.. Located on the Southern coast of India enjoys a well-balanced tropical climate. Nature has composed its magic to perfection here. A million verdant coconut palms lining the rivers lean to examine its reflections on the glassy rivers. Everywhere, nature is at its best. Blooming forth in perfumes of flowers. In the riot of colours of multi-hued birds. In the fresh, succulent and bountiful freshwater

ALLEPPEY Also called Alappuzha, Alleppey is a pleasant easy-going market town surrounded by coconut plantations. Climb aboard the traditional kettuvallams (riceboats) converted into houseboats with bedrooms and attached toilets. Originally these boats were used as ferries to carry rice. Cruise through the backwaters of Kerala. Houseboat is one of the 50 “must do” things as described by the National Geographic Traveller magazine. The backwater cruise through the narrow canals that criss-cross a typical Kerala Village, rich with green paddy fields and verdant coconut trees and is a thrilling experience. The boat cruise takes you to small islets tucked away amidst those waters where you get glimpses of village at the best of its serenity and innocence. Lunch and dinner will be served on board. Overnight on board.

MARARI Enjoy 3-4 days relaxing on the Keralan coastline with lush food,sunsets and ambience staying in a beach cottage at a gorgeous 4 star beach resort anc completely unwind before heading back home on Day 14

tourName: Kerala cultural holiday, tailor made
generalInfo:
This enriching journey through Kerala is perfect for travellers seeking authentic cultural immersion, scenic natural beauty, and meaningful local experiences. Ideal for those who enjoy a mix of gentle adventure, lush green landscapes, and engaging traditions, this trip offers a deep dive into the rhythm of South India—from serene backwaters and tea-covered hills to vibrant temple towns and heritage streets. Whether you're a curious first-timer or a returning explorer, this itinerary promises connection, comfort, and discovery at every turn.

Trip Highlights
• Culture & Heritage – Discover the colonial lanes of Fort Kochi, walk through bustling temple towns like Madurai, and explore royal palaces and ancient synagogues rich with stories of the past.
• Spiritual & Sacred – Witness soul-stirring rituals at the Meenakshi Temple, partake in a twilight ceremony, and feel the quiet reverence of Kerala’s sacred spaces and historic churches.
• Immersive Experiences – Trek to high-altitude tea plantations, cruise through Kerala’s serene backwaters, and enjoy guided walks through vibrant flower and spice markets.
• Local Encounters – Visit spice farms, learn from artisans, cook with local families, and engage with traditional practices like Kalaripayattu and Kathakali for a deeper cultural connection.
• Nature & Wellness – Unwind in boutique eco-stays nestled in tea estates and jungles, enjoy optional Ayurvedic treatments, and embrace Kerala’s slow-paced, nature-rich living.

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Cochin to begin the journey. Arrive at Cochin International Airport and transfer to a boutique hotel in historic Forte Kochi. Unwind amidst colonial-era streets and breezy cafés. Meals: Breakfast. Overnight at Forte Kochi

Kochi – Munmnar Journey into the misty hills of Munnar, a charming hill station in Kerala known for its rolling tea plantations, cool climate, and colonial charm. Check into your eco-lodge nestled amidst lush greenery, offering tranquil views of the surrounding landscape. Spend the afternoon at leisure or take an optional gentle walk through the serene trails winding through tea-covered slopes. In the evening, visit a nearby Tea Museum located within a working plantation, and discover the fascinating journey of tea—from leaf to cup—through an engaging demonstration of traditional processing methods. Meals: Breakfast. Overnight at Lockhart Bungalow

Munnar (into the Misty Hills) Start your day with an early morning 2.5-hour guided trek to Kolukkumalai, home to one of the world’s highest tea plantations. Enjoy breathtaking views of the Western Ghats bathed in golden morning light. Return to your hotel for a well-earned lunch. In the afternoon, set out by car to explore the region’s scenic highlights—breathe in the crisp air at Echo Point, admire the unique shola-grassland ecosystem of Eravikulam National Park (home to the endangered Nilgiri Tahr), and soak in the serenity of Kundala Lake, framed by rolling hills and cherry blossoms. Meals: Breakfast. Overnight at Lockhart Bungalow

Munnar to Madurai Drive across the scenic Western Ghats into the vibrant temple city of Madurai. As dusk settles, explore the bustling tailor market—an energetic stretch where hundreds of tailors work side by side, crafting garments with impressive speed and skill. It's a unique glimpse into the city’s thriving textile culture. Later, step into the spiritual heart of Madurai for the night-time closing ceremony at the 3,000-year-old Sri Meenakshi Amman Temple. Witness an age-old ritual where the deity of Lord Shiva is ceremoniously carried in a procession to his consort Meenakshi’s shrine, accompanied by drummers, chants, and oil lamps—an unforgettable and deeply immersive cultural experience. Meals: Breakfast. Overnight at Heritage Madurai

Madurai Start your day with an early morning walking tour through Madurai’s lively streets—stroll past vibrant fruit and vegetable markets, watch locals create intricate rangolis at their doorsteps, see cows being milked, and soak in the aroma of fresh filter coffee and masala tea at roadside tea stalls. Return to your hotel for breakfast, then continue to the colorful flower bazaar and the historic Mari Amman Water Tank, from where sand was once extracted by kings to build the city’s grand temple and palace. In the evening, explore the elegant Thirumalai Nayak Palace and the sacred temple precincts, ending your day with a curated street food tour through the flavors of Madurai. Meals: Breakfast. Overnight at Heritage Madurai

Madurai to Periyar Cross back into Kerala and check into your jungle lodge in Periyar, a gateway to the Periyar Tiger Reserve—one of India’s most celebrated wildlife sanctuaries, known for its elephants, rich birdlife, and scenic lake. After lunch, explore a local spice plantation and discover the secrets behind Kerala’s world-famous spices. In the evening, enjoy a captivating performance of Kalaripayattu, Kerala’s ancient martial art that blends power, agility, and storytelling. Meals: Breakfast. Overnight at Spice Village
