Departure to Delhi And just like that, it’s time to head home. Bags packed, hearts full, and memories to last a lifetime.

tourName: Ladakh tour in India
placesVisited: Delhi, Leh, Spitok, Phyang, Tikse, Hemis, Shey, Nubra Valley, Khardung La Pass, Hundar, Diskit, Alchi, Uletokpo, Sonamarg, Zoji La Pass, Drass Valley, Sindh Valley, Thajiwas Glacier, Srinagar, Gulmarg
generalInfo:
Venture on an unforgettable journey through Ladakh, where breathtaking landscapes, ancient monasteries, and rich cultural traditions come together in a truly immersive experience. Starting in Delhi, you'll travel to the remote Himalayan region, exploring Leh’s monasteries, Nubra Valley’s sand dunes, and the serene beauty of Pangong Lake.

Crossing high-altitude passes, witness the untouched beauty of Mirpal Tso and YaYa Tso, and visit Hanle, India’s first Dark Sky Reserve, for unparalleled stargazing. Connect with Changpa nomads at Tso Moriri, gaining insights into their way of life and Pashmina wool production. From the sacred monasteries of Alchi and Lamayuru to the remote wilderness of Tso Kar, this adventure blends spiritual discovery with stunning natural scenery. This itinerary is a perfect mix of culture, history, and nature, and offers an authentic glimpse into one of India’s most fascinating regions.

dayInfo.description: Delhi - Arrive in Delhi and transfer to the hotel. The rest of the day is free to relax or explore the city. Overnight Radisson Blu Hotel or similar.

Leh - Early morning transfer to the airport to fly to Leh, in the remote region of Ladakh. The afternoon is free to relax and acclimatise to the altitude, and a little later we take a stroll to Leh market known for its traditional crafts and souvenirs. Overnight Ladakh Eco Resort or similar. (BLD)

Spitok - Phyang - Spend today exploring some of the sights of Leh. First, we visit the Shankar monastery, known for its collection of Buddhist scriptures and murals. Then we head to Phyang and Spitok, still inhabited by monastic communities today and a great place to learn about the ancient traditions of Ladakh. Overnight Ladakh Eco Resort or similar. (BLD)

Tikse – Hemis - Shey - Spend the day exploring the deep Buddhist heritage of this isolated part of India. Drive first to the 500 year old Tikse Monastery and Hemis Monastery, the largest in Ladakh. We then take a short walk to Shey, meeting local people on the way. Shey was once the capital of Ladakh dating back to the 17th century and home to an ancient fort, palace and monastery. From here we return to Leh for the night. Overnight Hotel Spic n Span or similar. (BLD)

Alchi - Uletokpo - We take a scenic drive along the Indus River to Uletokpo. En route we stop at Alchi monastery with its impressive religious art, dating back to the 10th century. Overnight Ule Ethnic Resort or similar. (BLD)

Lamayuru - Leh - Visit Lamayuru Monastery, one of the oldest and largest monasteries in Ladakh. We return back to Leh stopping at the Sikh pilgrimage site of Gurudwara Pathar Sahib on the way. Overnight Ladakh Eco Resort or similar. (BLD)

Nubra Valley - Drive from Leh to the Kardung La Pass, at 5359m one of the highest motorable passes in the world. The views along the way are incredible with panoramic views of the Zanskar and Karakorum ranges, before we descend to the Nubra Valley. On arrival we head to the Hundar sand dunes before continuing to our accommodation. Overnight Ossay Khar Resort or similar. (BLD)

Nubra Valley - This morning, we visit Diskit Monastery to experience the monks' morning prayers. After that, we explore a nearby lake, the ruins of Charasa Fort and ancient rock carvings. Overnight Ossay Khar Resort or similar. (BLD)

Pangong Lake - A stunning drive through the Sayok River Valley to Pangong Lake. This is a breathtakingly beautiful area and we have time to explore the area, see the ever changing colours of thew water and watch the sun set over the lake. Overnight Desert Blue Camp or similar. (BLD)

Hanle - We travel to Hanle, crossing the Kaksang La Pass, one of Ladakh’s highest routes. Along the way we visit the picturesque lakes of Mirpal Tso and YaYa Tso. We then arrive in Hanle, India’s first Dark Sky Reserve. This evening we visit the observatory for amazing views of the constellations above. Overnight Hanle House or similar. (BLD)

Tso Moriri - We cross the Changthang plateau, part of the Changthang Wildlife Sanctuary, home to kiangs (wild donkeys), yaks and migratory birds. We arrive at the turquoise waters of Tso Moriri, one of Ladakh’s most pristine lakes and visit Korzok Monastery to see monks following their daily prayers and meditations. We also have the opportunity to meet Changpa nomads, known for their pashmina wool production, and learn about their traditional way of life in this remote corner of India. Overnight Korzok Eco Lodge or similar. (BLD)

Tso Kar - Leh - Drive to Tso Kar, a stunning high-altitude lake known for its salt marshes and rich birdlife, including the black-necked crane. From here we return to Leh to reflect on our expedition through the Ladakhi wilderness. Overnight Ladakh Eco Resort or similar. (BLD)
Delhi - Fly back to Delhi for our final night in India. Overnight Vivanta by Taj Hotel or similar. (B)
Delhi - Transfer to the airport for your onward flight. (B)

tourName: Ladakh wildlife holiday, India
generalInfo:
Few places look as barren and inhospitable than the Trans-Himalayan highlands. Empty, rolling plains mostly made up of rock and scree as well as a few hardy grass species and stunted trees and bushes; all dominated by inaccessible steep rocky mountains and outcrops.

All of this do not seem like the best place to find wildlife. But this ecosystem is teeming with animals, from the ghost-like snow leopard and Eurasian lynx to herd dwelling Tibetan wild asses (kiang), argali, Asiatic ibex and Ladakhi urail there is a raft a life here waiting to be seen.

This tour is a specialist tour where some of the most elusive and specially adapted species of mammals and birds are searched for. So if you wish to be one of the few wildlife watchers to explore the vastness of India's Himalayas and possibly see some of the rarest species in the world then this tour is for you.

Introduction:
We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching tours and safari holidays all over the world, specialising in the Indian subcontinent and of course the wonderful and diverse country of India. Whilst most wildlife watchers who visit India spend time in the famous tiger reserves of the central plains or maybe the forests and grasslands of the north east of India and the Western Ghats in the south. But these ecosystems and incredible wildlife are just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to the wildlife that India has to offer.

This tour explores some of the lesser known regions and takes you into the wildest and least inhabited parts of India’s north west Himalayas. All of this whilst escorted by our very own expert zoologist (- zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us)coupled with local guides. Of course there is one species in particular that dominates everyone’s thoughts and dreams when they think of the stunning Himalayas nowadays and that is the majestic snow leopard.

Whilst there are chances of seeing snow leopards here we take time to showcase the their ecosystem in full and try and find as many other animals that share the mountains with snow leopards. Most of this trip will involve driving to spotting and scanning locations as well as walking among the high altitude grasslands and rocky slopes looking for animals that make this inhospitable locations their home.

One of the reasons why our safaris of India are unique is that our background (as a company) is from a scientific and zoological standpoint and so have a great network of colleagues and contacts all over the world who are the people on the front line in search of the best new locations for wildlife watching in the wild. All of these reasons and many more make us experts in arranging and guiding safaris and are able to tailor a Indian safaris to any location to try to find them that you request. All you have to do is to get in touch with us and tell us your budget and your group size and where you would like to go on safari.
We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching all over the world and we have a great range of Indian wildlife watching safari holidays. These tours range from the dry desert regions of Gujarat in search of striped hyena and Asiatic lions to the icy peaks of the Himalayas on the quest for snow leopards. But we also have a range of specific birding and bird watching tours, this being one of them.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner) where mentioned, in some locations lunch and dinner are not included (please refer to the itinerary), such as in cities and towns. There will be bottled water (approx 1ltr) available for each guest each day. We have our own private air conditioned vehicles with an excellent driver for all transfers. Where possible we use two brilliant guides; first a professional zoologist (when available - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) who will escort you on all your excursions and we also have very knowledgeable English speaking local naturalist guides who have decades of experience working and guiding through India and particularly birding holidays. Your naturalist escort is an expert in ornithology and their conservation and behaviour and will be able to help you identify the different species as well as interpret you what behaviours you are seeing. We will also employ a specific cultural guide for all sightseeing of temples and monuments.

The local guides have spent years searching out the best wildlife watching locations and have an unrivalled knowledge where we are going to visit. Where needed we further employ local guides at specific locations where their intimate knowledge of individual reserves and parks is invaluable in finding our targeted species. We also include all vehicle safaris, trekking permits, spotlighting, guided walks, park entrance fees and sightseeing entrance fees. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the park. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us).

Seasons:

This tour is recommended for the northern hemisphere summer season. This is not the normal season people visit Ladakh for snow leopards, but they are seen throughout the year with good regularity. But the key factor here is that during the summer there are more roads and passes open to explore and the diversity of wildlife is much higher. Many of the herbivorous animals and migratory birds which leave to head to areas not covered with snow in winter are here in their numbers.

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our bird watching holidays are guided by an experienced naturalist as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• Our local Indian guides have a good relationship with the park and reserve officials and because of this we get a heads up when animals are sighted and this can guide us in where to focus and thus increasing our chances of seeing our targeted species.
• Visit the parks and reserves morning and afternoon in your own private vehicle for your group only.
• All the above reasons give this, our wildlife and bird watching holidays of India a great success rate of seeing the best wildlife around here. We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides throughout India so that we can try and find and observe birds. We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of India at other times of year and focusing on other species such many mammals like tigers, snow leopards, elephants, rhinos and many species throughout this incredible country. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Locations:

This tour visits a range of locations around Ladakh, your entry and exit point in Ladakh will be the city of Leh and when you arrive and depart from India you will travel through Delhi.

Fitness Level:

This tour is at high altitude and whilst it is not full hiking, there are no long days of trekking; there are some hikes at altutude included and so a level of fitness or experience of being at altitude is needed for full enjoyment of the trip.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking.

Minimum Age: 18 Years Old

dayInfo.description: Delhi - Arrival & Sightseeing On your arrival into Delhi you will be met by your local driver and guide and driven to hotel. If your flight arrived in the morning you will then later in the afternoon you will be taken to the Sultanpur National Park. This is a pleasant national park close to Delhi; whilst here it may be possible to see a jungle cat as well as several species of birds including sarus cranes, black-necked stork and dozens of species of waders and waterfowl and maybe some raptor species before returning to your hotel for the night. (no meals included today).

Leh - Travelling & Acclimitisation This morning after breakfast you will be taken to the domestic airport to catch the plane north to the state of Ladakh and the capital Leh (3,500m). Once you arrive in Leh you will be met by your new local guide who will take you to your hotel. You will spend the next two nights here to begin to acclimatise to the altitude. In the evening you will have your welcome to the Himalayas meal at your hotel where your guide will brief you on the rest of the trip. (breakfast and dinner included today).

Leh - Wildlife Watching (Acclimitisation) Today most of the morning will be kept free for further acclimatization with a walk up to Shanti Stupa located north of the main town and at an altitude of 4,267m. However this afternoon we will try and find some interesting Himalayan birds, there are very few mammals around Leh so until we get more remote we will see what the avian world has to offer. A short downhill walk in the Stok area should prove productive for species like red & yellow billed choughs, Eurasian tree sparrows, Himalyan chukars, common kestrels, citrine wagtails and white-capped water redstarts. We will also keep our eyes open for mammals such as woolly hares and Himalayan pikas. In the late afternoon we will return to the accommodation for your dinner. (breakfast and dinner included today).

Uley - Travelling & Wildlife Watching After breakfast you will be transferred to Uley village (~2 hours). The drive will bring us through the villages of Likir and Hemis Sukpachang and then eventually to the tiny village of Uley. The Snow Leopard Conservancy have reported snow leopard sightings in every month of the year here and the chances are pretty good for a sighting of the grey ghost. Over the next three full days we will have this elusive cat at the top of our list of animals to try and find. Started as soon as we have rested and grabbed some lunch. The village itself is made up of 4 or 5 houses and their families, the main livelihood being sheep, goat or yak farming and during our stay here your accommodation will be with these local people as they have opened their land to tourism and we will camp close to their houses and enjoy their hospitality. It is great to be welcomed into a small village such as this and hear of stories from people that live their lives in the presence of the ghost-like snow leopard. (all meals included)

Leh - Travelling This morning you will leave Uley and begin the journey back to Leh in our private vehicle (~2 hours). After a few days of camping and hiking through the mountains you will be thankful for a hot shower and after a rest you will be free to indulge is some shopping and check out the local restaurants in downtown Leh. (breakfast and dinner are the only meals included today)

Tso Kor - Travelling & Wildlife Watching Early this morning you will be taken to the check post at Karu and after a hot roadside breakfast you will continue onto Tso Kar via Lato and Rumtse – this is a spectacular drive. Lato is where the Indian plate collided with the Eurasian plate about 55 million years ago and you can see the impact of the collision here. The steep crevices and the rock faces in brilliant hues of pink, green, purple, red and ochre show what occurred in stunning colours. Here along the riversides you will be stopping to look for brown dipper, fire-fronted serins, Eurasian crag martin, Northern house martin, hill pigeon as well as fly bys from Himalayan griffons. There are chances of sighting mammals around here like the mountain weasel, stone marten, blue sheep and few other mammals. We will carry on towards Rumtse and look for golden eagle on a well known nest here, then wait and see if we can get to see the long tailed marmots, there will be birds like lammergeier, osprey, golden eagle, Himalayan griffon and of course possibilities of Himalayan snowcock, Tibetan partridge etc as we move towards Tso Kar. Along the way there are lots of birds species that can be seen including large flocks of horned larks, Tibetan snow finches, robin, brown and black-throated accentor, Tibetan lark, Brandt mountain finch etc near the Tso Kar area. Some of the speciality bird species here include the black-necked crane, great crested grebe, black-necked grebe, common tern, white-winged tern, Tibetan sandgrouse, nesting bar-headed geese and ruddy shelducks, saker falcon, upland buzzard and little owls. Also around here we will try are best to see some of the Himalayan mammal species such as Tibetan wild ass, woolly hare, silvery mountain vole, Tibetan argali, Tibetan wolf (however the chances of wolves depends on the movements of the Nomads as they follow them) and dhole. There is a small population of Eurasian lynx in the area surrounding this place however they are very hard to see here. So we will keep a look out for this with our local guide. After exploring the area for its mammals and birds we will head back to the accommodation, level camping; for your evening meal. (all of your meals are included today).

Tso Moriri - Wildlife Watching & Travelling Early this morning you can have a walk towards Starstapuk Tso, a fresh water lake nearby where we have camped the night before. Here you will check the edge of the lake carefully as Tibetan sandgrouse as they inhabit these areas. Mammals here include Tibetan argali, blue sheep and Tibetan gazelle, which we will scan the hillsides for. After breakfast we will drive to the Tso Moriri plains looking for red fox, Tibetan wolves, Himalayan marmot, Royles pika, Ladakh pika, woolly hare and Tibetan wild ass. Tso Moriri is the breeding ground of the bar headed geese and the ruddy shelduck, there are other birds like Humes short toed lark, Humes groundpecker, common raven, plain mountain finch, white rumped snowfinch and twite. On reaching Tso Moriri we will set up the hotel in time for your dinner. (all meals included today)

Tso Moriri - Wildlife Watching Today is kept as a spare day, either to spend around the Tso Kar area or can be the Tso Moriri area, this decision will be based on which location offers the best wildlife watching when we are there and what species we have already seen and which we hope to still see. There is also an area between Tso Moriri and Mahe which is Sumdo, Upper Sumdo, Chumathang as far as Yoye Tso. During the afternoon we will move to this area and set up the camp once again. By doing this we make the long drive back to Leh tomorrow shorter. (all meals included today).

Leh - Travelling This morning you will start early and drive back to Leh, the drive is through some very interesting habitats and we will make birding stops at different places. Once back at Leh this afternoon, we will check into the hotel and then you are free for some retail therapy at the local markets. Before your evening meal and last night in the Himalayas. (breakfast and dinner included today).

Delhi - Travelling This morning you will fly back to Delhi and after checking into the hotel with the rest of the afternoon will be kept free for you to relax or souvenir shop before your farewell meal in the evening. (breakfast is the only meal included today)
Home - Departure After breakfast you will be transferred to the airport in time to catch your return flight home. (breakfast is the only meal included).

tourName: Leopard safari and culture, India
generalInfo:
Bera is well Known as a destination for leopard sightings in an open Jawai Dam at Bera is in the Pali District of the State of Rajasthan. The Pali district encloses Jawai Dam (Baand) which lies adjacent to a village called Bera. Together they constitute Jawai Bandh Community Reserve. In recent times the surroundings have become famous for leopard (panther) sightings in the open and their harmonious existence with villagers. River Jawai forms a habitable ecosystem for leopards and megafauna.
Udaipur situated in the State of Rajasthan Udaipur is a panoramic historical city. The city glorifies urbanity through its beautiful lakes, gardens, noble houses, and palaces. Historical temples are regulars for the pious. Udaipur extols ancient and modern with architectural excellence modern and ancient. The battlegrounds were the forts simply made for war and enclosure for embattled citizens.
The most amazing aspect of the structures besides the ancient architecture, is the amazing fine arts and embellished interiors. This is typical of Rajasthan but the palaces amidst the lakes are exceptional. Only a visit will reveal the secrets of Udaipur.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Delhi, our executive will be at the airport to welcome you later he will transfer you to the hotel. Day to relax overnight Hotel.

Post a sumptuous breakfast we are on the way for Delhi sightseeing. The historical places we will visit today are Qutub Minar, Jama Masjid Nation's largest Mosque, the oldest bazaar Chandni Chowk the spice market get one get all masalas available pan India. Here we will enjoy a Rickshaw Ride, then visit the elegant but imposing Red Fort, Raj Ghat-a memorial to Mahatma Gandhi, and the Humayun's tomb-Delhi's finest example of Mughal architecture. In New Delhi, we will pray at Bahai Lotus Temple and Swami Narayan Temple. Next, we visit The Parliament House, The President House, and India Gate. The rest of the day is free at your leisure. During our visit, Indian Cuisine on our palate is assured. Overnight at our Hotel.

Today post breakfast we take an early flight to Udaipur, arrive at Udaipur then drive straight to Bera Jawai, for the evening safari. We will be enjoying our stay at a popular heritage lodge at Bera, and enjoy the vegetarian food Marwar is famous for. The lodge is environmentally friendly and leaves fewer carbon footprints. The vegetarian is a delightful serving of several delicious recipes Marwar is famous for. You will relish each, and every dish, it will be an unforgettable experience.
Morning & evening safari. The safaris are organized on open jeeps with a naturalist guide who knows the area very well. We will also enjoy birding and the sights of other wild animals.
After breakfast drive to Udaipur, and check in at the hotel later we will do half-day sightseeing. We will visit local bazars of Udaipur, evening Light and sound show at City Palace.
After breakfast we will set out for Udaipur sight seeing a of lakes. On this day we will visit Lake Pichola, Jagmandir, City Palace, and Jagdish Temple. Boat ride at Lake Pichola.Overnight Udaipur.
After Breakfast we take a direct flight to Delhi. Overnight Delhi day to relax.
After breakfast transfer to International airport for your flight Back home

tourName: Luxury Golden Triangle holiday in India
placesVisited: Delhi, Agra, Fatehpur Sikri, Jaipur
generalInfo:
The Golden triangle staying at the very best hotels in India!

This luxury Golden Triangle holiday allows you to explore some of India’s greatest cities and ancient sites in style and comfort. You’ll have an air-conditioned car with a driver for the duration of your trip.

Highlights of your holiday will include a Five Senses tour and visiting Delhi’s 17th century Red Fort with its gilded columns and marble pool; exploring the centuries-old city of Agra and visiting the majestic Taj Mahal at sunrise; and strolling the boulevards and pink-hued streets of Jaipur, discovering palaces, courtly homes and the authentic dynamic night market.

dayInfo.description: Step off the plane and into our care with an assisted transfer at Delhi International Airport, from the bustle of the streets to the calm of your hotel. Relax and take your time to arrive fully. Hotel example: The Imperial
Delhi - Over a relaxed breakfast briefing, plan your adventures for the week ahead, then plunge straight in with a unique Five Senses tour of Delhi. Hotel example: The Imperial

Agra - After a relaxed breakfast, your chauffeur will be ready to drive you to the beautifully-preserved city of Agra, once the capital of the Mughal empire. Later in the evening visit the Agra Fort and Mehtab Bagh to see the Taj Mahal from the other side of the river during sun set. A unique experience. Hotel example: The Oberoi Amar Vilas

Agra - Slip through the centuries surrounded by some of the world’s finest structures. Sleep with a smile on your lips, you’ll be waking before sunrise to see one of the Seven Wonders of the World - gaze upon the Taj Mahal's ethereal beauty, where love stories are etched in time. Later come back to the hotel for a leisurely breakfast. Later in the evening your guide will take you for a colonial tour of Agra to see the footprints of British Raj. Hotel example: The Oberoi Amar Vilas

Jaipur - Relax and enjoy your journey to Jaipur, en route, visit the abandoned city of Fatehpur Sikri. Further down the road visit the 8th century stepwell. On arrival Jaipur check in to your hotel and enjoy luxury of your hotel. Hotel example: The Oberoi Raj Vilas

Jaipur - Enjoy a sightseeing tour of Jaipur. Discover why Jaipur earned its nickname of the ‘Paris of India’ on a half-day tour. Stroll its wide boulevards and photograph its flamboyant pink-painted streets. Stock up on treasures to take home at the vibrant night market. Be amazed by the ingenuity of the city’s past inhabitants at Jantar Mantar, the world’s largest stone observatory. Watch in wonder as dusk blushes Jaipur’s terracotta buildings a deeper shade of pink. Hotel example: The Oberoi Raj Vilas

Delhi - After breakfast, drive back to Delhi (approx. 05 Hrs). Upon arrival check in at the Hotel and take your time to savour the luxury of your Oberoi hotel before going home. Hotel example: The Oberoi Gurgaon
In the morning after breakfast, you will be assisted & transferred in your private car to Delhi International airport to connect with your flight.

tourName: Luxury India Tours, Taj, forts and palaces
placesVisited: Delhi, Imperial hotel, Jaisalmer, Gadi Sagar Lake, Jodhpur, Raas hotel, Spice & jewellery markets, Udaipur, Lake Picholla boat trip, Fateh Garh hotel, Jaipur & city tour, Rambagh Palace hotel, Fatehpur Sikri, Agra, ITC Mughal hotel, Taj Mahal, Option for combining with Anada and the Himalayas
generalInfo:
Explore India´s palaces & forts and sleep in the lap of luxury!

This 14-day luxury tour of India's Taj, forts and palaces has everything taken care of from accommodation and airport/hotel transfers in a private car to monument entrance fees and local guides, so that you can sit back, relax and concentrate on immersing yourself in India’s vibrant and beautiful north region!

The hotels have all been handpicked and are historical gems in themselves, occupying some of the best spots in their cities so you can revel in the views before you even leave the front door. From the iconic Imperial hotel in Delhi with its art deco and colonial chic to Jodhpur’s elegant Umaid Bhawan Palace hotel where the views of Mehrangarh’s Victory Palace are unrivalled, via the Rambagh palace - the ‘jewel of Jaipur’.

With comfortable bases taken care of, your days will be packed full of adventure as you begin your tour of the cities exploring the spices, monuments and Mughalai food of Delhi; the medieval-walled ‘Golden City’ of Jaisalmer and Jodhpur’s spice bazaars and glittering jewellery markets.

With private air-conditioned cars to transport you onwards, you’ll have a good amount of time to relax amongst Udaipur’s palaces, gardens and lakes, enjoying a sundowner or two as you take an evening cruise on Lake Picholla. Recharged, you’ll then make your way to the ‘pink city’ of Jaipur (the ‘Paris of India’) to explore its beautiful boulevards and pink terracotta buildings. No trip would be complete without glimpsing at the Taj Mahal however, and so your last stop will be to Agra where you’ll take an early morning horse and carriage ride to watch the sun rise over India’s most iconic building.

Included:
Luxury accommodation for 13 nights including breakfast
All airport and hotel transfers
An air-conditioned car with driver
Monument entrance fees included
English-speaking local guides
Farewell dinner in Delhi

dayInfo.description: Delhi -2 nights: Upon arrival in Delhi airport, you will be met by our representative and will be provided assisted transfer to your hotel. Upon arrival check in to the Hotel. Spend the rest of the day at leisure. Overnight at the Hotel (The Imperial). On day 2 after breakfast, enjoy a half day city tour of New Delhi Humayun’s Tomb • Qutub Minar • Drive past Kartavya path & Janpath. Later in the afternoon enjoy the food tour of Old Delhi. along with a Cycle Rickshaw ride. Overnight at your hotel.

Jaisalmer - 2 nights: After breakfast fly to Jaisalmer, in the evening visit the dunes and experience the camel ride. Jaisalmer, nicknamed the ‘Golden City’, is an oasis in the heart of the Thar desert. Founded in 1156, this medieval city rises on a sea of sand protected by a three-mile stone wall. Relish unparalleled levels of luxury, Rajasthani-style at the Suryagarh hotel. Overnight at Surya Garh. On day 4 enjoy a Sightseeing Tour of Jaisalmer. Then in the flickering lights of the evening, explore Jaisalmer’s magnificent fortress city. Wonder at the sheer scale of Jaisalmer Fort, one of the world’s largest, complete with its own palaces and Jain temples. Take time to meditate on the shores of Gadi Sagar Lake, shrines and temples reflected in its still waters. See the sky blaze with colour then reveal a thousand twinkling stars in the velvet beauty of the evening desert sky. Overnight at your hotel.

Jodhpur - 2 nights: After a leisurely breakfast enjoy a relaxed drive across the desert back to the red-rose sandstone city of Jodhpur. Rest of the day at leisure to enjoy the luxury Hotel Umaid Bhawan Palace. On day 6 explore the walled city on a half-day tour, lose yourself in the bustle of Jodhpur’s spice bazaar and the temptations of its glittering jewellery market. Contrast the gleaming white marble Jaswant Thada monument with the rose-pink stone of the city. Enjoy dinner on the hotel terrace, each bite delicately-flavoured with hand-ground spices, specially selected from a 200-year old shop. Overnight at your hotel.

Udaipur - 3 nights: After breakfast, drive to Udaipur (approx. 6 Hrs). Enroute visit Ranakpur temples and count the 200 pillars which support the 29 halls and 20 domes at the breathtaking architectural miracle of the Ranakpur Jain temples. Upon arrival check in to the Hotel Lake Palace. On day 8 enjoy and experience • The City Palace • Sahelion ki Badi • a shared Boat Ride at Lake Pichola and free time in the afternoon. Overnight at your hotel. Day 9 at leasure to enjoy the Hotel and free time.

Jaipur - 2 nights: Relax and enjoy your flight to Jaipur, we’ll take care of everything. Look for the city’s distinctive pink-painted streets and wide boulevards as you are whisked from the airport to the Rambagh Palace hotel. Overnight at your hotel The Rambagh Palace. On day 11 after breakfast, we guide you on a full day city tour of Jaipur. Places to visit include: • Amber Fort • City Palace • Jantar Mantar • Hawa Mahal (from outside only). In the evening explore the colorful local markets of Jaipur. Be amazed by the ingenuity of the city’s past inhabitants at Jantar Mantar, the world’s largest stone observatory. Watch in wonder as dusk blushes Jaipur’s terracotta buildings a deeper shade of pink. Sleep soundly in the palace known as the ‘jewel of Jaipur’, former home to generations of royalty. Overnight at your hotel.

Agra - 1 night: Start the day with an early breakfast, tonight you’ll sleep surrounded by opulence at the ITC Mughal, a paradise for the contemporary Mogul. But first a visit to the abandoned city of Fatehpur Sikri, then on to Agra, home to one of the New Seven Wonders of the World and three World Heritage sites, prepare to be dazzled… Walk through the haunting perfection of the abandoned palaces and courtly houses of the ‘Ghost City’. Lose yourself in the love story of Shah Jahan and his wife Mumtaz Mahal at the Kalakriti theatre. Sleep contentedly with the thrill of seeing the Taj Mahal in the morning.

Delhi: In the early morning by sunrise, visit the iconic Taj Mahal. Later come back to your hotel for breakfast. Check out and drive back to Delhi. Before leaving Agra you can visit the Agra Fort. Overnight stay at the JW Marriot Aero city hotel.
Flight back home

tourName: Luxury Rajasthan holiday, 13 days
placesVisited: Delhi, Udaipur, Devigarh, Jaipur, Agra, Heritage hotels
generalInfo:
This Rajasthan holiday is all about enjoying this majestic state at a gentle pace, with excellent chauffeur guides, and staying at some of the state’s most stunning heritage and luxurious hotels. In Delhi, for example, where this tailor made itinerary begins, you will be welcomed at the Imperial Hotel in the prestigious Connaught Place. Your guide will take you around the city, Old and New, visiting some of its most splendid sites, such as Mahatma Gandhi’s memorial, Raj Ghat, the magnificent Red Fort, and also enjoying a trip in a rickshaw around Old Delhi.

After transferring to Rajasthan’s city of Udaipur, known as Venice of the East because of its complex lake system that creates waterways around its historic palaces and pretty streets, you will stay in a hotel that matches the city’s propensity for romanticism, The Leela Palace Hotel, with stunning rooms overlooking Lake Pichola. During your time here you can take a boat ride on the lake, visit the magnificent City Palace or just enjoy this city’s unique setting with its mountainous backdrop provided by the Aravali Hills.

You get to immerse yourself even more in the Aravali Hills by spending two nights in another five star heritage hotel, this one in a magnificently restored 18th century fort, with a location that is second to none. Originally built by the Jhala Rajputs who ruled the Mewar Kingdom this is a wonderful place from where to explore the local village, go horse riding into the hills and explore the local Jain temples. As you can imagine, the night skies here are also a magical experience in themselves, which you can take in from your private terrace.

From here, the itinerary takes you to Rajasthan’s capital city of Jaipur, famous for its pink sandstone buildings which give a constant yet ever changing rosy glow. Packed with architectural wonders, such as Jantar Mantar stone observatory, the walled city that is home to two palaces, Hawa Mahal and Jal Mahal and of course the world famous Amber and Nahargarh forts. You will stay in your own feat of architecture out in the hills surrounding the city, the Tree Of Life Resort & Spa, for more luxury and more relaxation.

Leaving Rajasthan, the final couple of days of this holiday take place in Agra, for the icing on the cake: The Taj Mahal seen by carriage ride at sunrise. Staying at the nearby Oberoi Amarvilas hotel, from which you can actually see the most beautiful marble mausoleum in the world, you will end your Indian and Rajasthan holiday ends just as you began. In serenity and style.

dayInfo.description: Delhi - 2 nights at the Imperial Hotel: Step off the plane and into our care with assistance on arrival at Delhi International. Redolent with history, the Imperial Hotel is a fascinating blend of Art Deco, old Colonial and Victorian styles. Plan your adventures for the days ahead over a breakfast briefing. Explore the vibrant cities of New and Old Delhi.

Udaipur - 2 nights at the Leela Palace: Say farewell to Delhi after breakfast. Following a stress-free transfer, touch down in Udaipur, nicknamed the ‘Venice of the East’. Explore the city’s palaces and landscaped gardens on a half-day tour. Cocoon yourself in the opulence of the incredible Leela Palace.

Devigarh - 2 nights at the Devi Garh: Enjoy breakfast on the terrace before a brief drive further into the Aravalli ranges to the 18th century Fort Palace of Devi Garh, described as one of the most romantic places on earth. Lavishly refurbished as an all-suite luxury spa resort, this is your home for the next few days.

Jaipur - 2 nights at the Rajvilas: Relax and enjoy your day’s journey to Jaipur, we’ll take care of everything. Discover why Jaipur earned its nickname of the ‘Paris of India’ on a half-day tour. Stroll its wide boulevards and photograph the flamboyant pink-painted streets. Stock up on treasures to take home at the vibrant night market.

Jaipur - 2 nigths at the Samode Palace: After breakfast take a short transfer to your perfect getaway nestled in the undulating Aravalli hills. Discover centuries of traditional hospitality coupled with a deft modern touch. Unwind on your private garden terrace, perhaps enjoy dinner there – just for two – with tasty treats from the chef’s organic garden.

Agra - 2 nights at the Amarvilas: Wake up early, refreshed from your idyll, excited to travel again. Tonight you’ll be sleeping in the beautifully-preserved city of Agra, surrounded by some of the world’s finest structures. En route visit the abandoned city of Fatehpur Sikri. Enjoy your stay at the Oberoi Amarvilas.
Gurgaon/Delhi - 1 night at The Oberoi Gurgaon: Take time over a leisurely breakfast with a late check-out. Transfer to Delhi and we’ll assist you with your departure to the International Airport.

tourName: Luxury wildlife holiday in India
generalInfo:
This itinerary in western and central India is for those who want to explore wildlife off the beaten track. You'll uncover a huge diversity of wildlife in amazing landscapes, and travel well beyond the well-known destinations, staying in luxurious, sustainability-forward lodges. Highlights include: great chances to see sloth bears, leopards and tigers; safaris that go far beyond the standard jeep drive; plus a rare chance for a nocturnal safari.

The first destination on the tour is Jawai, which is a very interesting landscape of water, rocks and boulders. It's a great place for leopard sightings. Leopards co-exist with shepherds in the area, and you'll enjoy rural life alongside possible big cat sightings.

Next, we go to the little Rann of Kutch, which is a much sparser landscape, and one of the homes for the wild ass and desert fox. There's also excellent birdlife, which lives alongside the nomadic communities here. After exploring the little Raan, this itinerary takes you to the Black Buck Sanctuary, an amazing place: this small national park known for its black buck sighting and is one of the best places to see and photograph wolves and striped hyena. The Black Buck Sanctuary also has the largest congregation of different species of harriers anywhere on earth.

From the Black Buck Sanctuary you will travel by road to Ahmedabad and then onward to Bhopal in central India to start the next leg of your journey. Satpura is one of central India’s best kept secrets. Your first stop in Satpura Tiger Reserve is the Bori Wildlife Sanctuary, known for good tiger sightings. This hidden gem of an area feels very exclusive, and alongside tigers you might see sloth bears wild dogs, leopards, sambar, spotted deer, and a great amount of birdlife. After three nights in Bori, you will proceed to the Satpura National Park by boat, giving you a truly unique perspective of the landscape.

Satpura offers a mix of activities making it unique from other tiger reserves in Central India. During your stay you will have a mix of game drives and a choice of walking safaris, boat safaris, canoes excursions, horseback safaris and even night safaris: a chance to see civets, jungle cats, owls and the tiny and very elusive rusty spotted cat. This park is the place where you'll have the highest probability of seeing a sloth bear.

After Satpura, return to Delhi with stories of all your amazing animal encounters.

tourName: Madhya Pradesh tailor made holiday, India
placesVisited: Bhopal, Sanchi & Bimbetka Caves, Gwalior’s Impregnable Fortress, Orchha, Khajuraho, Bandavgarh Tiger Reserve, Mumbai
generalInfo:
Madhya Pradesh, affectionately known as the soul of the Indian subcontinent, offers some of the richest and most varied historic architectural and experiences in the country, and on this tailor made holiday you’ll discover a region of India that is entirely unique. You'll visit prehistoric caves dating back to 10,000 BC as well as fascinating ancient temple architecture, including the UNESCO World Heritage sites of Bhimbetka and Khajuraho. With its bold sculpture depictions of erotica and sensuality, Khajuraho paved the way for emboldened architectural expression as early as 9th century AD, and is still thought of today as among the best examples of temple architecture in India.

This trip also offers the chance to go in search of the tiger! You'll delve deep into the National Parks of Bandavgarh and Kanha on private jeep safaris and stay in remote jungle lodges in tree-top huts. Madhya Pradesh offers some of country's finest wilderness areas, which are home not just to big cats, but to plentiful other wildlife and birds.

There's no better way to cap this experience off than to finish in the urban jungle of Mumbai. While in Mumbai, we'll not only walk you through the unique and rich history of the Colaba, we'll offer you unique experiences such as visiting the lively Dhobi Ghat (Washerman's village), sampling the local street food and visiting historic Irani Cafes.

dayInfo.description: Mumbai’s Heritage and Street Food walking trail - Returning to Mumbai, we’ll cap the trip with a uniquely guided walking trail through Mumbai’s historic Colaba where apart from history, we’ll also showcase some amazing culinary landmarks and street food favourites.
International Departure - You depart from Mumbai for your flight back home.

tourName: Maharajahs Express luxury rail holiday in India
generalInfo:
Luxury accommodation onboard the Maharajah’s Express train
Extravagant feasts and champagne brunches
Sightseeing and activities all include entrance fees
English-speaking guides on all sightseeing tours
24-hour point of contact

Delhi, Agra, Ranthambore & Jaipur

Cultural exploration, Indian history, Safari

dayInfo.description: Delhi to Agra overnight train Delhi railway station departure – Overnight to Agra – Day 01 Leave the bustle of Safdarjung railway station behind when you step onboard your home for the next three nights. Experience the ultimate in old-fashioned luxury on a journey fit for a Maharajah, designed with you in mind. Experience Breathe in the perfume of the flowered garland around your neck, feel the warmth of a traditional Indian welcome. Settle into your compartment and delight in the decadence of a bygone Colonial age. Freshen up and head to the dining car for a lavish welcome feast and meet new friends. Sleep soundly in your comfy cabin, rocked by the gentle motion of the train as it steadily speeds to Agra.

Agra Agra 2 nights After a relaxed breakfast, transfer to the beautifully-preserved city of Agra, once the capital of the Mughal empire. Slip through the centuries surrounded by some of the world’s finest structures. Sleep with a smile on your lips, you’ll be waking before sunrise to see one of the Seven Wonders of the World. Experience Lose yourself in the love story of Shah Jahan and his wife Mumtaz Mahal at the Kalaktiti theatre. Hear the clip-clop of horses’ hooves as you ride in a carriage to the Taj Mahal at sunrise. Be inspired by the rags-to-riches story behind the marble tomb of Itmad-ul-daulah. Marvel at the colorful contrast of the red sandstone and dazzling white marble of the Red Fort

Ranthambore Ranthambore 1 night After a hearty breakfast, get ready to experience the breath-taking beauty of India’s wild nature. Discover why Jaipur earned its nickname of the ‘Paris of India’ on a sightseeing tour. Sleep for one last night onboard this most extraordinary train. Experience Enjoy a thrilling game safari in the Ranthambore National Park spotting tigers and leopards in their natural habitat. Truly live life as a Rajah watching an exhibition match of elephant polo Watch the sandstone of the Amber Fort glow in the sunlight. Indulge in a royal banquet. Later, back on the train, sip a cocktail in the Safari bar, savour the moment.
Arrive in Jaipur Jaipur After a once-in-a-lifetime journey, living life in the lap of regal luxury, it’s time to step back into the real world.

tourName: Maharashtra 3 day tour, India
generalInfo:
Are you a history buff? Does the thought of exploring temples and century-old monuments excite you? This 3-day tour to explore some of South India’s best-kept secrets will astound you. You’ll not only visit UNESCO World Heritage sites but also sprawling vineyards of Maharashtra.

To kick off your explorations around Maharashtra, we’ll take you to Nashik–the wine capital of India. At the heart of Nashik is Sula Vineyards: an excursion from Mumbai that wine lovers won’t want to miss. Tucked a few hours away from the bustle of Mumbai, Sula Vineyards boasts 160 acres of land. India’s most well-known and loved wine is found here. Tour through the lush vineyards, comprehensive processing units and learn the art of wine-making.

After this, we’ll take the hop on a train to Aurangabad and spend the night. First thing in the morning we shall depart for the Ajanta Caves, a 3-hour journey from Aurangabad. Take in the Ajanta Cave complex, encircling a gorge along the Waghora River. This spectacular complex houses 29 caves full of ancient Buddhist murals, paintings and sculptures.

Imagine strolling through incredible ancient rock-cut temples, chiselled by hand thousands of years ago. the historical grandeur of your surroundings.

The next day, we’ll get an early start to explore the Ellora caves. This is one the world’s largest rock-cut temple complex boasting artwork, monuments and inscriptions from Buddhism, Hinduism and Jainism. The proximity of these monuments are indicative of how religions existed in harmony over the course of India’s history.

After exploring Ellora Caves, we’ll venture to Aurangabad’s must-see sites including Devgiri Fort and Bibi Ka Maqbara. Hike up to the top of Devgiri Fort, a fortress built in the 14th century, and be rewarded with a stunning view of the city. We end our day of exploration at BiBi Ka Maqbara, also known as the Baby Taj Mahal, with some fabulous photo opportunities.

The Maharashtra Trail is a must for all those passing through Mumbai, on their way in or out of the city. Learn about some of India’s greatest historical monuments around Aurangabad and wind down in the vineyards of Nashik.

Our mission is to improve the quality of lives in the communities where we work. Like all of our tours, 80% of the profits fund our NGO based in Mumbai and Delhi. Thank you for supporting our programs by signing up for the tour.

dayInfo.description: Nashik: To kick off your explorations around Maharashtra, we’ll take you by early morning train (3.5 hours) to Nashik–the wine capital of India. We’ll then take a car to Sula Vineyards, covering 160 acres of land, which wine lovers won’t want to miss as India’s most well-known and loved wine is found here. We’ll tour through the lush vineyards, learn the art of wine-making, and taste the wine of course! In the afternoon, we’ll look around Nashik city, including Panchavati Temple, before taking another train to Aurangabad the home of many World Heritage Monuments including Ellora Cave Temple, Ajanta caves and Bibi Ka Maqbara. We will be arriving in Aurangabad and reach the hotel and take much needed rest from the long and productive day!

Ajanta Caves: We leave at around 8 am by car for Ajanta Caves (3 hrs) and we will spend the day exploring the caves, encircling a gorge along the Waghora River. This spectacular complex houses 29 caves full of ancient Buddhist murals, paintings and sculptures. We’ll later return to the hotel in Ellora.

Ellora Caves: We’ll get an early start to explore the Ellora caves. This is one of the world’s largest rock-cut temple complexes boasting artwork, monuments and inscriptions from Buddhism, Hinduism and Jainism. The proximity of these monuments to each other are indicative of how religions existed in harmony over the course of India’s history. After exploring Ellora Caves, we’ll venture to Aurangabad to see Bibi Ka Maqbara, also known as the Baby Taj Mahal, with some fabulous photo opportunities. In the afternoon we’ll catch a comfortable train back to Mumbai (7.5 hrs), with some pleasant views of rural Maharashtra. On your arrival in Mumbai, we will transfer you to your hotel and your tour will be complete.

tourName: Nepal small group tour, culture of the Himalayas
placesVisited: India: Delhi, Gwalior, Orchha, Khajuraho, Varanasi, Sarnath, Lucknow, Nepal: Bardia National Park, Game drives and wildlife watching, Lumbini, Buddha’s birthplace, Pokhara, Hike to Sarangkot, Boat ride on Lake Phewa, Kathmandu
generalInfo:
This journey through Nepal offers a rich mix of culture, history, nature and quiet spiritual moments. Travelling through the hills, valleys and plains of the country, we’ll experience both the energy of city life and the calm of rural landscapes. Along the way there are chances to meet local communities, visit sacred sites, enjoy scenic walks and explore the region’s deep-rooted traditions. It’s a varied and engaging route, designed for those who enjoy a balance of gentle adventure, cultural interest and time to take things in.

We begin in Kathmandu, exploring its temples, squares and Buddhist sites before heading into the hills to Gorkha and the lakeside town of Pokhara. From there, we travel to the traditional hill town of Tansen, continue south to Lumbini, the birthplace of the Buddha, and on to Chitwan National Park for a taste of Nepal’s wildlife and jungle landscapes. We end the trip in Bhaktapur, a beautifully preserved medieval city known for its crafts, food and timeless atmosphere.

dayInfo.description: Tour starts in Kathmandu: The tour begins this evening at our joining hotel in Nepal’s bustling capital, Kathmandu. After some time to settle in we’ll meet for an introductory briefing before then heading out for dinner. We’ll walk a short distance through the streets of Kathmandu to Sam’s One Tree Café, a spot busy with locals and a social enterprise that employs hearing-impaired waiting staff.

Kathmandu: Places, Temples & Stupas: The busy streets of Kathmandu surround the city’s historic royal complex of Durbar Square where we begin our city tour this morning. Home to the Royal Palace as well as temples and pagodas, the square has a peaceful ambiance and we will witness locals visiting temples and lighting incense amongst the Newari architecture. From here we will head to Boudnath, the spiritual centre of Nepal’s Tibetan Buddhist community where we will have lunch at the Boudha Stupa Café. Afterwards we will join the pilgrims in their circumambulation of the giant stupa, spinning prayer wheels and exploring side chapels and the small Gelugpa Monastery as we go. Nearby is the Pashupatinath Temple on the banks of the sacred Bagmati River. We’ll explore the complex (non-Hindus are not allowed in the main temple), one of the holiest Hindu sites in Nepal, filled with pilgrims and holy men. We may have the opportunity to meet one of the sadhus who frequent the temple and hear his philosophy before we visit the Guhyeswari Temple dedeicated to an unexpected anatomical homage. We'll return to the hotel and have the evening at leisure.

Kathmandu – Gorkha: Sunrise Stupa & Village Walk: An early start will take us to the Swayambunath Stupa for sunrise; at this hour the temple belongs to the local people as they begin their day with prayers, worship and sacred songs. The temple is more than 2500 years old and we can join the devotees in the kora walk around the stupa, adorned with gold leaf and colourful prayer flags. We will return to the hotel for breakfast and then set out to Gorkha, a journey of around 5 hours. The route will take us through terraced hills, farmland and small villages. After lunch at our resort we will take a 2-3 hour easy walk through the local villages passing traditional homes and farmers tending their crops on the terraces while taking in the panoramas of the Annapurna and Manaslu ranges.

Gorkha – Pokhara: Palace & Mountain Valley: Set atop a hill in Gorkha, the Gorkha Palace is an excellent example of traditional Nepalese architecture, featuring intricate wooden carvings and fortified stone walls. Built in the 16th century, it is home to several Hindu temples and a small museum. We will start our day with a visit to the palace before embarking on the drive to Pokhara. Passing through farmland we will have the chance to see the traditional methods still employed by farmers and buffalo ploughing fields. The landscape becomes increasingly dramatic as we pass lush valleys, forested slopes and the occasional waterfall tumbling down the hillside before we enter into the Pokhara Valley with Machhapuchhre or Fish Tail Peak dominating the skyline at 6977m. We will enjoy lunch in a local organic restaurant before heading to the White Peace Pagoda, a Buddhist monument on one of the nearby hills providing views out over Lake Phewa, on which Pokhara sits. We will watch the sunset from Pumdikot before walking along the lake shore in the early evening to witness evening prayers.

Pokhara: Mountain Sunrise & Tibetan Community: Sunrise over the Himalayas is a breath-taking sight and we will enjoy the colours and first sun rays early this morning from Sarangkot. After breakfast nearby we will then visit the Tashi Palkhel Tibetan Refugee camp. Established in 1962, the camp is one of many in Nepal and we will have the opportunity to engage with Buddhist monks, meet a traditional Tibetan doctor and learn about Tibetan medicine, spiritual practices and daily life. We will also hear stories to gain a greater understanding of life in exile and resilience as well as exploring their unique culture and Tibetan Buddhism. For lunch we will head to Annapurna Mon Village, a traditional guesthouse engaged with community support and offering local dishes with produce from their organic garden. This afternoon we will stop at the Gorkha Memorial Museum and the Tibetan Women’s Refugee camp and Handicraft Centre on our return to Pokhara where we will have a free evening to explore.

Pokhara – Tansen: Historic Hill Town: This morning we will journey approximately 3-4 hours to Tansen travelling through Nepal’s central hills while enjoying scenery of agricultural terraces and small villages and crossing numerous bridges. As we approach the historic hill town of Tansen, perched in the Shrinagar Hills, the road becomes more mountainous and winding. Tansen, an important centre during the Rana era and once the capital of the Magar Kingdom, is known for its rich history and Newari architecture and this afternoon we will explore the cobbled streets of the town taking in the ancient Rani Mahal or Queen’s Palace as well as the bustling bazaar.

Tansen: Traditional Crafts & Coffee: We will further explore Tansen today focussing in on the traditional crafts the region is known for. Tansen is the home of dhaka, a colourful woven fabric used to make topi hats, shawls and thaili, a kind of purse. There are many dhaka workshops and we will stop in to see the weaving in action as well as the many colourful products being made. We will move on to the area of Taksar which for centuries has produced bronze and brassware and we will see how many of the traditional products such as the karuwa (water jug), hukka (water pipe) and auntee (Newar jug for storing raksi a distilled homemade alcohol) are produced. Tansen is also home to the first coffee plantation in Nepal and the coffee grown here is considered the best in Nepal with over 2000 farmers growing beans. We will visit an organic coffee plantation where the arabica beans are grown over 800m ensuring high quality.

Tansen – Lumbini: Terai Landscapes & Bazaar: This morning we will descend from the mountains to the landscapes of the Terai, the area that borders India, with its flat plains, lush greenery and rural life. Our journey will take 2-3 hours. Lumbini draws thousands of pilgrims each year as the birthplace of the Buddha and the town has a peaceful atmosphere with many gardens, ponds and temples. There is also a vibrant bazaar frequented by Nepali and Indian shoppers with a wide variety of spices, cloth, handicrafts and street food which we will visit to experience the bustling local culture.

Lumbini: Birthplace of the Buddha: This morning we’ll visit Lumbini Garden, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the most sacred places in the Buddhist world. The birthplace of Lord Buddha, this serene complex is home to the Maya Devi Temple, which marks the exact spot of his birth, and the Ashokan Pillar, erected by the Indian emperor Ashoka in 249 BCE. We’ll also explore the surrounding monastic zones, where countries from across the Buddhist world have built temples in their own unique architectural styles. We’ll move on to Tilaurakot, an ancient, archaeological site and the childhood home of Siddhartha Gautama - the Buddha; we’ll explore the ruins of the palace, gates and other structures while learning about his life. We’ll end the day at the Jagdishpur Reservoir, a haven for bird watchers with numerous species of migratory and resident birds.

Lumbini – Chitwan: National Park River Cruise: A drive of around 4 hours through the Terai brings us to Chitwan, Nepal’s first national park which covers nearly 1000 square km. A vast region of forest and grasslands, the area is surrounded by traditional Tharu (an ethnic minority) villages. After lunch and a briefing in our lodge, we will head out on a boat cruise on the Rapti River which flows through the western area of the park. We can enjoy a sundowner whilst spotting wildlife with our naturalist. Before dinner we will have a short presentation on the park and the wildlife we will hope to see by one of the naturalists.

Chitwan: Morning & Afternoon Jeep Safaris: An early start will see us heading into the park for a morning jeep safari. We will travel through the forests looking out for the animals, still active before the heat of the day sets in. The park is home to a huge array of species with one-horned rhinos, Bengal tigers and elephants all resident in the park. We may also see sloth bears, mugger crocodiles and gharials, jackals and various cats. There are also over 500 bird species in the park including babblers, darters and eagles. Our morning safari will include breakfast in the park and we will return to the lodge for lunch before heading back out in the afternoon for a further safari.

Chitwan – Bhaktapur: Momo Cookery Class: Our journey nearly at an end, we will head back to the Kathmandu Valley this evening to the mediaeval city of Bhaktapur; the drive taking 4-5 hours. The city has retained much of its authentic, historic charm with brick paved roads and red brick houses along with the woodcarving for which the city is known displayed on window frames and temples. This afternoon we will meet a local family who will share with us the secrets of cooking momos. These steamed dumplings are one of Nepal’s national dishes and are available in nearly every restaurant as well as being popular throughout the region. After we have learned about the ingredients and tried folding the small shapes we will enjoy a meal with our hosts.

Bhaktapur: Durbar Square, Crafts & Pottery: We will explore Bhaktapur’s Durbar Square this morning, the palaces, temples, gates and statues date from the 13th to 18th centuries and are a showcase of the art and architecture from the Malla Dynasty. We will see such highlights as the 55 Window Palace and the Golden Gate before we meet some of the city’s artisans. Renowned for various skills, the city is home to many workshops where intricate wood carvings and traditional metal work is created. We may be lucky enough to be invited into the homes of one or two of the artisans to learn about their craft and culture. In Pottery Square we can admire the beautiful pots and sculptures before we head to the village of Thimi and try to recreate some of the pieces in our own pottery workshop. This evening we will have a final dinner together in the city.
Tour ends in Bhaktapur: The tour ends after breakfast, those on the suggested group flights will be transferred to Kathmandu Airport.

tourName: Nilgiri Hills nature and indigenous culture holiday, India
generalInfo:
Explore the world of the Adivasi – the indigenous forest-dwelling tribal people of the Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve in South India – with a pioneering social enterprise which aims to bring mutual benefit to them and to those who support them.

We offer two fortnight-long nature tours (April and Dec 2026). Our area of the Western Ghats in South India is rich with hundreds of species, many endemic to the Nilgiris. Walks, talks and safaris will be arranged to learn about the lives and environment of the hunter-gatherer Adivasi. Sandeep, our charismatic and knowledgeable naturalist, will lead the small group tours; his popular bird-watching walks are a key feature of the tour.

Guests on the tours will stay, with exclusive use, in our purpose-built luxury guest house. Each room has an en-suite bathroom and a private veranda with mountain views. South Indian cuisine will be served (cooking lessons are available) with Western breakfast also provided. Yoga lessons are also on offer. The climate is perfect at this time of the year, pleasantly warm during the day without any excessive heat, because of the elevation. Nature walks will be organised in the surrounding hills and nearby estates and safaris into the Tiger and Elephant Reserve near the guest house.

These tours, uniquely, involve and benefit tribal communities in India, whilst exploring the extraordinarily species-rich aspects of the natural world in the stunning Nilgiri Hills and the Mudumulai and Bandipur Forests. Walking distances and difficulties can be tailored to suit the participants on each tour. By participating, you will be giving valuable help to the Adivasi community, through employment and because all profit from the tours is donated to the tribal community organisations. Please watch on Netflix The Elephant Whisperers, a short documentary Oscar winner, which features members of this community and their elephant charges. We are happy to tailor any aspect of the tours to meet your preferences including visiting some heritage sites in Mysore, Srirangapatna, Somanathapura and Ooty, as well as a trip on the 'toy' mountain train if desired. Contact us for details!

Testimonials from former tour participants:

'It was the best holiday I have ever had. We were beautifully looked after by wonderful staff in a very comfortable house, driven to National Parks, saw tigers, elephants and a mass of other animals and birds, were fed delicious food, went to Ooty where we stayed the night in a lovely comfortable hotel; our guide was just brilliant, we learnt a lot, saw so much and I didn’t want to come home! Just wonderful. Thank you.'

'Words can't describe what a fabulous time we had. Nothing could have prepared us for that extraordinary experience thanks to you and your wonderful staff and collaborators';

'Awe-inspiring views, superb staff and outstanding cooks';

'A unique and fantastic experience';

'Simply wonderful - rarely does a destination over-perform, but Plenti does so in spades'.

dayInfo.description: Fly from the UK to Bangalore
The group is met at Bangalore and travel to Mysore. After relaxing in the afternoon visits are arranged to the market and to Mysore Palace, with overnight stay in Mysore.
Travel from Mysore to the Nilgiri Hills, crossing through the Bandipur Forest. Stop for bird-watching en route.

Morning short bird-walk (or yoga, optional); after breakfast, talk about expectations of the tour from the participants, and review of the itinerary. Naturalist's presentation on Western Ghats. Afternoon visit to Gene Pool, the Forest Department's nature centre.

Safari in Mudumulai Tiger Reserve. Breakfast at Jungle Hut resort in Masinagudi in the reserve. Birding there with the local Naturalist. Post lunch session about, and with, the local tribal community and the work of their community organisations.
Visit a large nearby tea estate trail for birdwatching. After lunch, options for local walks, cookery etc. Early evening talk on the Mammals of the Western Ghats

Yoga optional before breakfast. Morning with local expert on elephant/human conflict mitigation to hear about and discuss his work. Afternoon, visit to tribal social welfare/livelihoods organisation) to learn about their work. Evening talk on Nilgiris Conservation.
To Avalanche, near Ooty. Birding en route at Wenlock Downs. Overnight stay.

To Coonoor and by Toy Train to Ooty for lunch and sight seeing, (Ooty was the summer capital of the Madras Presidency during the time of the British Raj; the Botanic Gardens were laid out at that time). Return to Gudalur

Yoga optional before breakfast. See how the famous Lantana Elephants are made by tribal youth, and how they remove that invasive species from the forest. Visit and hear a short presentation on the work of the Real Elephant Collective. In the afternoon, visit the tribal hospital to discuss tribal health challenges. Evening of talks with Naturalists.
Yoga optional before breakfast. Opportunity to enjoy Ayurvedic massage and learn South Indian cooking, visit the local town and follow some local walking trails.

Travel via Bandipur Tiger reserve, with a self-drive safari, followed by breakfast at the Serai resort, and birding in its vicinity. Then on to Mysore via the Hoysala Dynasty temple at Somnathpur. In Mysore, local sightseeing as preferred.

Birding in Mysore surrounds, visit the Ranganathittu Bird sanctuary; lunch at Srirangapatna, optional visit to Tipu Sultan's Summer Palace and Gumbaz (his burial place). Travel on to Bangalore for overnight stay.
Return flight to the UK, arriving back in the afternoon. Please note the above itinerary is representative; details and daily arrangements may change, eg because of elephant movements.

tourName: North and South India grand tour, 30 days
generalInfo:
An amazing tour of India’s most cherished treasures. From sunrise on the Taj Mahal to a sunset over the rose-coloured terracotta towers of Jaipur to the plantations of Munnar..this trip has it all.

• Accommodation as specified in the itinerary on Double sharing basis for 30 Nights or similar
• Daily buffet breakfast at all the hotels.
• All Meals (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner) whilst stay at Houseboat in Alleppey.
• Single entry to the monuments as mentioned above.
• All transfers and excursions using 01 AC Innova Car.
• Services of an English speaking local Guide as per the itinerary (on private basis)
• Rickshaw ride in Delhi
• Boat ride at Lake Pichola, Udaipur on shared basis.
Kathakali Dance Show at Cochin
• Tea Museum Visit at Munnar
• Spice Plantation Tour at Periyar
• Boatride at Periyar
• Assistance on arrival and departure transfers.
• All applicable taxes on hotel & transport.
• Govt. service tax of 3.62%

dayInfo.description: Delhi Day 1 Upon arrival in Delhi airport, you will be met by our representative and will be provided assisted transfer to your hotel. Upon arrival check in to the Hotel. Spend the rest of the day at leisure. Day 2 After breakfast, full day city tour of New & Old Delhi. Places to visit includes: • Jama Masjid • Cycle Rickshaw ride in Old Delhi • Red Fort (from Outside) • Humayun’s Tomb • Qutub Minar • Drive Past Janpath

Agra Day 3 Morning transfer to railway station. Departure from Delhi @ 0600 Hrs and Arrival @ 0757 Hrs On arrival check in at the hotel. Rest of the day is free at leisure. Day 4 Sunrise Taj Visit (closed on Friday). After Taj visit return back to the Hotel for breakfast. After breakfast, visit rest of the monuments in Agra • Agra Fort, • Itmad –ud-daulah Evening is free at leisure.

Jaipur Day 5 Today morning after breakfast, drive to Jaipur (approx. 05 Hrs), en-route visit Fatehpur Sikri. Upon arrival in Jaipur, check-in at the hotel. Day 6 Today morning after breakfast, full day city tour of Jaipur. Places to visit includes: • Amber Fort • City Palace • Jantar Mantar • Hawa Mahal (From outside only) Evening explore the colorful local markets of Jaipur. Day 7 After breakfast, day free at leisure.

Shahpura Day 8 Morning after breakfast drive to Shahpura.(approx. 5 Hrs). Upon arrival check in to the Hotel. Spend the rest of the day at leisure. Overnight at the hotel. Day 9 Morning breakfast at the hotel. Rest of the day is free at leisure to indulge in some activities on direct payment basis. Overnight at the hotel.

Jodpur Day 10 After breakfast, drive to Jodhpur (approx. 07 Hrs). Upon arrival check in to the Hotel. Day 11 After Breakfast, Half Day City Tour of Jodhpur. Place to visit includes: • Mehrangarh Fort • Jaswant Thada • Umaid Bhawan Palace Evening free at leisure. Overnight at the hotel.

Udaipur Day 12 After breakfast, drive to Udaipur(approx. 0700 Hrs). Upon arrival check in to the Hotel. Jodhpur Day 13 After breakfast, Half day city tour of Udaipur. Places to visit includes: • The Maharana’s City Palace • Sahelion ki Badi In afternoon boat ride at Lake Pichola on seat basis. Day 14 After breakfast, day free at leisure.

Mumbai Day 15 After breakfast, you will be provided assisted departure transfer to airport to connect the flight for Mumbai. In Mumbai you will be provided assisted arrival transfer from airport to Hotel. Upon arrival check in to the Hotel. Day 16 After breakfast, Full day city tour of Mumbai. Places to visits includes: • Gateway of India • Prince Wales Museum (Closed on Monday) • Drive past Marine Drive • Kamla Nehru Park • Victoria Terminus • Hanging Gardens • Mani Bhawan • Dhobi Ghat Overnight at the Hotel.

Cochin Day 17 After breakfast, you will be provided assisted departure transfer to airport to connect the flight for Cochin. In Cochin, you will be provided assisted arrival transfer from airport to Hotel. Upon arrival check in to the Hotel. Cochin Day 18 After breakfast, half day city tour of Cochin. Places to visit includes: • Jewish Synagogue (Saturday remain closed) • Dutch Palace (Friday remain closed) • Chinese fishing nets • St. Francis Church • In the evening witness a classical Indian dance show – Kathakali.

Munnar Day 19 After breakfast, drive to Munnar (Approx. 04 Hours). Upon arrival check in at the Hotel. Rest of the day is free at leisure Day 20 After breakfast, full day sightseeing of Munnar. Places to visit includes: • Echo Point, • Tea Garden, • Tea Museum

Periyar Day 21 After breakfast, drive to Periyar (3.5 Hrs approx.). Upon arrival check in at the hotel. Later enjoy Kalaripayattu show in Thekkady Day 22 After breakfast, enjoy a full day Thekkady tour • Spice plantation tour • Periyar Lake Day 23 Full day at leisure for independent activities. Overnight at the hotel.
Alleppey-Houseboat Day 24 Today morning after breakfast, drive to Alleppey (3.5 Hrs approx.) Upon arrival overnight on houseboat.
Kumarakom Day 25 After breakfast disembark at Kumarakom and check in at the hotel. Day 26 After breakfast, day free at leisure.

Marari Day 27-30 After breakfast, check out and drive to Marari. (1 Hrs approx.) Upon arrival check in at the Hotel. Day 31 After breakfast, drive to Cochin airport. In Cochin you will be provided assisted departure at airport for your flight to onwards journey.

tourName: North East India 10 day tour
generalInfo:
Embark on A Journey to Northeast India's Hidden Gems:
Guwahati | Cherrapunjee | Shillong | Kaziranga | Jorhat

The Seven Sister States are a region in north-eastern India, comprising the contiguous states of Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Manipur, Mizoram, Nagaland and Tripura.
The sisters lie deep in the lap of easternmost Himalayan hills. Connected to the rest of India by merely 20 km of wide land (at Siliguri, West Bengal), North- East India shares over 2,000 km of border with Bhutan, China, Myanmar and Bangladesh.

This Tour will take you to a lesser visited part of India - the town of Cherrapunjee in Meghalaya, remote monasteries, the virgin forests of Arunachal, the endangered species of the one horned Rhino of Kaziranga in Assam and finally the gentle tea gardens of Jorhat.

North-East India is home to a varied number of tribal groups (almost 166). Each tribe has their own distinct culture, which gives them a unique cultural identity. Numerous of art forms and festivals of the region are intrinsic part of its rich culture and tradition. Main industries in the region are tea-based, crude oil and natural gas, silk, bamboo and handicrafts. The states are heavily forested and have plentiful rainfall.

The region is known for its unique culture, handicrafts, martial arts and scenic beauty.

Includes:
- 9 Nights stay in hotels as above.
- 9 breakfast, 9 dinner and 8 lunches
- One sunset cruise ride in Guwahati with high tea
- AC SUV for the entire tour of 10 days
- Accompanied English speaking guide for the entire tour
- Local ferry transfer to Majuli Island with local lunch
- Jungle safari, caving/hiking and all activities mentioned in the plan
- All monument entrances as applicable

Best months to travel: November to April

dayInfo.description: Guwahati - Arrival: Guwahati, on the bank of Brahmaputra River and at the foot of Shillong Plateau is an ancient town since the pre-historical era and used to be an important seat of tantra and Vajrayana Buddhism. Guwahati has been a part of the state from the time immemorial and traces of the city are often found in Puranas or ancient epics. Mahabharata talks about Guwahati as the capital of Bhagadatta and Kamakhya. And it was referred to as "Pragjyotishpura", which means "city of eastern light". Guwahati now, has also been mentioned as Durjaya in many places that indicates an invincible power ruling Kamrup during the time. Interesting ruins evoke a glorious past and many ancient temples scattered all over the city have brought it a title and it is also famous as the "The City of Temples." We check in to your hotel in the city and then you will have the option of taking some rest and personal time at the hotel or you can go for a Sunset Cruise to enjoy your evening with a relaxing and unforgettable sunset over the mighty Brahmaputra River. See the sun go down over the stunning landscape and then watch the stars appear in the night sky. The cruise will sail from Guwahati to North Guwahati and back for about an hour, so all you need to do is sit back, enjoy and admire the view. Overnight at your hotel.

Guwahati- Cherrapunjee: Today we drive to Cherrapunjee (5 - 6 hrs). With a unique climate gifted to the area, its untouched beauty and an environment similar to the freshest dew drops, Cherrapunjee is sure to refresh you inside out. The waterfalls in the area only compliment the climate and the flattering pleasant air around. These include the Dain Thelen falls, Noh Sngithiang falls, Noh Kalikai falls and more. This rainy misty place is also famous for the lavish spread of the Bangladesh plains from its cliffs. This lovely town is also famous for its limestone caves, orange, honey, a headquarter of the Syiem of Sohra and a Centre of the Khasi Culture and literature. Reach Cherrapunjee resort in the afternoon. Check-in and rest. Overnight in Cherrapunjee.

Cherrapunjee - Caving: After a 15 kms drive, enjoy the 5-7 kms of caving (6-7 hrs round trip). Meghalaya has more than 5000 caves out of which only 600 have been mapped till date. The Krem Mawmluh cave we take you to is a labyrinth of routes totalling about 7 kms. We reach Cherrapunjee, put on overalls and boots and with carbide lamps on our heads we are all set for our adventure. We get into the cave through a small opening. Once inside, it is a different world altogether. We walk on sand and rocks, squeeze ourselves though narrow openings, sometimes on all fours. You will be able to see the impressive stalactite and stalagmite formations and water pools. Open your lunch hamper in one of the sandy chambers in the cave or finish caving and open the hamper outside on the rocks under the sun. Those not keen on caving, go for a sightseeing trip of Cherrapunjee. Overnight at your hotel.

Cherrapunjee - Shillong: a Double Decker Living Roots bridge walk- 10 kms drive and 5-6 kms trek one way (6-7 hrs round trip). The lower reaches of the southern slopes of Khasi and Jaintia hills in Meghalaya are humid and warm and are streaked by many swift flowing rivers and mountain streams. A species of Indian Rubber tree thrives and flourishes alongside these streams and rivers. This tree can comfortably perch itself on huge boulders along side the riverbanks or in the middle of rivers and send its roots down to the riverbed. The bridges here are made from these living roots. This is one of the most beautiful treks. The high point of this trek is the Double Decker Root Bridge and the natural swimming pools in the river bed. This trek is open through-out the year and is being used by the villagers daily.
