We’re also involved in several community projects aimed at putting sustainable income where it is needed most, and we actively encourage guests to find out more about our charitable fund-raising in some of the more remote rural villages that we'll encounter as part of the tour.

Completing the tour as the sun sets over the Taj Mahal is just as magical as you can imagine with visits to the Agra Fort providing ever-lasting memories before you board a fast-train back to Delhi before finally heading for home.

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Delhi : A Grand Welcome to India’s Capital Step into Delhi, a city that tells its story in layers from imperial grandeur to spiritual resilience and the vibrant chaos of everyday life. This afternoon, embark on a curated exploration of some of North India’s most iconic and inspiring landmarks. Qutub-Minar, Soaring 73 metres into the sky, this UNESCO World Heritage Site is a masterpiece of Indo-Islamic architecture and a towering symbol of Delhi’s medieval past. Humayun’s Tomb: Often described as the ‘precursor to the Taj Mahal’, this elegant 16th-century mausoleum is a serene oasis of symmetry, red sandstone and Mughal artistry. Gandhi Smriti (Gandhi Museum): A moving tribute to the Mahatma, this peaceful residence turned museum invites quiet reflection on India’s journey to independence through deeply personal artefacts and stories. Local Markets: Lose yourself in the sensory spectacle of Delhi’s bustling bazaars, where fragrant spices, handcrafted treasures and kaleidoscopic fabrics offer a thrilling introduction to the city’s living culture. As the sun sets, return to your boutique accommodation , your peaceful sanctuary in the midst of the capital’s energy. Overnight in Delhi: Rest, recharge, and prepare for the journey to unfold.

This morning, board one of the world’s most enchanting railway experiences the iconic Toy Train, a UNESCO World Heritage journey through the Himalayan foothills. As the train winds its way past mist-laced forests, cascading hillsides and picture-postcard villages, sit back and soak in the nostalgia of a bygone era — colonial charm meets cinematic scenery, every curve offering a new perspective. Arrive in the historic hill station of Shimla, once the summer capital of British India. Nestled at 2,200 metres, Shimla is a refreshing escape of pine-clad hills, colonial-era architecture and crisp mountain air. Spend your afternoon strolling along the Mall Road, taking in Victorian landmarks, bustling cafes, and perhaps a glimpse of a snow-dusted peak beyond the rooftops. Overnight in Shimla: Sleep in the serenity of the hills, where heritage meets Himalayan tranquillity.

Today, step back into the days of the British Raj as you explore Shimla’s elegant colonial legacy. This hill station once served as the grand summer capital of British India and its streets still whisper stories of power, politics, and leisure in the mountains. Wander through the charming old town, where Victorian and Edwardian architecture still stands tall from timeless churches and ivy-clad schools to the graceful Vice Regal Lodge, the former residence of British viceroys. Stroll along the heritage-laden streets and hidden lanes, soaking in the atmosphere of a bygone era with every cobbled path, carved balcony, and wrought-iron gate offering a glimpse into Shimla’s storied past. Overnight in Shimla : Drift to sleep in the cool mountain air, surrounded by history and Himalayan peace.

Today’s journey leads you deep into the heart of the Satluj Valley, following a scenic mountain trail that unfolds through cedar scented forests, terraced farmlands, and quiet Himalayan slopes brushed with wildflowers. Stop in Thali Village, a traditional Himachali hamlet untouched by time. Here, you’ll be warmly welcomed by the local community a chance to learn about daily mountain life, ancestral customs, and perhaps even enjoy a taste of home cooked Himachali fare shared with generous smiles. The trail continues to Tattapani, a peaceful riverside village renowned for its natural sulphur hot springs, believed for centuries to hold healing and purifying properties. Let the day’s hike melt away as you immerse yourself in the warm, mineral-rich waters an ancient wellness ritual set beneath open skies. Overnight at Hotel Hot Springs, Tattapani : Settle into riverside tranquillity, where wellness meets wilderness. Enjoy a traditional meal, perhaps a local herbal infusion, and fall asleep to the gentle murmur of the Satluj River.

This morning, take a gentle hike through the lush, terraced landscape surrounding Thali Village a serene corner of the Himalayas where nature and community live in quiet harmony. Your walk leads to two small, local schools, where you'll have the opportunity to meet students and teachers, witness daily school life in the mountains, and begin planning the first phase of a life-enhancing water filter programme , a project aimed at providing clean, safe drinking water to these remote educational hubs. This is more than a visit , it’s an invitation to engage, contribute, and connect with a community that welcomes you not as a tourist, but as a trusted guest and ally. As the sun dips behind the peaks, settle into your charming local farm stay, surrounded by fields, forests, and the scent of woodsmoke. Enjoy a simple, wholesome dinner made with ingredients grown nearby a truly grounding end to a day of shared purpose and Himalayan hospitality. Overnight at Farm Stay, Thali Village – Experience mountain life at its most authentic: slow, sincere, and deeply rewarding.

This morning, embark on a short yet spectacular hike through the serene, rolling hills of the Himalayas, leading you to Baror Village, a hilltop haven nestled amid forested ridges and offering panoramic mountain views. At the heart of the village is a small, vibrant school a place filled with hope, curiosity, and the promise of the future. Here, you’ll have the unique opportunity to meet the students and teachers, and, if you wish, to contribute further to ongoing community projects. Whether it's supporting local education, facilitating clean water initiatives, or simply sharing stories with the villagers, your involvement makes a lasting difference. This is more than just a visit, it’s an exchange, an opportunity to become part of the community and connect through shared goals and genuine relationships. As the day draws to a close, return to your cosy farm stay, where the hospitality is warm, the landscape is breathtaking, and the spirit of community is ever present. Overnight at Farm Stay, Baror Village: Rest in the tranquillity of the hills, surrounded by fresh mountain air, stunning views, and the welcoming embrace of a community that feels like home.

Today, embark on a memorable trek starting from the sacred Badeyogi Deo Peak a revered site that holds deep spiritual significance for locals. As you make your way down, you’ll be taken through the heart of the hidden mountain communities, where time honoured traditions, stone houses, and terraced fields paint a picture of a simpler, slower pace of life.Reach the historic Mahunag Temple, dedicated to the local deity, Mahunag, believed to protect the region. This centuries old temple is a stunning example of Himachali architecture and spiritual devotion. Pilgrims from far and wide visit for blessings and to pay homage to the mountain gods.As the day draws to a close, set up camp under the stars in the tranquil surroundings of Mahunag, where the spirit of the mountains and history intertwine.Overnight Camping at Mahunag: Rest beneath the stars, immersed in the serenity and sacred energy of the temple and the Himalayan wilderness. Overnight Camping at Mahunag : Rest beneath the stars, immersed in the serenity and sacred energy of the temple and the Himalayan wilderness.

En route to Chindi, be captivated by the vibrant and colourful Hindu temples, each brimming with rich history and intricate craftsmanship. These sacred sites offer a fascinating glimpse into the region's spiritual life. In the evening, unwind with a yoga class that helps you reconnect and relax before enjoying the sunset over the hills. As night falls, gather around the campfire at Chindi village, where the flickering flames and the sounds of nature create a truly magical atmosphere. Overnight Camping at Chindi: Rest beneath the stars, enveloped by the tranquillity of the mountains and the warmth of the campfire.

Start your day with a breakfast amidst alpine forests, where the crisp mountain air and the peaceful sounds of nature set the perfect tone for your adventure. Continue your trek through apple orchards and traditional villages, offering a glimpse into the local way of life, before making your way to Shanthal Camp. This picturesque route is framed by lush landscapes and tranquil surroundings, creating a serene journey that’s as beautiful as it is peaceful. Arrive at your campsite, perched high above the Karsog Valley and Chindi, offering breathtaking views of the valley below. The perfect place to unwind and soak in the beauty of the Himalayas. Overnight Camping at Shikari : Fall asleep beneath the stars, with panoramic views of the valley and the comforting sounds of nature all around.

Today, travel back to Shimla via scenic mountain roads, descending through traditional, remote communities where local families continue their age-old farming practices. As you journey through these picturesque villages, you'll witness the beauty of rural life in the Himalayas a peaceful contrast to the bustling hill station ahead. Upon arrival in Shimla, enjoy the cool mountain air and the charm of this former summer capital, where colonial architecture meets stunning natural landscapes. Overnight in Shimla: Rest in comfort, surrounded by the unique blend of history, culture, and breathtaking views.

Today, say goodbye to the serene mountains as you journey from Chandigarh to Delhi, moving from the peaceful landscapes to the vibrant energy of India’s bustling capital. Upon arrival in Delhi, immerse yourself in the dynamic atmosphere of the city, where history, culture, and modern life converge. Overnight in Delhi: Rest in comfort, surrounded by the city's vibrant pulse and its many stories waiting to be discovered.

This morning, board a fast train to Agra for a day of unforgettable exploration. First stop: the Taj Mahal, one of the world’s most iconic monuments. This awe-inspiring white marble masterpiece, built as a symbol of eternal love, glows with ethereal beauty, a moment that stays with you long after you’ve left. Continue to the majestic Agra Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage site steeped in Mughal grandeur. Wander through its red sandstone palaces, royal courtyards, and storied walls, imagining the echoes of emperors past. Before returning to Delhi, enjoy time to browse Agra’s bustling street markets, where you’ll find local crafts, marble inlay souvenirs, and colourful textiles. Fast train back to Delhi Overnight in Delhi: Unwind after a day of wonder, with the city’s vibrant energy waiting just outside your window.

It’s time to say goodbye to India: a land of mountains, memories, and meaningful connections. Transfer to the airport for your international flight home, carrying with you the colours, stories, and spirit of the Himalayas and beyond. Though the journey ends here, the experiences stay with you and the mountains will always be waiting.

tourName: North India holiday, cultural immersion and the himalayas
generalInfo:
Highlights:
Historical and Cultural Delhi - Spiritual Holy Ganges - Golden temple, holiest place of Sikh Faith - Dalai Lama’s Dharmshala – Maharaja’s from Mandi – Chindi, stunning Alpine hills – Relaxing hot springs – Shimla, previous British Raj capital – Chandigarh, Rock Garden - Breath taking Taj Mahal

India & The Himalayas are stimulating and rewarding places to visit - with long histories, complex social and religious influences and a colourful and diverse population. This is a region with many languages, religious beliefs, architectural & archaeological treasures: an area influenced by many over the centuries, including the British Raj.

Your varied itinerary will give you an insight into the region as a genuineTraveller, not a tourist. With an experienced local guide and with just a few Travellers in a group, you can get to places that larger groups cannot, eating genuine local food, perhaps joining in with some Yoga and visiting hidden, authentic locations.

You can do some day trekking in the beautiful Himalayan foothills, taking tea with village elders and developing a genuine appreciation of the challenges these people face. The hilltop villages are totally unspoilt and a visit to a community project will give you the chance to experience the culture first hand.

There are some inspiring, iconic sights in this region, including the famous Taj Mahal and the beautiful Golden temple where you’ll have a chance to understand the history and beliefs of the Sikh faith. We’ll take you to less-visited places too, such as Parmarth Niketan Ashram where candle lighting and signing are part of the magical evening ceremony next to the Holy Ganges.

Those who have travelled with us often comment that their trip has given them a unique opportunity to spend time understanding the people and traditional ways of life in this remote corner of India whilst enjoying the amazing mountain landscapes – memories that will last them a lifetime.

dayInfo.description: Delhi. Arrival. Markets and historical sights of Delhi. Overnight, New Delhi.
To Rishikesh. Train from Delhi to Haridwar and car to Rishikesh. Overnight, Rishikesh.
Rishikesh. Sightseeing and visiting temples and riverside ashrams, evening ceremony next to the Holy Ganges Overnight, Rishikesh.
Haridwar. Sightseeing in Haridwar and holy river ceremony by the river. Overnight, sleeper train to Amritsar.
Amritsar. Visit the inspiring Golden Temple and Border Flag Ceremony at Wagah. Overnight, Amritsar.
Dharamshala – Visit to the Tibetan museum and Buddhist monasteries and the Dalai Lama’s residence. Overnight Mecleodganj.
Kangra. Visit Kangra Fort, Brijeshawary temple and tea Estates in the Kangra Valley. Overnight Taragar Palace.
Mandi. Explore this traditional Himachali Town. Afternoon walk at the beautiful Rewalser Lake and ancient Buddhist Caves. Overnight, Mandi.
Chindi. Relaxing drive up through scenic terraced fields and Alpine forests. Overnight Chindi.
Tattapani. Morning trek and picnic lunch with amazing mountain views. Drive to hot springs to explore village life. Overnight, Tattapani lakeside.
Thali village. Visit a local school or community sustainable travel project. Overnight, Farmhouse at Thali village.
Shimla. Early drive to Shimla and heritage walk in this previous summer capital of the British Raj with expert guide. Sightseeing and evening shopping. Overnight, Shimla.
Chandigarh. Historic ‘Toy Train’ from Shimla to Chandigarh, afternoon visit to the famous Rock Garden and town, Overnight, Delhi.
Taj Mahal: Day trip by fast train to the inspiring Taj Mahal. Overnight in Delhi.
Flight home.

tourName: North India luxury tour with Shimla
generalInfo:
The Best of North India - this Tour is a truly Exceptional One!
On this 19 day tour, you will live the Ultimate North India experience, adding the exceptional hill station Shimla. You will not only witness the best of the Golden Triangle, but also one of the most beautiful railway journeys - on the Kalka-Shimla Toy Train. Offering views of the lush green valleys, rugged mountains, waterfalls and pine covered forests, the Toy Train passes through more than 100 tunnels and 800 bridges to cover some 60 miles. Built in 1903, this UNESCO World Heritage Site takes you back in time with a display of awe-inspiring landscapes and rich colonial history.

Includes:
• Accommodation as specified in the itinerary on Double sharing basis for 18 Nights
• Daily buffet breakfast at all the hotels.
• Single entry to the monuments as mentioned above.
• All transfers and excursions using 01 AC Innova Car.
• Services of an English speaking local Guide as per the itinerary (on private basis)
• Toy Train in Non Ac from Kalka to Shimla
• Train fare for sector Delhi – Kalka, and Kalka – Delhi in AC Chair Car
• Rickshaw ride in Delhi.
• Boat ride at Lake Pichola, Udaipur on shared basis.
• Assistance on arrival and departure transfers.

dayInfo.description: Delhi: Day 1 - Upon arrival in Delhi airport, you will be met by our representative and will be provided assisted transfer to your hotel. Upon arrival check in to the Hotel (Heritage Hotel Maidens). Spend the rest of the day at leisure. Overnight at the hotel. Day 2 - After breakfast, full day city tour of New & Old Delhi. Places to visit include: • Jama Masjid • Cycle Rickshaw ride in Old Delhi • Red Fort (from outside) • Humayun’s Tomb • Qutub Minar • Drive Past Janpath. Overnight at the hotel.

Shimla: Day 3 - After breakfast, you will be provided assisted departure transfer from Hotel to railway station to board the train for Kalka. At Kalka, transfer to the Toy Train (no assistance). Enjoy the scenic and historic Kalka-Shimla toy train ride - a UNESCO World Heritage site that connects Kalka to Shimla. On arrival in Shimla, a representative will be waiting for you at the railway station who will take you to your hotel for overnight stay. Hotel: The Oberoi Cecil’s. Day 4 - After breakfast, sightseeing of Shimla. Places to visit: • Vice-regal Lodge • The Ridge • The Christ Church • Jakhoo Hill • Indian Institute of Advance study (remain closed on every Monday). Overnight at the hotel. Day 5 - After breakfast, day free to explore Shimla. Overnight at the hotel.

Delhi: After breakfast, you will be provided assisted departure transfer to Kalka railway station to board the train back to Delhi. On arrival in Delhi, you will be provided assisted arrival transfer from train station to Hotel. Overnight at the hotel (The Connaught)

Agra: After breakfast, you will be driven to Agra (4 hours approx.). On arrival check in at the hotel. Rest of the day is free at leisure. Overnight at the hotel (Trident Agra - ranked amongst the best hotels in Agra near the Taj Mahal)

Jaipur: Day 8 - Experience a Sunrise visit of the Taj Mahal (closed on Friday). After Taj visit return back to the Hotel for breakfast. Later drive to Jaipur (appr. 5 hours), en-route visit The Unesco World Heritage site Fatehpur Sikri - the capital of 16th century Mughals before they shifted to Agra; also visit 8th century stepwell Chand Baori at Abhaneri village. Upon arrival in Jaipur, check-in at the hotel. Spend the evening at leisure. Overnight at the exceptional hotel Samode Haveli - a traditional Indian mansion set in a verdant garden with apartments arranged around a series of intimate courtyards, built 225 years ago as a residence of the rulers of Samode. Day 9 - Today morning after breakfast, full day city tour of Jaipur. Places to visit include: • Amber Fort • City Palace • Jantar Mantar • Hawa Mahal (From outside only). In the evening explore the colorful local markets of Jaipur. Overnight at the Hotel. Day 10 - Day free at leisure. We have a wide range of activities which we can organise for you for this free day on your request with supplement cost (for example Art & Antiquities Walk, Block Printing, Bagru, Bazaars, Craft & Cusines, Blue Pottery Excursion, cooking demonstrations along with meal with the local family, Kite flying for the kids and so on). Overnight at your hotel.

Deogarth: Day 11 - After breakfast, drive to Dev Shri Deogarh (approx. 5.5 Hrs). Upon arrival check in to the Hotel. Spend the rest of the day at leisure. Overnight at the hotel Dev Shri Deogarh - the Best Homestay in Rajasthan and seventh best in India - where royal heritage meets modern comfort amidst Rajasthan’s serene landscapes. Day 12 and 13 - After breakfast, rest of the day is free at leisure to enjoy the hotel and indulge in some activities on direct payment basis. Overnight at the hotel.

Udaipur: Day 14 - After breakfast, drive to Udaipur (approx. 2.5 Hrs). Upon arrival check in to the Hotel. Spend the rest of the day at leisure. Overnight at the hotel Trident - a 5 star hotel on the banks of Lake Pichola. Day 15 - After breakfast, Half day city tour of Udaipur. Places to visit include: • City Palace • Sahelion ki Badi. In the afternoon enjoy a common boat ride on Lake Pichola. Overnight at the hotel.

Jodhpur: Day 16 - After breakfast, drive to Jodhpur, enroute visiting Ranakpur with audio guides (approx. 6 Hrs). Upon arrival in Jodhpur, check-in at the hotel. Spend the evening at leisure. Overnight at the Hotel Ratan Vilas Jodhpur - a heritage hotel that was once the private home of Maharaj Ratan Singh. Day 17 - After Breakfast, Half Day City Tour of Jodhpur. Places to visit include: • Mehrangarh Fort • Jaswant Thada • Evening free at leisure. Overnight at the hotel.

Delhi: Day 18 - After breakfast, fly back to Delhi, drive just 20 minutes to arrive at your hotel. Upon arrival check in to the Hotel. Overnight at the Hotel Trident Gurgaon. Day 19 - Today morning after breakfast, you will be assisted & transferred in your private car to Delhi International airport to connect flight for onward destination.

tourName: North India small group tour
placesVisited: Delhi, Jaipur, Agra, Agra Fort, Taj Mahal, Taragram paper making factory, Orchha, Khajuraho, Kama Sutra temples, Varanasi, sunrise boat ride on the Ganges
generalInfo:
Explore the highlights of northern India on this adventure tour from Delhi to Varanasi. Discover the Pink City of Jaipur, see the Mughal architectural splendours of Delhi and Agra, and soak up the ambience of holy Varanasi. This wonderful introduction to the magic of India includes lavish palaces, vibrant bazaars, Kama Sutra temple carvings, Bollywood blockbusters and the incomparable Taj Mahal.

Admiring the manmade sights of northern India, from Jaipur’s Palace of the Winds to Agra’s Red Fort, is just one element of this trip. You’ll get to know the region’s people and culture, too. Share a home cooked meal with a Hindu family in Khajuraho, watch ancient bathing rituals and candle flower ceremonies on the Ganges and enjoy a cooking demonstration and dance show. This trip spends 12 days exploring, using everything from planes, trains and rickshaws to move from place to place, with nine nights in hotels and two in heritage properties.

dayInfo.title: Delhi.
dayInfo.description: Namaste! Welcome to India. When you arrive at Delhi Airport, you’ll be collected by a local representative and transferred to your hotel. Your adventure then begins with a welcome meeting at 6 pm to meet your local leader and fellow travellers. Later, why not get your new group together to sample of this country’s famed food?

dayInfo.title: Delhi .
dayInfo.description: Get your bearings in Delhi by starting your day with a leader-led tour of the oldest part of the city – aptly called Old Delhi. Your leader will help you navigate the metro system so you can explore the impressive Mughal architecture on foot. It’s not Delhi without a traffic jam, so hop aboard a traditional rickshaw and weave your way around the streets surrounding the Chandi Chowk marketplace. Stop by India’s oldest and largest mosque, the Jama Masjid, before heading into the Sikh temple of Sheeshganj Gurudwara to observe the capital’s spiritual side. Enjoy a traditional Thali lunch with your group before a free evening to wander the city as you wish. Tap into your leader’s local expertise for food and activity recommendations that match your mood.

dayInfo.title: Agra.
dayInfo.description: Board the train and journey to the city best known for housing one of the Seven Wonders of the World. After you settle into your hotel, head out for lunch in a cafe run by women who have survived acid attacks. After, take in the sights as you head to the Taj Mahal. A tribute to his belated wife, Emperor Shah Jahan commissioned this famous monument in 1632 to house her remains. Stroll through the gardens and learn more about its history at the Museum. You can also sign up to an optional demonstration on hand knotted carpets – a craft that dates to the Mughal era – or explore Agra at your own pace.

dayInfo.title: Agra/ Ranthambore NP .
dayInfo.description: If you fell in love with the Taj Mahal yesterday, you can opt to visit again today. There is plenty more to see, like the mosque and its symmetrical jawab building on either side of Main Mausoleum. Then, you will visit Agra Fort. Learn how Akbar built a fortress and prison out of red sandstone in 1565, and then Shah Jahan converted and added to the fort to transform it into a palace. In the afternoon, take a private transport to your next location, the Ranthambore National Park, where you’ll stay for two nights. As this is the longest journey on the trip, your leader will help you secure some snacks and drinks for the ride.

dayInfo.title: Ranthambore NP .
dayInfo.description: Begin your day with an adrenaline rush by embarking on a morning safari. As one of the biggest national parks in northern India, Ranthambore is home to a huge variety of mammals, birds and reptiles. Although it’s primarily known for housing the Royal Bengal Tigers, you might also be able to spot leopards, sloth bears and crocodiles when you’re cruising along. Enjoy a free afternoon before setting out on safari again in the evening for more wildlife watching.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur.
dayInfo.description: Stop at a rural village in Sawai Madhopur on your commute to Jaipur and admire the ancient sacred temples erected around the vicinity. When you arrive in Jaipur, also known as the ‘Pink City’ due to its pink buildings, join your leader on an orientation walking tour. The city has been ranked as one of the most pedestrian friendly cities in India so feel safe as you wander through the busy streets and colourful alleyways. After, immerse yourself in the culture by opting to go to a Bollywood movie screening or enjoy some free time this evening.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur .
dayInfo.description: Your leader will show you around more of Jaipur this morning, maybe starting with the City Palace – a building that wouldn’t look out of place in a Wes Anderson film. Although the royal family of Jaipur still occupy the palace, some gardens and courtyards are open to the public. The rest of the day is yours to explore as you wish. Perhaps visit Jantar Mantar – an observatory filled with instruments to track the stars, built by the founder of Jaipur, Maharaja Jai Singh. Or you can opt for a hot air balloon ride and watch the countryside below from a bird's eye view.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur/ Panna Meena Stepwell & Amber Fort .
dayInfo.description: Explore a lesser-known side of Jaipur by visiting Panna Meena Kund Stepwell. Stepwells like this one were used to collect rainwater, as well as serve as spaces for rituals and gatherings. After, head to the nearby and more well-known Amber Fort, located on a hilltop, giving you a good view of the city. Take in the Rajput and Mughal architectural styles as you explore the various halls and palaces on the grounds with a local guide. Don’t miss the sparkling Mirror Palace – covered floor-to-ceiling in thousands of reflective tiles, the hall becomes a dazzling fantasy with the light of a single match. Then, enjoy the afternoon exploring more of Jaipur and discovering anything you may have missed yesterday. Finish your day with a cooking class in a local home and tuck into your traditional homemade food for dinner with your group.

dayInfo.title: Delhi.
dayInfo.description: Head back to Delhi this morning in a private transfer. The afternoon is yours to explore at your leisure. There are plenty of sites you may have missed the first time around, like Humayun’s Tomb – a garden tomb dating back to 1570 – or Qutb Minar, the highest tower in India. Your leader can help you book any activities you wish to do. In the evening, perhaps gather your group together for a farewell dinner, where you can reminisce about your Indian adventure.

dayInfo.title: Delhi.
dayInfo.description: Your adventure ends after breakfast. Additional accommodation can be pre-booked if you wish to spend more time exploring India. Just speak to your booking agent ahead of time.

tourName: North India tiger and cultural tours
generalInfo:
This private journey in North India will take you through the state of Rajasthan, land of Maharajas and Maharanis and their Majestic Forts and Palaces along with UNESCO World Heritage sites including masjetic Taj Mahal. We will also take you to the former hunting grounds of Maharajas of Jaipur to stop Royal Bengal Tiger. Continue further to Lucknow, the city of Nawabs and Varanasi, the holiest city of India, the destination for millions of pilgrims each year who come to bathe in the River Ganges and say farewell to their loved ones. You will also visit Sarnath where Buddha Sarnath, where Buddha delivered his first sermon..
To bring you more closer to India and its local people, you will travel in Indian trains, also we will take you to the local family to interact and learn about the use of Indian spices in Indian cooking ; we will introduce you to the century old Yoga practice..

These prices are not valid during peak period i.e during festival time like Diwali and Holi festivals, between 20 December to 10 January and also during Dev Deepawali festival in Varanasi. Some of the hotels charge higher prices during these dates.
If your travel is happening during this period, we will advise you prices based on your travel dates.

Highlights
- Common Boat ride in Lake Pichola, Udaipur.
- Stay in Deogarh Mahal, old fort converted into hotel.
- 3 Shared Jeep safaris to Ranthambore National Park.
- Experience The Taj Mahal, widely considered to be one of the greatest architectural masterpieces in the world and is listed as one of the New Seven Wonders of World.
- Explore UNESCO World heritage sites with the help of knowledgeable local guides.
- Witness the impeccable handwork by local artisans on fabric, marble and gems during this sumptuous journey.
- Interaction with local families to learn about use of Indian spices and Indian cooking.
- One Yoga session
- City of Lucknow
- Travel in Indian trains.
- Visit Varanasi, holiest city of India
- Early morning Boat ride on river Ganges
- Evening Aarti ceremony at the ghats of river Ganges.
- Sarnath, where Buddha delivered his first sermon.

Important :
1. Ranthambore National Park is closed on Wednesdays
2. We have included 2 domestic flights within India. Free baggage allowance in domestic flights is 15 kg for check-in baggage and 7 kg for hand baggage. Incase your baggage will be more than this limit, you will have to pay for extra baggage at the airport. For each traveller, only 1 check-in baggage is allowed.

dayInfo.description: Arrive Delhi Arrive Delhi and meet your representative at airport. Transfer to hotel (check-in time 14h00).

In Delhi Start your tour to India with visit to Rajghat, memorial dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi (also known as Father of Nation). It’s a black marble platform where last rites of Mahatma Gandhi were performed after his assassination on 31th January 1948. It is an open-air memorial spread in large green area. Morning start your day with orientation tour of New Delhi, the foundation stone of the city was laid by Emperor George V during the Delhi Durbar of 1911. It was designed by British architects, Sir Edwin Lutyens and Sir Herbert Baker. Drive pass of President House (formerly Viceroy’s House), Indian Parliament, India Gate - a memorial to 70,000 soldiers of the British Indian Army who died in between 1914–1921 in the First World War and the third Anglo-Afghan War, and Connaught Place. Continue to visit Humayun’s Tomb built in the 1560’s, with the patronage of Humayun’s son, the great Emperor Akbar. Persian and Indian craftsmen worked together to build the garden-tomb, far grander than any tomb built before in the Islamic world. Humayun’s garden-tomb is an example of the charbagh (a four quadrant garden with the four rivers of Quranic paradise represented), with pools joined by channels. The garden is entered from lofty gateways on the south and from the west with pavilions located in the centre of the eastern and northern walls. Later proceed to Gurudwara Bangla Sahib, one of the prominent Sikh gurdwara or Sikh house of worship. Once inside the main building, you will be amazed with great interior, there is space to be seated on the floor and listen to “kirtan – the devotional songs” sung live by the staff. The holy book of Sikhs, the Guru Granth Sahib, is placed on top of a bed of silk and flowers. Like in all Sikh Gurdwaras, the concept of “langar, a communal free kitchen offering free sit-down meal” is practiced here too, and all people, regardless of race or religion may eat in the Gurdwara kitchen (langar hall). The Langar (food) is prepared by volunteers who wish to help out and by gursikhs who work there. It is believed that everyday around 25000 people eat in this hall. You are supposed to cover your head with a scarf and clean your feet with water at the entrance, as it is strictly followed in Sikhism.

Delhi / Udaipur (by flight) Transfer to airport to connect flight to Udaipur, known for its artificial water bodies hence also known as The City of Lakes. This city is located around waters of Lake Pichola, and Aravalli Hills. In the evening, enjoy boat ride on Lake Pichola with stop at Jag Mandir island famous for its marble pillars, fountains and domes (boat ride subject to water level and its operation).

In Udaipur Morning visit City Palace Complex by first visiting City Palace, known for its architecture, mosaic, mirror and miniature painting work. Inside the Palace you will also see a massive collection of paintings. Continue further with visit to Crystal Gallery which has massive collection of crystal objects. Finally stroll through extensive lawns of Sahelion Ki Bari (garden of the Maids of Honor). Visit painting boutique which showcase skillful work of miniature paintings, you can also buy souvenirs for yourself, family and friends.. In the evening, enjoy boat ride on Lake Pichola and stop at Jag Mandir island famous for its marble pillars, fountains and domes. Visit local artisans preserving art of Miniature paintings that you would have just seen in City Palace

Udaipur / Deogarh (by road – approx. 3hrs drive) Morning drive to Deogarh for overnight stay at Deogarh Mahal, residence of Deogarh family members but now converted into a heritage hotel with modern facilities. The imposing edifice of Deogarh Mahal dates back to 1670 AD when Rawat Dwarka Dasji built it as a family residence. As a heritage hotel, authentic royal character is steeped into every brick of the property. A part of the Mahal is still occupied by the family which is closely associated with the hotel and personally supervise it.. Afternoon, proceed for a nice pleasure trip in to the Aravali Hills by Meter guage train on 1930’s British Track and also the highest track on the Western Railways. The train doesn't have a name…It just has a number - 222. The track consists of numerous U shape bridges and couple of tunnels. This passenger train chugs at a leisurely pace through the rural forested area, some pretty rugged terrain, some stunning and indeed very cinematic landscape. This train plays a vital role in transporting the locals of the area. You get an opportunity to interact with the locals and enroute you also come across countless monkeys. Distance covered is only 17 KM but time taken is 2 Hours… no air conditioning in the carriages.

Deogarh / Jaipur (by road – approx. 6 hr) Morning drive to Jaipur, an enthralling prolific “pink’ city and capital of Rajasthan state. The city was painted in pink to welcome the Prince of Wales and Queen Victoria in 1876 since the colour is the mark of Hospitality. As a result, Jaipur started to be known as the Pink City. On the way, stop at Pushkar, a sacred Hindu site with hundreds of temples, including 14th-century temple dedicated to Lord Brahma who is considered as a “creator of Universe”. Its holy lake has 52 ghats (stone staircases) where pilgrims bathe to wash their sins and perform religious ceremonies. Pushkar’s interesting mythological history and the legacy of timeless architectural heritage makes it a fascinating city. Late afternoon visit local Indian family to dinner…interact with family and learn about Indian cooking and spices. Lady travelers will learn wearing Indian sari and also Mehndi, is a form of body art in which decorative designs are created on hands and feet.

In Jaipur Morning excursion to the famous Amber Fort constructed in the 16th century by Maan Singh, the trusted general of Emperor Akbar. The fort is known for its architectural splendour manifested in Sukh Mandir, the Hall of Public Audience, Sheesh Mahal and Kesar Kyari. Photo stop at Jaipur’s most photographed building, the Hawa Mahal or Palace of Winds, is an extraordinary pink-painted, honeycombed hive that rises five storeys. It was constructed in 1799 to facilitate ladies of the royal families to watch the life and processions of the city. Lunch at Samode Haveli which is residence of rulers of Samode but now converted into a hotel. After lunch enjoy Old City Rickshaw tour with Pink City Rickshaw company (45 minutes to 1h duration) that aims to provide employment opportunity to women from low income households. Drop at City Palace. Later proceed to beautiful palace came into existence with the establishment of the city of Jaipur. Built by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh II, the palace was the administrative and ceremonial seat of Jaipur Maharaja. Beautiful courtyards, gardens and buildings in the palace complex are worth exploring. Continue to visit 18th century astronomical observation site, the Jantar Mantar. This UNESCO World Heritage site has collection of some 20 fixed astronomical instruments built by the Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh II. Designed for the observation of astronomical positions with the naked eye, they embody several architectural and instrumental innovations.

Jaipur / Ranthambore (by road – approx. 4 hrs drive) Morning drive to Ranthambore National Park which was once the royal Maharaja’s hunting grounds. Today this national park has abundant wildlife and protected tigers. Afternoon first game drive in shared jeep. Important : Ranthambore National Park is closed on Wednesdays

In Ranthambore Morning and afternoon shard jeep safari to National Park. Ranthambhore National Park, covering an area of 1334 sq km, is known for its Bengal tigers. The park's deciduous forests are characteristic examples of the type of jungle found in Central India. Other fauna include the Indian leopard, nilgai, wild boar, sambar, striped hyena, sloth bear, southern plains gray langur, rhesus macaque, mugger crocodile and chital. The sanctuary is home to a wide variety of trees. Important : Ranthambore National Park is closed on Wednesdays

Ranthambore / Agra (by road approx.. 6 hrs drive) Morning drive to Agra with enroute stop at UNESCO World Heritage site of Fatehpur Sikri to visit this ghost town. Built during the second half of the 16th century by the Emperor Akbar, Fatehpur Sikri (the City of Victory) was the capital of the Mughal Empire for only some 10 years. It has complex of monuments and temples, all in a uniform architectural style. Continue to Agra, once a Mughal capital.

In Agra Morning visit The Taj Mahal, an enormous mausoleum complex commissioned in 1632 by the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan to house the remains of his beloved wife. Constructed over a 20-year period on the southern bank of the Yamuna River in Agra, India, the famed complex is one of the most outstanding examples of Mughal architecture, which combined Indian, Persian and Islamic influences. At its center is the Taj Mahal itself, built of shimmering white marble that seems to change color depending on the daylight. Designated a UNESCO World Heritage site in 1983, it remains one of the world’s most celebrated structures and a stunning symbol of India’s rich history. Later continue to Agra Fort, also called Red Fort, large 16th-century of red sandstone located on the Yamuna river. It was established by the Mughal dynasty emperor Akbar and, in its capacity as both a military base and a royal residence, served as the seat of government when the Mughal capital was in Agra. The fort complex was designated a UNESCO World Heritage site in 1983. Return back to hotel. Rest of the day free to relax at hotel.

Agra / Lucknow (by road – approx. 5 hrs drive) Morning drive to Lucknow, a historically important city and which for centuries was at the heart of the North Indian culture. Also known as a home of the Nawabs of Avadh, they were great patrons of the culinary and other arts, particularly dance and music. You will find great architecture of British Raj era buildings and mausoleums. Visit architecturally beautiful La Martiniere, built by Frenchman Claude Martin as his palatial home. Continue to visit the ruins of Lucknow Residency which offer a glimpse into events of First War of Independence (Indian Uprising) in 1857, considered to be the beginning of the end for the British Raj. Visit one of the well-known sites of Lucknow, Asafi Imambara. In 1775 when a famine broke out in the city, to give employment to his people, the Nawab began the construction of this Imambara Complex. The complex has a hall, a mosque, gardens and a step well. You will have a photo stop at the 220 foot tall red brick Clock Tower. It is said to be the tallest in India, built in 1880 in memory of Sir George Couper. Later in the evening, walk through the local market.

Lucknow / Varanasi by train – 07:00 am / 13:30 pm) Morning transfer to railway station to connect train to Varanasi, one of the holiest cities in India and the destination for millions of pilgrims each year who come to bathe in the River Ganges and say farewell to their loved ones. Rest this afternoon, as you'll take to the waters tonight to observe the Aarti ceremony on the ghats. Thousands of locals and pilgrims gather together every sunset to offer their prayers to the Mother Ganges. This prayer ceremony, a fire offering given to the Goddess Ganga, is performed on a stage by a group of young Hindu priests (pandits) dressed in saffron attire. The ceremony begins with the blowing of a conch shell and continues with the circling of large flaming lamps. The movement of these lamps is synchronized with the rhythmic chants of hymns and clang of cymbals. Note : Boat ride and Aarti ceremony is subject to water level of River Ganges.

In Varanasi Early morning, take a boat ride on the River Ganges to enjoy the sunrise and observe the devotees having their ritual bath and performing prayers to rising sun (an ancient tradition that is still followed today). Return to the hotel for breakfast before heading out again for a half day tour of Varanasi with your guide.

Varanasi / Delhi (by flight) Morning introduction to Yoga, a 5,000-year-old Indian knowledge. For everyone it has different meaning. For some, it is a way of life or a spiritual practice and for others it is a way to feel good in their bodies. Yoga involves various breathing exercises, yoga poses (asanas) and meditation. Return back to hotel for breakfast. Transfer to Sarnath, a major Buddhist centre where Buddha delivered his first sermon after attaining enlightenment, in which he taught the four noble truths and the teachings associated with it. Connect flight to Delhi to connect your flight to next destination.
Delhi / Fly to next destination or return back home

tourName: North India tour
generalInfo:
Travel from Delhi through the verdant hills of Himachal and holy temples of the Northern area with this tour package. We’ll take you around to experience the glorious nature and historical charm this region has to offer. In cities like Amritsar you will not only see the Golden Temple, but also visit a local market and learn how people live. In Dharamshala, we’ll explore the tea gardens, monasteries and the Dalai Lama temple.

Indeed, throughout the 13 days we will visit all the must-see temples and historical sights. Whether its exploring holy cities, wandering through lush greenery, discovering local delicacies, meandering through markets—this region is awaiting to be discovered!

dayInfo.description: DELHI: Welcome to Delhi, the nation’s capital, a vibrant city with an unbelievable amount of history! Your tour guide will meet you at the airport and then you will transfer to your hotel. Depending on your arrival time and how tired you are, the tour guide will plan the rest of the day with you accordingly, which could include some sightseeing, plus a welcome dinner.

DELHI: Today you can do any of the city tours or slum tours which we do. We suggest in the morning visiting Sanjay Colony, a small slum built on 25 acres of land located in the south of Delhi near the Bahai Lotus Temple and Iskcon temple. Learn about the working and residential life and witness how despite the challenging living conditions it remains an area charged with positive energy and strong community. You will also learn about the NGO programs directly supported by your visit. In the afternoon we suggest doing some more traditional sightseeing of your choice such as visiting India Gate, Qutub Minar, Humayun’s tomb, Agrasen ki Baoli (a stepwell) and Gurudwara Bangla Sahib, a Sikh temple and one of the largest community kitchens in India which feeds more than 10,000 people per day. In the evening, if you still have the energy, you can explore old Delhi and go on our popular food tour if you wish!

SHIMLA: Today we leave for Shimla by taking a 4-5 hour train ride from Delhi in the morning, across the state of Punjab, to Chandigarh. On arrival in Chandigarh, you’ll be transported by private vehicle to Shimla. Once you arrive, take some time to explore the town’s charm on an orientation walk with your tour guide.

SHIMLA: In the morning we’ll visit the church on Mall road before stopping at a viewpoint that provides sweeping views of the Himalayas. We will then visit the Jakhu Hanuman Temple and its entourage of monkeys at the top of the mountain, accessible by ropeway, where we will also see a magnificent Hanuman statue (Monkey God), the largest in India. We’ll take you to the Viceregal Lodge, where the partition agreement between India and Pakistan was made. We will then see the handicrafts in Lakkar Bazaar before coming back to the hotel to relax.

MANDI: Today’s journey takes us to Mandi, a charming village located on the banks of the Beas River. This quaint town boasts a rich cultural heritage of both historical and theological significance. Once a part of the salt route to Tibet, it now serves as the gateway to the stunning Kullu Valley.

DHARAMSHALA: In the morning, we’ll travel from Mandi to Dharamshala by car (6-7hrs). This is quite an adventure where you will enjoy great views of the Himalayas along the winding roads. We will stay in McLeod Ganj, a hilltop retreat, home to the Dalai Lama and the Tibetan government in exile, and busy with robed monks strolling between monasteries. Later in the evening, we will visit a local family and enjoy a Himachali style dinner. After dinner you can spend the rest of the evening wandering the peaceful streets, which are set to the backdrop of the Himalayas.

DHARAMSHALA: We’ll spend the day exploring McLeod Ganj and its surroundings, in the morning visiting the iconic Dalai Lama Temple. The Dalai Lama visits this important pilgrimage spot, located near His Holiness’s residence, a few times every year to preach and to bless the people. Then we will visit a Tibetan Museum where you will see the history of Dalai Lama and his followers’ exile to India and the Struggle for freedom from China. After that we will see the beautiful Bhagsunag Shiva Temple, tucked into the mountains, and then see some tea gardens and monasteries in the area. We will visit Norbulingka Institute which preserves and develops Tibetan arts and culture. If you are a cricket fan, you can also see the Himachal Pradesh cricket stadium, one of the most beautiful sports venues in the world.

AMRITSAR: Today we will travel down the mountains to reach Amritsar, We will reach by late afternoon In the afternoon, we’ll visit the famous Golden Temple (Harmandir Sahib), the spiritual capital of Sikhism and its holiest place of worship. We will also visit one of the biggest community kitchens in the world which cooks meals for more than 50,000 people per day. In the evening we will wander around the markets, discovering the local Punjabi delicacies such as sweet lassi, kulfi and parathas.

AMRITSAR/OVERNIGHT TRAIN: Today we will spend the whole day touring Amritsar and experience the historical significance of Jallianwala Bagh, the site of the tragic 1919 massacre that played a crucial role in India’s independence. Later we will visit the Partition Museum where we can learn about the biggest human migration and partition of history. Afterwards, head to the India-Pakistan border to witness the daily flag ceremony, a military exercise that has been followed by the security forces of both countries since 1959. Finally, take an overnight sleeper train from Amritsar to Haridwar, and rest up for your next adventure.

RISHIKESH: Start the exciting journey that began with an early morning arrival in Haridwar, followed by a scenic one-hour drive to Rishikesh, the yoga capital of the world. After checking into your hotel, take an orientation walk to explore the area. Our first stop is the Chaurasi Kutia ashram, a once-booming spiritual center. This ashram is now famous for its murals and the Beatles’ visit in the 1960s. Admire the faded yet beautiful architecture and the graffiti that reflects the band’s influence and the counterculture of the time. In the evening, enjoy a leisurely stroll along the sacred Ganges River, where the temple bells ring and the traditional fire ritual of Ganga Aarti will begin.

RISHIKESH: The morning is free for you. We can arrange a lesson for you to learn how to play classical Indian instruments such as the sitar or tabla. You can join a session of Hasya yoga (laughter therapy). Or you could simply take time to enjoy the surroundings, engaging in a day of meditation. Later in the afternoon, we will head to Haridwar for a truly unforgettable experience. The Arti ceremony, which takes place in the evening, is a beautiful and spiritual event that you won’t want to miss. As you witness the ceremony on the banks of the Ganges River, you will be transported to another world and gain a deeper appreciation for the traditions and beliefs of India and its Culture.
RISHIKESH/DELHI: In the morning we will drive to Haridwar and board a train to Delhi departing at 1.30pm. The train is expected to arrive at 6.40pm after which you will be taken to your hotel
DELHI (departure): This morning we will finish the tour and we will transfer you to the airport.

tourName: North India tours, 14 days
generalInfo:
Explore the rich, vibrant and diverse culture of India with our 13-day North India adventure tour. Covering the country’s greatest northern features, including the Golden Triangle, you’ll see it all. Experience iconic major landmarks like the Taj Mahal and the spiritual ancient city of Varanasi with a twist, venture into the desert for a camel safari and treat your taste buds to an abundance of delicious food. From bustling cities to rural villages, our Adventure Leaders take you off-the-beaten-track as you explore all that North India has to offer.

Included in all tours:

An epic Adventure Leader, aka a local legend, to turn your trip into the adventure of a lifetime.
All local transport within India, including flights between Jodhpur and Mumbai.
Accommodation (including hostels, Thar Desert camping, & three overnight trains).
Meals provided: 1 breakfast, 1 lunch (included with cooking experience, which may shift to dinner based on local timing), & 2 dinners

Accommodation style:

In true backpacking style, our accommodation is in shared, mixed-gender dorm rooms as standard on this tour. But if you’d prefer a little extra comfort and your own space to relax after an action-packed day, room upgrades are available. Please request this on booking.

Included in all Dragon Trip tours:

Pre-departure briefing (Delhi)
Hindi language lesson (Delhi)
Old Delhi tour (Delhi)
Sis Ganj Sikh Temple in Old Delhi (Delhi)
Akshardham Temple (Delhi)
Ghat Boat Tour incl. Ganga Aarti Ceremony (Varanasi)
Taj Mahal at sunrise (Agra)
Nagargarh Fort at sunset (Jaipur)
Food Court Tour (Jaipur)
Monkey Temple (Jaipur)
Camel Safari & Camping (Thar Desert)
Walking Tour of Blue City (Jodhpur)
Indian Cooking Experience (Jodhpur)
Mumbai Orientation Walk (Mumbai)

dayInfo.description: Delhi: Welcome to New Delhi – the start of an unforgettable 14-day adventure across India! Once you’ve checked in, we’ll kick things off with a pre-departure briefing, where you’ll meet your Adventure Leader and fellow travellers, get the lowdown on the itinerary, cover health and safety tips, and pick up everything you need to make the most of the journey ahead. Next, get ready for a fun Hindi language session! Your Adventure Leader will teach you some essential phrases that will come in handy throughout the trip – perfect for connecting with locals, ordering tasty street food, or haggling in the markets like a pro. In the afternoon, we’ll explore the magic of Old Delhi on a guided walking tour. Wander through buzzing backstreets, colourful markets, and historic temples, sample incredible street food, and soak up the city’s lively atmosphere. This is your chance to experience a side of Delhi that most visitors miss. (Tip: comfortable shoes are a must!) To finish the day, step inside Sis Ganj Sahib Gurudwara, an important Sikh temple in Old Delhi. Take a moment to enjoy the serene and spiritual surroundings, connect with the welcoming community, and reflect on your first day of adventure in India – a truly memorable introduction to the country.

Delhi: Start your morning in Lodhi Garden, the city’s green oasis, where you can join a friendly game of Ultimate Frisbee. Jump in, meet some locals, and get moving, or simply cheer from the sidelines and soak up the atmosphere. If culture is more your vibe, opt to visit Humayun’s Tomb, a stunning UNESCO World Heritage site that served as inspiration for the Taj Mahal. Wander the gardens and marvel at the intricate Mughal architecture – it’s a fascinating glimpse into Delhi’s rich history. For lunch, we’ll head to Khan Market, a hub of cool cafés, international eats, and boutique shops. It’s the perfect spot to relax, refuel, and get ready for the afternoon’s adventures. Next, immerse yourself in the colours and chaos of Delhi Haat, an open-air market brimming with handicrafts from across India. From vibrant textiles to handcrafted jewellery, it’s the ideal place to practice your bargaining skills and pick up a one-of-a-kind souvenir. As the day winds down, we’ll visit the breathtaking Akshardham Temple. This enormous, intricately carved complex is a feast for the eyes, blending spiritual calm with jaw-dropping architecture – a truly unforgettable Delhi highlight. Finally, we’ll gather as a group to board an overnight train to Varanasi, ready for the next chapter of your Indian adventure.

Varanasi: We roll into Varanasi in the morning and hop on private transport straight to the hostel. Take some time to freshen up, unpack, and relax before diving into the day’s adventures. In the afternoon, culture lovers can explore Sarnath, a world-renowned Buddhist site steeped in history. This is where the Buddha gave his first teachings after enlightenment, and the energy of the place, layered with centuries of Hindu heritage, is truly unforgettable. As evening falls, prepare for one of the most magical experiences in Varanasi: a boat ride along the Ghats of the Ganges. Drift past the riverside steps where locals bathe, worship, and carry out daily rituals. Witness the intensity of the Burning Ghat, and end the journey with the Ganga Aarti, a mesmerizing ceremony of fire, chants, and devotion that lights up the river in a way you’ll never forget.

Varanasi-Agra: Kick off the morning on the Ganges with an optional Sunrise Boat Tour. Watch Varanasi come to life as the sun casts its glow over the river, witness morning rituals unfold on the Ghats, and if you like, grab a famous Tulsi Chai or some local street snacks on the way back – a perfect way to start the day! Next, wander through the vibrant old markets of Varanasi and make your way to the legendary Blue Lassi Shop. Sip their creamy, colourful lassis while soaking up the sights, sounds, and colours of the Kashi Vishwanath Corridor – a true feast for the senses you’ll remember long after you leave. In the afternoon, it’s time to trade the river for the rails and journey to Agra. Depending on availability, hop on the afternoon or overnight train. Once in Agra, check in and recharge – tomorrow we’ll visit one of the world’s most iconic landmarks.

Agra: Start the morning with a stroll for breakfast to Bread & Mine Café, a charming spot that supports the deaf community. Whether you’re a coffee lover or just want a meaningful start to your day, it’s a great way to fuel up before exploring. In the afternoon, join an optional tea session with your Adventure Leader. Listen to inspiring stories about India, ask questions, and, if you’re lucky, meet some locals for first-hand insights into life here. It’s a relaxed, personal way to connect with the culture and people around you. Next, enjoy free time to explore Agra at your own pace. Wander through the towering Agra Fort and the elegant Baby Taj, soaking in the history, architecture, and stories that make these sites unforgettable. In the evening, regroup with your travel crew for dinner and drinks at Salt Café, one of Agra’s top spots for good food, great vibes, and the perfect place to toast another epic day of adventure.

Jaipur: Rise early for a bucket-list moment: a sunrise visit to the Taj Mahal, one of the seven wonders of the world. Watch as the marble monument glows in the first light of day, and enjoy the 20–30 minute walk there as the city slowly wakes, building anticipation for one of the world’s most breathtaking sights. After soaking in the Taj, hop into your private transfer for the journey to Jaipur. Stop for breakfast along the way, then enjoy a scenic 5–6 hour drive with just a couple of short breaks – perfect for stretching, grabbing a snack, and watching the landscape change as you roll through the heart of India. Once in Jaipur, check in and get settled at your accommodation. Then, it’s time for another unforgettable experience: Nahargarh Fort at sunset. Explore the fort’s historic interiors, then climb to the rooftop to see sweeping views of the Pink City glowing in golden light – the perfect way to cap off a day full of iconic sights and stunning scenery.

Jaipur: Are you an early riser? If so, start your day with an optional balloon safari, an unforgettable chance to watch the sun rise over Jaipur as you drift gently above the city. Prefer a slower start? No problem – wake up at your own pace and enjoy breakfast before heading out to the spectacular Amber Fort, built entirely from yellow and pink sandstone. Wander through its ornate halls, courtyards, and ramparts while soaking in the history and architecture. This afternoon is yours to explore Jaipur your way. Visit the opulent City Palace and the iconic Hawa Mahal, marvel at the astronomical instruments of Jantar Mantar, or dive into the bustling energy of Bapu Bazaar for souvenirs, textiles, and local crafts. As evening falls, regroup with your Adventure Leader for a Food Court Tour, a true foodie’s dream. Sample Jaipur’s best-loved local treats, discover hidden culinary gems, and get a taste of the city’s vibrant food scene. Night owls can cap off the day with a night out in Jaipur – whether it’s hitting a lively club or enjoying drinks with the group, soak up the city’s buzzing nightlife before heading back to rest.

Jaisalmer: Rise early for a truly memorable start to the day with a visit to the Monkey Temple (Galtaji). This vibrant Hindu pilgrimage site is set against stunning landscapes, showcases fascinating architecture, and – of course – is home to a lively troop of monkeys that add an extra spark of energy to your morning! After your temple visit, the rest of the morning is yours to enjoy. Take it slow with breakfast and some downtime, explore the bustling streets of the Pink City, or head to Patrika Gate, a visual delight known for its intricate Rajasthani patterns – perfect for photos and soaking up Jaipur’s colours. In the afternoon, we’ll transfer to Jaipur station and hop on the train to Jaisalmer, the next highlight of your India adventure. Settle in, watch the landscape roll by, and get ready for the golden deserts that await you!

Jaisalmer: Arrive in Jaisalmer this morning and head to your local hostel to rest, freshen up, and enjoy a hearty breakfast. Once fuelled up, it’s time to explore the city’s crown jewel: Jaisalmer Fort. Towering up to 250 feet in places and with parts dating back to the mid-1600s, this golden sandstone fortress is a marvel of history and architecture – perfect for wandering its winding streets and snapping unforgettable photos. Next, choose to visit Gadsisar Lake, a serene spot just outside the city, where you can take in the calm waters, spot temples and shrines along the edges, and enjoy panoramic views of the surrounding desert. But there’s no time to linger too long, because your first Dragon Moment awaits – a magical journey into the Thar Desert. Hop into a jeep and head deep into the sand dunes, where a camel trek will carry you to your desert camp. As the sun dips below the horizon, enjoy a delicious dinner al fresco before settling into your comfortable beds. Tonight, fall asleep under a blanket of stars – an experience you’ll never forget!

Jodhpur: Wake up to a desert sunrise that paints the dunes in shades of gold and pink – an unforgettable way to start the day. After a simple breakfast and packing up your camp, it’s time to head back to Jaisalmer and prepare for your private transfer to Jodhpur. Upon arrival, check in to your next hostel and drop off your bags, then join your Adventure Leader for a guided tour of the Blue City. Wander through its iconic streets, marvel at the Clock Tower, and explore the fascinating Toorji Ka Jhalra, an ancient stepwell that’s as beautiful as it is historic. In the evening, soak up the city’s vibes with your group – grab a drink near the stepwell, watch the sunset over the blue-painted buildings, and reflect on another epic day of your India adventure.

Jodhpur: Today is all about indulgence and adventure! Start your morning with a hands-on Indian Cooking Experience, where you’ll learn to prepare classic Rajasthani dishes, taste your creations, and pick up culinary secrets to impress friends and family back home. It’s a true Dragon Moment – fun, interactive, and delicious! For those craving an adrenaline rush, there’s the optional Flying Fox Zipline adventure. Race across six thrilling stations, soar high above the city and its fort, and take in breathtaking panoramic views of Jodhpur spread out beneath you. Whether you’re keeping your feet on the ground or flying high, it’s a day packed with culture, flavours, and unforgettable experiences, perfectly blending relaxation and excitement in the Blue City.

Mumbai: Late morning, it’s time to fly to Mumbai, the bustling heart of India’s west coast! Once you land, your Adventure Leader will whisk you to your accommodation to drop off your bags and freshen up. In the afternoon, get ready to explore the city on a guided tour. Marvel at the iconic Gateway of India, stroll along the shimmering Marine Drive – also known as the Queen’s Necklace – and soak in the sights, sounds, and energy of this vibrant metropolis. As evening falls, it’s all yours to enjoy. Head to the Colaba District for dinner, drinks, or a wander through its lively streets. For a truly special view, seek out one of the city’s rooftop bars and watch Mumbai sparkle beneath the sunset.

Mumbai: Start the morning with an optional Dharavi Slum Tour, a chance to see a side of Mumbai that’s far beyond the usual clichés. Witness the energy, industry, and community spirit of one of Asia’s largest slums, and gain a deeper understanding of the creativity and resilience of its residents. In the afternoon, head to Dhobi Ghat Mahalaxmi, the world’s largest open-air laundry. Watch as workers wash, beat, and dry clothes using time-honoured techniques – a chaotic, fascinating spectacle that captures Mumbai’s industrious spirit. As evening falls, wrap up your adventure Bollywood-style with an optional Movie Night. Enjoy the dazzling dance numbers, epic stories, and vibrant energy of India’s world-famous film industry – the perfect way to celebrate your journey in the city where Bollywood was born.

Mumbai: Today marks the end of 14 epic days in India, but not before a visit to the famous Siddhivinayak Temple! Dedicated to Lord Ganesha, it’s one of Mumbai’s most iconic temples and a fascinating glimpse into the city’s spiritual heart. Then you’ll bid farewell to your group, ready to head home!

tourName: North India wildlife expedition tour
generalInfo: Embark on an unforgettable 12-day wildlife and nature safari across some of North India’s most pristine and diverse wilderness landscapes. Your journey begins in Delhi, where you can unwind after arrival before setting off for Rajaji National Park. Nestled in the Shivalik foothills, Rajaji offers thrilling encounters with elephants, leopards, and a rich variety of birdlife, explored over two days of morning and evening safaris while staying at the charming Rosette Farmstead. From there, travel to the iconic Corbett Tiger Reserve and settle into Jim’s Jungle Retreat. Enjoy safaris through the Jhirna, Dhela, and Bijrani zones—renowned for their high tiger and elephant populations, as well as opportunities to spot sloth bears and hornbills. After immersing yourself in Corbett’s scenic beauty, continue to the remote and wild Terai region, arriving at Dudhwa National Park. Over three days, explore both Dudhwa and Kishanpur Wildlife Sanctuary—lesser-visited parks that promise sightings of the rare one-horned rhinoceros, swamp deer, and an incredible variety of raptors and forest birds. Your base here is the cozy Tiger Lilly Lodge, offering comfort and hospitality in the heart of the jungle. Each park showcases its own unique ecosystem, from alluvial grasslands to dense sal forests, ensuring a diverse and rewarding wildlife experience. The itinerary concludes with a return to Delhi for a final night of relaxation before your onward journey. This expertly curated safari is ideal for nature lovers, photographers, and wildlife enthusiasts eager to explore India’s untamed beauty in comfort and style.

dayInfo.description: Upon arrival at Delhi Airport, you will be received and transferred to your hotel, Novotel Delhi. The rest of the day is at leisure, giving you time to relax or explore the surroundings at your own pace. Overnight stay at Novotel Delhi. Meal Plan: Bed & Breakfast

After breakfast, check out from Novotel Delhi, and begin your scenic 4-hour drive to Rajaji National Park. Upon arrival, check in to the charming Rosette Farmstead, nestled close to the park’s wilderness. Dinner and overnight stay at Rosette Farmstead.

Begin your day with an exciting morning safari in Rajaji National Park, exploring its diverse landscape of sal forests, grasslands, and riverbeds—home to elephants, leopards, and rich birdlife. After a relaxing afternoon, head out again for an evening safari, offering a chance to witness the park’s wildlife as it becomes active at dusk. An unforgettable wilderness experience awaits. Dinner and overnight stay at Rosette Farmstead.

Begin your day with a morning safari in Rajaji National Park, exploring its scenic terrain of dense forests, grasslands, and riverine ecosystems. The park offers excellent chances to spot elephants, leopards, spotted deer, and vibrant birdlife. After a break, venture out again on an evening safari, when wildlife activity peaks, offering a different perspective of the jungle as it transitions into dusk. Dinner and overnight stay at Rosette Farmstead.

After breakfast depart to Corbett which will be a 3 Hrsdrive, Arrive at Jim's Jungle Retreat, a serene wildernesslodge nestled in the southern buffer zone of CorbettTiger Reserve. After check-in and settling into youraccommodations, enjoy a short guided nature walk ledby the resident naturalist, offering an introduction to therich biodiversity of the region. Dinner & Overnight stay at Jim’s Jungle Retreat

Early morning, set out on a thrilling safari to the Jhirna or Dhela Zone—once reclaimed villages, now thriving wildlife habitats. These zones offer excellent opportunities to spot tigers, elephants, sloth bears, and great hornbills amidst rich natural surroundings. Return to the lodge for a hearty breakfast and lunch. In the afternoon, head back into the Jhirna/Dhela Zone, a striking mosaic of dry deciduous forest and riverbeds. This area is known for its frequent tiger and elephant sightings, making for an exciting wildlife experience. Dinner & Overnight stay at Jim’s Jungle Retreat

Venture into Bijrani, Corbett’s most scenic zone with open meadows and sal forest, often dotted with tiger pugmarks and birdlife. Return to the lodge for lunch. In the afternoon, enjoy another safari into either Jhirna or Dhela, depending on latest wildlife movement. Dinner & Overnight stay at Jim’s Jungle Retreat.
After breakfast and check-out, begin your scenic drive through the lush Terai landscape, arriving at Tiger Lilly Lodge by evening. Dinner & Overnight stay at Tiger Lilly Dudhwa

Embark on morning and evening safaris in the lesser- visited Kishanpur Wildlife Sanctuary, a vast open grassland landscape renowned as one of the best locations in the Terai to spot tigers. The sanctuary also supports healthy populations of swamp deer, hog deer, and a variety of raptors, making for a rich and rewarding wildlife experience. Dinner and overnight stay at Tiger Lilly, Dudhwa.

Experience morning and afternoon safaris in the iconic Dudhwa National Park, a biodiverse haven of alluvial grasslands, wetlands, and towering sal forests. Keep an eye out for the majestic Indian one-horned rhinoceros, elephants, and an impressive array of birdlife that thrive in this unique ecosystem. Dinner and overnight stay at Tiger Lilly, Dudhwa
After breakfast, check out from Tiger Lilly and embark on a scenic 8.5-hour drive to Delhi. Upon arrival, check in to Novotel Delhi. Dinner and overnight stay at Novotel Delhi.
After breakfast check out from Novotel Delhi and transferred to Delhi airport for onward flight

tourName: North India wildlife holiday
generalInfo:
With a strong focus on wildlife, this exciting and comprehensive itinerary takes in four key wildlife viewing areas and is perfect for those looking for big cat encounters, with opportunities to see not only tigers and leopards, but also the rare Asiatic lion. Add to these, myriad birds and other wildlife, plus sunrise at the magical Taj Mahal and you have an unforgettable Indian experience.

Highlights Include:

- Rare Asiatic lions at Sassan Gir
- Tigers at Ranthambhore
- Leopards, wolves and other mammals
- Guided birdwatching
- Taj Mahal at dawn

Accommodation:

Gir Lion Safari Camp - 3 nights full board with game drives
Fern Hotel Ahmedabad - 1 night with with dinner and breakfast
Bera Safari Lodge - 3 nights full board with guided safaris
Tiger Den Resort Ranthambore - 3 nights full board with shared game drives
Crystal Sarovar Premiere Hotel Agra - 1 night with dinner and breakfast
Red Fox Aerocity Delhi - 1 night with dinner and breakfast

Please note: from prices shown are for low season (Apr-Jun), please ask for high season rates (Oct-Mar). Accommodation is subject to change. All domestic transfers and travel as per the itinerary are included in your package.

dayInfo.description: Mumbai to Sasan Gir: International flights are not included as part of your package but can be arranged and added with ease. This morning you will arrive independently to Mumbai airport and take a morning flight to Rajkot. Upon arrival in Rajkot you will be transferred by private car to Sasan Gir, an approximately 4-hour drive. After checking in at the Gir Lion safari Camp the rest of the evening will be at your leisure. 3 nights accommodation at Gir Lion Safari Camp on a full board basis including breakfast, lunches, dinners and game drives.

Sasan Gir: Morning and afternoon jeep safaris on days 2 and 3. Expect to see rare Asiatic lions, plus other wildlife and birds. Possible sightings of leopards. On day 4, take morning jeep safari in Gir Park and then an afternoon 6 hour drive in a private car through the countryside to Ahmedabad. Overnight at the Fern hotel with dinner and breakfast.
Bera: After breakfast, depart for six hour drive in private car to Bera. Afternoon guided safari in the Sanctuary looking to spot leopards. Overnight at Bera Safari Lodge on full board basis.

Bera: The area around Bera is in the heart of leopard country and these days will include morning and afternoon jeep safaris looking out for these elusive animals as well as wolves and spectacular birdlife. Full board accommodation at Bera Safari Lodge.

Ranthambhore: Transfer to Udaipur Airport by private car in time to board the 11.30 flight to Jaipur, arriving at 13.25. Upon arrival in Jaipur your private transfer will take you to Ranthambore, a drive of approximately 3.5 hours. After checking in at the Tiger Den Resort the remainder of day will be at your leisure. 3 nights’ accommodation at the Tiger Den Resort on a full board basis including breakfast, lunches, dinners and shared game drives.

Ranthambhore: Morning and afternoon jeep safaris within the national park looking for tigers plus other mammals and birds. Rathambhore is rich in history with ancient ruins and temples, set in wooded and marshy and lake-land countryside. Once the hunter grounds of the maharajahs of Jaipur and later the British, Ranthambhore National Park (Sawai Madhopur) was declared a wildlife sanctuary in 1955. The wildlife, including the tiger population is thankfully flourishing so the Indian government have decided to increase the national park to encompass a range of hills close to Ranthambhore to ensure the Tiger populations have the space to grow. Expect to see tiger, sloth bear, mongoose, samber, cheetal, langur monkeys and if you are lucky also leopard, hyena, jackal and march crocodile. Excellent birding opportunities including paradise flycatcher, serpent eagle, jacana, painted stork, Bonellis eagle, horned owl, grey partridge, white necked stork, king vulture, ring dove, golden backed woodpecker and many more. Do not miss the opportunity to visit the fort which is a wonderful backdrop to the majestic landscape and its many lakes. Full board accommodation at Tiger Den Resort

Ranthambhore & On to Agra: A last jeep safari in the morning in Ranthambhore before transferring to Sawai Madhopur railway station for fast train to Bharatpur departing at 12.30. Arriving at Bharatpur at 15.00, transfer by car to Agra ( one hour) and check in to hotel Crystal Sarovar Premiere Hotel for dinner and overnight.

Agra: Up early for a guided visit to the Taj Mahal at dawn to experience the magic of sunrise over this monument to love. In the afternoon, drive by private car to Delhi. Overnight in hotel Red Fox Aerocity with dinner.
Delhi: Breakfast at hotel and then transfer to airport for return or onward travel

tourName: North Kerala tailor made holidays
placesVisited: Cochin, Calicut, Wayanad, Thalassery, Kasaragod, Ayurvedic massage, backwaters cruise
generalInfo:
Imagine Kerala and the mind typically wanders to scenic coastlines and quaint fishing villages in their idyllic natural settings. This North Kerala tailor made holiday will help you explore them.

Now how about traditional folk dances involving frenzied drumming and dancing around fires? Or ancestral spice-traders whose homestays offer up some of the region’s most authentic and culturally distinct cuisine? Or walks to local tribal homes, and meeting traditional boat builders? All of these are possible and more. You can also experience an invigorating ayurvedic massage by the beach, go on spice-plantation walks or jeep safaris through the forested Western Ghats, go country boating to get close to migratory birds, or trek through deep, dark rainforest. Enjoying a local catch of fish prepared right on your houseboat as it glides along the unexplored scenic backwaters will also add to your experiences of Kerala’s beautiful and culturally diverse North.

dayInfo.description: Cochin. This experience begins with the historic of Cochin on a unique private historic walking tour of the ancient quarter of this port city and ending with a traditional Kathakali dance performance.

Calicut. Experience a coastal train ride, traditional Kerala boat building, country boating through a migratory bird sanctuary and ancient spice and sweet-meat markets. Additionally experience a performance of the ancient 11th-century Kallari martial arts form at one of their traditional schools.

Wayanad. Spend these two days in this nature-rich region on the Western Ghats experiencing spice plantation walks, jungle safaris, bird watching and tribal villages from the comfort of your eco-resort or plantation homestay.

Thalassery. Spend these two days at an ancestral homestay situated in this historic spice-trading port town. Experience authentic north Kerala cuisine and get to try a hand at it with structured cooking classes with the host family. Additionally experience one of North Kerala’s most distinct folk dance forms that pre-dates it’s existence to Hinduism itself! Known as Theyyam, this is one of Kerala’s most distinct classical performances.

Kasaragod. Travel to the scenic backwater and coastal region of Kasaragod; one of Kerala’s most northern-most regions. Spend these next few days immersed in activities based out of a scenic coastal eco-resort.
Lake Temple. Spend the day visiting one of Kerala’s largest fort-complex situated right on the coast as well as a uniquely constructed Lake Temple exemplifying it’s uniqueness in construction.
Nature trek. Spend the better part of the day on a nature trek through the region’s grassland and rainforested slope, situated on the border with the state of Karnataka.
Ayurvedic massage. Spend the day at leisure occupied with a traditional Ayurvedic massage and ending with an authentic Kerala dinner aboard your private houseboat through the backwaters.
Departure. Transfer to the nearest airport or catch the coastal train to the nearest airport to catch your flight out.

tourName: Northern India and Nepal guided tour
generalInfo: Discover the highlights of North India and Nepal, from pulsating Delhi to the highest mountains on Earth. The cultural wonders on this trip are numerous: sunrise at the Taj Mahal, the pink city of Jaipur, a dawn boat ride on the misty Ganges and a visit to Lumbini, birthplace of Buddha. That’s complemented by natural experiences, including scanning Chitwan National Park for rhinos and gazing at the mighty Himalaya, to create an unforgettable adventure in these two diverse destinations.
