The Maharaja’s palatial complex contains a mixture of Hindu and Muslim architecture, spanning four separate palaces, which are connected by courtyards that feature shades of rose and honey stone, white marble, and gilded accents. In the Hall of Victory, you will find marble panels and a mirrored ceiling that opens to a panoramic view of the walls. Back in the city, your guide will lead you through the historic city center that gave rise to Jaipur’s nickname, the “Pink City.”

dayInfo.title: Pushkar – Visit the Temples and Desert Scenery of Pushkar
dayInfo.description: The desert landscape and spiritual ambiance of Pushkar will offer you an alluring change of pace as you settle into the magnetic city known as a Hindu pilgrimage destination. The city is often buzzing with drums, peeling with bells, and humming with devotional songs that stem from the ghats of the holy lake and milky-blue temples. You can explore the city to view one of the world’s few Brahma temples, which is marked by a large red spire over the entryway. A goose symbol adorns the door before giving way to the interior that is blanketed with engravings along the floor and walls that are dedicated to the dead. You can spend time at the Gandhi Ghat, which was named for the point at which Gandhi’s ashes were sprinkled after his death, before taking the cable car to reach Savitri Temple at the top of Ratnagiri Hill. Your options in Pushkar are endless, and yours to enjoy at leisure.

dayInfo.title: Jodhpur – Find Majesty in Jodhpur and Jaswant Thada
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will depart Pushkar for the city of Jodhpur, which is the second-largest city in Rajasthan. As you travel to the city, you will notice the vibrant blue facades of homes that rise along a foothill of a mountain. The aromas of chili and tamarind will fill the streets from restaurants, and vendors may serve the traditional mirchi bada . You will then follow your guide through the streets of the city, where the scent of spices and teas may drift through the Clock Tower Market, and shopkeepers may bargain over hand-embroidered fabrics. When visiting the Mehrangarh Fort, you will traverse grounds that date back 500 years, spanning an area of more than three miles. You will then continue your exploration of the region at Jaswant Thada, which is a memorial that was built entirely out of white marble at the turn of the 20th century. Carved-marble lattice screens offer views of the surrounding landscape while whimsical domes add to the grandeur of the pristine design.

dayInfo.title: Udaipur – Venture to Ranakpur en route to Charming Udaipur
dayInfo.description: Before you reach the pearlescent city of Udaipur, you will visit the town of Ranakpur, which is located on the hills of the Pali district. As you explore the streets with your guide, you will find one of India’s largest and most important centers for Jain temples. The milky-white marble shines in the desert sun and embodies the grandeur of the original design, dating back to the 15th century. The temple was dedicated to Adinath, who was the first Jain teacher, and contains images that resemble Buddha amid the 80 domes and 1,444 individually hand-engraved pillars. You can spend hours discovering the distinctive features that decorate each individual pillar, which will reveal how no two columns are alike. The idol depicts Parshvanatha, which was carved out of a single slab, and possesses 1,008 snakeheads. You will then continue to Udaipur to enjoy the city known as “The Pearl of Rajasthan.”

dayInfo.title: Udaipur – Experience the Splendor of Rajasthan’s Pearled City
dayInfo.description: The morning light will wash over Udaipur to showcase the collection of reflective surfaces of Lake Pichola to the narrow alleys between the marble mansions. Your tour will begin at the City Palace, which embodies the grandeur of Udaipur along the shores of the lake. The magnificent structure has a façade that stretches over 800 feet long and stands nearly 100 feet tall. It acts as a collection of 11 separate smaller palaces. Your guide will highlight the eight arches that adorn the Badi Pol gate on the northern end, which represent the times that royal family members were weighed with their weight in gold or silver being distributed to the locals. At Saheliyon Ki Bari, you will discover one of the most elegant gardens in the city. Here, you can stroll along the lush lawns and enjoy the trickling water from the marble fountains.

dayInfo.title: Udaipur – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will see boats crossing the lake to reach the island palace of Jagmandir. Two large stone elephants border the entrance, and the 17th-century tower glints a subtle blue above the water. The streets will return to their lively ambiance around the Bagore-ki-Haveli, which is a traditional mansion that is located near the Gangaur Ghat. The home hosts 138 rooms that are each connected to a collection of courtyards. After breakfast, your private transfer will meet you in your hotel’s lobby to escort you to Maharana Pratap Airport for your brief flight to Delhi, where you will board your connecting flight home.

tourName: Indian Odyssey Tour: Taj Mahal, Khajuraho, Jaipur, UNESCO Ellora Caves & More
placesVisited: Mumbai, Aurangabad, Delhi, Jaipur, Agra, Jhansi, Khajuraho, Varanasi
generalInfo: Step out along the trails that will take you through caves and monuments, palaces and rivers, each one a celebration of history and spiritualism on this 14-day tour through India. Whether you find yourself beneath a sensational stone statue carved into an underground temple or you walk along a honey-colored stone path that trails over a fort, you won’t just witness the splendor of India but will also experience it. This tour takes you into the grandeur of a country that has inspired the world with color and spice, spirit and devotion.

dayInfo.title: A Journey’s Arrival
dayInfo.description: Welcome to the largest city in India, known as Mumbai. The diversity of its streets can be seen in the undulating skyline that shadows over the reaching city and experienced within the modern luxuries that tend to spotlight the continuous traditions of the people, from the colorful clothing that flows in the breeze to the delicate scent of spiced chai that often wanders through the air. You are met at the airport by a private transfer and quickly able to settle into the comforts of your accommodations with the rhythm of the city around you. The city is dotted with colonial buildings and monuments, including the Gateway of India that stands along the seaside welcoming people to the country and commemorating the country’s welcoming of King George V. It is not hard to become comfortable within the beat of the city once you come to hear its colorful, mesmerizing tune.

dayInfo.title: Cave Adventures
dayInfo.description: Welcome in the morning and its rich scents with a smile and a wave as you enjoy a sumptuos breakfast that allows you to sample the traditional flavors of India within the comforts of your hotel. The cinnamon and fennel scent of chai is luscious, while the chapatti , baked flatbread, are fresh, warm, and soft. After breakfast you will venture to Elephanta Island, known for the magnificent caves that were carved into temples during the mid-fifth to sixth-centuries. The high cliffs give way to stone pillars etched out of the rock’s base, chiseled and refined beneath a series of different precipices, from full stone to those overrun with fields. Once inside, the earthen scent and cool temperature adds to the atmosphere of the surrounding reliefs. Images of Shiva protrude from the walls in various sizes, bringing to light the god as creator, protector, and destroyer eternally etched into stone, hidden from the elements. Later in the afternoon you will meander through the monuments of Mumbai, from the Hanging Gardens to Marine Drive, where you can see the uniqueness of the Parsi “Towers of Silence,” a 19th century engraving representing the Zoroastrian religion meant to be a final resting place.

dayInfo.title: Deeper into the Earth
dayInfo.description: After breakfast you will leave the energetic streets of Mumbai behind and make your way to Aurangabad, a once prominent Mughal capital in the mid 17th century. As you are met at the airport you may think you have already come to Agra, noticing the large white domes of the Taj Mahal; however, the replica was built in 1679 to stunning response but less grandeur. You can almost feel the famous silk of the city draping through the air and gliding across your skin as you notice the elegant flow of Paithani and Hamroo saris. Eighteen miles north of the city will bring you to the Ellora Caves, displaying the epitome of rock architecture dating back to the fifth-century all the way to the 10th with both Buddhist and Hindu origins. Strewn across a relatively flat area of the Western Ghats Mountain Range, the temples are carved into the rock, including Cave 10. Here you can find The Buddhist Carpenter’s Cave, with its arched columns and vaulted roofs textured with ribs to imitate wooden beams while standing over a depiction of a seated Buddha.

dayInfo.title: The Captivating Architecture
dayInfo.description: The morning brings you energy because every morning brings another stretch of adventure; like Odysseus through the Mediterranean, you are discovering the majesty of India, above and below ground. After breakfast you will leave the glistening replica of the Taj Mahal behind and find yourself at the Ajanta Caves, full of spectacular paintings and cave temples that date as far back as the second-century BC. Walking along the vast greenery you can barely see the architecture displayed through the forest, it looks like limestone mountains peaking through the canopy. The present scent of fallen rain and wet stone brings fresh life to the day. When you enter the prayer hall your breath literally leaves your body, amazed by the power and elegance that people have made out of a cave, with its ribbed, vaulted ceilings towering over thick, smooth pillars. The tremendous artistry is not just in the architecture but the reliefs that line the walls. Where many children have dreamed of being Indiana Jones and happening upon a lost world hidden within the earth, you are embodying such a discovery here, where images of gods and myths are carved and painted onto the walls in detail difficult to create in stone and in colors that continue to inspire with their vibrancy. You will arrive at the airport in the afternoon and quickly find yourself settling into India’s capital city of Delhi.

dayInfo.title: The Old with the New
dayInfo.description: The history of Delhi is told on the fixtures of its new neighborhoods as much as on the old, paying homage from where and when the city came. After breakfast you will step out on a guided tour to experience the mystery and majesty of its streets. The Red Fort is a massive sandstone structure that stands over a lengthy manicured green field with adjacent cupolas at its gate rising over 54 feet high. The mixture of marble and sandstone gave power and force to the outer walls during the 17th century. The interior was once used to house embellished jewels and gold but even now you can still see the remnants of opulence around the frilled arches and sunken ponds meandering through the interior. Stepping along the strong walls within the textile galleries you will find the marvelous artistry and fabulous history of the strength of Delhi and of India.

dayInfo.title: Red Fortress to Pink City
dayInfo.description: You can spend some time reveling in the active sounds and scents of early morning Delhi. The shops come to life; the streets fill with men pushing carts along the road, selling fresh brewed tea and surrounded by locals on their way to work. India’s capital streets are soon behind you as you make your way to Jaipur, the capital city of Rajasthan. The old city is awash with pink from the sandstone architecture that graces the skyline, making the open blue air look like sunset. In the late afternoon you will come to Lakshmi Narayan Temple, a lavish marble construction whose spires rise, each one taller than the last. The interior is decorated with fabulous depictions of devout patrons of various faiths bringing a tranquil bond to those that visit and frequent the ornate temple grounds.

dayInfo.title: The Power of Colors
dayInfo.description: Stepping away from the vivacious pink stone that drapes the city you will find the honey colored Amer Fort that rises up the mountainside just outside the city. You can see the labyrinthine walkways winding up the precipice to the gates, some people walking, others taking elephant rides as the maharajas would have after conquering distant kingdoms. The fort and the palace inside dates back to the 11th century; however, the marvels of the palace in its current form dates back to the 16th century, as lavish and unadulterated as it can be. Follow an imposing stairway from the main courtyard that will take you through two lush silver doors where the texture from the raised relief catches the light and glows. Sitting above the doorway is an image of Ganesh carved from a single piece of coral. Every step through the palace, from the Hall of Public Audience to the maharaja’s apartment, brings another layer of history, another image of luxury, and another adventurous story for you to experience before returning to the city center and finding the latticed windows of the famous Hawa Mahal, the signature architectural image if Jaipur.

dayInfo.title: Finding Ghosts
dayInfo.description: The morning comes soft and easy over the city bringing the pink hue back to the streets and the sky. After breakfast, you venture beyond the fringes of the city and come to Fatehpur Sikri on the way to Agra. The imperial ghost city was constricted by Emperor Akbar and continues to shimmer the quintessential pink of Indian sandstone. What was once the short-lived capital of the Mughal Empire in the latter half of the16th century, it became desolate of empirical custom but continued to house the natural grandeur inherent in the architecture. Within the palace walls you can find the main courtyard where a splendid platform is raised over a pond, reached by bridges that extend over the waterway on either side of the square shaped podium. Cupolas rise over the walls offering terraced views over the empty squares and cityscape as the fabulous Hall of Private Audience is as majestic outside, with a large Moorish arch, as it is on the inside where a column rises into a blossoming textured sphere that helps support the structure. In the evening you will come to Agra where the luxuries of the city sit within the legendary shadow of the Taj Mahal.

dayInfo.title: Fit for a Legend
dayInfo.description: Just before sunrise the cold breeze crawls through the city. You are awake and out of your hotel room standing at the entrance gates of the Taj Mahal, one of the modern Seven Wonders of the World. The light starts to rise along the horizon as you enter the celebrated grounds. Built in the 17th century for emperor Shah Jahan’s third wife, it has always been considered a “jewel of Muslim art in India.” The myth and majesty of the building stands within the manicured gardens and quiet early morning fountains. The reflection of the pristine structure blossoms in the long stretch of water before the platform. The vibrant pulse of the day winds through the pathways as the translucent marble captures the stark colors of sunrise, bringing the white stone to graceful orange and purple. The symmetry of the construction brings a uniform look and atmosphere, an image of regal elegance that surrounds everyone coming to pay homage to the spectacular artistry and magnificent arabesques. As you are guided through the monuments of Agra you will find each one to be equally captivating, but none more enchanting than the iconic Taj Mahal.

dayInfo.title: En Route to Reliefs
dayInfo.description: After breakfast you will depart from the marbled wonder that sits within Agra and climb aboard a first-class train ride that will have you on your way to Khajuraho, known for its sensational temples decorated with thousands of remarkable images celebrating religion and legends within an open space surrounded by lush forest. Along the path of the train you can see villages sweep past, goat herds meandering beside the tracks, and flashes of shaded clotheslines adding to the vivacious scenery. Once in Jhansi you will be taken the rest of the way by private transfer, able to settle into your accommodation with unrivaled anticipation of the majesty to come.

dayInfo.title: The Tremendous Temples
dayInfo.description: The morning brings you to the steps of the tremendous temples that house the likes of Jain and Hindu architecture, along with thousands of statues carved into the interior and exterior that brings visitors from all over the world, driven by devotion or curiosity. Out of the 20 temples that remain, they can be dated back to the 9th and 10th centuries, each displaying their ancient masterworks proudly. The highest spire stands over the Sanctuary of the Divinity, symbolizing the “Cosmic Mountain,” while the most important temples in the grouping are located in the western zone, starting with Varaha, which is known for its large image of the boar incarnation of the god Vishnu. Engraved into the over five-foot tall statue are almost limitless images of seated and powerful Vishnu that when added together create the board itself. Within each frame of each inch of each temple you will find the markings of terrific history wrapped up in the detail of the reliefs that celebrate both the Jain and Hindu tradition. In afternoon you will catch your flight to Varanasi and come to beating heart of a sacred city.

dayInfo.title: Sacred City
dayInfo.description: When you wake up in the sacred city you will come to a world that is seemingly chaotic and rich, organized and spiritual, misunderstood and magnetic. The scent of chai brings with it new memories; the cinnamon now reminds you of the bright red sari that you witnessed along the riverbank as you step aboard a boat to view the endless activity of the city. Once on the Ganges River you can see where the true heart of the city lies, where women wash their clothing and men lather their bodies and bathe. Children swim in the wandering heat of the summer but you feel the drifting breeze sweep across your skin from the gentle speed of the boat. The stonework along the river harkens back to history, where the deep roots of the city lie. You will come to the Dhamekh Stupa in Sarnath just outside of Varanasi, the site where Buddha gave his first address after reaching enlightenment. The park is set aside from the energy of the city, embraced by tranquility and overlooked by the 132 foot high Dhamekh Stupa, decorated by fifth-century floral and geometric carvings. There is an endless source of spirituality in and around Varanasi, filled with pilgrims and color, where a lifetime of stress can be washed away in the scared waters of the river.

dayInfo.title: When the Odyssey Returns
dayInfo.description: Every morning brings the delight of a new flavor or new aroma that entices you and rouses you for the new day and will have you looking forward to the coming adventure. The early hours of the day are at your leisure where you can explore the streets and sounds of the city stretching across the spiritual and photogenic steps of the Ghats that you noticed from the boat the previous day. The Assi Ghat is the farthest south and marks where the Ganges meets the Assi River. In the mid afternoon you will board your flight and return to Delhi for the evening, where the familiar mixture of the new and old city is a comfortable reminder of where you have been and where you are going.

dayInfo.title: Adventurous Memories
dayInfo.description: The day brings the marvelous sights and sounds of the capital city back to you with the scent of paratha lingering in the air. After your joyous breakfast you will have a private transfer to the airport to the plane that will soon carry you home. Your Indian odyssey took you through the colors and landscapes of the country, finding the incredible cultures along the way, from religious life to village life, where the spirit of the temples are as important as the vibrancy of the people.

tourName: India’s Golden Triangle Senior Tour
placesVisited: Agra, Jaipur, Delhi, Shimla
generalInfo: Embrace the wonders of the Golden Triangle and beyond during this customizable 14-day India tour that focuses on Delhi, Agra, and Jaipur. Venture through the desert to find exotic palaces and to discover marble tombs that decorate the banks of the Yamuna River. The sound of the sitar will become an enticing staple of your journey, and you will find comfort in aromatic cuisine and opulent fortresses.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – India’s Capital City
dayInfo.description: The vibrant city of Delhi acts as an amalgamation of greater India with streets and architecture that embody the broader history, culture, and heritage of the nation. Your flight will land at Indira Gandhi International Airport, where your private transfer will greet you at customs and transfer you to your luxurious accommodation in the heart of the city. You will then have the remainder of the day at your leisure to enjoy the comforts of your gorgeous accommodations. For insight into the unique beauty of Delhi, you can visit the Old Fort of Purana Qila, which boasts foundations that date back 2,500 years.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – History and Treasures of Delhi
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, your guide will meet you in the hotel lobby and introduce you to the sensory feast that Delhi represents. You will be exposed to the layered aromas of simmering curries, the lively cries of merchants as they call to passersby, and the spectacular colors of the architecture and clothing. You will make your way around a selection of the eight distinctive neighborhoods at your preferred pace to discover how each district acts as a separate city. You will continue to Gurudwara Bangla Sahib, which is the most important Sikh place of worship in the city.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – The Changing of the Guard
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will set out to view the renowned Changing of the Guard at the residence of the president. After viewing the fascinating ceremony, you will continue with your guide to Old Delhi. Inside the Red Fort, you will discover how the contemporary lives of Delhi residents revolve around the antique architecture and back alleys of the complex. You can enter the bustling lanes of Chhatta Chowk bazaar, where merchants display their flowing silks, shimmering gems, and antique silverware among aromas of mouthwatering cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Agra – Visit the Iconic Taj Mahal
dayInfo.description: Your private transfer will then meet you in the hotel lobby after breakfast to escort you to Agra. After taking time to settle into the comforts of your luxurious accommodation, your guide will take you on an intimate tour of the Taj Mahal at sunset. The shifting colors of the sky will reflect across the pristine marble façade of the Mughal monument. The iconic dome stands 180 feet tall with a diameter of sixty feet at its widest point. As you walk around the decorated gardens, you will find elegant pools that help create a harmonious ambiance of the monument.

dayInfo.title: Agra – Famous Mughal Monuments
dayInfo.description: Your guide will greet you at your hotel after breakfast to introduce you to the greater Mughal monuments of Agra that have shaped the city since the 17th century. You can begin your tour at Itimad-ud-Daulah’s Tomb, which historians believe was the inspiration for the Taj Mahal. The tomb rises above the banks of the Yamuna River with an exquisite design. You can continue to the gardens of Mehtab Bagh to walk along the square complex. Flowering trees and lush bushes open along the edges of the Yamuna River for remarkable views to the Taj Mahal located across the water.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – The Former Mughal Capital
dayInfo.description: The unique aesthetic of the Mughal Empire will once again become apparent during your private tour of the former capital city of Fatehpur Sikri. Your private transfer will greet you at your hotel after breakfast and lead you to the 16th-century complex to meet your guide. Your guide will explain the unique blend of Indian and Islamic elements that create a fascinating architectural masterpiece. The city has been preserved, allowing you to wander through the three palaces. You will find the Hiran Minar, which is a spiked tower that is decorated with elephant tusks carved from stone.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – Amber Fort and Sitar Lesson
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the vibrancy of the Pink City’s streets will return. Your guide will meet you at your hotel and take you to the dramatic gates of the Amber Fort, which is located at the edge of Rajasthan’s capital. You will enter the Sun Gate to reach the first of four courtyards. In the afternoon, you will continue to a local village to experience the traditions of the Rajasthan state, which is often considered the most colorful state of India. Here, you may notice locals leading camels, teaching visitors how to tie turbans, and offering lessons on the art of henna. You will sit in the comforts of a private home to begin your sitar lesson.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – Delight in Heritage and Color
dayInfo.description: Today, you will venture into the heart of Jaipur to explore the city center with your guide. First, you will witness the iconic pink walls of the City Palace. The Welcome Palace contains a small museum that displays royal costumes and opulent shawls of the former royal family, such as garments worn by Sawai Madho Singh I. You will then continue to the Nahargarh, which is an 18th-century fortress that overlooks the city. The complex once acted as a summer retreat for the royal family and now hosts approximately a dozen identical bedrooms that belonged to the different queens.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Day at your Leisure
dayInfo.description: The familiar aromas of chai masala will fill the streets of Jaipur in the morning. Your private transfer will greet you at the hotel and escort you back to Delhi, where you will have the day at your leisure. After settling into the charms of your accommodation, you can venture into the unique districts of the city to enjoy the streets at your own pace. You can find merchants with a blend of handicrafts and cuisine. Cultural performances reflect the diverse heritage from around greater India. The stalls around the marketplace rotate every 15 days to ensure the handicrafts on display remain fresh and diverse. The colorful displays include jewelry, paintings, leather goods, rugs, and saris.

dayInfo.title: Shimla – Day of Self-Exploration
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will have a private transfer to the airport, where you will board a brief flight that is bound for Chandigarh. You will continue to Shimla with the comfort of a private driver. The city once acted as a summer resort during British colonial India and retains an ambient charm within the car-free city center. The main avenue winds along the spine of the hills with branching streets that create labyrinthine alleys and hidden stairways. On clear days, the expansive view opens to the jagged peaks of the Himalayas. You will then settle in to your accommodation before having the rest of the day to spend at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Shimla – Bask in the Countryside
dayInfo.description: The city of Shimla rests along a steep ridge at the foothills of the Himalayas. As you stroll the streets at your own pace, you can find troops of monkeys that roam the streets. You can venture to the peak of Jakhoo Hill to find spectacular views of the mountainside and a panorama of the city below. A temple crowns the hill and is dedicated to Hanuman, which is the Hindu monkey god. At the temple, you can find images of Hanuman that decorate the outer walls and the interior.

dayInfo.title: Shimla – Indulge in the Scenery
dayInfo.description: n the morning, the austere façade of Gorton Castle will return into view along the alpine streets of Shimla. After breakfast, you will make your way to the train station for a journey along the Himalayan Queen Express Toy Train. The scenic ride travels between Shimla and Kandaghat. The service ventures 60 miles across 20 hill stations, through 102 tunnels, and over 889 bridges. During your adventure, you will have time to explore the village of Kandaghat, where the Chail View Palace connotes the former opulence of the district as a royal summer escape.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Back to Delhi
dayInfo.description: You can relax in the morning at your preferred pace by wandering the pedestrianized city center of Shimla. When you are ready, your private transfer will meet you in the lobby and escort you back to Chandigarh for your return flight to Delhi. Upon your return, a private driver will transfer you to your accommodation. Once you settle in and relax, you will have the remainder of the day at your leisure. For a unique view of Delhi, you can visit the narrow lane of Natraj Dahi Balle for an eclectic fusion of cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you can listen to the harmonious call to prayer before your private transfer meets you at the hotel. You will venture to the airport with plenty of time to connect with your flight home.

tourName: India’s Golden Triangle Tour for Families
placesVisited: Jaipur, Agra, Fatehpur Sikri, Delhi
generalInfo: Make lifelong memories during this customizable 7-day family India tour that focuses on the Golden Triangle. Discover the treasures of the Pink City, the luster of the Taj Mahal, the vibrant lanes of traditional bazaars, and the captivating aromas of traditional cuisines. Uncover centuries of history and heritage with private transfers and guided tours that allow you to witness opulent architecture and experience the authentic culture of India.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Arrival and Day at your Leisure
dayInfo.description: The vibrant city of Delhi remains a treasure trove of history and an amalgamation of cultures from around India. Your flight will land at Indira Gandhi International Airport, where your private transfer will greet your family at customs. You can settle into the comforts of your accommodation and enjoy the remainder of the day at your preferred pace. At dawn, hundreds of seagulls linger above the water in search of food and reflect their wings on the surface of the river.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Treasured Culture and History
dayInfo.description: In the morning, your guide will escort you on a private tour through the city that will reveal the splendor of the capital of India. The city acts as a sensory feast with vibrant colors, captivating aromas, and a chaotic ballet of movement. Your guide will lead you to the famous Mehrauli Archeological Park, where you can find more than 440 monuments that were built between the 10th century and the British colonial era. You will continue to the Red Fort to find the stronghold that was constructed in the mid-17th century.

dayInfo.title: Agra – Agra’s Famous Monuments
dayInfo.description: Your private transfer will meet the family at the hotel and escort you away from Delhi to reach Agra, which is the city that is known for hosting the Taj Mahal. You will settle into the comforts of your family-friendly accommodations before setting out on a private tour of the Mughal legacy that decorates the city. Eventually, your family will make their way to the Taj Mahal for a sunset tour. Your guide will lead you through the gardens, where you can find glassy pools that reflect the image of the tomb that was built for the Mughal emperor’s favorite wife.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – Visit Fatehpur Sikri
dayInfo.description: The grandeur of the former Mughal capital city of Fatehpur Sikri remains a fine example of 16th-century art, architecture, and ingenuity. The Indo-Islamic masterpiece shines with red sandstone, which adds to the distinctive ambiance of the deserted city. You can reach the large mosque of Jama Masjid behind the towering Victory Gate. Your guide will lead you around the complex, and your kids will marvel at the collection of palaces that host an intricate collection of carvings, courtyards, and ornamental pools.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – Historic Neighborhoods and Bazaars
dayInfo.description: Jaipur is a city where the historic architecture blushes to give it the nickname of the Pink City. The grandeur of the royal complex reflects the former lavish lifestyle of the royal family, and the bustling bazaars represent the active daily life of the city’s residents. Your guide will escort you through the capital of Rajasthan for an encompassing tour that, beginning with the City Palace. At first glance, the astronomical tools on the grounds of the Jantar Mantar may resemble massive sculptures, but your guide will provide insight into the importance of each instrument.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Wander the Amber Fort
dayInfo.description: Your guide will meet your family at the hotel in the morning and lead you to the entrance gate of the Amber Fort. The dramatic complex contains four palaces with foundations that date back to the 10th century. By the time you reach the third courtyard, you will find the lavish design of the Jai Mandir, which is an entrance gate that was decorated with glass panels and glistening mirrors. After discovering the opulence of Amber Fort, your private transfer will whisk your family back to Delhi, where you will have the remainder of the day at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Departure
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will have time to return to the dynamic streets of the famous Chandni Chowk market, where silver jewelry and stacks of books divide the alleys. Your private transfer will meet your family at your hotel. When you are ready, your guide will take you to Delhi’s international airport for your flight home.

tourName: India’s Golden Triangle Tour
placesVisited: Delhi, Agra, Jaipur, Udaipur, Rajasthan
generalInfo: On this elite personalized India tour , you will experience the splendor of color, the marvels of culture, the grandeur of architecture, and depth of history. Venture beyond the Golden Triangle to see the expanse of luxury and landscape. Striations of color drape the Taj Mahal at sunset, reflecting dark red and rich purple. The Pink City of Jaipur fills with a celebratory spirit year-round. Ancient history rises out of Delhi’s parks and gardens. Lake Pichola mirrors Udaipur’s pristine palaces. Discover the extravagance of India’s cities and countryside proving all that glitters can be better than gold.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Arrive in the Fantastic City of Delhi, the Capital of India
dayInfo.description: Delhi is a city that paints modernity with the brush of history. The capital of India is filled with a whirlwind of culture and tradition that will easily sweep you up. You will arrive at the airport and be met by your private transfer. Your accommodation will put you at the center of the city’s buzz, but you will feel miles away when you arrive in the quiet comforts of your hotel. The luxuries of the past will embrace you while the city continues to beat. The fragrant spices of chai masala embody cardamom, cinnamon, and nutmeg that reveal depths of aromatics both new and familiar. Women wear saris dancing in the gentle breeze as the textiles’ vibrant hues are set over a wealth of patterns. Lush, vibrant gardens flank the wide boulevard of Rajpath, the “King’s Way” and the blossoming flowers emulate the marvelous patterns and colors of the textiles local women wear. The grand boulevard leads from the India Gate to the Presidential Palace, and a 73-foot dome stands at the far edge of the wide street, in a grassy garden. Beneath the canopy sits the Royal Coat of Arms and an inscription dedicated to King George V, which reads “Rex Imperator,” or “King-Emperor.” The modern city of Delhi hosts luxurious shopping areas centered around the colonnaded facades of the city’s financial district known as Connaught Place. Boutique and designer shops continue to blend international style and Indian flair amid the top heritage structures of the city. The charm of Delhi emanates from the ruins and towering ancient buildings reminding locals and visitors of the city’s 1,000 years of history, as well as the prestigious shops reflecting India’s forward-thinking progress.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Tour through the Remarkable Landmarks of Delhi
dayInfo.description: In the morning, your breakfast will be fast and wonderfully fragrant. Fresh mangos and bananas fill the table as the scent of cardamom and cinnamon drift through the air. Paratha, traditional flatbread, tastes savory and sweet since it is sometimes covered in honey or coconut milk. After breakfast, your private guide will meet you to begin your tour of the city at Qutab Minar. The single tower was constructed using a combination of sandstone and marble. It stands over 237 feet tall and contains 379 steps. The encompassing park is filled with Mughal ruins adding to the historic, yet tranquil ambiance. The history of the minaret dates back to the 12th century, under the founder of the Delhi Sultanate, while the edifice was completed in the 14th century. Your guide will highlight the balconies, which separate each section. A large lantern stands to the side on a stone platform. It looks like a gazebo but once stood at the top of the tower and helped light the evening sky. You will notice the calligraphy that is carved into the stone edifice, which displays the combined elegance of artistry and geometric design. Couples picnic on the grassy park as the city brims with people working and shopping. Within the shadow of the illustrious past, you have only just begun to find the beauty of India in Delhi.

dayInfo.title: Agra – Witness the Celebrated Colors of the Taj Mahal
dayInfo.description: Delhi comes to life in the morning with tea karts set alongside the street and locals that form crowded lines for breakfast en route to work. Shops open and overflow with colorful textiles. After breakfast, your private transfer will meet you at the hotel and escorts you to Agra. The city is famous for the iconic landmark, the Taj Mahal. The moment you step into the vast garden complex, its splendor will strike you. Manicured trees, shrubs, and flowers offer greenery with bursts of orange and red along the walkways. Long reflective pools stretch toward the platform of the celebrated marble edifice as the water mirrors the sparkling domes and spires that stretch into the sky. The mausoleum was constructed in the 16th century and was the first Mughal building erected using all marble. The symmetry is impeccable, and the pristine color of the façade emanates light. The central dome stands 115 feet tall, and it was meant to resemble a blossoming lotus. The entire complex was dedicated to Shah Jahan’s third wife reflecting the emperor’s eternal care and devotion. Semiprecious stones decorate the mausoleum’s interior, which are arranged in the shape of flower petals and vines. They capture the sunlight that peeks through the windows, which shimmer with grace and life. Each second near the Taj Mahal is a moment of discovery. You will find lavish embellishment but also an indelible sense of wonder inside the Mughal emperor’s design.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – Visit the Old Capital of Fatehpur Sikri en route to Jaipur
dayInfo.description: At dawn, the Taj Mahal reflects the sunrise as the colors blanket the white marble in layers of pink and blue. You will bask in the distinct glow of the shifting hues as they spread over the Taj Mahal at daybreak for an exclusive view that embodies the true majesty of the architectural wonder. After breakfast, your private transfer will take you out of Agra to the celebrated ghost city of Fatehpur Sikri. The sandstone complex was constructed in the 16th century and stood as the short-lived capital city of the Mughal Empire. Upon your arrival, you will see the Buland Darwaza, the entrance gate that stands over 177 feet tall and contains a large Moorish arch. Today, the palace grounds remain elegant, and the rustic red of the walls will capture your attention. Diwan-i-Khas was the Hall of Private Audience, and it still retains the plain square exterior. The interior central pillar will draw your attention for good reason as the square base supports an octagonal pillar that is adorned with a geometric and floral design. It looks more like a centerpiece than a pillar. The 36 serpentine brackets at the center create an image of a stonework chandelier. After your exploration of the distinct capital city, you will continue onward to Jaipur, the famous Pink City of Rajasthan. The wide boulevards of the old city are remnants of an imperial past. While classic culture shines bright, pieces of the contemporary lifestyle seep through as rickshaws wind through the streets and camels pull karts alongside the bustling avenues. You will indulge in the finer narrow alleyways of Koli Basti, known as the carpet market. The specific and vivacious designs are woven splendidly into a soft and plush fabric.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – Discover the Tremendous Colors of the Pink City
dayInfo.description: Beyond the rugged hills that surround the city is the vast Thar Desert. The morning sunlight spreads over the city. Camels return to their spot alongside the boulevards as they pull carts carrying fresh fruits. The pink walls of the City Palace display the lavish celebration and a rich history. The Hawa Mahal, also known as the Palace of Winds, stands 50 feet tall and the honeycomb façade contains 953 niches, resembling a pipe organ. Its namesake comes from the latticed windows that allow in the breeze. The royal women would watch the procession of marching armies or the morning boisterousness of the bazaars from behind the windows to preserve their modesty. This tradition emulates the mythical stories of maharajas and the mysterious women behind the curtain. The City Palace was built in the 18th century, and descendants of the royal family continue to reside in the Chandra Mahal. The Private Audience Hall is paved with marble tiles and is open to the outer courtyard. The wide arches, stone tiles, and open space create a cross breeze in the heat of summer. Floral patterns decorate the arches and encircle the ceiling around the chandeliers. The power of the empire feels more delicate when accompanied by the embellishments that have kept the legends of romance and strength alive.

dayInfo.title: Udaipur – Make your Way to the Lakeside City of Udaipur
dayInfo.description: The day begins to brim with the ritual of morning light. The City Palace continues to shine pink, and the aroma of chai masala emanates from the corner tea stands. After breakfast, your private transfer will escort you away from Jaipur and onwards to the charming lakeside city of Udaipur. Lake Pichola is surrounded by a backdrop of turreted balconies, ornate palaces, and majesty of rolling, verdant hills. Classic mansions and bathing ghats sit on the water’s shores and the mountain air is fresh and crisp. Your accommodation embodies the best of the city often referred to as the “Venice of the East,” due to the luxurious waterway and gorgeous palatial complexes. The streets in the old city are tightly wound mazes that offer a treasure-trove of shops and restaurants to be easily discovered, yet often overlooked. The lake’s surface is calm with serene, shimmering ripples. The City Palace sits on the shore and reflects in the glassy water. In the evening, you will step aboard a small boat and drift along the water on a private cruise that provides one of the best panoramas of the illustrious cityscape. The lake is almost two and a half miles long and over one and a half miles wide. When you look back at the city, you will find the ancient buildings awash with ochre, draped in the colors of the sunset. As you reach the center of the water, you will see Monsoon Palace crowning the hill above the city.

dayInfo.title: Udaipur – Enjoy the Romantic City
dayInfo.description: The walls of the City Palace are immaculate and stunning. Cupolas decorate the ramparts and add to the festive, elegant ambiance. Latticed windows encircle the outer rooms that would be otherwise visible from the lake. Colonnades line the palace ridge and offer a view of blossoming flowers and lush trees. The City Palace was constructed in the 16th century and is an amalgamation of various residences. The main façade is imposing and impressive as it stretches over 800 feet in length and 100 feet in height. The complex was constructed with granite and marble, which lends to its specific off-white coloration. The structure symbolizes the fascinating architecture amid the majestic landscape attracting royals from across Rajasthan and the world interested in relaxing in the cool summer breezes along the shore. The Great Palace contains an exotic garden housed on a rock formation 89 feet high. The platform creates the illusion that the palace’s ground floor is at the same height as the surrounding buildings’ fourth floor. The intricate and gilded mosaics decorate Mor Chowk. The courtyard almost glows with extravagant detail that brings geometric decoration and romantic images to light. The artistry is captivating and the grace is endless. A breeze blows through the open courtyard and you can see the leaves of the Great Palace rustle.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: The sun rises over the surrounding mountains and casts a gentle beam over Lake Pichola. You will sip on your final chai masala in India savoring the combination of cinnamon and allspice. Udaipur is endlessly charming and jovially romantic. After breakfast, your private transfer will take you to the airport for your return flight to Delhi. You will have gone beyond the three points of the Golden Triangle to witness more than just the Taj Mahal and the Pink City. You will have ventured into the hills and experienced India’s variety. The beauty of the countryside and the grandeur of the royal touch throughout history is nothing less than unforgettable.

tourName: Intimate Exploration of India for Couples in One Week
placesVisited: Agra, Ranthambore National Park, Jaipur, Delhi
generalInfo: Embrace passion and experience unparalleled charm during your 7-day couple’s tour of India. Romance will become the focus of your discovery, as your specialist guides and private transfers help create memorable experiences in secluded corners of Delhi and Jaipur. From watching the sunrise over the Taj Mahal to witnessing the sunset burn across Rajasthan’s sand dunes, this India tour immerses you in the culture, heritage, contemporary warmth, and enchanting romance of the country.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Arrival and Day at Leisure
dayInfo.description: The city of Delhi is a historical and cultural treasure in India that reveals stories of the past in addition to the distinctive heritage of the country’s diverse traditions. Your flight will land at Indira Gandhi International Airport, where you will meet your private transfer at customs. After settling into the comforts of your accommodation, the remainder of the day is at your leisure. The Garden of the Five Senses is located in the Saidul Ajaib neighborhood and is popular with couples who are searching for an escape from the city’s bustle.

dayInfo.title: Agra – The Beauty of Delhi
dayInfo.description: The ambiance of Delhi will compel you through the streets and historical sites during your private tour. Your tour will lead you from the lively merchants in the Red Fort to the tranquility of the Qutub Minar complex. You will continue to the former capital of the Mughal Empire, Fatehpur Sikri, before reaching Agra. The city has a distinctive hue that exudes from the red sandstone that was used to create the walls, gates, and stones of the city. You can have a relaxing stroll in the Hall of Private Audiences.

dayInfo.title: Ranthambore – Early Agra Tour
dayInfo.description: Your guide will meet you at the hotel before dawn and escort you to the Taj Mahal. You will see the pale image of the Taj Mahal’s pearlescent façade mirrored in the reflective pool as the sunrise casts a soft pink hue across the dome. The tomb stands as the ultimate act of love and was built in the 17th century as a gift from the emperor to his favorite wife after her passing. After traversing the beauty of Agra, your private transfer will lead you out of the city to reach the quiet and secluded jungle terrain of Ranthambore National Park.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – Jungle Safari and Camel Excursion
dayInfo.description: The morning at Ranthambore National park will be filled with the sounds of rambunctious monkeys as they amble across the branches of the tropical canopy. After breakfast, your guide will take you on a safari in search of wildlife. You will enjoy searching for signs of wildlife around the underbrush, including the renowned Bengal tiger. After your safari, you will depart Ranthambore National Park for the desert terrain of Rajasthan. Before settling into your luxury accommodations in Jaipur, you will set out on a camel excursion that will lead you to an area where you can watch the sunset over the golden sand dunes.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – The History and Culture of Jaipur
dayInfo.description: After breakfast this morning, your guide will lead you on a private tour of the city, from the City Palace to the Jantar Mantar Observatory. For a fantastic view of the city, you will venture to the 18th-century Jaigarh Fort, which retains an ambiance of timeless India. You will experience where the contemporary and historical customs of Jaipur converge when you stroll through Johri Bazaar. The warren of streets glints with gold and silver jewelry in addition to precious charms with traditional kundan designs.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Explore the Amber Fort
dayInfo.description: This morning your guide will lead you to the Amber Fort for a private tour. The four main sections of the complex each possess their own courtyard, making the fortress feel like four separate palaces. In the Hall of Pleasure, you can find views of the rippling water of Lake Maota below the raised foundations of the fortress. Inside the Mirror Palace, candles often fill the entire hall with light. After visiting the Amber Fort, you will return to Delhi with the remainder of the day at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Departure
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the spiced aroma of chai masala will drift through the streets of the Red Fortress. After breakfast, your private transfer will meet you in your hotel’s lobby to escort you to Indira Gandhi International Airport for your flight home.

tourName: Kingdom of Rajasthan Tour: Fabled Cities, Thar Desert, Hill Forts & Palaces
placesVisited: Delhi, Mandawa, Bikaner, Jaisalmer, Jodhpur, Udaipur, Jaipur, Fatehpur Sikri, Agra
generalInfo: The history of Rajasthan mesmerizes and inspires people throughout the world and during your 14-day India tour, the landscape tells legends of perseverance and the lavish architecture tells stories of wealth alongside colorful cities. You will venture through the fabled palaces of maharajas and discover the treasured majestic mansions that persist through time, where you can find unmatched regal beauty in the immaculate imagery.

dayInfo.title: Delhi - Among Palaces and Maharajas
dayInfo.description: Arrive in Delhi, the capital city of India. The energy is palpable the moment you step off the plane. You are met by your private transfer and quickly taken to your charming bed and breakfast that offers the calm of the countryside alongside the whirlwind of the Delhi streets. You are immediately swept up in the allure of India. Women walk down the street with saris that gracefully dangle and drift with vibrant hues. The spiced scent of masala chai brings familiar notes of cinnamon and cardamom. The old and new divisions of the city draw equal luster and vitality. You settle in and watch your first day in India go by.

dayInfo.title: Delhi - Explore India's Contemporary Capital
dayInfo.description: The morning streets of Delhi roar to life around sunrise. You are hidden away in comfort in your luxurious accommodation. Breakfast brings with it a traditional sweetness and spice of the masala chai, along with the flaky, delicious crunch of paratha , pan-fried flat bread. Your guide meets you in the lobby ready to take you through the wonder of Delhi, from the old bazaar that dates back to the 17th century to the blossoming marble petals of the Lotus Temple. The Akshardham Temple is a marvelous display of modern architecture set along the banks of the Yamuna River. The complex has combined traditions of Hindu and Indian culture, spirituality, and architecture to create an immaculate tribute of devotion and connection. The central monument rises 141 feet at its highest point and is carved with delicate flora, fauna, dancers, musicians, and deities from bottom to top. You notice the blend of red sandstone and pearl marble that bring the elements together as a tribute to India’s historical monuments. When you come to the musical fountain, the largest step well in the country, you find a respite from the sunlight and a grand display of musical theater in the evening.

dayInfo.title: Agra - The Images of Agra
dayInfo.description: After breakfast your private transfer will meet you at your hotel to help you make your way from Delhi to Agra. The city is home to the iconic image of India, the Taj Mahal. Agra is a city always on the go, filled with modern commerce that surrounds the historical architecture from the Mughal Empire. Once there you will venture through the celebrated Agra Fort before coming to the gates of the Taj Mahal. Once inside the gateway you find the garden stretching over 980 feet, filled with raised pathways and exquisite flowerbeds. Fountains are lined next to avenues of trees all leading to the graceful white marble structure of the mausoleum. The complex was constructed in the 17th century by Shah Jahan. The curves of the central dome are elegant. The way that the sunlight casts the marble in various shades of oranges and blues continues to captivate visitors from all over the world. The minarets rise over 130 feet tall. Within the main archway you find intricate flowers carved into the walls and inlaid with precious stones that create a careful glint. Calligraphy climbs up the large pishtaq , the rectangular frame around an arched opening. The day wears into night and the glow of the Taj Mahal lingers.

dayInfo.title: Agra - Present Icons to Past Capitals
dayInfo.description: As you step away from Agra you can imagine the early morning colors sweeping across the pearl marble at the Taj Mahal. The beauty of the site has not waned since its creation. You come to Fatehpur Sikri on your way to Jaipur. The ancient capital of the Mughal Empire began and ended in the 16th century. The sandstone complex brings a bright red color to the open blue sky stretching almost four miles in total circumference around the city walls. Buland Darwaza is a large gate that stands a striking 165 feet tall and resembles a “Victory Arch.” The Moorish archway at the central portico brings a grand echo within the gate and is topped with three cupolas. The city may have once been abandoned but continues to display grandeur and grace in its elaborate architecture, stunning coloration, and its artistry. You can see the mother-of-pearl mosaic along the wooden canopy in the Tomb of Salim Chishti. As you continue to Jaipur, the evening will settle over the Pink City where camels and rickshaws both come to a rest.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur - Around the Majestic Pink
dayInfo.description: Jaipur is a fascinating city whose history stretches back to Maharajas, filled with mystique and sandstone palaces. After breakfast your guide will bring you out of the city to the serenity of the Water Palace. The walls glow with a light sandy color as the deep blue of the lake brings a contrast to the stone. The palace was constructed in the 18th century and sits at the center of Man Sugar Lake encircled by tremendous hills. At Monkey Temple, also known as Gaitalji, the ancient pilgrimage site is filled with temples that date back to the 16th century nestled between the hills. Rocky cliffs tower over the complex. You find a treasure of water tanks glistening in front of the rising stone temples. The complex is also known for its large population of rhesus macaque monkeys that rush along the upper levels of the cupolas and rocks, and drink from the pools. The day is filled with the unique topography and stunning architecture that has been treasured by the region and wilds alike.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur - Beyond the Palace of Winds
dayInfo.description: Today you will once again journey through the wonderful Pink of Jaipur that is wrapped around its romantic past in the mystical remains of the empire. The historic center is filled with the terracotta pink color that is based in tradition. You find the Hawa Mahal, also known as the Palace of Winds, in the City Palace. The honeycomb façade was constructed at the end of the 18th century with latticed windows to allow female members of the royal family to look upon the processions of the bazaar without sacrificing their modesty. The name comes from the screens. When the breeze would brush through the windows it would bring a stir or whistle as the cool air entered the inner corridors. In the evening you can enjoy the sunset over the city at the Sun Temple, a small Hindu temple that offers a marvelous panorama. The relaxed ambiance brings a welcomed calm to the expansive view of pink that rises from the streets and the dusk. You will find tranquility in the breeze, the seclusion, and this moment set at the edge of a cobblestone walkway on the mountains that overlook the valley.

dayInfo.title: Mandawa - Desert Mansions and Frescoes
dayInfo.description: Mandawa brings an 18th century opulence to the rolling sandy hills that surround the city. You find the charming and lavish haveli, historic mansions, of the city’s past, filled with remnants of a gilded age that stretches along what once were wealthy districts. The Double Haveli dates back to the early 1900s and adjoins two family wings. When you look at the open courtyard you are struck by the continual colors that flow from the floral arabesques and peacocks painted above the archways. The lattice windows scroll along the upper floors of many of the mansions, above ridged arches and intricate pillars. Cupolas of Mandawa Fort create the skyline of the city and stand above the illustrious frescoes on the gates which bring a fabulous power to the colorful walls.

dayInfo.title: Bikaner - Relishing Desert Towns
dayInfo.description: When the morning light hits the frescoes along the Haveli you can imagine the glinting colors and images that have decorated the desert mansions for a century. After breakfast you will venture out of the city and onward to Bikaner, a vivacious town that was once a desert outpost, and continues to attract people from all over the world with its charm and stunning fortress. The desert Junagarh Fort was constructed in the 16th century with 37 bastions and a wall that stretches almost 3,000 feet. The doors to the main gate are reinforced with iron spikes and studs, meant to prevent imposing armies from ramming the doors with elephants. Within the Karan Mahal, the Hall of Public Audience, you find the immaculate décor fit for the royalty of Rajasthan. Stained glass windows and carved balconies stand over wood fluted columns, while intricately patterned mirrors add a decadent reflection of color to the gold and red painted linings. As the desert sands border the city, it adds to the splendor of your time within the fortress and the streets of Bikaner.

dayInfo.title: Jaisalmer - Indian City of Gold
dayInfo.description: In the light of the desert beyond Bikaner you embark on your journey out of the city and onward to Jaisalmer, considered to be the Golden City of India. Once there it is impossible not to notice the towering fort that stands atop a hill in the city center. The rest of the homes, shops, restaurants, and hotels wrap around the fortress’s base. The fort looks as though it were made from the very sand that surrounds Jaisalmer, giving it that golden sheen in the afternoon light. 99 bastions encircle the twisting and turning lanes where shops are draped in spectacular embroideries. The 12th century construction is layered with three walls, from the solid stone blocks of the lowest bastions that were reinforced with loose rubble, to the inner walls where the Rajput once hurled oil and water onto their enemies. Around 3,000 people continue to reside within the honeycomb lanes. Children rush along the cobblestone and women sew beneath the translucent shade of stretching cloth. In the evening you can sit on the roof of your hotel and watch the fortress glow beneath the lively starlight of the clear desert sky.

dayInfo.title: Jaisalmer - The Desert Sands
dayInfo.description: Today you will have an early breakfast before setting out into the desert to meet your new guide who will take you to the horizon filled with sand dunes on a spectacular camel safari. The camel has a rich history within the region. You can climb aboard the camel as it is led along the flat and speckled desert expanse until you reach the Sam Sand Dunes where the romantic image of the Thar Desert comes to fruition. The sweeping, undulating landscape looks like sandy waves in the morning light, brushing against the skyline. Back in the city you find yourself strolling beneath the Patwa-ki-Haveli, the largest mansion in Jaisalmer. Its intricate stone placement divides its interior into five sections each dating back to the 19th century, evoking a richness of the past and connecting to the immaculate discoveries of the day.

dayInfo.title: Jodhpur - Golden Fort to Blue Houses
dayInfo.description: You watch the gilded hues of Jaisalmer fall behind the desert horizon as you make your way to Jodhpur, known as the Blue City. The majesty of the buildings that rise along the mountainside brings a vibrant collection of blue cubes stretching over six miles long around a 16th century wall. When you begin to meander through the streets the delicate aroma of fresh chapatti , traditional flat bread, swirls through the air, along with a blend of traditional spice and incense. MV Spices is a few streets down from the clock tower that tends to act as a marker within the winding streets of old city. From vanilla to pink peppercorn, masala to mutton, they have traded the sensual flavors and delicate aromas for centuries. Mehrangarh, an impregnable fortress stands 360 feet above the city along the rocky hill. When you stand along ramparts that swell between 12 and 102 feet tall you can look out over the painted buildings and cobblestone streets, understanding the exceptional beauty of the city.

dayInfo.title: Udaipur - Exchanging Blue Buildings for the Blue Lake
dayInfo.description: After breakfast you will depart from Jodhpur as the blue homes of the old city and delightful spices of the ancient trade linger farther and farther away. You arrive in Udaipur, the passionate city alongside the lake. The glowing rose and cream colors emanate from the stone buildings that capture the sunlight. Step onto the lake and find the reflections of your surroundings, from the rocky mountains to the City Palace complex, each rippling with radiance along Pichola Lake’s surface. The sun starts to set and the palace shimmers in the dwindling light.

dayInfo.title: Udaipur - Like a Maharaja
dayInfo.description: The City Palace complex is an example of grandeur, from the cream stone color to the powerful, opulent look. Dating back to the 16th century the façade runs over 800 feet in length and 100 feet in height, pressing against the ridge of the lake. Gateways are set along the east, including the Triple Gate with three arches. When you visit the uppermost court you come to the Amar Vilas. The platform is a raised garden constructed in the Mughal style. Arcades encompass a square marble tub and hanging gardens surround the fountains. The entire vista is surrounded by towers and terraces. In the majesty of the garden you can stroll through history and almost feel as though you belong within the world of past royals as you watch the city pass by through lattice windows, listening to the energetic calls from the bazaar.

dayInfo.title: Delhi - Lakeside Departures
dayInfo.description: The morning drapes over the lake and brings the reflections of the palace painted along the water’s surface once more. You enjoy the rich aromas of masala chai during breakfast before your private transfer escorts you to the airport for your return flight to Delhi. Your arrival in Delhi brings an end to your journey through India. You could always spend more time traversing the countryside, enriching yourself with the culture evolved from marvelous Maharajas and exquisite architecture, but as your flight time comes closer you will step onto the plane and continue your journey home.

tourName: Luxury Rajasthan Tour of Land of Kings
placesVisited: Delhi, Agra, Jaipur, Shahpura, Nimaj, Osian Camel Camp, Jodhpur
generalInfo: On this 13-day India tour through Rajasthan, you will find reminders of warrior-kings and saris that burst with color. A remarkable fortress watches over the expanse of a Blue City and a pink palace bursts with character. Men wear traditional twirling mustaches and camels stroll along the desert sand. From silver bracelets to jewels inlaid in the architecture, your time in India will be filled with luxury and unparalleled discovery.

dayInfo.title: Delhi - The Royal Welcome
dayInfo.description: Welcome to the gateway of grandeur. Delhi is a city that is filled with a spellbinding energy that emanates from its over one thousand years of history. The modern suburbs and cityscape shows you the contemporary power and wealth of the nation’s capital. Tucked away in hidden corners, or standing tall in lush parks, you will find ruins and temples, remnants of the Mughal Empire and ancient walls that encompass a continuously thriving market. You are met at the airport by a private transfer and escorted to the Imperial Hotel in the heart of the city. The marble floors in the gallery sparkle and the high ceilings provide spacious comfort. The combination of savory and sweet spices is captivating. The India Gate stands proud as a memorial to past soldiers of the British Indian Army that fought in World War I. It was unveiled in 1931 and stands over 137 feet tall. In the fading daylight the stone edifice glitters like gold and welcomes you to India.

dayInfo.title: Delhi - A Regal Exploration
dayInfo.description: The modern streets of Delhi burst with life. The Rajpath fills with people venturing to work. The spacious tree-lined boulevard runs from India Gate to the Presidential Palace and looks like it has its own private procession in the morning hours. The aroma of fresh brewed chai masala is enamoring and fills the streets with cinnamon and allspice. Soon your guide arrives at your hotel. You are ready to step out into the city. Jama Masjid is the largest mosque in India and was completed in 1424. Thirty-nine steps elegantly lead upwards to the eastern gate. The scent of grilled Seekh kebabs emanates from Karim’s. Two minarets stand around 130 feet tall, each one constructed with a mixture of white marble and red sandstone. The entire complex glows a rustic red from the specific materials used to create the grand mosque. Even in the grand opulence of the historic walls, courtyard, and gallery there is an intimacy that lets you appreciate the people, the culture, and the beautiful hymns of the call to prayer.

dayInfo.title: Agra - Past Mystique
dayInfo.description: Breakfast is filled with the tart and sweet flavors of fresh fruit, from mango to bananas. Sip on your sweet and spiced tea before meeting your private transfer. In the afternoon you will arrive in Agra home to the legendary Taj Mahal, an iconic landmark of India. The complex was constructed in the 17th century in homage to Shah Jahan’s third wife. It was the first Moghul structure to be constructed entirely of white marble. When you enter the gardens you understand the words of the poet Rabindranath Tagore when he said the Taj Mahal was “a teardrop on the face of eternity.” The gardens are manicured and pure. The scent of pine and budding flowers is prevalent. The reflective pool almost points the way to the mausoleum. The marble captures the light and changes colors throughout the day. The sun casts a pink shadow over the site when sunset nears. The four minarets are 130 feet tall and add to the overall symmetry of the mausoleum’s design. The dome has remarkably rounded angles and stands 115 feet tall at its peak. The design is both elegant and staggering. Semi-precious stones decorate the interior gallery and catch the light that beams through the window. The stones inlaid into the walls create designs of flower petals and vines, which add to the captivating lavishness. In the evening you will arrive at the fabulous Oberoi Amarvilas and find a panorama of the Taj Mahal shimmering beneath the starlight.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur - White Marble to Pink Sandstone
dayInfo.description: The dawn brings an uproarious grace to the already ethereal Taj Mahal. Witness the shifting colors of the white marble at sunrise when the edifice shifts from a subtle blue to a bright purple, and eventually back to immaculate white. After breakfast you will head to Jaipur, also referred to as the Pink City. The old city was constructed in the 18th century in accordance with Hindu principles that adhere to symmetry and geometry. The main boulevards are wide and long. Rickshaws are painted vibrant yellows and greens. Camels trot alongside the boulevard pulling carts behind them. Near the Badi Chaupar , the big square, you can find the Johari Bazaar. The narrow lanes wind away from the main plaza and are filled with lavish gold and silver jewelry. Bangles are stacked on tables and dangle from the ceiling. Translucent curtains frame the stores. There is a little jangle from vendors trying to entice you into their stores. The vibrancy of Jaipur sweeps you up.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur - The Power of the Past
dayInfo.description: The Amer Fort continues to rise over the Maota Lake with a watchful gaze on the nearby Pink City. You will have a private transfer to the foothills where the fort resides. You will climb aboard an elephant and traverse the nearby Aravali Forest located outside of Jaipur. There are 500 miles of ancient trees and protected wildlife. You feel safe and comfortable in the howdah , the compartment that sits atop the elephant. You notice the ease with which the pachyderm moves. Each step is a gentle and calculated sway. Tree branches brush past you and the scent of evergreen and bark is crisp. After a picnic breakfast you will proceed to the Amer Fort. The pathway leading to the entrance gate is long and winding. The fort was constructed in the 16th century and the impressive edifice is filled with exuberant décor. Four separate sections offer distinct gateways, courtyards, and residences. The Ganesh Pol glistens in the morning light. You can see the elegant artistry that decorates the façade. Each fresco has a golden fringe and the latticed windows give a touch of modesty to the opulent geometric embellishment. The windows were originally meant for the women of the palace from which they would watch the daily processions from behind the woven window in order to preserve their modesty.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur - The Vibrant Pink Walls
dayInfo.description: The Pink Palace is the iconic image of the city. The Mughal buildings were painted pink during the 19th century royal visit by Prince Albert. The city continues to shine with its famed coloration, no more so than on the magnificent façade of the City Palace. The complex was constructed in the 18th century. The entrance contains elements of a Mughal archway bordered by thin and regal pillars that give way to rounded embellishments. Two regal elephant statues guard the cobblestone walkway. You immediately feel the presence of the Chandra Mahal. Its presence is commanding. It stands seven stories tall and continues to be the residence of the royal descendants of Jaipur’s former rulers. The inner courtyard contains the exceptional Peacock Gate, known for the elaborate colors and motifs that decorate the doorway. The stately ambiance is palpable and the historic grandeur of the city is brought to the forefront.

dayInfo.title: Shahpura - Stately Estates
dayInfo.description: The camels once again trot down the main boulevard. The bazaars fill with people searching for fresh produce and textiles. After breakfast your private guide takes you to the rural walled town of Shahpura. You settle in to your gorgeous estate hotel that encompasses nearly 45 acres of land. It was once used as a summer palace. The gardens are bright with blossoming flowers. The pasture is verdant and comforting. Peepal trees produce figs and large dangling leaves. The scent of fresh mango is intoxicating. A couple sits on the serene lake. Towering palms and precious quiet surround them. Enjoy a cooking course on the terrace that overlooks the landscape. Your private chef shows you each ingredient and its historical value to Shahpura. The spices are aromatic. Indulge in the traditional flavors of lapsi , where the coconut and cardamom add unique vivaciousness to the wheat-based dish.

dayInfo.title: Shahpura - No Small History
dayInfo.description: The morning is filled with birdcalls, from herons to kingfishers. You can hear their chirps and chortles soaring over the nearby lakes. After breakfast you will venture into the surrounding towns to visit the local farms and craftsman. He gently creates a phad , a painting that traditionally signifies folk or religious lore. The town was settled in the 17th century and is a respite from the endless energetic cities. Dhikhola Fort stands atop the lush hillside in the distance. The strong stone towers resemble those in the British Highlands more than the colorful pink walls of Jaipur’s City Palace. Local women walk to and from the farm. Some carry large clay pots on their heads. The vessels are filled with the fruits of their crops or with water. Their saris are wrapped comfortably around their shoulders and head in a tradition of modesty, but also as a shield from the sun. You see the heron gliding over the water. Their beaks are sharp and pointed. Their plumage is a collection of tan and rich brown. You are not only witnessing the everyday life of Rajasthan but experiencing it.

dayInfo.title: Chhatra Sagar - The Noble Countryside
dayInfo.description: In the morning light you can see the outline of Dhikhola Fort sitting atop the hillside. After breakfast you depart from the village and make your way deeper into the countryside. The reservoir was completed in the 19th century and the resulting collection of water turned the arid landscape fertile and verdant. When you come over the horizon you can see the oasis shining like an inviting beacon. Your accommodation is a gathering of private luxury tents that are fit for kings with floors that are individually painted with elaborate henna designs. The beds are plush and comfortable. You have your own private veranda that looks out over the gentle rippling water. A flock of geese meanders on the reservoir’s surface. Chilies and wheat are aromatic along the surrounding landscape. Goats bleat and are herded by a local shepherd. He wears a tightly wound red turban and sports a fantastic twirling mustache. The remains of the 9th century temple of Magar Mandi Mata are close by. The temple was destroyed by the Mughals and eventually covered by the sands of time.

dayInfo.title: Osian - A Golden Landscape
dayInfo.description: The oasis drifts into the distance and you watch the fertile greenery fade into a stretch of golden Thar Desert. Your camp in Osian is a different type of oasis that takes you back into history. You will spend the day exploring the wavy sand dunes and discovering the elegance of the desert by camelback. The village of Osian is known as a bastion of history and Rajasthani culture. Sachiya Mata Temple was constructed in the 9th century and is referenced in ancient Jain records. The sandstone shines a rustic red under the desert sun. The stupas are textured and rotund like beehives. Pillars are decorated with exceptional carvings that represent deities and legends. The temple is ancient but has a particular vibration that remains strong. When you come to the camp you find it nestled in the dunes. The sand ripples over the hills like waves. You can sit beneath the night sky with an exquisite drink and try to count the stars.

dayInfo.title: Jodhpur - An Imperial Blue
dayInfo.description: The desert is gold and stretches along the horizon like an endless treasure. Breakfast comes and goes in the comforts of the elegant campsite. The evening was quiet and perfect beneath the unencumbered starlight. After your meal you have a private transfer to Jodhpur, also known as the Blue City. The buildings in the old quarter are awash with indigo and color the city like an ocean beneath the shadow of the impenetrable Mehrangarh Fort. The complex is over 400 feet above the city and is known for its imposing thick walls. The foundation was laid in the 15th century and now offers exceptional views of the valley in the distance. Kilkila cannon is wonderfully preserved and sits on the ramparts in its ancient position, on watch over the fort. The Pearl Palace is a fabulous display of regal splendor and preservation. The stained glass windows bring a gathering of colors that spread across the soft red carpet. The archways are rigged and refined. The ceiling is gilded and symmetrical. From the color of the city to the decorating hues of the various palaces set inside the fortress walls, you will quickly find historic stature and grace.

dayInfo.title: Delhi - A New Noble Return
dayInfo.description: The morning streets in the old city are animated. Ghanta Ghar, the old clock tower, rises like a temple stupa and almost marks the entrance to the Sadar Market. Stroll through the old bazaar and experience the captivating aromas that have continued since the ancient spice trade. Fragrant vanilla and herbaceous anise, the gentle spice of cinnamon, and the colorful yellow of turmeric are all on display at MV Spices. In the afternoon you will have a private transfer to the airport and return to Delhi for the evening. The memorable luxuries of the Imperial welcome you back. The city is once again in filled with palpable energy. Venture to the Lodi Gardens where you can sit on the grass in the tranquil atmosphere and watch the locals stroll on the pathways.

dayInfo.title: Delhi - A Finishing Touch
dayInfo.description: The streets are active and the colors of the city wind through the ancient and contemporary neighborhoods but the morning feels calm and cool.
