At breakfast you sip your chai and savor the flavor. Saris wave as women walk down the street. You have witnessed paradises and palaces, forts and gardens during your time in India. You not only saw royal luxuries but also experienced them, from your accommodation to your meals. After breakfast you will have a private transfer to the airport where you will step aboard your flight home.

tourName: Nepal and India for Seniors Itinerary
placesVisited: Kathmandu, Thamel, Patan, Chitwan National Park, Lumbini, Varanasi, Orchha, Fatehpur Sikri, Jaipur, Delhi, Jhansi, Agra
generalInfo: The slower the travel the more you see. Take this mantra with you through Nepal and India on a one-way journey that connects lands of sublime history and spiritual present. Regal palaces, epic mountains, sunset ceremonies, and jungle safaris will be just the start of your time in Nepal. Then, memoirs of the Mughal Empire, hot air ballooning, Buddha’s birthplace and more will be a few of the highlight of India. Tailored for senior travelers, this leisurely journey will take you through a stunning selection of highlights to the best of Nepal and India on one vacation. Click here for additional traveling in Nepal ideas that are available on Zicasso.

dayInfo.title: Kathmandu – A Gentle Welcome to a Spiritual Land
dayInfo.description: When you touch down in Kathmandu, you’ll take your first look at the mountains. Nothing is straight or flat in the Himalayas, and as you look to the horizon, the mountains seem to extend ceaselessly. They will provide the backdrop for your time in Nepal, omnipresent as you tour a city that brims with pride and passion. Locals enter small temples, colorful saris dominate side streets, and there’s a sense that Kathmandu marches to the beat of its own drum. You’ll be greeted at the airport and transferred to a boutique hotel just outside the city, with a stunning view of Mt. Everest shining at sunset.

dayInfo.title: Kathmandu – Buddhist Shrines, Monkey Temples and Holy History
dayInfo.description: On your first full day in Nepal, Buddha’s eyes will stare at you from the top of a temple. Locals burn incense and chant besides small stupas. Buddhist monks bring crimson robes to a temple loved by monkeys. Visit Swayambhunath to see the spectacular architecture and views before you enjoy all its subtleties, from Hindu holy men to stupas that bring Buddhism and Hinduism together. There will be a similar experience at Kathmandu Durbar Square, where the slower you walk, the more you enjoy, from the palace rooms and rebuilt 15th-century temples to the emotional locals and a living goddess that peeks from a balcony. There will be other potential destinations as well today, which you can take in on a private day tour of Kathmandu’s heart.

dayInfo.title: Kathmandu – Everest Helicopter Flight and a Quiet Afternoon at Boudhanath
dayInfo.description: Today, you will fly to Lukla and soar through the Himalayas in a helicopter, rising above glacier-carved valleys on route to Mt. Everest. Icy rivers twist through stark landscapes, and rows of ever-rising mountains flank everything. At first, you’ll look up to the snowline, but soon mountains fully clad in white will surround you, including a string of 8000-meter giants. Pass Mt. Lola and Mt. Lhotse on to Everest, which forms a stark triangle that seems unruly from the helicopter window. Then loop around and return through the Khumbu Valley where Mt. Ama Dablam is the highlight of this scenic helicopter flight. After you return to the capital, spend the afternoon at Boudhanath and watch the spirituality that engulfs a giant pagoda.

dayInfo.title: Chitwan National Park – Rhinos in the Jungle
dayInfo.description: From the lodge, you’ll glimpse Everest at sunrise, which comes out of the shadows as it is illuminated by bands of red and yellow. This morning, you’ll fly to Chitwan where you are greeted by other feats of nature. Rather than open panoramas, you will be inspired by the smell and sound of the dense jungle that is full of echoed calls and a striking atmosphere. Rhinos will be your neighbors and you’ll see one wander past before another bashfully retreats into the trees. Elephants hoot as they announce their coming, a mother and calf on route to the Rapti River below. This World Heritage Site showcases nature untamed and this first day is just an introduction to the safari experience.

dayInfo.title: Chitwan National Park – Immersive Safari Including Canoe and Jeep Activities
dayInfo.description: A Chitwan safari is all about the different angles and you will have plenty of time to try it all. Canoe safaris will be slow and gentle as you paddle silently along the river to beautiful close-ups of rare animals. Jeep safaris create adventure where you will bump along muddy trails mostly in search of Chitwan’s rarest resident, the royal Bengal tiger. Walking safaris will take you even closer to offer an intimate understanding of the jungle’s inner workings, especially when you follow the spoor of a rhino or elephant. These three activities will be combined with jungle picnics, sunset cruises, and visits to conservation centers, where you discover how different species are blossoming in the park. Like Kathmandu you could spend a day in Chitwan and get a good impression of the area but to really enjoy this Nepalese highlight you must spend more time and go deeper into the jungle.

dayInfo.title: Lumbini – A Day at the Birthplace of Buddha
dayInfo.description: The next day, a moving atmosphere will confront you in Lumbini, where the outpourings of emotion are sometimes too much to take in. This small border town marks the birthplace of Buddha and a cycle rickshaw is a good way to get around. From an elevated vantage point, you pass serenely through streets of temples and spirituality with barefooted monks all around. This is one of Buddhism’s four pilgrimage sites, and you’ll slowly gain a sense of the religion, through the local guide and the scenes you witness. Stop at the sublime Ashoka Pillars to view the spot where Buddha was born, then spend the evening on your own as you take your own slow footsteps through Lumbini.

dayInfo.title: Varanasi – Opening the Senses to India’s Holiest City
dayInfo.description: The following morning, you’ll cross the border and drive south through India, a relatively long journey that offers a whole cascade of new impressions. Mud-brick buildings, flowing saris, vibrantly designed temples, clouds of dust, spluttering rickshaws, lanes of street food and so much more through the sanctity of your window. When you arrive in Varanasi, it will be a sensory overload as the narrow pedestrianized streets are packed with harmonic sounds, peculiar smells, living histories and an atmosphere that seems both ineffable and ephemeral. Enjoy taking in the sites at a slow pace before you return to the hotel rooftop to relax. Like each day in India, you’ll be led by an expert guide, who shows you the destination through local eyes.

dayInfo.title: Varanasi – Sunrise Boat Ride, Burning Ghats and Sunset Ceremonies
dayInfo.description: In the next few days, you’ll discover that Varanasi rewards slow travel. Approximately 3000 years of history emanates from the haphazard walls, attracting devotees to an overflowing excess of temples and shrines. Narrow alleyways are lined with temple deities and mysterious archways while lumbering cows stop and sleep, requiring the street food carts to choose a different route. Incense flumes greet you on corners while funeral processions carry bodies on bamboo stretchers. Monkeys live on the rooftops while tiny food stalls send their smells through the narrowest of lanes and children fly kites over the Ganges. You will have a local guide who accompanies you everywhere in Varanasi, something that will be highly valuable while navigating the fascinating maze of the pedestrianized Old City. During your stay, your guide will plan a flexible itinerary that does not rush you through the attractions. One of the essentials will be a sunrise boat ride on the Ganges, some time spent at the holy burning ghat, and a candlelit sunset ceremony at the river. For many, this city reflects the magic of India, right down to the flower markets and confusing rituals.

dayInfo.title: Orchha – Palaces and Proud Memoirs to India’s Rich Past
dayInfo.description: Once you arrive in Orchha, you’ll be amazed to think you’re in the same country. Standing on the banks of the Betwa River, Orchha is a regal town from the 16th-century, remarkably untouched since the Bundelas clan ruled the region. An abundance of old temples fill the town’s center, each seemingly more elaborate than the last. Small palaces showcase an otherworldly opulence, with Orchha Palace the grand dame of forgotten Mughal architecture. You can travel anywhere by foot, giving you plenty of time during your visit to be immersed in the 16th-century Indian backwater city.

dayInfo.title: Agra – Beyond the Taj Mahal
dayInfo.description: This morning, you’ll cross India to Agra, stopping first in Jhansi for a gourmet lunch then onwards on the train to the city of the Mughal Empire’s excesses. Traveling by train is an iconic Indian experience, and this route is air-conditioned and first class, giving you quiet time to absorb the rural impressions through the window. When you arrive in Agra, you will not immediately visit the Taj Mahal. Instead, you’ll take time to explore the region’s equally impressive but less recognized attractions. Begin with part-fortress and part-palace, Agra Fort, a sandstone giant that glistens deep crimson in the fading afternoon light. All over Agra you’ll find sublime examples of Mughal architecture, many of them overlooked by tourists. Explore them with a guide and you’ll also get to know the architectural building blocks that gave rise to the Mughal ode to love.

dayInfo.title: Agra – Sunrise at the Taj Mahal and More Beautiful Mughal Remainders
dayInfo.description: In the morning, all will be still in the courtyard. Slowly the marble emerges from the sun’s shadow and at first it glistens red before the color softens and light dances transiently across the domes. Walk past the pools and get a little closer, admiring the sharpness of the Taj Mahal’s form. Calligraphic messages wrap around the monument, and they beckon you inside, where the architectural opulence comes as a surprise. Almost everyone has seen photos of the Taj Mahal, but few have considered consider how beautiful it must be on the inside. Take your time and enjoy the morning around this pre-eminent Mughal monument, before the afternoon takes you off the beaten path, with Persian mosques and Akbar’s Mausoleum among the highlights.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – Living the History in India
dayInfo.description: Agra has evolved, a modern city growing around an ancient capital. In comparison, Fatehpur Sikri has hardly changed. This city was the Mughal capital for a fleeting few years in the 16th century, but the royal town was eventually abandoned and left to the desert dust. Even today it feels like a ghost town, a showcase of architectural might that almost looks out of place. Persian and Hindu styles merge together and the more you walk around, the more you’ll get to discover. From here you continue across the ochre plains of Rajasthan to arrive in the Pink City for an afternoon in the markets. After the 16th-century you’re now in a city that brings history into today, which is exemplified by bazaars of cramped stalls and enigmatic smiles.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – Hot Air Ballooning Above the Pink City
dayInfo.description: With its domes and forts, Jaipur is the perfect city to view from the air. Today, you’ll rise in a hot air balloon and cruise serenely above the monuments, perhaps spotting a procession of elephants down below. A desert landscape surrounds Jaipur that glows red and orange to complement the pink city hues. Once you touch down, you’ll enjoy the first day of exploration. Like all your Indian destinations the focus is on flexible touring with a private guide, tailored to your interests and your energy levels. So today could bring a whole host of sights, or it may be a day to escape the city crowds and recharge at your luxury hotel.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – Forts, Observatories and More Royal Legacies
dayInfo.description: The following day’s highlight will be riding a painted elephant up to Amber Fort. You’ll be dazzled by the peculiarity at The Hall of Mirrors (Sheesh Mahal). Then, explore the extravagance on show at The City Palace, where each stately room is more ostentatious than the last. Discover bazaars full of jewelry and textiles then appreciate the silence of Jantar Mantar Observatory. Go to watch a Bollywood movie in the cinema then take a stroll through streets laden with sizzling local food. Jaipur’s main attractions usually require two days, but there’s no set itinerary in a city that mixes architectural wonder with welcoming local culture.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – The Best of Old and New Delhi
dayInfo.description: Your final days in India will be spent in Delhi, the bustling capital city that embodies India’s dynamic culture. Ride the modern metro system then take a cycle rickshaw down Chandni Chowk, the city’s oldest lane. Then, gaze up at what was once the world’s tallest building in the 11th century before you sit around a communal kitchen table at a cooking class. Wander through the immense colonial remains of Red Fort before a feeling of spirituality accompanies a visit to Humayun’s Tomb. Finally head into the new part of Delhi, a cosmopolitan almost-Western city that shows the changing side to India. Old and new, adventure and relaxation, Delhi has more to offer than the initial impression of crowds and chaos. In many ways it’s the microcosm of India, a fitting place to end your time in the region.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Departure
dayInfo.description: Today you’ll leave India with three weeks worth of memories, including all those little moments that only slow travel can afford.

tourName: Northern India Family Discovery Tour
placesVisited: Delhi, Agra, Ranthambore, Jaipur, Nawalgarh, Alsisar
generalInfo: Alluring mansions and charismatic ruins bring to light enchanting splendor during your customizable 12-day family tour to Northern India. Your family will have an immersive experience wandering through the elaborate halls of Mughal emperors and observing the sky at a preserved observatory. Discover an old fort that fades beneath jungle vines, where macaques and tigers roam, and witness the treasured colors of the Taj Mahal at sunrise, inspiring a lasting connection with India’s remarkable heritage.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Have the Day at your Leisure
dayInfo.description: Your flight will land at Indira Gandhi International Airport, where your private transfer will greet your family and escort you to your luxurious accommodation in the heart of the city. The remainder of the day will be at your leisure to discover the treasures of Delhi, and its captivating rhythm may lead you to the intricate Lotus Temple to view the magnificent Bahai House of Worship. You can also venture to the Khari Baoli, which is the largest wholesale spice market in Asia.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – The Charm and History of Delhi
dayInfo.description: Your guide will meet your family in the lobby after breakfast for an exciting tour of Delhi’s monuments, such as the Red Fort and Humayun’s Tomb. Jama Masjid is one of the largest mosques in India and boasts foundations that date back to the 17th century. Your family will marvel at the two massive minarets that shine with red sandstone and white marble, shaping alternative vertical stripes along the facades. You can also venture to the top of the minarets for an incredible panorama of the city. At the 12th-century minaret of Qutub Minar, your family can stand beneath the tallest minaret in India, which stands nearly 230 feet tall.

dayInfo.title: Agra – View Royal Tombs and Architecture
dayInfo.description: This morning, your private transfer will escort your family from Delhi to Agra, where you will be greeted with the aromas of fried and mashed potatoes known as Bhalla . After having time to relax at your hotel, your guide will lead your family on a fascinating tour of the city, introducing you to the remarkable aesthetic of the past and beginning with the Itmad-ud-Daula’s Tomb. Your guide will lead you through the marvelous grounds and manicured gardens to find the first examples of pietra dura, where inlays of semiprecious stones create elaborate flora designs etched into the marble walls.

dayInfo.title: Ranthambore – The Taj Mahal and Fatehpur Sikri
dayInfo.description: Before sunrise, your guide will meet your family in the hotel lobby to embark on a spectacular tour of the Taj Mahal, which is of the New Seven Wonders of the World. The foundation dates back to the 17th century. As the sun rises over the city, your family will notice the colors of the facade shifting from white to pink. Outside of Agra, your private transfer will escort you to the antique city of Fatehpur Sikri, which is the former capital of the Mughal Empire. The fortified walls date back to the 16th century and shine with red sandstone, capturing this masterpiece of Indo-Islamic design.

dayInfo.title: Ranthambore – In Search of Ruins and Wildlife
dayInfo.description: Ranthambore offers a remarkable and unique blend of history that is embodied in the ruins of the 10th-century fortress along the Vindhya Plateau. During your time here, your family will discover gorgeous water lilies and lotuses that float along the ponds. You can stop at Ranthambore Fort to stroll along the ancient ruins that have been overtaken by the jungle. The views will provide you with a spectacular panorama of the woodlands, where you can spot serpents, eagles, and vultures. The sounds of wild macaques will echo among the trees as you search for the majestic Bengal tiger.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – Discover Chand Baori
dayInfo.description: Before reaching the remarkable Pink City of Jaipur, your family will travel to the 10th-century wells of Chand Baori. The oldest elements of the structure date back to the 8th century, and elegant colonnades and arcades were added in the 18th century under Mughal rule. You can peer below to view the traditional mansion pavilion with intricate lattice windows, where aristocratic families would rest in the comfort of the cooler temperature. After your private introduction to the marvels of the elaborate geometric design, your private transfer will lead your family to the heart of Jaipur, where the aromas of mirchi vadas will drift through the narrow streets.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – Traverse the Observatory and City Palace
dayInfo.description: Your family tour of Jaipur will begin at Jantar Mantar, which is the preserved observatory that was built nearly 300 years ago. Your guide will direct you to the Samrat Yantra, which reaches more than 88 feet tall and casts a shadow that is able to measure the exact time with a standard deviation of two seconds. The royal complex overtakes the heart of the Old City with three centuries of history being related to the Amber court. The large, guarded walls create the ambiance of a storybook structure, and it is here that the modern-day royal family continues to live.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – Amber Fortress and Johari Bazaar
dayInfo.description: The remarkable prestige of Amber Fort originates from the extensive palace complex that glows with hues of yellow and pink. Inside the Jai Mandir, your family will find exquisite embellishments in the form of glass inlaid panels that shimmer beneath the multi-mirrored ceilings. You will then continue to the vibrant aisles of Johari Bazaar, where the vibrant colors of intriguing silks will add to the rhythm of vendors who call to passersby. While semiprecious stones and silver tea make up a portion of the market, you can also explore the elaborate saris and quilts that fill the showrooms.

dayInfo.title: Nawalgarh – View the Beautiful Havelis
dayInfo.description: Upon reaching the charming town of Nawalgarh, your guide will meet your family in the lobby of your hotel. The scent of fresh fruits and vegetables will drift out of the 18th-century Bala Quila fort as you wander along the labyrinthine lanes of the city. The Aath Havelis represents a group of six mansions that illustrate the transition of painting styles throughout the decades. The front gallery possesses a steam locomotive, while images of elephants, horses, and camels adorn the back section of the mural. The Morarka Haveli Museum blends luster and charm in the courtyard to illustrate depictions of Shiva, Parvati, and Krishna.

dayInfo.title: Alsisar – Alsisar’s Palace and Legendary Artwork
dayInfo.description: Today, your family will be immersed in mythology upon your arrival in Alsisar. Here, you can find Persian, Jaipur, and Mughal influences emerging from the diverse schools of art. The distinctive style of the town captures the tradition of the region’s urbanization along the caravan route between Delhi and Jaipur. At Sone ki Dukaan, your family can visit the golden shop that was established in 1850. Here, the interior shimmers with elaborate plating and paintings that have been spread across the three vaulted ceilings to depict reincarnations of Vishnu and the life of Krishna.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Visit the Bazaars in Delhi
dayInfo.description: Your private transfer will escort you back to Delhi in the morning, where the aromas of tasty dumplings will fill the aisles of Kamla Nagar Market. After settling in to the comforts of your luxurious accommodation, your family can explore the vast bazaars of India’s capital city. The bazaar in which you will visit was established in the 17th century as part of the Mughal city and surrounds the walls of the Red Fort today. With more than 1,000 shops, your family can find the delicate flavors of local sweets and the aroma of leather as it fills small stores.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: The traditional ceremonial boulevard of Rajpath will fill with locals in the morning as they travel between the city landmarks that connect Vijay Chowk and the India Gate. The significant design of the President’s Residence crowns the western edge of the boulevard and reflects an engaging mixture of Mughal and European decoration. As the scent of chai tea returns to the streets, your private transfer will transfer you to the airport for your flight home, bringing a close to your incredible family tour of Northern India.

tourName: Northern India Tour: Vibrant Cultures, Iconic Temples & Scenic Wildlife
placesVisited: Delhi, Jaipur, Agra, Khajuraho, Ranthambore National Park, Bandhavgarh National Park, Bharatpur Bird Sanctuary, Kanha National Park
generalInfo: The pink sandstone of historic palaces shimmers in the sunlight while tigers blend into the golden savannah grass. You can hear the calls of White Siberian cranes within the marshland as elephants parade along the lake’s shores. This is home to the maharajas and the Jungle Book , the captivating scent of cinnamon and anise from chai tea, and transcendent artwork of the Khajuraho temples. Find the illustrious bamboo forests and the prolific leopard, and the allure of the tiger is never far away on this custom tailored tour through India’s northern wild.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Opening Up
dayInfo.description: Arrive in the capital city of India, Delhi, where the history and the culture, food and temples combine into a collection of splendor. You are met at the airport and taken to your hotel by a private transfer. The colors of the city are inherent in the clothing as the sweet and spiced scent of frothy chai surrounds you. Once at your hotel the day is yours to explore Delhi’s streets and the inherent beauty that comes from the almost inescapable culture. Jama Masjid is the largest mosque in India, built in the 17th century and surrounded by multiple entrances that all lead to the apex of the main worshiping deck. The sandstone red brings a sunset color to the sky while bulbous domes accompany the thin minarets. The ambience is energetic and humble all at once, while the colors of the city continue to shimmer in the afternoon light, from the clothing to the architecture, the food to the sky.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – The Wild Wonders of Pink
dayInfo.description: The morning stretches out over the city as people begin to make their way into the streets, bringing back the palpable energy from the previous day. You awaken to the lovely aroma of the mixture of traditional Indian and Western fair that offers the lushness of bananas and kiwi, and the flaky texture of chapatti, a tasty flatbread, with the comfortable flavors of eggs accompanied by sweet jam. After breakfast you will make your way out of the city and along the road to Rajasthan. The desert landscape is impressive and seemingly endless, filled with remarkable open space and speckled with villages far away from the bustle of big cities. Soon you will be welcomed to Jaipur, the “Pink City,” known for the coloration of its buildings and the fabulous history that runs through the streets and is inherent in the city’s walls. In the evening you will visit the Lakshmi Narayan Temple where the white marble structure looks almost translucent beneath the evening sky. Three domes rise above the temple, each one larger than the last. The external columns are ingrained with the decorative carvings that bless the grounds, from western saints to eastern sages, making the temple a place to enjoy the commonality of devotion and artistry housed within the tangible connection that locals and visitors have.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – A Day In Pink
dayInfo.description: Revel in the early morning scent of fresh chai, a combination of a sweet taste balanced with nutmeg, cinnamon, and fennel. Like Delhi, the energy of Jaipur is apparent immediately, from sunup to after sundown, ripe with the vibrancy that glows from the flowing saris and towering palaces. When you picture the city you come to the image of Hawa Mahal, the grand palace that almost looks like a large pink model of organ pipes, also giving the façade the name “Palace of Winds.” The marvelous color comes from the sandstone that lends the pink and red hues to the walls depending on the angle of the sun, and also gives Jaipur the name of its particular coloration. Built just before the 19th century in a style meant to imitate the crown of Krishna, the honeycomb texture houses 953 small latticed windows that were meant to allow cool air flow and, more importantly for the time, let women of the royal household view the street processions without being seen and risking their virtue. Traveling along the walls of the interior takes you to a wild world, one that seems so different but always close at hand, viewed in the romance of movies and books that have captured the imagination of millions worldwide. The courtyard carries the same hue as the façade, where a large square is sunken, perforated by a protruding platform surrounded by water. You can stand at the center of the palace, look out over the courtyard and even in the eternal bustle of the city, feel the peaceful nature for which the yard was originally constructed.

dayInfo.title: Ranthambore – The Wild Calls of India
dayInfo.description: India boasts an incredible mixture of wildlife from its unique position between the Far Eastern jungles and the Middle Eastern deserts, creating a unique habitat that can be found within the protected walls of Sawai Madhopur. After breakfast you will depart from Jaipur and make your way into the new city that is scented with its famous fruit, the guava. When you travel through the gate that separates the city from Ranthambhore National Park, the trees bend over the road and welcome you into the jungle. What was once a private hunting ground for the Maharaja of Jaipur is now an almost 830 square-mile park brimming with unique and magnificent wildlife. Along the hill that overlooks the forest, almost covered in brush, is the Ranthambhore Fortress, constructed in the 10th century and climbing around 700 feet above the plain. Tumbling tree roots have taken over many of the walls while the interior is scented with ancient stone and lively brush, surrounded by cupolas and flamboyant arched colonnades.

dayInfo.title: Ranthambore – Tigers and Crocodiles
dayInfo.description: The morning calls of monkeys slip through the trees and out of the park bringing you to excited anticipation knowing that soon you will be gliding through Ranthambhore National Park witnessing the majestic wilds that have traipsed through the continent since beginning of legends. The air is warm beneath the canopy as your vehicle trundles over rocky, unpaved terrain. Within the canopy you can see monkeys sprinting across the branches, some screaming, others following, their tails lifted and curled. Your guide points out the shores of Lake Mansarovar, where crocodiles bask in the sun, their mouths open in a display of power and defense. When the trees become silent, absent of birds and monkeys, your guide stops the vehicle and scans the horizon in search of what made the trees quiet. He points into the close distance, at the side of the road ahead just beneath the tall, swaying grass. You spot the golden coloration of the coat, streaked with black stripes and a white face that almost blends into the plain. You’re witnessing a tiger in its natural habitat, the grace and nonchalance of its nature as it parades through, keenly aware of your presence but indifferent, as it strolls across the road and disappears back into the brush.

dayInfo.title: Bharatpur – Flying High
dayInfo.description: From the sights and sounds of tigers to the grand wingspan of White Siberian cranes, today you will depart from the Ranthambhore National Park and find yourself in the diverse ecosystem of wetlands and savannah that make up the Bharatpur Bird Sanctuary. The world you have entered sings with birdcalls, from elegant chirps to vibrating squawks. Birds linger and perch, often soaring through the air where you can witness their graceful flight and the crane’s wingspan of over 87 inches. Their snow-colored feathers pronounce their long slender beaks that tend to shimmer pink and red. Whether viewing the bird flocks peck and polish around the swamp or watching the black and red colors of the Indian Saras Crane, the graceful display of the open savannah brings a soft side to the wilds of Northern India.

dayInfo.title: Agra – Imperial Ghosts
dayInfo.description: The morning is lively with tweets and chirps rising with the sun, agreeing with the old adage, “the early bird gets the worm.” You will soon rise with them to the luscious scent of breakfast before watching the marshes shift from grasslands to the ruins of the imperial “Ghost City,” known as Fatehpur Sikri. Founded in the 16th century as the capital of the Mughal Empire, the sandstone buildings offer shimmering red beneath the crescent blue sky, where both mirror the other’s emptiness. Each building, from the palace to the mosque was constructed with Persian principles but with Indian aggrandizements. The grandeur of the abandoned city is both beautiful and peculiar, with great cupolas and intricate pillars, and continuous manicured gardens within the palace. The over 162 feet high entrance gate is as welcoming as it is imposing, with a Moorish arch and domes making the red and off-white color stand out like clouds at sunset. In the late afternoon you will arrive in Agra, a city known for its industry but famous for its architecture. As the sun begins to set you will come to one of the Seven Wonders of the World, the Taj Mahal. The radiant white marble of the structure captures the colors of the sun that spread across the sky turning the lavish pearl into an ever-changing rainbow. Constructed in the 17th century as a mausoleum for Mughal emperor Shah Jahan’s third wife, it has become one of the most well-known and treasured buildings in the world. Within the strident colors you can see the detailed inscriptions that line the exterior and interior, beneath the domes and within the minarets. The garden affront the structure is lined with scented bushes and fountains that guide the way to the open tomb. In the glint of sunset that soon becomes filled with the wild moon, to call the moment breathtaking would not be an overstatement.

dayInfo.title: Khajuraho – Onward and Upward
dayInfo.description: The early morning of Agra is brushed with quiet as you imagine the colors of the Taj Mahal in the distant rising light. After breakfast you will come to the train station to board the comforts of a first class ticket that will take you onward towards Jhansi. You can see the dark red fortress climbing over the city with tiered walls, dating back to the 17th century and which now houses a museum. Upon your arrival in Jhansi you will be met by a private transfer and carried further afield to the Khajuraho, where remarkable reliefs and statues display the treasured history of past kingdoms. In the evening you will find the luxuries of your accommodation soothing within the succulent aromas of dinner.

dayInfo.title: Bandhavgarh – Within the Eager Temples
dayInfo.description: Khajuraho is a small town surrounded with the majesty of history, drawing in locals and visitors from near and far interested in the vibrant and spiraling past found within the collection of monuments. The combination of Indian philosophy and aesthetics created a series of temples in the 9th and 10th centuries set along the open space surrounded by forests. The excited atmosphere surrounds the temples that are separated into four groupings based upon their direction in a clockwise formation. Surrounding the temples is exquisite stonework that shows a storyboard of life displaying gods, warriors, and mythological animals from ages long ago. The carvings of Varaha shows Vishnu’s boar incarnation in an over four-foot high sandstone boar. The rising, detailed chedis of the temples are only half of the reverence for which the ruins are known, while the Kama Sutra carvings tout a legacy of artistry, ancient intrigue, and account for 10 percent of the overall artwork along the monuments wrapping around the outer and inner temple walls. In the later markings of the day you will leave the Chandela architecture behind and enjoy the evening in Bandhavgarh, home to Bandhavgarh National Park.

dayInfo.title: Bandhavgarh – Where White Tigers Roamed
dayInfo.description: The day drapes over the Bandhavgarh National Park and you are out exploring its expansive wilds before the scent of chai washes through the streets of town. The park is host to the highest density of tigers in India, along with housing over 40 leopards, the most prolific big cat who can be found hiding within the trees, their limbs and tails often mistaken as part of the canopy. A white and sandstone fortress rises over 2,400 hundred feet above the park, perched over the trees giving home to various birds, such as the vultures and swift flying crag martins. Within the large grassland Bengal tigers perch and purr as elephants meander through the trees, breaking apart branches and marking their trails. When the cool morning and evening air is taken over with afternoon heat, the tigers bask in the shade of the canopy letting the breeze comb over their colorful fur.

dayInfo.title: Kanha – Into the Jungle (Book)
dayInfo.description: The road to Kanha is vast, brimming with villages and people that give way to pockets of emptiness that show how beautifully desolate the landscape can be. Arrive in Kanha in the later afternoon and you will be ready to venture into the National Park that gave birth to Rudyard Kipling’s Jungle Book . Your journey takes you deep into the bamboo forest where the scent and firm texture of the unbreakable wood is pristine within the sprouting greenery. You can see deer and the odd guar, an Indian bison, rummaging through the meadows.

dayInfo.title: Kanha – Turning the Pages
dayInfo.description: Today you will spend your time roaming through the trees on a significant safari experience within the jungle reaches of Kanha, once more finding yourself in the depths of the bamboo jungle and around the fringes of the lavish meadows in search of wildlife that only gets more exciting every time you experience a sighting. The creation of the reserve dates back to the 1970s, and continues to be one of the most well kept and safest parks for the local fauna. You can see the blossoming purples and pinks of local flowers accentuating the possessive leaves. A Bengal tiger marches before you, regal and strong, the largest feline in the big cat family. It walks proud and unassuming, unworried but focused. You heart skips a beat as it strolls past. You want to follow into the trees and continue to watch its beautiful coat rise and fall with every breath. Soon your guide moves you along and you return to your accommodation with the fluttering of butterflies a reminder of the brushing grass.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – City Streets and Monuments
dayInfo.description: The wild scents of bamboo and savanna lend themselves to the famous orange citrus of Nagpur, stretched along the magnificent buildings and mansions that date back to the principality’s Raj. You will find yourself at the airport and soon returning to the city where it all began, Delhi. The wide, bustling streets are exactly as you remember them, bringing you from the diverse natural landscape of the nature reserves to the diverse monuments of the cityscape. The far-reaching aromas of wild greenery have been replaced by the familiar and intoxicating scent of butter chicken. You make yourself comfortable in your lavish accommodations and allow yourself to relax within the shades of your room as the tiger had within the shade of the canopy.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Round the Roads
dayInfo.description: Your final breakfast in India is a pearl of a moment, where you let yourself soak in the aromatics of your chai, knowing that the tea at home will never come close to the relative sweet and spiced flavors that you have tasted while here. After breakfast you will have a guided tour of the city, meandering through the monuments and roads that mark the tremendous history ranging from military conquests to religious equality, from the Qutub Minar victory tower, to the Jamas Masjid. The Chandni Chowk, the local bazaar filled with remarkable goods, will offer another look into the culture and colors of India and the city. Stepping along the dense market brings the brightness of the clothing and the collection of jewelry shops, dangling and jingling with silver bracelets and earrings all sparkling in the apparent sunlight. The scent of vigorous spices that range the same colors as the clothing offer enticement, while the bangles and necklaces show delight. In the evening you will have a private transfer to the airport where you will board your plane and fly home. Consider adding on or further customizing this trip. Browse the reviews for India travel agents for ideas and traveler reviews.

tourName: One-Week Highlights of India Tour: Delhi, Agra, Jaipur
placesVisited: Agra, Jaipur, Fatehpur Sikri, Delhi
generalInfo: The wonders of the Golden Triangle will capture your imagination during this one-week highlights tour of India. This adventure immerses you in the cultural charms and majestic history of India. Experience the country’s authentic heritage and preserved beauty with private tours from specialist guides that emphasize the grandeur of the past. Uncover layers of tradition and preserved majesty in iconic landmarks, such as the Taj Mahal, the Amber Fortress, the City Palace, and the Qutub Minar.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Arrival and Day at your Leisure
dayInfo.description: Your flight will land at Indira Gandhi International Airport, where your private transfer will greet you upon arrival and escort you to the heart of the fascinating city. You can relax in the comforts of your accommodation before discovering the marvels of the bustling streets at your own pace. The Qutub Minar dates back to the 12th century and soars above the surrounding contemporary park. In the evening, the aromas of the garlic, cardamom, and nutmeg will sweep through the streets.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – The Old and New City of Delhi
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will meet your guide in the lobby for a tour that will introduce you to the layers of history throughout the city. You will begin at the renowned Red Fort for a distinctive view of the Mughal power. Your guide will then lead you to the main entrance of the Lahore Gate. The Chhatta Chowk bazaar remains active inside the walls of the main fort. Merchants call out to passersby and offer images of silk, glinting gems, and stunning silverware. When you reach the Lotus Temple, you will find the unique image of a Bahai house of worship, which was designed to resemble a giant flower.

dayInfo.title: Agra – Private City Tour and Taj Mahal Visit
dayInfo.description: In the morning, your private transfer will meet you at your hotel after breakfast to escort you to the famous city of Agra. After touring the unique structures of Agra, your private guide will crown your discovery with a sunset tour of the Taj Mahal. The renowned Taj Mahal will glint with the shifting palette of the sunset along its white-marble exterior. The bulbous dome at the center of the tomb stands 180 feet tall and symbolizes the devotion between the emperor and his favorite wife. Inside the tomb, your guide will highlight the inlay of semi-precious stones and elegant calligraphy from the Koran.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – Fatehpur Sikri, Abhaneri, and Sand Dunes
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, your private transfer will meet you to escort you to the remarkable Fatehpur Sikri, which is the fortified city and former capital of the Mughal Empire in the 16th century. The entire city shines with red sandstone walls, and marble accents reflect an Indo-Islamic architectural masterpiece. You will continue to the distinctive site of Chand Baori, which offers 11 levels of intricate design that is tucked into a stepwell. A camel ride into the desert to view the sunset over the rolling sand dunes will bring an end to your day of discovery.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – The Famous Pink City of Jaipur
dayInfo.description: The Pink City of Jaipur will pulse with energy in the morning as merchants return to the marketplaces, camels pull carts of fresh produce, and vendors fill the streets with the mouthwatering aromas of chai masala. After meeting your guide, you will have a tour of the regal city, beginning with the City Palace at the heart of the Old City. The foundations of the sophisticated design date back three centuries. After traversing the marvelous history and heritage of Jaipur, your guide will lead you through the Johri Bazaar. Here, merchants display gold and silver that has been crafted into opulent designs, and vendors exhibit colorful saris made of pure silk.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Visit the Amber Fort
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, your guide will lead you to the entrance gate of the enchanting 16th-century Amber Fortress. The yellow sandstone shimmers like gold in the returning daylight. Your guide will lead you on an encompassing tour of the fortress’s four main courtyards. You will reach the marvelous design of the Jai Mandir, where glass panels create a whimsical ambiance that is accentuated by ceilings with multiple mirrors. After visiting Amber Fort, your private transfer will escort you back to the streets of Delhi, where you can relax in the comforts of your luxurious accommodation.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Departure
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the quiet landscape of the Lodi Garden takes on a tranquil reprieve from the vibrant streets of Delhi. The manicured park hosts Lodi-era tombs that date back to the 15th century. After breakfast, your private transfer will meet you at your hotel and escort you to Indira Gandhi International Airport for your flight home, concluding your remarkable highlights tour of India.

tourName: One-Week History and Food Tour of India
placesVisited: Mumbai, Aurangabad, Goa
generalInfo: Indulge in an immersive experience of cultural heritage and soul during this customizable 7-day India tour that features Mumbai, Goa, and Aurangabad. Uncover natural splendor on the shoreline as you dig your toes in golden sand and embody the prestige of the forest when you uncover a collection of ancient Buddhist cave temples. From Portuguese colonial architecture to a delicate blend of spices, you will sample the treasures of Central India and discover pure majesty.

dayInfo.title: Mumbai – Arrive in Mumbai with a Private Introduction to the City
dayInfo.description: The city of Mumbai pulses with activity at all hours of the day and acts as the gateway to India along the shores of the Arabian Sea. Furthermore, the city represents the deep contrasts of India, which are set between history and modernity. Grand colonial-era architecture decorates the historic neighborhoods of the city, while winding lanes lead to unique bazaars and hidden temples. Your private transfer will meet you at Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport upon your arrival to escort you to your luxurious accommodation at the heart of the city. After settling in to the comforts of your hotel, your guide will meet you in the lobby for a private tour of the city’s dynamic neighborhoods. The monument known as the Gateway to India was built in the early 20th century but represents the iconic style of 16th-century Gujarat. The basalt arch rises over Mumbai Harbour and remains a popular destination for people-watching as vendors sell fresh bhelpuri . The Taj Mahal Palace lines the waterway with a mixture of Islamic and Renaissance design and remains one of India’s most photographed monuments. The structure was built in 1903 and remains indelible to the city’s rich history.

dayInfo.title: Aurangabad – Discover the History of Aurangabad and Ellora Caves
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the aroma of spicy lentils and dried chickpeas will fill the streets of Mumbai and fade beneath the enticing spices of masala chai. When you are ready, your private transfer will meet you at your hotel and escort you to the airport for a brief flight to Aurangabad, which is the former home to the Mughal Emperor, Aurangzeb. After indulging in the luxuries of your hotel, your guide will lead you on a fascinating tour of the city’s layered history, beginning with the Bibi-ka-Maqbara. The four minarets and bulbous dome create a striking resemblance to the Taj Mahal but were crafted mainly from lime mortar and interspersed with marble adornments. You will then make your way to the Ellora Caves, which will offer insight into the early Buddhist architecture of India. The collection of 100 structures, which are etched into the hillside, dates back to the 6th or 7th century AD and is spread over a half-mile area. Thirty-four of the caves are open to the public, and Temple 16 possesses a life-size elephant statue within a complex that has been excavated to resemble a chariot and was dedicated to Lord Shiva.

dayInfo.title: Aurangabad – Traverse the Unique Contours of Ajanta
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will find the aromas of red mutton curry as it slowly cooks. After breakfast, your guide will escort you to the countryside and the remote river valley that hosts caves that were carved between the 2nd century BC and the 6th century AD. The scent of wet soil and herbaceous trees derives from the surrounding Deccan forest. Your guide will point out distinctive elements of the architecture as you arrive in the network of caves, where you will notice the facades that adorn the cliffs of the horseshoe-shaped gorge. You will enter the first cave to find gorgeous decorations that explain the Bodhisattva Padmapani, which is the interpretation that depicts the most iconic Ajanta artwork. The terrace leads to a congregation hall, where you will discover sculptures and murals that add a deeper perspective to the artwork by representing daily life and showing characters with active facial expressions. Colors across the murals remain vibrant and were crafted using local minerals. You will continue to other caves, including Cave 16, which possesses the most famous paintings of the complex.

dayInfo.title: Goa – Fly from Mumbai to Goa for a Culinary Tour of the Coastal City
dayInfo.description: The vibrant contrast of the traditional and contemporary worlds of India become tangible in Goa, where the golden sun and sand meet a mouthwatering blend of Indian and Portuguese spices. Your private transfer will escort you to the airport for your flight to Goa, where your driver will escort you to the luxuries of your centrally located hotel. Here, Portuguese colonial architecture dates back to the 16th century, and scuttling crabs make indentations of the sands of hidden coves. After you have settled in, you will meet your instructor for a private cooking lesson that will offer you insight into the layers of Goa’s unique flavors. Before your cooking course, you will begin your tour with a visit to the local market at Panjim City, where the aromas of dried fish and Goan spices fill the aisles. Vendors may offer samples of sweets amid vibrant flower displays and handcrafts, and your instructor will purchase ingredients for your cooking class, including seafood like crab and tiger prawns. During your instruction, you will learn how to create a traditional five-course meal using Goan flavors, which may result in dishes like crab xacuti , samarachi kodi , and the multi-layered cake known as bebinca , depending on what you purchase at the market.

dayInfo.title: Goa – Uncover the Secrets of Old Goa during a Private Tour
dayInfo.description: The historic streets of Goa reflect the era of Portuguese colonialism, and the city was once considered the Rome of the East due to its population size and architectural grandeur. Your guide will meet you at your hotel after breakfast to escort you to the heart of the old city, where the imposing churches and cathedrals retain their original luster. The Se Cathedral was built in the 16th century, and you can view the remaining tower houses, including the Golden Bell, which is the largest tower house in Asia. The Archeological Museum displays the history of Goa before the arrival of the Portuguese with artifacts that date back to ancient Hindu temples, including a collection of sati stones, which are markers that signify a spot where a widow flung herself onto her husband’s funeral pyre. You will then continue to a spice farm, where your guide will lead you through the spices that are grown in Goa, such as black pepper, cloves, cardamom, and tamarind, which all collectively share the history of trade and colonialism in the region.

dayInfo.title: Goa – Delight in a Free Day to Enjoy the Beauty around Goa
dayInfo.description: With the day at your leisure to explore Goa, you can dig your toes in the golden sand along the Arabian Sea or venture to the 12th-century Mahadeva Temple at Tambdi Surla. For another relaxing immersion into the history of Goa, you can visit the charming quarter of Fontainhas in Panjim. The Latin Quarter rises above the ancient Ourem Creek and edges the Altinho hills. The colorful colonial architecture shines with fluorescent and pastel facades, representing the 18th-century wealth of Portugal. The narrow-cobbled lanes will whisk you back in time as you marvel at the houses that have been painted green, yellow, and blue. Each is crowned by a set of red-colored tiled. Captivating cafes and bakeries divide the homes and fill the air with the aromas of freshly baked bread and masala chai. You can visit the 19th-century Chapel of St. Sebastian to find a pristine white façade that glints beneath the surrounding trees. In the evening, you can experience a traditional Tiatr , which is an authentic performance that involves six or seven acts of music, dance, satire, or comedy.

dayInfo.title: Mumbai – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: Every Friday, the Mapusa Market takes place and offers Goa a vibrant space for traders to showcase their wares from all over India, featuring delicious produce, vibrant spices, and captivating textiles. You can find the essence of Goa in the array of colors that stem from the vendors who arrive from surrounding villages or distant cities. Many visitors search for the famous pottery, jewelry, and carpets on display in the bazaar amid the aromas of seedless tamarind and marinated pork sausages. Your private transfer will meet you at your hotel after breakfast and a quick jaunt around the market to escort you to the airport for your flight back to Mumbai, where you will connect to your international flight.

tourName: One-Week India Family Tour: Nature, Culture, and Cities
placesVisited: Kochi (India), Kovalam, Alleppey, Periyar, Varkala
generalInfo: Make lasting memories among the tropical landscape of Kerala during your 7-day family highlights tour of India. This tour focuses on uncovering unique beauty, dramatic history, and preserved culture. Discover tranquil canals, colorful temples, wonderful wildlife, and crashing waves at India’s southernmost point. Specialist guides and excellent accommodations help make this family India tour an experience that brims with hidden treasures and memories.

dayInfo.title: Kochi – Introductory City Tour
dayInfo.description: Kochi embodies the unique point at which India connects to the surrounding world. Your flight will land at Cochin International Airport, where your private transfer will greet you upon your arrival. You will make your way to your accommodation at the heart of the city. After settling into the comforts of your accommodation, you can explore the marvelous city. The Paradesi Synagogue is located in the Mattancherry district and dates back to the 16th century.

dayInfo.title: Alleppey – Enjoy the Famous Canals
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the aromas of Cochin Masala Chai will drift through the streets and grace the air with fragrant black tea, ginger, cardamom, and cinnamon. Your private transfer will meet your family in the lobby after breakfast and escort you to the charming town of Alleppey. Here, you will find the fascinating backwaters of the Kerala region. The unique image of Alleppey will captivate your family as you explore the water with your guide to find the rainbow entrance tower of the Kidangamparambu Temple before visiting a 19th-century lighthouse. From the top of the lighthouse, you can see the expansive greenery to the east of Alleppey and the turquoise water to the west.

dayInfo.title: Periyar – Wildlife of the National Park
dayInfo.description: Your private transfer will meet your family at your hotel after breakfast and escort you to the preserved landscape of Periyar Tiger Reserve. The jungle blankest the hills and blankets the landscape in a majestic ambiance throughout the day. In the reserve, you will set out on a safari in search of the wildlife that thrives in the park, such as boar, sambar, and langur. Your children will keep their eyes on the trees as they search for the rambunctious monkeys. As you venture through the wilderness, your guide will look for signs of tigers. Your guide will explain how langur monkeys offer the best alarm system for nearby tigers because they bark to warn their troop.

dayInfo.title: Varkala – Exploring Charming Varkala
dayInfo.description: After an early morning safari for another chance to spot tigers and the elephants that roam through the jungle terrain, your private transfer will escort you to the city of Varkala, which sits on a red cliff. The setting shapes the enchanting ambiance, which is accentuated by the sounds of lapping waves against the sands. You will set out with your guide to visit the Anjengo Fort. You will spend much of the morning touring this fort and other iconic sites before a scenic boat ride allows you to witness the exotic scenery from a new vantage point.

dayInfo.title: Kovalam – Discover a Historic Temple
dayInfo.description: You will venture to Kovalam with your private transfer in the morning and stop at unique sites along the way. You will first stop at Shri Padmanabhaswamy Temple. You will then continue to the Mansion of Horses, which was named for the 122 horses that were carved into the wooden supports. The vast complex hosts a warren of royal buildings that date back to the mid-19th century and offers examples of traditional Kerala architecture. In the museum, your family will marvel at the musical tree that can produce eight distinctive sounds.

dayInfo.title: Kovalam – Kovalam and Kanyakumari
dayInfo.description: In the morning, your guide will escort your family through Kovalam and Kanyakumari for a day of exploration at the southernmost tip of the country. As you travel south, your family will notice the dramatic jade hues of the rice paddies and the fading grandeur of the ghats that adorn the western shores. When you reach Padmanabhapuram Palace, you will find a remarkable collection of carved rosewood ceilings and teak beams. You can witness worshippers as they bathe in the waters at the ghats along Cape Comorin near Kumari Amman Temple as your guide provides the story of how Kumari conquered the world’s demons.

dayInfo.title: Kovalam – Departure
dayInfo.description: The scent of fermented rice and coconut dough from Kerala Appam will fill the air in the morning before your private transfer meets your family at your hotel. You will venture to Trivandrum Airport for your flight home, bringing a close to your delightful 7-day India tour.

tourName: Rajasthan Tour of Forts & Palaces
placesVisited: Delhi, Udaipur, Ranakpur, Kumbhalgarh, Jodhpur, Pushkar, Kishangarh, Jaipur, Samode
generalInfo: The elegance of Rajasthan is in the charming palaces and powerful fortresses that continue to decorate the magnificent landscape. This custom tailored tour will take you through the unique desert and precious mountain scenery. You will cruise on reflective lakes alongside the graceful City Palace complex of Udaipur, and traverse the inspiring ramparts of Mehrangarh Fortress. From delicate temples to emotional hymns, endless protectorate walls to glistening ancient frescoes, you will find more than just palaces and fortresses in Rajasthan, you will find culture and the quintessence of this remarkable country.

dayInfo.title: Delhi - From Home to Palaces
dayInfo.description: Your journey begins before you land in India. Your thoughts are focused on the soon to come iconic images of the country, from the vibrant saris to the colorful fruit. You step onto the plane ready to soar and to find the coming wonders, from the delectable colors illuminated from the Pink Palace to the mesmerizing Blue City of Jodhpur. You have imagined the culture and the architecture, the food and the landscape and, as the plane lands in the capital city of Delhi, you are ready to experience it all.

dayInfo.title: Delhi - Along the Old Gates
dayInfo.description: Welcome to Delhi, a city that brings together its eclectic historic architecture and modern culture. Moghul ruins sit in a park reappropriated by local students, studying and relaxing along with the ancient temples and cupolas in Hauz Khas Complex. You are met at the airport and escorted to your hotel by a private transfer. The city whirs around you and you are eager to visit, explore, and discover. In the city’s ancient walls you can find Chandni Chowk, the old market that continues to brim with life, filled with the enticing smoky aromatics of grilled kebab and the rainbow clothing hidden in the bylanes. Stores are stacked and filled with saris that run the gambit of colors. In the whirlwind of the streets, you can hear the call to prayer from the Jama Masjid, the largest mosque in the city. The sanctuary was constructed in the 17th century and the multiple entrances all lead to the same level deck along the interior that is able to hold up to 25,000 people. The minarets stand 130 feet tall, filled with 130 steps. Like the rest of the structure, each minaret is striped with white marble and red sandstone. The energy of the city, whether in the melodic hymn of the drifting call to prayer or in the energetic movement of the old market, you will find grace within the commotion. At first, it seemed uncontrolled but now it is captivating and exciting.

dayInfo.title: Delhi - Visiting the Old and The New Delhi
dayInfo.description: The morning is graced with the mixture of sweet and spice that rises from the breakfast beverage of masala chai. This delicate introduction to India’s flavors is a great way to kick-start the day. After your meal, your escort meets you at your hotel and guides you through the historic streets of the city. From the old market to the Raj Ghat, the Mahatma Gandhi Memorial, you venture through the new streets that eventually bring you to the Qutub Minar. You find the mystique of the seasoned structures alluring; the minaret climbs over 217 feet into the air, constructed almost a millennia ago. The red sandstone catches the sunlight bringing a tremendous sunset red to the blue sky. The pillar tapers inward until reaching its pointed apex of a thin seven and a half feet. The surrounding complex is made up of ruined tombs and monuments including Altamish’s tomb, which is decorated with scrawling Islamic calligraphy. Your sense of Delhi comes alongside the banks of the Yamuna River and the vast history represented in the old walls and new streets as you discover India Gate and Parliament before you settle back into your hotel for the evening.

dayInfo.title: Udaipur - The City on the Lake
dayInfo.description: The morning brings with it the effervescent spices of masala and the palpable whirlwind of the day. After breakfast you are taken to the airport to catch your flight to Udaipur. You find the tawny and purple woods of the surrounding foothills set alongside the banks of Lake Pichola. The sun brushes over the city with accents of cream and rose. After you settle into your accommodation you will enjoy a venture out onto the cool lake which ripples with the reflection of the surrounding mountains. The lake runs almost two and a half miles long and almost two miles wide. You notice the City Palace complex along the shore, where gardens brush up against the banks and the cupolas rise along the structure like mountain peaks. It is calm and serene on the water, where the city almost surrounds you as it presents itself. The Palace on Jagmandier Island dates back to the 17th century and begins to glisten in the sunset as the light glints off of the water’s surface. Magnificent stone elephants stand at the entrance, and the 17th century tower carved from bluestone continues to linger over the lake.

dayInfo.title: Udaipur - Crystal Galleries and Luminescent Waters
dayInfo.description: The immaculate City Palace Complex wraps around the edges of the lake and stands like a regal memory. It is both a modern museum and a collection of heirlooms of historic royalty. The ramparts run over 752 feet long-standing over 90 feet tall and dates back to the 17th century. Once inside the complex around the Great Gate, you find eight arches on the left-hand side. The arches commemorate the times that Maharajas were weighed in the open courtyard and their weight in gold or silver was distributed to the local people. The three-arched Tripolia Gate takes you into a large courtyard. You find a handicraft shop and a large tiger-catching cage. It is a remarkable look into the treasured past of the city and palace, from the current workings of the artisans to the historic commemoration of the royal life.

dayInfo.title: Kumbalgarh - Rose City to Stellar Temples
dayInfo.description: Today you will journey away from the glittery waters of Udaipur, watching the ramparts of the City Palace fade from view and be replaced by the marvelous 15th century Jain Temples at Ranakpur. The temple complex is constructed of cool white marble that brings a pearlescent glow to the entire area. The structure is filled with 1,444 pillars and decorated with detailed carvings. Chaumukha Mandir, known as the Four-Faced Temple, was constructed in the 15th century with milk-white marble. Twenty-nine halls and 80 domes come together to show the architect’s and funder’s devotion. It is easy to marvel at the work of artistry and the chiseled gods, where pillars are knotted with carvings that bring a calm and harmonious echo to the exquisite space. You continue to Kumbhalgarh and arrive in the evening with the unforgettable detail of each statue that lined the interior walls of the complex fresh in your mind. Kumbhalgarh is a remote fort that brings the romantic expectations of the Rajput era to life, where the traditions and culture can be seen enriched in the architecture of the fort. Dating back to the 15th century rising over 3,300 feet above sea level, the fort brings endless vistas of the blue sky and the mountain horizon. The walls run over 22 miles and protect 360 temples, some dating back to the second century BC. If the history and magnitude isn’t mesmerizing enough, the massive entrance gate, known as Ram Gate, is both bulbous and powerful, protecting a wall that is only second in size to the Great Wall of China.

dayInfo.title: Jodhpur - Large Walls to Mountainous Blues
dayInfo.description: Today you will leave behind the stretching walls of the Kumbhalgarh Fort and come to the Bishnoi Village. The people have been known since the 15th century for their conservationist religion, standing for the preservation of animals and vegetation. The village highlights the diversity of the country, displaying the eclectic combination of people in a large and small expanse. The sect of Hindu follows 29 principles to live by which have helped them survive in the desert landscape outside of Jodhpur. Blackbuck graze along the desert grass outside of the village. The Bishnoi consider the buck sacred and have been known to be aggressive toward people that harm animals and trees, which are considered pillars of sanctity. As the afternoon lingers along the landscape you continue onward to the towering stretch of blue buildings that create the old city of Jodhpur. The powerful stone of Mehrangarh Fort stands atop the cliff and looms over the ancient buildings. You are guided around the clock tower on a rickshaw tour of the old city. The streets are aromatic with spices. You can see all the collected colors of the spice trade emanating from Mohanlal Verhomal, MV, one of the oldest spice merchants in the city.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur - Blue Tops to Pink Towers
dayInfo.description: The morning light stretches over the Blue City and brings a reflection of color between the sky and the buildings. Spend the morning meandering through the extensive expanse of Mehrangarh Fort, rising over 400 feet above the city. You can see historic palanquins, a means of travel for noble women who were once carried through the streets within the domelike protectorate. Soon you will come to Pushkar, a unique city that draws in Hindu pilgrims and curious travelers alike with its charm and the holy Brahma temples. When entering the religious complexes you find numerous bathing ghats among 400 milky-blue temples, and you can feel the earth tingle with humming prayers, drums, and gongs echoing off of the mountains and the marble. The ghats surround the lake and allow pilgrims to dip into the sacred waters where legends of Vishnu and Brahma took place. In the early evening you will arrive in Jaipur, the Pink City, with the rosy light fading beyond the horizon.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur - The Elegance of Strength
dayInfo.description: The day is yours to drift through the Pink City and experience the majesty of sandstone buildings that date back centuries. Witness the lavish interior of the powerful Amer Fort. Just outside of the city you will come to the crisscrossing pathways that wind up the hillside to the main gateway. Within the walls you find the palace of the Rajput Maharajas that dates back to the 15th century. The first impression of the exterior walls is pure strength but when you step inside you discover the lavish adornments that bring elegance and beauty to the interior. The Ganesh Pol stands at the edge of the first courtyard where you can see lattice windows running across the upper levels. The gilded frescoes around the central archway add to the three-level opulence before you have even entered the palace structure. As you continue through the fort and along the immaculate décor, including the Mirror Palace that was built to make a candle flame twinkle like endless starlight, you will return to the pink walls of City Palace to find a richer sense of the past. In the evening you will delight in a traditional home-cooked meal with a local family where the essential flavors and aromas of Jaipur will be savored.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur - A Wealthy Village
dayInfo.description: When the Pink City falls behind the horizon and becomes an echo of memories you arrive at Samode. The small village is set among rugged hills, and is overlooked by the 19th century palace. The village jangles with glass bangles, each one colorful and filled with eccentric geometrics. Trails spread across the countryside, outside of the village, around the palace, and beneath the fortress where you can see the flora climbing along the ramparts. Whether strolling through the open hills for a sensational panorama or visiting the interior of the palace filled with gentle fountains, manicured gardens, and a tranquil tile patio, the afternoon is yours to enjoy.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur - Final Palace
dayInfo.description: The alluring scent of breakfast brings you within view of the palace walls that watch over the village. After your meal your private transfer will escort you to Delhi where your tour will come to an end. There is always more to discover within the tremendous history of India, from the renowned Taj Mahal to the eclectic shores of Kerala. Once at the airport you will step onto your flight and make your way home but, then again, why not stay a while longer? Browse the India tours reviews for more information about what travelers experienced while in India.

tourName: Romantic Tour of North India for Couples
placesVisited: Delhi, Sariska Tiger Reserve, Ranthambore, Jaipur, Bharatpur, Agra
generalInfo: Delight in romance and discovery during your customizable 10-day couple’s tour of North India, which will immerse you in the splendor of famous bazaars, the natural majesty of the secluded jungle, and intricate designs of celebrated architecture. Share in the treasured view of the Taj Mahal at sunrise, scour the underbrush for signs of lazing tigers, and bask in the prestige of maharajas at the Amber Fortress. India is waiting for you to revel in its storybook ambiance and welcoming culture.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Introduction to Delhi
dayInfo.description: Your private transfer will greet you upon your arrival at Indira Gandhi International Airport and escort you to your luxurious accommodating in the heart of the city, where you can relax and have the remainder of the day at your leisure. Among the calls of the merchants, you will hear the sounds of devotional music stemming from the tomb of Sufi saint Nizamuddin Auliya. The marble shrine of the religious leader offers a dazzling introduction to Delhi and the culture of the city behind the tangled alleyways of the marketplaces.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Historical and Cultural Charms
dayInfo.description: Your guide will meet you in your hotel’s lobby after breakfast for a private tour of Delhi that will feature the majesty of India’s fast-paced capital. Your tour will include visits to the Sunder Nursery, Khari Baoli, which is the largest spice market in Asia, and the India Gate. The structure shines with a red stone base that rises above a domed bowl, and the archway towers above the surrounding parkland at 138 feet tall. You will also visit the Jama Masjid, which is the largest mosque in India and dates back to the 17th century. You can venture to the top of its minaret for a spectacular view of Old Delhi.

dayInfo.title: Sariska – The Sariska Tiger Reserve
dayInfo.description: This morning, your private transfer will escort you to the secluded corners of the Sariska Tiger Reserve and National Park, where the jungle contains a wealthy variety of trees. The day will be yours to enjoy the incredible diversity of the landscape and history that is hidden within the borders of the reserve, which will lead you from the ruins of Bhangarh to the Kankwari Fort. You can enjoy the terraces and views from the fortress walls, which will provide you with what feels like a private panorama of the surrounding landscape.

dayInfo.title: Ranthambore – Explore Historic Landscapes
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will embark on a journey to the shores of the Siliserh and Jaisamand lakes. Once you arrive, you will be led on a guided safari to find crocodiles lounging on the grass and basking in the sun. You do not need to worry because you will encounter these animals from the safety of a private vehicle and under the guidance of an expert guide. During your safari, you will be able to hear waterfalls as they cascade through the woodlands and splash into waiting pools. This Jeep jungle safari will place you in the heart of active wildlife in Sariska before your private transfer escorts you from the Tiger Reserve to Ranthambore National Park.

dayInfo.title: Ranthambore – Indulge in a Wildlife Safari
dayInfo.description: The images of crocodiles may linger along the shores of Padam Talao as you begin your enchanting safari in the morning. Throughout the day, you will be bombarded with the sounds of whoops and grunting barks as troops of monkeys amble through the treetops. The protected scenery encompasses nearly 109 square miles of pristine jungle terrain and wildlife reserve, where over 300 species of birds thrive among one of India’s largest populations of tigers. As the day grows warmer, you may find a tiger lounging in the sunlight with their stunning striped coat glowing against the backdrop of luscious trees and sprouting grass.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – Tour the Majestic Pink City
dayInfo.description: After settling into the comforts of your hotel at the heart of the old city, your guide will offer you a private introduction to the cheerful city, where camels amble along the streets pulling fruit carts, and the aroma of masala chai permeates to the winding alleyways. You will begin your tour at the City Palace, where you will be immersed in the architecture of a fairytale. The massive complex of courtyards, gardens, and sophisticated designs continues to house members of the Rajasthani royal family. You can walk hand-in-hand along the grandeur of the gallery, where maharajas would meet with their advisors and consult with ministers.

dayInfo.title: Bharatpur – Amber Fort and National Park
dayInfo.description: The returning light will wash over the Amber Fort in the morning on the outskirts of Jaipur to reveal the prestige of the 16th-century maharaja’s palace. The impressive stronghold overtakes more than a square mile with foundations that date back to the 10th century. As you wander beneath the reflecting ceilings of the Mirror Palace, you will find an enchanting ambiance that derives from the mosaics of colored glass, creating a jewelry box of shimmering hues that was designed to reflect the flickering candlelight. You can also discover the Magic Flower here, which refers to an intricately carved marble panel.

dayInfo.title: Agra – Visit the Romantic Fatehpur Sikri
dayInfo.description: Your morning inside Bharatpur Bird Sanctuary inside Keoladeo National Park will reveal the marvels of nature and the importance of breeding and feeding grounds. You will explore the fabulous wonders of the wildlife sanctuary with a private guide to find an incredible number of waterfowl, openbill storks, and Indian-spotted eagles, whose wingspan can reach 59 inches wide. You will enter through the magnificent gate of Buland Darwaza, which creates a grand impression and stands over 177 feet tall. The doorway possesses intricate craftsmanship etched into the sandstone and white marble with granite inlays.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – The Beauty of the Taj Mahal
dayInfo.description: You will visit the enchanting Taj Mahal at sunrise for an unparalleled view of the ivory-marble facade as it shifts colors in the reflecting light. Persian poems add to the stunning details that adorn the wall over a horseshoe archway, and reflective tiles contribute to the glossy ambiance that transcends culture and geography. After discovering the intimate beauty of the Taj Mahal, you will return to Delhi with your private transfer and have the remainder of the day at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: The familiar aromas of cinnamon and clove will sweep through the bazaars of Delhi in the morning, and the vibrant ambiance of the Karol Bagh bazaar will cast a light on the gorgeous ornaments available from the merchants. You will have the opportunity for a brief stroll before your private driver transfers you to the airport for your flight home.

tourName: Senior Tour of India: Heart of Rajasthan
placesVisited: Jaipur, Udaipur, Bikaner, Jodhpur, Pushkar
generalInfo: The desert and mountains of Rajasthan will reveal treasured palaces and glistening lakes during this one-week India tour for seniors. Discover the culture, heritage, and opulent history, from Jaipur to Jodhpur and from Pushkar to Bikaner. Marvel at the glassy shores of Lake Pichola, find lavish facades of the Havelis of Bikaner, and delight in the vibrant life of the bazaars with this tour that has been specifically designed with senior travelers in mind.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – Introduction to the Pink City
dayInfo.description: Jaipur is a city of royalty and shimmers with rosy hues. Jaipur also acts as the gateway to the lively region of Rajasthan and embodies the culture of the desert landscape and secluded cities. Your flight will land at Jaipur International Airport, where your private transfer will meet you and escort you to the comforts of your luxurious accommodation. After settling into your accommodation, your guide will meet you in the lobby to introduce you to Jaipur with a private tour. You will reach the complex of the Jantar Mantar observatory in addition to other notable landmarks.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – Amber Fort and Jaipur Bazaars
dayInfo.description: Your guide will meet you after breakfast and take you to the marvels of the Amber Fortress. The foundations of the fort date back to the 10th century. Your guide will lead you through the preserved splendor, from the elegant artwork that adorns the Ganesh Gate to the 27 colonnades that crown with elephant-shaped capitals in the Hall of Public Audience. In the third courtyard, you will find the Mirror Palace. You will return to the heart of Jaipur and venture through the famous lanes of the Johri Bazaar. Here, vendors display rows of gold and silver ornaments, earrings studded with precious emeralds, and sapphires that shimmer on necklaces.

dayInfo.title: Bikaner – Bikaner and Karni Mata Temple
dayInfo.description: You will depart with your private transfer after breakfast to the desert town of Bikaner.
